review: We had a 3 night stay at Hotel VIC with the Club VIC add on. This was amazing and the experience made us feel very special. We had a room on the 22nd floor with a fantastic view of Victoria Harbour with all the lights and boats. Club VIC and the staff there was amazing. With a gorgeous breakfast and a 2 hours of cocktail hour every evening, we found that this was the best place to be in Hong Kong. The staff gave us a fantastic customer experience with the beautiful people in Hong Kong that go the extra mile to make your holiday fabulous. I would thoroughly recommend this Hotel and their Club VIC experience and would not even contemplate staying anywhere else on my next visit.

I booked a 鈥淧remium Harbour View Room鈥?which had a great view of Victoria Harbour. The room itself was very comfortable and modern but a little smaller than I am used to enjoying on my travels. The hotel is fairly new and has a small shopping complex below it. The hotel lobby has to be accessed by the lift as its not located on the ground floor. The hotel pool is beautiful with great views of the harbour. The gym is also well equipped. The MTR station is across the road from the hotel with bus and tram stops also within walking distance. There are plenty of restaurants, eateries and 7-elevens within walking distance. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would return again.

By far the best value mid range hotel in Hong Kong as compared to other networkAmazing spread for breakfast and a wonderful panaromic view at roof top pool and cocktail loungeClose proximity to MRT and also the ferry terminal is simply way too convenient Freebie in in-room fridgie and also attentive check in front desk

Booked straight off a website and very happy with our choice. Rooms are not huge but modern and very comfortable. Free bottled water on a daily basis is a nice touch. Farmhouse Staff could do with a bit more training on how to greet guests and help when needed. Should be noted concierge on desk at reception is fantastic super helpful. Staff at cruise bar are also lovely and very helpful. The hotel itself is modern and free shuttle to central and causeway bay is a great help. For those not wanting to stay in Kowloon this is a great choice.

It is in general a really great hotel ,I especially appreciate it's luggage keeping service as it has 14 days that makes our wedding so much easier in terms of logistic,the only thing that is I don't really have time to enjoy the pool. For a wedding photo shoot venue ,it's a bit too small,however the view and big window are helpful

Excellent view of Victoria harbour Free mini bar for refreshment Good swimming pool on Sky floor Need to pay more attention on toilet hygiene. Some finger print on toilet handle and some dirty marks on toilet seat. Little bit disappointed.

Excellent stay at Hotel BIC in a club room for our family holiday. Excellent service in the club and we so enjoyed the pool. 2 minute walk to North Point MTR, ferry at the doorstep, restaurants and ding-ding very close. Will definitely stay again!

Superb location near MTRBest brekkie spread in Hong KongPanaromic view at rooftop pool and barFree in room mini barSmallish room no bath tub But wonderful harbour viewOutstanding front desk serviceMy go to hotel in Hong Kong

Very pleasant experience. Location was great and views from the room were superb! The room was very clean and bedding was comfortable. Highly recommended for couples and family. Will definitely stay again!

Great location close to train and all transport. All restaurants & the rooftop bar excellent. We had a club Vic room which we loved having a drink before dinner each night in the club room. All staff throughout were excellent but Katy in Club Vic who checked us in and gave us important local information made our stay exceptional. Her friendly and helpful service is a huge asset to the hotel. Also Sharon organised our smooth checkout. Both staff made our stay just that more special.

4 night stay in a Club Premium Harbour view. Swanky, new hotel in North Point, beautiful harbour views! Rooms on the small size, (or book a suite) but everything else makes up for it. Modern, clean, great service from all the Club Vic staff, very helpful. Good breakfast, afternoon tea, evening drinks & canap茅s made for a very comfortable stay. Easy access transport. A nice location change from Kowloon when you鈥檝e been here many times, more local. Reasonably priced. Good rooftop gym & pool. Will be back.

Check in was slow as there鈥檚 only one person handling the counter. Specifically told the check in to make sure my stay points are credited to my membership but it didn鈥檛. Maybe the hotel can provide a pen or some writing paper in the room so some business travellers have something to use.

The hotel is very modern and the rooms are clean. The staff has been attentive and nice. The hotel is next to the Barbour so the view is great. Was here with my family on a family trip. Would stay at this hotel again on my next visit.

I did have some "issues" checking in, but after this hurdle the hotel and its staff are well appointed to assist. The teams English is good for western folks like me, and after all you are in HK so expect language could be different from your home land. But sit back and enjoy the Hotel VIC. Its at north point and VERY easy on the MTR just use exit A1 and you can walk almost to the front door.

I am local customer.Customer Service is nice. But Company policy shows no sympathy to customer's tragedy, even a tiny little. Too sad for me to disclose the details but in short my proposal ruined. Blacklisted all Sun Hung Kai Properties owned and managed hotels.If you have a really important stay, go for a Hilton or Marriott.

The hotel has been operating for less than a year. Staff were very helpful and friendly which made our stay very enjoyable. The facilities are very new.Whilst the rooms were quite small they worked really well for two people. We stayed in the urban harbour view on level 22 (Club Vic). The extra $ was worth every cent for the Club Vic. The location was not very central however the mtr was so close and the trams which were super easy to take to central and wan chai districts.

What can I say about Vic on the Harbour? The experience has been absolutely amazing and unforgettable. Everything was perfect, from the check in to the check out (especially the surprise in my room, with a heart full of pictures of myself). The room was a dream come true, I can鈥檛 get over that view!The pool, the yummy breakfast, perfect location, the wonderful harbour view and the flawless service made of our stay something special Thanks Anya and Vic team! we love you guys and can鈥檛 wait to come back!!

I had a harbour view room at club floor. With it comes buffet breakfast at the 22F club room (not as expansive selection if I had it downstairs but luxury of having it in relative peace and quiet while marvelling at Victoria Harbour view), afternoon tea and evening cocktails. Pool and Gym at 23F are a delight, not all HK hotels have these. Food at outlets (Cruise and Farm House) are innovative but still have comfort food feels and taste) - I love the pineapple with lime chili sauce. Only drawback for me - there鈥檚 only 1 English station on TV (CNBC).

Room is big with amazing harbour view. Well room cleaning everyday. Service is excellent. Staff are friendly and welcoming. However, no smoked salmon for the breakfast even there are still a lot of choices (Dim Sum is good!)

Hotel was most impressive and our 21st floor room was spotless and provided great views.The Club Vic was most enjoyable and staff were very friendly and provided great service during our stay. We would have appreciated more drawers for storage.

This Hotel exceeded my expectations, excellent Customer Service in all areas. Exceptionally clean, superb harbour views and a number of wonderful dining choices, my favourite on the 23rd floor with a view to die for, excellent food and exceptional service. Highly recommended

Good location. Friendly staff. Excellent fitness and swimming pool. The hotel can be recommended for business trip and not long accommodation. Room is not big but comfortable and clean. Beautiful view from a window.

We very much enjoyed our stay. breakfast was giid, the staff helpful. the location is great just in front of the star ferry and 2 blocks away from tram and MTR. North point is said to be far from central but I much preferred the ambiance there than in central. overall I will advise anyone to stay at the VIC.

Hotel has great views across the river towards Kowloon. Located in North Point, area is more residential but rapidly being developed. Located 2 mins walk to MTR (subway) and about 10/15 mins MTR ride into Central. Easy access also to ferry (outside door) and tram (ding ding).Staff were excellent and looked after us really well in the lounge - nothing a hassle or bother.Only been open for <12 months so everything still spanking new.Rooms like most in Hong Kong on the smaller side and storage limited - this is to be expected people!Highly recommended and I can see the rates shooting up when it鈥檚 more established.

All the staff were very friendly and helpful in every way. The room was clean and modernbut lacked drawer storage space. We stayed at the club level as our visit was for my Birthday. We were treated like royalty on arrival and were checked into our room actually in our room. We could not fault anything during our entire stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Really enjoyed this quaint hotel with excellent service and lovely harbourview I am especially impressed with their Club customer service, friendliness and attention to details. Staff made every effort to connect with customers.

Really modern, clean and hospitable hotel. We chose the club Vic upgrade and were spoilt by the team. Multiple restaurant options, pool with a great view. Would certainly consider staying again next time in HK

Another great stay at this lovely hotel on HK Island. Great location in Northpoint just walking distance from the MTR.The view from my room was stunning (as they all are) and service was extremely professional and courteous. The infinity pool is a must!!One of my favourite hotels in Hong Kong and cannot wait to come back.Thank you to Ken and Angel for a memorable stay!

Having stayed on both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon on numerous occasions, we decided to try a new area. North Point showed itself to be a highly interesting area with its wet market and trams. The Hotel Vic is located very close to North Point Ferry Terminal. Although the rooms are small, they were very comfortable and well designed. A high point of out stay was the roof top infinity swimming pool. What a view!The staff in the "Club" were very friendly and helpful.

The concierge team wholeheartedly helped me to put my boyfriend 鈥榮 birthday gift to the room in advance and decorated the room with birthday balloons! It was a extraordinary experience to stay in the hotel with spectacular harbour view.

We stayed here for two days. The property is great in terms of amenities and infrastructure. Everything was first class. However, they are zero in hospitality. The experience starts with an additional breakfast charge for my son. None of the hotels I have visited till date have charged like this, not even we were just dinning guest and not a stying guest. Initially, I thought this might be common for Hong Kong but that is not the case either. The second shocker was 1500 dollar as deposit... most of the hotels take a deposit but they take ur credit card details and authorization but never debit the money at the beginning. This guy debited money and at end refund it. So virtually you have to pay twice for the international transaction on ur credit card. The final shocker was checking out. I have requested for late checkout by two hr but there was a big NO. ( in spite of the fact that I have checked in almost at night). After repeated request, they have given 1hr extension but when we tried to enter our room after 12:00 PM checking out time, the door was locked. Again request has to be made to open the door and get our luggage. The only two guys I remember having some sense of hospitality were Joy ( at the transport desk) and the guy who was sitting at the Concierge desk. Overall as I said, fantastic amenities without human touch...For me, a human touch is much more important than anything else.....

Stayed at the Vic for 5 nights. Room has amazing views over to Kowloon. Only negative was the lack of storage / drawer space but this is probably common for HK. Check-in staff were fantastic - very friendly and helpful. We arrived very early and they made it easy to use the pool for the morning before the room was ready. Pool is on 23rd floor, open views across harbour - stunning. Gym was very well equipped - also on top floor. Cruise bar on top of West tower is also great. Overall a lovely new hotel, good location (2 mins from North Point MTR station and close to Tram stops) and great staff.

Just had 3 days at Hotel VIC - beautiful hotel, very luxurious and well run. Great location next to North Point MTR station. Enjoyed the rooftop bar in the evenings. The pool is great but needs a few more sun beds. Would go again

Despite some of the negative reviews, I stayed here for 6 nights (April/May) and the experience was fantastic. Great location if you plan to visit all the tourist spots as the MTR is about 200 metres away.Lots of eating places nearby, although mostly local foodThe check in was surprisingly smooth, we even managed to get our room a little early and as promised, we had a great view of the harbour The staff were always courteous and always happy to go that extra mile to make us comfortable.

We stayed at the Vic Hotel on the Harbour using a Luxury Escapes voucher. Our room on the 20th floor was very nice with splendid views of the harbour. We had access to the Executive lounge which was the best we have ever used. Breakfast, afternoon tea and evening canapes with wine, beer and spirits were all top quality. The hot and cold selection of canapes every evening were plentiful and varied and changed each day. The wines were first rate too but the best thing about the lounge were the staff who went out of their way to look after you and give you advice and recommendations. Special thanks to Grace, Katie, Kyle, Howard, Sharon and their new trainee, Laurie. We also enjoyed a delightful meal in the Cruise restaurant and had a swim in the rooftop pool with stunning views.

This is a relatively new hotel located in a good area. It has a mix of Hong Kong culture and western influences. The rooms are not huge but adequate for Hong Kong. They have a great rooftop pool but it is on the small side. We had a great harbour view room while only paying for an urban view. Overall the hotel was a good deal and offered what we were looking for for a night. What I really wanted to speak about was that my wife lost her ring after breakfast. Actually, we were not aware that she had lost it yet but a staff member called our room to inquire if we lost a ring. Upon inspection, my wife did lose her wedding ring. A staff member found the ring and turned it in. The manager went to the videotape and did a CIS investigation to find out who the ring belonged to. In this day and age, you don't have this many honest people around you. I just have to say that this hotel has integrity and went out of their way to return something of both financial and sentimental value. That type of integrity and service goes a long way, more than a room with a view!I appreciate the staff members and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Thank you Hotel VIC!

we had a mini break of 7 nights in a club urban room great room which gave us access to the club vic facilities which were awesome. the staff in the club looked after lots of little details for us and gave stellar advice. Service was great and the facilities were beautiful.

The hotel was new and have well-designed rooms. Spacious and clean. Their food is also nice. Not too crowded and have nice facilities like the gym, pool, and the mall is just on the ground. The location was a bit far from central but MTR is very near. Overall, we were satisfied to stay here.

A relatively new hotel, this property has a lot to offer. The rooms are spacious and the views over the harbour are amazing. A perfect location, walking distance to the train as well as the ferry. The breakfast was one of the best I have ever experienced and the staff are were so friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend when visiting Hong Kong. Another bonus is the hotel is just around the corner from true local markets, massages and hidden little eateries!

This is the third time we have stayed here. Why do we keep coming back to this excellent 5 star hotel ? The facilities, the room and the food are all of a very high standard but it is the unique quality of the service that makes this Hotel our favourite place to stay in the world. We are lucky enough to travel extensively and have enough experience to be able to say that the VIC has that extra specialness about it that makes it a unique experience. This specialness is the staff who are local, who not only know HK they also know how to make their guests feel special. a big thank you to the Club lounge staff - especially Sharon, Anya and Laurie.

This hotel was a good find. Its not in the usual crowded area like Causeway Bay or in Lanham Place but its slightly off the beaten tourist trail but very accessible using the MTR.We love visiting wet markets so its also located walking distance from some local wet markets as well. We saw more locals and domestic helpers in this area than tourists, which was a nice change.

My partner and I had 7 nights at this new hotel. We normally stay at Holiday Inn Golden Mile on Nathan Road in Kowloon, but after being told about this new hotel by friends, we thought we would give it a try. Check in was quick and easy, our room was lovely but smallish (an Upper Premium Harbour View room), with a lovely harbour view. The breakfast buffet was good but I have had better - hash browns were cold every morning even though they were under a heat lamp and the skim milk jug not refilled once emptied. Had to ask for it to be refilled on 3 occasions so I could have skim milk with my cereal. And the Cereal was not refilled once the big bowls were empty either. Very annoying.... Good bar though with outside seating with a great harbour view. We didn't eat at the Hotel apart from breakfast, but the restaurants looked good. It's not in the prettiest of areas of Honkers, but it's right on the harbour front so that makes up for it, and not that far away from anywhere you want to be. MTR is in the block behind the hotel so nice and handy. Would recommend it to anyone wanting to stay a bit further out of the hussle and bussle of Honkers.

We spent 8 nights at the Hotel Vic in a premium harbour view club room. The check in was in the club lounge and late so no delays. The staff in the club lounge were outstanding and nothing was too much trouble. The egg chef was terrific, he cooked our eggs to perfection every morning. We did find a lack of storage in our room however this is our only complaint, otherwise the room was lovely and the bed was very comfortable. The view of Kowloon at night from our room was spectacular. A special thank you to Kyle and Katy from the club lounge, your travel tips and general assistance was very appreciated.

My wife and I stayed here for a cheeky staycation to celebrate her birthday and we had a great time. I strongly recommend checking in and out online - it makes the whole process quick and easy. The view from our Deluxe Harbour View corner room was just spectacular, and the layout of furnishings meant very efficient use of space. The interiors throughout are very tastefully decorated in a contemporary style with quality furnishings and materials - everything feels quality from the chaise lounge to the delightfully velvety bathrobes. The beds were very comfortable and sound proofing exceptional; we were pleasantly surprised not to hear any road noise from the Island Eastern Corridor Highway which passes in front of the hotel. The hotel gym on the roof of one of the towers is one of the better equipped gyms we've used in a big city hotel, and the rooftop infinity pool is to die for. It's not very big however, and we wonder how congested it might get in the peak of summer (we happened to stay over a rainy weekend so crowding wasn't a problem). Sauna/steam room also available on site. Views from the Cruise restaurant are spectacular again, but unfortunately we didn't get to sample the food as the venue was booked for a wedding the night we stayed. The all-day international dining restaurant FarmHouse on the 2/F where you'll enjoy your complimentary buffet breakfast has an acceptably broad variety of food, with the exception of the disappointingly limited selection of fruit considering we're in Asia. An area for improvement perhaps?Another area for improvement was the room service menu, where the selection was almost as limited as what one might expect on a plane, but perhaps with such a rich variety of great restaurants on offer in Hong Kong and the hotel located just three minutes walk from North Point MTR, the hotel assumes guests won't want to dine in.We'd heartily recommend this hotel and will very likely return for our next staycation.

The room had views of the ever changing Victoria harbour that seems to be active day and night. Rooms and facilities are as advertised. Large rooms with bedding options. New hotel with uptodate easy to use technology. Easy 3 min access to North Point station with free shuttle covering most places. Multiple restaurants with places to sit and relax. Top floor gym and the pool adds value. All in all, our stay was very pleasant. If you venture out on your feet, be prepared to coe across the fish market and very busy market stalls. West wing rooms appear to be better than the east wing. Will stay again if we are stoping in Hong Kong.

The hotel met our expectations and the staff were fantastic, especially those in the Club Lounge (thank you Katy, Grace, Sharon and Kelvin) who made our stay much better by providing us with travel assistance and guidance and also looked after us so well while we were in the lounge. For those travelling to Hong Kong/Hotel Vic, ensure that you get access to the lounge as it is really good. This is a hotel that I'd come back to ...

We stayed here for three days on our way back from Vietnam and quite enjoyed it. The location is very good, with the North Point station right near the hotel and the view over the harbour is lovely. The breakfast buffet was extensive, one of the best we have encountered in our travels and the rooms are well appointed, with a smart phone you can use to log into your google maps account and take with you when out and about exploring. The pool area was stunning, but unfortunately the water is ice-cold, making it less enjoyable than it should be. Our main gripe was the check in process, we had to queue for more than 40 minutes, and noticed that this was a daily occurrence for guests....it took us longer to check in to this hotel than it did to pass through immigration and customs! The staff member checking us in spent several solid minutes typing, perhaps whatever info staff need, could be collected prior to arrival to streamline the process? We were also given a room that was already occupied, so had to return to the front desk to sort that out...very embarrassing! .... Management did apologise for this, offering a late check out, but we already had this as part of our luxury escapes package and could not use it anyway, due to an early flight.

we stayed in The Vic at North Point in April primarily for the Hong Kong Sevens Tournament as part of a Package. In retrospect we should have looked at other Options. However the Hotel was well appointed with all the standard options of Restaurants, Gymnasium, Pool, Spa and Saunas. A number of Retail outlets occupied the Ground and 1st floors.Getting to the Hotel was not well signposted albeit close to the North Point MTR Station. The entry is also confusing as the lobby is not obvious being off to the side of the Main entry to the ground floor retails shops.Rooms were smaller than most "western" hotels but nonetheless comfortable with Minibar (Complimentary Basics) and small ensuite bathroom. Room had harbour views as advertised.

New in 2018 this hotel has all the 5 star facilities, a great harbour outlook and all at a reasonable price. We took the harbour suite for our 4 nights and I would have happily stayed here for all 7 nights we spent in Hong Kong. Club access was a good benefit offering a low key breakfast but with everything you need. Snacks in the day and drinks 6-8 were also handy. The gym is a highlight and is what drew me in. Having a great view makes the workout so much more bearable. And the pool, steam rooms and saunas are on the same level, making for a great activity session. The area is indeed 鈥渓ocal鈥?but Causeway Bay is only a couple of metro stops away. There is a ferry stop at the front door. The Harbour North shopping plaza on the first 2 levels of the building was still getting established when we stayed in April 19. Though the full range of cosmetic stores are open for business. The metro is a short walk (past the municipal refuse facility). The city flyer airport bus (A11 and A12) stops 100m from the hotel and is my hot tip for travel to/from the airport. Cost HK$45. The upper deck provides a wonderful tour of Hong Kong. As with all of Hong Kong there are plenty of food options wherever you look near the hotel. Hotel staff were very eager to please and went the extra mile to help with anything we asked. They follow up with an email to confirm their recommendations, which was very useful. We ate at the Cruise restaurant which is very good. And the cheeseburger on the poolside dining menu was particularly good.

With my son living near to the North Point MTR this hotel was ideally situated for me. It is a spacious and clean hotel, with complimentary water, tea and coffee. The staff were very helpful however I did find all the light switches in the room very confusing! Had to ask a member of staff to show me how to turn one light off.... I didn鈥檛 find the app iPod very helpful either, found it hard to find information about breakfast times etc. Would prefer a paper welcome . The shuttle bus provided to the airport was good.

You can see the beautiful harbour view as you stepped into the room. In any day the view is magnificent. The room is clean and comfortable and furnished to a high standard. The room is not big but you can see how the space is effectively used. The design and layout of the room is very user friendly. I like their hair dryer - unlike some hotels where a travel hair dryer is provided, this hotel provides a professional hair dryer and it dries my hair very quickly. It means it leaves me more time to enjoy my stay in HK and not have to worry about the hair. The room also features a complimentary minibar and a nestcafe expresso coffee machine. I also appreciate that they are not using giveaway travel bottles for the shower gels/shampoo as it does otherwise create a lot of plastic waste. Their gym is superb. You get a great view on the running machines. Also their 3D virtual machine is great fun. Staff at the gym was friendly and helpful. The sauna facility is very good. I used it a few times and it is always clean and tidy.

Stayed in Hong Kong many times and by far this is our favorite trip due to this hotel.Fantastic pool with great views. Amazing gym and equipment high end.Breakfast buffet superb.Rooms bigger than average Hong Kong hotel room.This area North Point is more authentic and feels like you are in Hong Kong not some expat, touristy community and location to MTR 1 min walk away and enjoyed lovely evenings with a beer on the harbour watching the world go by.Will certainly stay again.

I have stayed at many hotels in Hong Kong when visiting with work but in my opinion this is the best. The hotel is new and finished to a high standard. The staff are all polite, efficient and keen to assist. The Club Vic is well worth the extra with a nice breakfast (don't expect a huge Chinese style buffet) , Afternoon tea and sandwiches and evening cocktails as well as drinks available throughout the day. The lounge is comfortable and a nice place to relax. The rooms are very well finished and thought out although ensure you request a room WITHOUT a connecting door. There is no sound insulation through the door and you lose all privacy. I raised this issue during the stay and the management are going to look into improving the sound proofing. That aside we had a lovely stay and all of the staff in the Club Vic lounge were very friendly and couldn't be more helpful. The location of the hotel is perfect in my view in that it is close to all public transportation (which is the best way to get around HK) and the views across to Kowloon are fantastic. The roof top bar at Cruise is a lovely place to sit and relax on a warm evening with a Mojito. So in summary 100% recommend the hotel and hope to return soon either privately or by suggesting that the hotel becomes a prefered hotel with the company I work with......

Loved this hotel, location and rooms are great but there seemed to be something missing in terms of quality of the rooms and cleanliness - we kept finding hairballs on the carpet Also the staff was absolutely amazing apart from 1 guy who took careOf the luggage drop off on our check out date and gave attitude to all the guests that we te coming to him for this service . Put a really bad final touch to our stay there

Initially we were booked a family room with two breakfast for four of us. So we expect there will be additional charges of extra two breakfast for our kids. We were surprised that a staff named Kyle Law who served us at the checking counter, offer us two complimentary breakfast for our kids. We thank for his extra mile service and we give him 5 stars. In between, we have feedback to the room service staff that the maintenance service should be improved. As we found the drain in rest room was clogged and curtain was tore. If there are many wore off, the management should consider for an upgrade project.

The hotel was a bit far away from bus or MTR station. But there was shuttle bus service for the hotel guests. The room was quiet and comfortable. Yet, the cleanliness needed to be improved that there were many hairs on the bed. The bathroom was not clean neither with many dirts and stains, especially near the hair dryer. Despite its cleanliness, it is still a good place to stay at the weekends, especially for those who look for a relaxing and quiet place.

this place is good to relax and we can enjoy view ocean from hotel , facilities swim pool and free shuttle to Tsuen wan station but very far from city center and unfortunately there is no destination to Tsim tsa tsui eventhought they writing information destination in notice board , if you go by taxi to city center will be expensive cost.... please consider for room 1621 the wall near the window is always wet (i dont know what is going on with this wall) maybe there might be a pipe leak on floor 17th or 16th

We stayed here with my siblings during the 1st week of June. We stayed in one of the family rooms. The room was spacious, just enough for the 4 of us & 1 child. We were assigned in a room with a sea view at it was amazing. The amenities were sufficient to have a comfortable stay. There's a pool and a gym, wifi is fast, and breakfast was good. There's a salad & breads table, cereals and drinks table, and the the table with the main course & rice. Another favorite aspect of this hotel is its proximity to the Lido Beach. You just have to walk a few meters and you are in a clean, well-maintained beach with toilets and dressing rooms. The view in the beach are the two magnificent bridges that connect Hong Kong's Islands. The hotel is also just 5 mins walk from the Ting Kau bus terminal so you can go to & from the airport using the A31P bus for just 18 HKD. The staff were friendly and willing to assist us and they can speak understandable English. They also have free shuttle which transports guests to and from Tsuen Wan MRT station at regular intervals, making it easy to go to all tourist spots using the metro and also for buying supplies and food in Tsuen Wan. The hotel is located away from the busy city and offers nature views in its surroundings.My only suggestion is for the carpets to be replaced with new ones since they're already quite old. Tips: -Go to the Lido Cafe early for breakfast to avoid long lines.-Don't forget to bring plug adaptor for your gadgets since Hong Kong's outlets are different. If you forgot to bring, you can buy at the front desk for 20 HKD.

If you are willing to go to disneyland hongkong but wanted to stay nearby without spending a lot of money on accomodation, this hotel might be suitable for you since all the hotels that really closed to disneyland hongkong quite pricey...the minus thing is this hotel location quite far from center of the city and no market near this hotel but they provide free shuttle bus service every 10-15 minutes to reach nearest MTR station...the staffs also very friendly and helpful...So this hotel is value for money in my opinion...

We stayed at this hotel for my birthday weekend. The hotel location is perfect if you want to be far from the crowd or city. The hotel provides a shuttle bus to bring the guests to the nearest station or city. In terms of service the staff are very quick to attend our needs plus the front desk team are really friendly and approachable. The room we stayed in are very nice and comfy. Our view was next to the Lido beach. The pool and sauna facilities are a plus point! My family really enjoyed the hotel and we will definitely stay here again.

For someone not speaking Chinese, this is not a great place. Staff has great difficulty with English. When they do not understand you or we do not understand their English which has a very thick accent, they get impatient and angry. I have travelled around the world and when this has happened, the staff typically is understanding, smiling and it ends up being a decent and pleasant experience. But, not in this hotel!!BTW, I went with my wife and 2 older children.

My family had a great time staying here at Royal View Hotel. My kids love the hotel and describe it as "FANCY" for their standards. The room was relatively big compared to other hotels/hostels. During our stay, we were 3 adults and 2 kids and we never felt that the room was too small for us. There were two double beds inside the room and we slept comfortably. I didn't have any regrets booking this room. It was worth-it considering that we come home to a clean and made-up room daily after our stroll in the city, buffet breakfast was served every morning that was included in our booking, a shuttle bus was readily available that will bring us from the hotel to the nearest MTR station, and this is also near Disneyland and the airport. We will surely stay here again when we will visit Hong Kong again.

It's my first time to spend a holiday in HK afar from the busy shopping district. This place is so quiet and the view is so amazingly relaxing. The hotel is clean and staffs are friendly, so wiling to clean and change our beddings plus they deliver the supply we need fast. Rooms are big. They have complete toiletries and towels. Food choices are great and the drinks as well. Try the spa room, the kids playroom and the spectacular views from your room. You will see a Golden-gate like bridges, high hills and sky highways near the hotel. Not to mention the free transportation to and from the hotel going to the MTR! The only Off for us was that there is no bidet :) but they have hair blower! I love this place and I will surely come back here!!! More power and keep up the good work!#RoyalViewHotelHKIsAmazingAndTheBest

This beautiful hill top 4.5 stars hotel overlook a bridge linking HK island and Kwoloon . We were given 19th Floor a very spacious deluxe room with a seaview. It is located at castle peak road which is away from the hustle and bustle of HK island. However, the hotel provide regular free shutle bus services to Twen Wen MTR station every 10 to 15 minutes, which is very convenient to the travellers. We bought a travel pass which can be used for buses and MTR which can be refunded for any unused portion at any MTR station.As it is away from the city centre, the hotel is very peaceful with cool fresh air. The breakfast is good and has many good selection of chinese n western food. We like the location of the hotel and will consider staying there again when visiting HK. The staffs are very helpful and friendly. It is also located near the beach and there is a joking track for morning and evening exercises. The hotel is located not far from the Disney Land n Noel Ark and can access to HK Airport via MTR airport express.

We stayed 2 nights in this hotel. We love the view and serenity staying in this hotel. Rooms are large that can fit 3 beds for our family. Staff are courteous and accommodating. Will check in again if in Hongkong.

Great location, pleasant and clean rooms, special thanks to Kodi duty manager for his great incredibly help whenever we ask about visit places in HK.Kodi鈥?.We never forget you in our life. You are such a helpful and generous person in Royal View Hotel.I would recommend everyone who visited Royal view hotel must meet Kodi who is duty manager for any help. You feel like met a nice person in HK.

Great place to stay for a couple days. I would definitely go back again. I would recommend to family and friends. I liked the fact the their rooms smell super fresh every time that I walk in, good staff members as well they were very nice.

Had to upgrade my first room I was given, it had no desk and chair at all for my two computers for my work.The room was perfect had lot of spaces, very clean and the members of staff was very friendly and helpful.

Stayed here for 11 nights, carpet in hallway and bedrooms heavily stained, room was very musty, beds are very firm, stayed on the 7 th floor which was non smoking but could smell smoke coming in the vents from time to time. Breakfast was a buffet that was just ok, food was luke warm at the best of times, we kept our eye out for the dishes that came out freshly cooked. Bus service from the hotel to the station was great, easy to use and get around.

I love it, the location, the environment and the room....Frequency of the hotel shuttle buses is conveniently located in one of the main MTR stations - Tsuen Wan.You will find the most of it when you stay here.

Birthday celebration at Royal View for the first attempt but the services were generally excellent and out of my expectation!! Especially the front desk service staff Cody was so professional and he organized all the agenda for us and helped us upgraded our rooms. Whatsmore, although the breakfast session was busy, the food were refilled so fast and the staff of the cafe and the manager were very helpful. Overall it is a great experience here.

Travelled for a leisure trip for a week.. it鈥檚 worth the money we pay n absolutely value for moneyHighlightsOpt for room with Ocean view top floor for a breath taking view.. Swimming pool, beach near by.. best part is Hotel has free shuttle bus services from morning 6.30 till night 10.55 pm for every 15 mins to the nearest metro which is about 5 kms n 15 mins drive.. great service and friendly staffs.. i am staying here when ever i come next to hk

Regular family trip in Hong kong and first time to stay at Royal View. Hotel not at the town but provide courtesy bus to Tsuen Wan train station which is convenient and big mall are located there. Check in was efficiency by friendly receptionist. Derek Wong is an advantage he was pleasant and impressive as he shown extra concern to us by introduced hotel facilities, outlets. He also recommended attractive place in Hong Kong. Definitely come back and thank you for your excellent services again Derek.

The hotel had good facilities such as a gym, swimming pool and even a garden! The shuttle bus service by the hotel is also excellent with buses at regular intervals of between 5-10 minutes to which helps significantly since the hotel is situated pretty far from the central. The room service food was pretty good too, we ordered the penne with seafood :D

My husband and I had a 15 hr layover in Hong Kong, and needed a hotel. All the hotels that are near to the airport were all booked (my lack of planning). I was hesitate to book the Royal Vire Hotel since it was a good 25mins from the airport which meant a taxi ride. To our surprise it was a very nice hotel.I called from the airport and spoke to the front desk, Nick Lou was able to help us book the room. The taxi ride is only 25mins from the airport (Sat night and Sun morning ride). We arrived at the hotel...nice, clean, friendly, and very quiet. Nick was able to upgrade our room, which was absolutely wonderful! Nice shower, great water pressure, coffee and tea in the room, and a nice view of the bridge and water.They have a cute cafe shop on the first floor..desserts looked great.Great one night stay.

Did not take breakfast. Proximity to airport convenient. Shuttle service at short intervals is very good, except seats on the shuttle buses seem small. One shuttle service to Tsim Sha Tsui not enough, maybe increase to 3, good to connect transport to airport transit points like at Kowloon City

I visited royal view hotel in the month of feb with 6 members to celebrate out child鈥檚 birthday. Although we reached earlier then the check-in time but the management was considerate enough to offer us a family room to take rest, and not long enough we were offered another room and that too was upgraded to sea view . Pros of the hotel: 1. Excellent view from room2. Nearby beach which is walkable3. Untiring shuttle service every 10-15 mins to nearby metro station and market.4. Rapid checkout5. Satisfying breakfast 6. The hotel arranged an excellent fruit cake for my daughter on request and offered us an nice place to celebrate. If I revisit hong kong, this will be our first choice of stay for sure !

Needing to be near the airport, I selected this property in the Tsuen Wan area. Located in an elevated area, views of the bay and soaring bridges were relaxing. A small sheltered beach was also sighted nearby. Rooms were comfy and had all the mod-cons required. I was coerced into signing up for the breakfast by dangling a discount if I signed up upon check in. I should have opted to take the shuttle to the Tsuen Wan area instead. The breakfast price was cheap and this was reflected in the offerings. Oyster mushrooms galore appeared in three dishes. The fried rice had glimpses of egg and a stray pea or two, cheap chicken sausages and burnt bacon rounded up the breakfast. Well, at least you couldn鈥檛 complain about the price. Would I return? Yes, but this time armed with some cookies and beverages for breakfast.

Great view in the family room. Clean and comfortable environment in hotel. Kind and helpful staff there, especially Eric, appreciated about it.Shuttle bus is available going to MTR station, quite convenient.Will consider coming again.

Wonderful service provided by Hugo Lai and the Carrie Lau's remarkable simile from the staff at the front desk. I would like to appreciate them and recommend my friends to visit. Thank you and I hope enjoying the service again.

Book the room on internet and see many good comments. Hotel far away from the city, but they have a bus to go out. Very good. Cody very good service as upgrade the room for us, he recommend the shop close to hotel.

Excellent service with Mr Eric Wong the guest service manager who was very very helpful. I would strongly recommend him and the hotel and would love to come back again. Thank you again and see you soon

I love the location of the hotel. It is situated away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Even though it is in a secluded location in Tsuen Wan, they offer a courtesy shuttle to and from hotel to the Tsuen Wan MTR, and the shuttle runs very frequently, so it is very convenience for guests.Customer service is great too. Hotel staff are very helpful and courteous.

The photos of this hotel are not consistent with the room I stayed in. The carpet was stained, the lights in the shower flickered sporadically, there was hair in the bathroom sink (upon my arrival), the room periodically smelled of smoke (even on a no smoking floor), and the overall cleanliness was poor. The worse part is the bed. I have slept on softer surfaces while camping. Sleeping was literally the most miserable experience, I tried to bunch my comforter to sleep on top of it for some level of padding. Both my coworker (who was in another room) and I woke up with sore bodies from the bed. My experience was so poor we canceled the remainder of our reservation and moved to another hotel.I do have to say the staff was very nice and the view of Lido beach was beautiful.

Royal View Hotel is always my first choice when I would like to spend my leisure time. I went there last night again with my boyfriend to celebrate our anniversary. Front office staff was always nice with good attitude, their warm smile makes me feel like home at the time of check in. I would like to make a special compliment to manager Eric Wong. He was very nice and helpful. He help us to upgrade our room into ocean view room. Very nice view in this room. I will definitely stay in this hotel again and I will suggest Royal View Hotel to my friends. I'm looking forward to meet Eric again during my next visit.

Stayed here for 4 days with family (2 kids). Hugo - the Hotel receptionist provided great service and made us feel at home at the time of check in. Hotel room is clean and very cozy...great shower. The room had a great view of the river. It is however, a little out of the way from most of the exciting parts of HK. You needed to take the hotel shuttle service to get to the transit station. Taxi is a bit strange, some drivers do not speak English well and the hotel staff did not alert us that we may need to take one of those cards from the hotel with chinese writings to help us direct taxi driver to bring us back to the hotel.Other than language issue, everything went well and we are well rested and enjoyed the stay.I think this hotel is good for those who would like to chill out and be away from the hustle and bustle of city life.(it is a pity though, we were not able to use the pool at that time - because the hotel close it).

Excellent hotel with a lovely view. very good breakfast with lots of choice.Very good room with great shower but the only problem for my wife was a very hard bed but the hotel provided an extra duvet to go under her back. A bit out of the way but the hotel provided a shuttle to take you to the transit station.

My family with 2 kids stayed in a family room for 10 days and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We booked a family room which was very spacious and clean. The beds was nice and firm and comfy. Our room was on the top floor and we had an amazing view. Free bottled water was provided everyday, the room has good amenities and the hotel is nice and quiet. The hotel staff are very friendly and spoke well English. From the front desk staff to shuttle bus staff and even cleaners are wonderful and helpful. Location wise, it is in Ting Kau, next to a beach and not right in Tsuen Wan. However the hotel free shuttle bus service is very convenient. The bus runs frequently every 10mins or so and very on time. The shuttle line getting back to the hotel at night at Tsuen Wan MTR can be long but you can alternatively take a green van across the road for only $7HKD. There are so many good and cheap eateries in Tsuen Wan plus shopping centres. My kids also loved the video games room at the hotel! Overall we will definitely come back to royal view.

The hotel was great. Great bed, great breakfast, great view and great staff. The only thing, it was not close to anything. They did have a shuttle to take you to the transit station and you could get anywhere. If you took tours your tour bus usually stopped at the top of the hill and you walked down a half block to the hotel. But the hotel shuttle came to the door of the hotel.

Clean, comfortable, and nice staff. Close to the airport, so it was perfect for a stay of less than eight hours. Be sure you have the correct address if you are taking a taxi from the airport or train station.

闈炲父鎰熻瑵锛丄 lot of thanks 鉂わ笍1. I lost my ID yesterday, so I approached concierge this morning to seek for help. Mr. Chu at the Concierge made a lot of calls to different place to help. And luckily I have my ID back. I really really appreciate his kindness.鎴戞槰澶╂帀浜嗗彴鑳炶鎵€浠ヤ粖鏃╁幓绂硴閮ㄦ眰鍔╋紝鏈卞厛鐢熷公鎴戞墦浜嗗緢澶氶浕瑭辨壘璀変欢锛屾垜鏈€寰屼篃寰堝垢閬嬬殑鎵惧洖渚嗐€傜湡鐨勯潪甯搁潪甯告劅璎濇湵鍏堢敓鐨勫公鍔┿€?. Me and my friends lost our breakfast coupons in the room. Mr. Lau at the front desk also gave us a lot of help about this incident. 鎴戣窡鎴戠殑鏈嬪弸鎴块枔閬哄け浜嗘棭椁愬嵎锛屾珒妾殑鍔夊厛鐢熶篃灏嶆垜鍊戦潪甯歌Κ鍒囷紝绲︿簣鎴戝€戣ū澶氬公鍔┿€俆hank you so much. We will definitely recommend to our friends. 闈炲父鎰熻瑵浣犲€戯紝鎴戝€戜竴瀹氭渻鎶婂笣鏅厭搴楁帹钖﹁枽绲︽湅鍙嬪€戙€?,January 18

I鈥檝e been here a couple times with my husband and we both love it :) our most recent visit, Nick Lau helped a lot at front desk and we really appreciate it ! We plan to visit again in the future and we cannot wait !!

Heard from friends that the facilities in this hotel is great. Found good deal online, so four of us visited during weekend. Although it鈥檚 not near the city, the hotel itself provided FREE shuttle bus from both tsuenwan and tsimshatsui. We took the shuttle from TW MTR, it took me 10 minutes only! The stop is just right to the MTR, Very convenient. :) and it鈥檚 quite frequent. After arriving the hotel, the hotel staff was very friendly and could provide sufficient information about the attractions nearby.After we checked in, the bedroom is comfortable and the toilet is large and clean. Our hotel room view is towards the swimming pool. It also provided enough bottle water for guests I like the gym room the best, it has different facilities. And the staff there was friendly. We did gym for around an hour. Jogging, cycling, pulling etc. THE MOST expecting part is the sauna. Very relaxed The wet and dry sauna room are well l-equipped and not too crowded by the time we arrived. The changing room also has free locker to save our belongings. However, the swimming pool is under reconstruction. Definitely would visit again next time :)

The service and the environment is so good. Also, the swimming pool is big enough. I am looking forward to living in this hotel again in the future because it is really cool to watch the Tsing Ma Bridge in the room.

For the price that we paid, our expectations were definitely exceeded. The staff are very helpful and accommodating right from our check-in (thank you, Ivan!) all the way to our check-out. It's far from HK island but they offer a free shuttle that takes you to an MTR station. The shuttle also comes right on schedule based on the timetable that they gave us. The views of the Ting Kau bridge from our seaview room were spectacular - really lovely to watch the sunrise there! The breakfast buffet has adequate food though I think that maybe they can switch it up a bit after a couple of days. We will definitely consider staying here again when we go back to HK!Tip: From the airport going to the hotel, we found it convenient to ride the Airport Express to Tsing Yi then take an Uber from there.

Spent Christmas to new year here. Booked this hotel months before our flight schedule thru agoda at promotional price of Php 5,217.00/nightly family room without breakfast. I fortunately we missed our flight the day we supposedly first day in this hotel. But luckily we flew the next day. Here鈥檚 Ate the pros & cons.Pros: 1. this hotel is in Tsuen Wan, last station from Lantau island on the red line of Hong Kong MTR, Tsuen Wan known for cheaper place in hongkong. It鈥檚 near in Tsing Yi station going to central and back in airport. (Take note that the only fastest way to get in and back to airport is riding an arex. No other train will get you to central) 2. It鈥檚 a quiet place, near Ting Kau/lido beach just 5 minutes walking distance. View is great there and of course it鈥檚 free. 3. Since we missed our first day in hotel, this hotel gave us 鈥渇ree breakfast鈥?for the entire stays for our family package. Foods are decent. 4. There is a hotel shuttle service for free every 15 minutes everyday, from 7am - 11pm going to and from Tsuen Wan MTR Station. Pretty accessible right?! There鈥檚 mtr mall there, a mini supermarket also. I can鈥檛 complain. 5. There鈥檚 鈥済ame room鈥?for free. You can play Xbox, ps4 and one arcade game. Just ask reception/lobby to get the controller/s, sign the paper and game on! 6. There鈥檚 massage spa. It鈥檚 small but good. Though a bit expensive but give it a try. 7. There pool, but rarely open to use. Depends on the weather, I guess. 8. The room is quite spacious. (For a family of four) 9. It鈥檚 near in yung Chung line. Where Disneyland and Ngong Ping are located.10. Free unlimited WiFi Cons:1. They don鈥檛 change bed and pillows covers. They rarely well thorough clean the room.2. Bring your own razor, additional cotton buds, conditioner, cotton balls and other essentials. They don鈥檛 provide them for free. They only provide toothbrushes, shampoo, shower caps and sanitary plastic. 3. When you spend multiple days here, the WiFi seems to have Lags, and sometimes unreliable. 4. You need to bring international adaptor, though they provide one, but it could be less an issue if you provide your own. 5. Do not order 鈥渋n-room food鈥?no taste and definitely expensive. Unless you want and can afford tasteless low quality meal. 6. Housekeeping tend to be lazy to fully clean up the room, specially if you stay with kids, they rarely vacuum the floor, and neglect to dust. 6. Advisable to book this hotel from third party as it get cheaper than booking directly. All in all I still recommend this hotel for the main concern It provides. Even if you arrive late the MTR operates from 6am- 1am so it still cheaper to get yourself a cab or uber from Tsuen Wan station to this hotel. If ever I鈥檓 going back to hongkong I will book this hotel months before my arrival.

If you want to escape the bustle from the city like tsim sha tsui.. This is a great deal! Currently the ourdoor pool is under maintenance but indoor pool beside the sauna is great compensation for the chilly weather. Sauna is great becauae there are only a few guests who use it. Ideal time to go is around 9pm..Sauna: 7am to 11:30pm

Royal View Hotel offered great services and comfortable room! Staff were courteous and nice. I would like to thank Guest Service Manager, Miss Wancy for patiently listening to our requests during check-in. Overall, I am satisfied with this hotel and will be staying here again!

The location is not perfect due to missing direct connection with MTR but the good organised shuttle service to the station runs very often. The room is not spacious but comfortable and clean. The breakfast was good but not superb as a local restaurant in Hongkong and a bit messy due limited space. Everything in all good choice.

Travelling with our toddler and arriving late almost 10 PM. The reception staff (Mr. Nick Lau) was so understanding and kind. He recognized that we were tired, we needed a comfortable & clean and non-smoking room,and sizable bed for the three of us. He immediately upgraded us for free to a room with a special theme interior, complete with a car-racing simulator arcade!!!This hotel is strategically located for travelers looking to go to Disneyland, and near to Tsuen Wan for those looking for nice local culinary.

There Royal View Hotel seemed a big place fancy place after two months in Nepal; everything was clean, comfortable and overall the place had a well cared for feel. The hotel is located right up against one of Hong Kongs many impressive bridges but noise never seemed to be an issue. Down below the hotel, next to and even under the bridge, is a nice little swimming beach; it鈥檚 just a short walk with views of the bay along the way.Our room was on the 19th floor and had a feeling of being tucked right up under the bridge but it was quiet and getting off the elevators we enjoyed great views of the bridges and bay. Our room was modern and room. The beds firm and the linens cozy. The bathroom was very clean and the water really hot. The complimentary breakfast was diverse and very good. However, dinner options at the hotel were limited to a rather expensive buffet or room service.The location of the Royal View, next to the bridge and bay, is interesting but otherwise somewhat inconvenient. The hotel does run a free shuttle to town, the trip takes 10-15 minutes, and the wait was never more than a few minutes. The shuttle only makes one stop but that drops you off near other transit options and plenty of restaurants.We got our room at a good price online and if we were again in Hong Kong would stay at the Royal View again.

Because 1 Dec is an anniversary with my boyfriend , I call to request if upgrade is possible.Then the staff are polite, especially joanne and carrie.They help me to upgrade the top floor.It is a good service.The sea view is nice and the room is big.

Read positive reviews about this hotel before booking. During check in, I experience it. Great service from front office Mr Nick Lau. Very helpful and good communication. The housekeeping also act very fast on our request.

A very accommodating front desk staff Brian Wong. Free shuttle bus to and from train station. A nice buffet breakfast. Strong free wifi all over the hotel. Awesome outside view from family room. A quiet place away from city.

two nights stay before back to tasmania. different impression find in hong kong. there have a place like a bit in au and let me feeling like a home. family room is big enough for three of us and breakfast was very good with many choice. friendly staff with good price. will back again

Compare quality and price this is very nice Hotel in HK.Room was kept clean and the staff was friendly.Good view outside the window.The indoor pool looks so cool.It was really great value for your money.Must try!

We stayed here for one night prior to going to the airport. It isn't too hard to get to/from the city or airport via public bus, but the area is quite remote and this would definitely not be a suitable base for sightseeing in the city. Overall I was disappointed with this hotel - the service was perfunctory and impersonal (and check-in was very slow, the lone agent at the front desk spent approximately 15 minutes talking to one lady).The beds and shower were good, but the room had seen better days, lots of dust in corners and in the drawers/cabinets. Unfortunately the room had limited soundproofing, which is not good when many of the hotel guests lack basic consideration and have loud late night conversations in the hallways outside guestrooms. As there are plenty of options to choose from during my next visit to Hong Kong, I don't think I will return here.

I鈥檓 sad and disappointed...but I鈥檒l let this picture speak for itself.... this is our birthday cake for six people. We have come to this hotel so many time and this is the thanks we get. We was told this is the normal said. This is a slap in our faces and we will not return to this hotel. Also, it wouldn鈥檛 hurt to have a warm welcome... but I guess that鈥檚 to much to ask for. We are done!

- hotel is very much accessible via Airport express (Tsing Yi station) and the service shuttle is for free! -we were upgraded to connecting rooms which is totally awesome as they found that we are family visit, thumb up.-we were assisted very well by Ada and Rita even if we arrived early. :)Will definitely return here.

The room was super clean. There is a free shuttle to MTR points. The buffet was nice. Rita assisted me to have a room upgrade for our last day. Will totally recommend this hotel to friends and family.

I choose this hotel as their good comment. When I arrive, I found that it is true! The price was reasonable and the hotel was nice. Also, their receptionist staff were very accommodating. Special mention Kate and Rita. They used their smile and welcome us. They are very active to introduce the shuttle bus and the environment around hotel. Thumb up!

We stayed here for 3 nights while on a short stop over in Hong Kong. They asked for deposit for room in case of damage. Definitely not my kinda place. Breakfast was awful they served leftovers from previous day and UHT milk as fresh orange squash as fresh juice. Spar next door had fresh juice and fruit.

We stayed in silka for 9 night. We booked this hotel because of its location. Its location is very easy to reach the airport. You may enjoy their shuttle bus service taking guests around to mtr , tst and tsing yi. I also like the design of the lobby as well

Just booked this hotel for 6 nights, hotel is newly built with modern design. Appreciate fo staff arrange early check in upon arrival, thank your help Rita, Keith and albus. Room is equipped with Freddy mobile phone, which assist foreign travelers while travelling outside.

We stayed for 3 days. Hotel room is big & clean. Hotel's shuttle to nearest MTR & Airport Express train is very helpful. There's convinience store just next to hotel so we can buy things & top up octopus card easily. It's a recommended hotel. Just make sure to book non smoking room if u're non-smoker.

Hotel price is attractive , good environment and high hospitality, thanks you albus and Kathy, they are very accommodating. In addition, the hotel has convenient transportation and it is very easy to go to different theme parks.

Amazing sceneries and accomodating hotel staff,especially Rita and Keith. They are very professional and friendly.Also, they offer the shuttle bus to MTR which is very easy to travel in HK. They offer free WiFi and the freedy phone.

We stayed in Silka tsuen wan hotel for 4 nights and we have a very great memory here.Honesty the location of hotel is far from the city but there are two shuttle bus to the train stations so it made our plan more simple.Secondly, I want to express my compliment to Angus, Joseph and Peter. They are friendly, courteous and help. We always see these guys at night when we come back to Hotel and they helped us for the booking of shuttle bus everyday.Also, there is a 7-11 on ground floor, some restaurants can be found near the hotel, and a McDonald as well.I would recommend this hotel and I will definitely stay here if I visit hong Kong again!

Silka Tsuen Wan offers the best for their guests, they offer great service and they are very accommodating.Ricky from the concierge and his team is very helpful to us. The receptionists and the restaurant staffs are very kind and accommodating. They clean our room everyday and the CR is very clean.If I will go back to Hong Kong, I will surely booked to any of Silka hotels.

Good receptions by Mr Keith n Miss Kathy Good concierge by Mr Wilson Thanks 鈽?good location in city center.make everything very easy to access,sure to come back again next time,thanks for kindness of the receptions and the concierge.

Since our event had last minute cancellation (HK Dragon Boat Carnival 2019), our team managed to proceed anyways. We stayed few days at Dorsett and I found a hotel nearby, I immediately booked it online. Silka Hotel offered a great services (transportation, wifi, etc), friendly staff, very convenient location (close to shops/ laundry/ convenient stores/ bus). Overall I had a great experience, thank you and hope to see yah again.

The hotel provides great service for vacationers like me. They have fast wifi, hospitable employees and employees Rita, Martin and Angus who are very fluent in English, which is great for non-locals like me. My family was accomodated well and we liked the place.

It's my first time to travel to Hong Kong; I was so nervous before I left Taiwan. Angus and Keith gave me a hand to reserve the airport shuttle. Ada, Fiona, and Charles gave me great help during my stay. I'll consider booking this hotel again if I need to travel to Hong Kong.

All the staff are hospitally especially rita fiona and ricky and also the facility are very nice and clean the cafe area nice and good breakfast thank you so much silka hotel im enjoy to stay even 1 night i guaranteed to come ang relay to my family and friends

Although this hotel is not near the station, they provide the shuttle bus to MTR which is very convience. Also they have gym room , free wifi and the travelling phone to let take it outside and have free data At last, i want to say thank you to Rita and Angus who help me to check in and any help

I had the opportunity to stay at the Silka Tsuen Wan when I needed a night's lodging in transit. The staff was very friendly and efficient in helping me resolve common travel issues encountered. The hotel is a newly renovated industrial property with very unique interior design that made the hotel very pleasant esthetically. I found the small room, surprisingly comfortable and efficient, and other amenities just what I needed for travel (work out room clean, well ventilated and equipped for light workout), thus satisfying my needs like a much larger at a fraction the price! The hotel shuttle to the metro/bus was very reliable and made getting to and from anywhere in the city easy.

Thumbs up for Silka hotel. The room is very sheek, nice, and clean. The attendants are always ready to clean your room whenever you like to. The buffet breakfast is superb. They always have time fo refill and made sure all the food is hot and at its best. Lobby attendants are very welcoming and helpful. Will definitely book again and refer this hotel to my friends.

The wifi is fast and the customer service is good since the staff, Rita is very accomodating and very kind. Also the location of the hotel is very nice since it is near to a lot of restaurants and convenience store.

I have a pleasant stay in this hotel and I am especially very grateful for the friendly customer service. I would especially love to give a special shout to Joseph in the receptionist for a quick and excellent customer service even though when we arrived the lobby was pretty packed.

The place is convenient going to airport, disneyland and other tourist spots. They were so accommodating and they even let us check in early. Highly recommended! Thank you Ada, Martin, Keith, Aibus and Joe. :)

Very good hotel with polite staff members. Location is good with many stores and restaurants around the hotel. Shuttle bus to train station is good. Breakfast is also good with very nice people servicing there. The only issue may be the room is pretty small with little open spaces. This may be the case for many hotels in Hong Kong and Japan.

Checking in is easy and very convenient. The lobby staffs Martin, Ada, Keith and Joe were very accommodating to us. The hotel lobby is spacious and clean. We would definitely consider staying here again.

Great service! The hotel is nice and their staff are very nice, specially thanks to Joe and Rita. They also provide free wifi and in-town shuttle which are very nice. Specially mention that the shuttle bus will go to Asia-Expo.

This hotel were fabulous....the staff was happy to serving all of the people...wasn鈥檛 like the other hotel staff... and the room comfortable n they hv made a Decoration n location were build up at industrial centre area!but it is abit Quiet in the night.... doesn鈥檛 like to living in city...Noise! I hv strongly definitely recommend u guy should try on the hotel!also I pay cheap price n then u living one like 4star hotel!thank you鈥嶁檪锔?"May 24

High five to the staff of silka hotel tsuen wan. They were very accommodating especially the manager Joseph and also Joein all their efforts to grant my requests.Free shuttle service going to mtr station, daily buffet breakfast is excellent.Taxi going to airport is easy.We love staying in Silka and probably we will back in a second time around..my family esp my kids love it.Good job..

This is one of my fave hotel in HK. They have a wonderful, helpful staffs especially the manager, Joseph. Rooms are clean, and spacious for Hongkong standard, with all the necessary toiletries provided. With free shuttle service to nearest mtr station. There are also many nice foods within walking distance from the hotel, cheap and authentic Chinese foods. We stayed at 5th floor where the garden ia located. This is a 4star hotel with 5star service and facilities. Highly recommended.

Fantastic stay in Silka TsuenWan hotel. This is my first time to visit HK for leisure with my family. I would say thank you to hotel. Especially the staff from counter : Joe, Keith, Charles and Kathy. They are very polite, helpful and friendly. They introduce the facilities and services of their hotel to us clearly. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Hotel shuttle services are good for us to the town. We hope to stay in this hotel for next visit!

This hotel is very nice and courtesy. The hotel staff are very friendly and they offer early check-in as i request. thumb up to Kathy and Rita. The hotel also offer free shuttle bus to MTR and ferry terminal. this is very convenience. To other travellers, you can ask the front desk to have the local dinning map which is easy to find restaurants around hotel

Granted us free early check in, there is free shuttle bus as well, the staff are accommodating and helpful, they are fluent in speaking english. I love the hotel's ambiance. There is also a restaurant at the ground floor where they serve free buffet breakfast

Silka Hotel may not be located at the downtown area but they provide shuttle to Kwai Fung and means to the Airport. There is a mall near the hotel, 711 beside and eating places around. There is a multipurpose hall near the lobby where you can wait, charge or just rest. They respond quickly to our requests and the staff are friendly and accommodating. The only thing that we didn鈥檛 like in the hotel is the quality of food in the breakfast buffet. Overall, it exceeded our expectations.

We stayed at here for 3nights, it was a twin bed. The staffs are very accommodating and kind. They are very helpful as well. The hotel has its own shuttle service where they will drop you off near the Kwai Fong MTR station and they will also pick you up in the designated area, the shuttle service is always on time. the hotel is location is near a fast food chain and a convenience store if you do not have time to shop for food you can always go to the nearest fast food. The Breakfast Buffet is not that overwhelming but its enough for you to provide energy for the entire day. The room was small but enough for 2 person, since we only stayed there to sleep and take a bath we did not mind the space. The bathroom was clean and showers was pressurised. Just make sure to bring your own shampoo and soap, the hotel provide bath products but it was not my preferred scent. Hair Dryer is readily available as well.

I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in April 2019. I thought it was excellent value for money. Especially the staff made all the difference by having a great attitude and manner. Reception staff: Spoke great English and were always polite. Concierge staff: Did a perfect job of keeping the shuttle buses, taxis and coaches moving out on time when there was a build up of traffic in the street. They were polite even in the busy times.Shuttle bus: On time, every time. Leaving the hotel and at pick up points. I hadn't planned on relying on the shuttle bus due to my experiences at other hotels, but this one was done right, so I used it 3 out of my 6 days. Make sure you make a reservation for a morning bus the night before though because there are limited spaces and sometimes walk-ups can't get on in the mornings.Shuttle Bus time taken to downtown Tsim Sha Tsui:Hotel to China Ferry Terminal (Tsim Sha Tsui): 45 minutes (You can get ferries to Macau or walk to the Star Ferry Terminal through a shopping centre from there.)Free smartphone: Each room has a smartphone that you can take outside the hotel with you and use as a mobile WiFi hotspot for your own phones and mobile devices. That was an incredibly convenient bonus. I didn't have to pay extra for a Mobile wifi unit at the airport and worry about returning after. The phone could make free local calls, too, but I didn't use that feature. Concierge manager: (I think he was the manager by his age and air of authority) He was especially excellent. When we had ordered taxis by the in-room phone, he would pick us out from the crowd in the ground floor lobby area and show us to the taxi, confirm the destination in Chinese with the driver and give me a guideline price so I know what to expect. He also paid attention to our destination and offered advice such as letting us know Disneyland has a policy of no food and drink to be taken into the park. Thanks to his comment we quickly checked the internet (with the hotel mobile wi-fi hotspot) and found that we could take 1 water bottle each and they were lenient on kids with two bottles and snacks so we readjusted our bags to even out our drinks and food instead of me carrying everything.Then we were careful to pick a security line with staff who were not checking bags strictly. (For example, on one line a strict lady was checking every backpack deeply and some food and a canned drink was removed. But in our line the staff member just looked in the top of the bag and felt the bottom of the bag from the outside to check if there were any cans in there.) Breakfast: It was included in my room reservation, which was the cheapest available at that time. 7-10am. I found it to be above expectations on my first day, but like anything you get used to it after 5 days. It had a mix of Chinese and western breakfast including fried eggs, scrambled egg, sausage, boiled ham, chicken nuggets, baked beans, salad bar, fruit bar, Chinese dumplings, fried rice, noodles, and other things I can't name. Great freshly ground coffee machine, too. Cereal and toast available, too and some soft drinks. Restaurant had enough tables so we never felt overcrowded.Room: Clean. No unpleasant surprises. Includes toiletries like toothbrush, toothpaste, shaver, sewing set, shampoo, soap. Water temperature and power ok. One day, the cleaning staff didn't change the sheets as requested, but that was fixed the next day. The reception staff always responded to requests satisfactorily. Kettle and tea, instant coffee in the room. One water bottle for each guest replaced daily. That was a nice touch.To the management of Silka Tsuen: Give your concierge manager a bonus and praise your staff. They made the hotel shine.To other hotels if you read these reviews looking for ideas: free smartphones in rooms please! It will be a new deal breaker for me I think :-) Also, water bottles each day are good, too.Taxi prices that I paid:Airport to hotel 280 HKD (10pm) 45 minutesHotel to airport 241 HKD (8am)I don't know why there's a price difference, I think the driver on my first trip might have overcharged me slightly but I can't be sure.He pressed a button on the top right of his meter a few times to boost the price saying it was for the highway and night rate. But I didn't want to argue about it. The final driver taking us back to the airport in the morning only pressed the top right button once to add the highway toll fee.I suspect the second guy was the honest one. Hotel to Disneyland 160 HKD (9am) 25 minutesDisneyland to hotel 190 HKD (8pm)Again, a price difference. I'm not sure why. Several pressings of the "magic" meter button going on.Overall, thanks to the hotel staff I had a great stay. I would definitely stay here again if I went to Hong Kong again.(If you found this review useful, why not take a look at my books available on Amazon "Hanatoki: Japan Flower Shop", "Winning Sports Betting Strategies" and "Big Data Betting" by Tom Whitaker.)Once again, thanks to the hotel staff I had a great stay. This hotel is relatively new and very clean, so I think for the prices it charges, it is very reasonable. The shuttle bus, free water and especially the free smartphone use all add up to make the stay very smooth and pleasant.

Thumbs up for staying in this hotel. The place is nice and clean. Employees are accomodating. You can ask them anytime. They are responsive.The hotel offers shuttles and the place of this hotel is near restaurants outside.

The hotel is very nice and clean.The standard rooms are small but productive, there was everything we needed.The value for the price is excellent.The location is not in the center but also a nice place and not too far from the center.We didn't order a shuttle to the station to the express airport train because we didn't know that we had to order a place, so that when we came to the shuttle we figured out that the shuttle is full and we are in problem. But the staff helped us and organized us a special car for free that took us to the station.In summary: I recommend!Thanks.

Lovely hotel with excellent service. Came to stay here last month with my parents, it was our first visit and we were very impressed. The rooms were comfortable and well maintained. All the lobby staff were polite, friendly and attentive. Access to public transport was good, and all for a reasonable price. Would stay here again.

Stayed here for a week, from 20th-21st of April. Prior coming in to the hotel, I already felt the warm welcoming from the staff. Emailed them 2 days before asking for directions from HKIA, and they promptly answered my inquiry, giving me a lot of options. Upon arrival at the hotel premise, man from the concierge (sorry, forgot the name) immediately help me with my luggage and bag upon stepping down the shuttle direct me to the 1F for check in. It was early morning (around 12noon), Receptionist Keith assist me, provided me a copy of shuttle bus schedules and a map of restaurants nearby hotel - a plus, most of the hotel I've stayed in HK doesn't really bother to introduce you with the area, whether you are a newbie or pro, this kind of gesture really helps. Keith also let me go to my designated room (note: time is prior standard check in time) which is a BIG PLUS to me since I'm tired from my early flight and mostly didn't experienced this with previous hotel I've checked in around HK. Unable to bring with me adaptor, but housekeeping lend me with just 1 phone call. A great small room (a HK standard) but filled with everything I needed - cable tv, mini fridge, safebox, toiletries, minibar, cabinets, hangers, slippers and a smartphone with internet you can bring with you for free use. A nice mini garden to relax after a long day or lazy afternoon weekends, a gym and buffet restaurant. Another Overall, staffs here were great, from concierge to receptionist to housekeep, as well as the facilities. Will definitely be back here for future business meetings and recommend this hotel the company, friends and family. Keep it up, Silka Tsuen Wan!
