I stayed in Silka Tsuen Wan on 25 - 26 April and they let me feel warm. On 25 Apr, I arrived on early morning and the guy in reception, Odan helped me to have room early and let me have and rest. Also, I want to specially thanks to Rita as she provided excellent service! She teach me how to use their shuttle bus and introduce the local food around the hotel with their local dine map.They had a little garden which is very niceI will totally recommend my friends and family to be here

Hotel is absolutely good and has a good service. They also have a good connection for wifi which can be shared. The location is a little bit far way city but they provide the shuttle bus to citytown. At last, i need to say thank you to Odan.

The service was exemplary! Staff greeted you from start to end and very helpful. The lobby was beautiful and well-equipped. It were always clean & amenities awesome. Definitely a place to go back to. This was a great hotel at a great price.

This is my first time to visit here and I feel very warm. When I entered to hotel, Raymond is assist and lead me to reception. After that, the reception staff Rita also very kind . Hotel provide shuttle bus and local dinner map l. It is very conveience. Free WiFi , i will recommend others

Excellent service with Martin The rooms are clean and comfortable I will recommenced this hotel to my friends when they come to HK I鈥檓 looking forward to having a breakfast here, hope it will be delicious!!

Silka Tsuen Wan is a very homey place.The staff are very accomodating and friendly especially Odan the one who assist us..The hotel is very clean,near to all restaurant and MTR Stn..They have Shuttle Bus service for free to/from hotel..Two thumbs upfor the Silka Tsuen Wan Hotel..

My first time to Hong Kong,their front desk staff Kate and Fiona are nice.they have give us many useful information to travel in Hong kong. The room is good also they have free shuttle bus to send us to mtr. Actually they also have gym room but today we are too late to enjoy this service.

We stayed there last March 11 to March 14, 2019 for two rooms and we would like to give our sincere thank you for the great service that Silka Tsue Wan Hotel gave to us.From the start of emailing inquiries to them up to our check out day they never let us down - they really assisted us and helped us on whatever we need.To give highlights to their precious service I would like to pinpoint the following great things:1. One of our rooms is in the smoking floor area, I asked if we can change room and they give us another room -an upgraded one at no extra cost! Thank you for this Silka!2. All of their receptionists are very attentive to our needs, most especially to Ms. Rita Ng their Guest Relations Officer. She even make sure that the red taxi that we will get upon going to airport has no scent of cigarette - she find ways to accommodate us and help us even she's not on duty anymore (we saw here upon strolling outside and she tells us where we could get affordable food and groceries!) Thank you for all your effort Mam Rita!3. The Housekeeping Team is also helpful - for the 4 days that we stayed they always clean our room nicely. I feel their geniune concern to us because they always provide toiletries that we need. A sincere thank you Madams!4. The hotel is very new and beautiful, with modern style and lovely scent, we thank you for that Silka for maintaining your service in excellent way!4. They have a FREE cellphone to use, you can bring it when you will stroll outside and use its wifi! What more can you ask for? Thank you for that!We will definitely sure to come back and will recommend you to our friends and family!Because you make a warm, family-oriented feeling and memorable impression to us! It feels as if we are not tourists but one of your family! Thank yoy!

Checked in with my family and they do have a great service, as well as great staff. The hotel itself is well tidied too, the ambiance is good. Not to mention their interiors! More power to come, Silka. Def recommend!

My family stayed in Silka Tseun Wan Hotel while we were in hongkong and booked 2 rooms from them . The shuttle service provided by the hotel is a big help for the guests and the breakfast buffet is really a plus point .The hotel staffs are very approachable especially Joseph who extend his assistance from the elevator and helped us with our concern with the keycard and accomodate our request. Truly a recommended hotel in hk!

Thanks for service which provided by Rita Ada Odan Albus. They are kind and have good smile. They also answer my question patiently. And , this hotel provide the shuttle bus which is convenient for travelling in hong kong.

Highly recommended.the rooms are very clean and spacious good for family and friends.the staffs like ms ada, charles, martin and odan are very helpful and very accomnodating.they help and assist us guest if we have some queries.breakfast food is okay.

This is good hotel! The staff help us to upgrade the room regarding our needs. Also, they have good smile when we enter the hotel,especially thanks to Rita Keith Roger. Hotel have free shuttle bus service.

Thank you for making our stay comfortable, not the room I expected but still, a room is okay. I prefer booking to this kind of hotel again when I come to visit again, very peaceful and quiet. staffs are very accommodating and helpful.

Good customer service! From Ada, Keith, Rita and Alice, Thank you So much! The room and the hotel is very clean and the people i mentioned are very accomodating! You guys made our first trip to Hongkong very memorable, Thank you!

This is not my first time to visit this hotel, the staff of the reception are very kind. They arrange me to have early check in as I arrive in early morning. Specially thanks to Rita. Other staff of reception also are very friendly such as Alice Ada Keith. I will visit this hotel next time.

From the time we arrived we were wowed by our stay. Since this is a training hotel the students are closely monitored check in and check out. We were greeted by the staff who handled our luggage from the taxi. We were in awe over our ocean view room and they anticipated our needs by positioning my friend who was checking in several hours after us next to ours so we could open the adjoining door. The rooms are very large. Our double beds seem short but my friends king didnt appear short. The extra bed to accommodate our 3rd person was too hard so my daughter slept with me.The buffet breakfast which is included was excellent. We loved all of the spa services. One of us had an amazing massage while the rest enjoyed the jacuzzi, steam room and relaxation room. The spa is very clean and has alot of amenities. This is also included in the stay.On our first night we lucked out and was able o experience the Friday themed dinner. Definitely a must if you're there on a Friday.My daughter used the gym which had top notch equipment with TV'sWe would have appreciated more English speaking TV channels but it also forced us to take a break from TV.All of the staff were very friendly and professional

I stayed here with my 13-year old grandson for four nights and we had a wonderful time. We purchased our octopus cards at the airport, found the A10 airport bus and stayed on until stop 26. The hotel was easy to spot right across the street.We were warmly greeted and able to check in early after a long flight from Barcelona. The hotel room was perfect in every way. The included breakfast was delicious with all types of food. We had a late lunch one day and room service one night. Highly recommend the curry.I had a problem with the travel adapter we brought and asked to borrow another one at the front desk. Instead, two staff members came to our room and got it to work. Very impressed. We never had to open a door while going outside or getting an elevator.The location was so convenient with frequent bus service. We also did a 5 or 6 mile round trip hike to The Peak on a really quiet trail and were rewarded with gorgeous views.We stayed at the InterContinental after our time here which was great, but to be honest we preferred the T Hotel's staff and service. It was no problem getting an Uber to the InterContinental.Can't wait to return to our favorite Hong Kong hotel. Thanks T Hotel!

We had a very nice stay at The T Hotel recently. My wife uses an electric scooter, and the staff was very accommodating. The room and entire hotel was very clean, and we would definitely use it again in the future. Other positives include super-friendly staff, a good fitness center, and a great price (especially since it includes breakfast). Plus you get to watch raptors soaring right outside your window, and there's a great trail to The Peak that starts just up the street.Some (minor) negatives...1. The location isn't super-convenient, since it's on the opposite side of the island from Central, and not close to any MTR stop. There's not much going on in the Pokfulam area (though that can be a good thing).2. Taxi drivers sometimes have trouble finding the hotel, and once a cab we ordered (via SynCab) didn't show up because he couldn't find it.3. The breakfast buffet is a bit limited, compared to other hotels in HK.4. The handicap room didn't have a roll-in/walk-in shower.5. We had to learn that some more complex requests need to be made to the instructors, versus the trainees.All in all we had a very good experience, and would definitely stay there again.

We enjoyed six nights at the T hotel and every aspect of the hotel was outstanding. Breakfast is lavish, the rooms are spacious, and the other meals were delicious as well. Breakfast was varied with many options to choose from. We also recommend booking to eat both Chinese and Western meals from the culinary institute for lunch! The students worked hard to help with anything we needed and there was always support for them from their teachers. The hotel is located in Pokfulam, which is an easy one-bus ride from the airport on the A10. Other buses whisked us back to the MTR and we even took the bus to Stanley. The lounge has a wonderful view of the sea--try to get a room that does as well. We will certainly stay again on our next visit to Hong Kong. It represents true luxury at a budget price AND you are helping students learn in their chosen professions.

We just stayed here for 6 nights. Hesitant about sharing as it is such a great deal! It is pleasantly surprising.This is a training hotel so be prepared for a few hiccups. The staff are delightful young people being training in the hotel and hospitality field. They don鈥檛 always understand what you want but do their utmost to help you and will always call a senior staff member to translate. Great rooms well managed and very clean and comfortable. We had a wonderful view over the Lamma Channel. A great breakfast included in the rate with a big variety of dishes to choose from and freshly made egg dishes. Not so great in making a latte! The lounge is also open for lunch,tea and dinner. We had dinner twice and were very pleased. It is very quiet with only 30 rooms on the 6th floor.The bus stop is less than 100 yards away on the Main Street. Taxis are easily available and only 15-20 minutes into the city. We would certainly stay there agai.

OK, so we found the T Hotel courtesy of Tripadvisor, rather than our own detective work but what a great place. As you鈥檒l have seen, the hotel trains staff to work in the hospitality industry but that doesn鈥檛 mean there鈥檚 any compromise on standards. This is basically a 4 star (in some respects 5 star) hotel for a lot less than you鈥檒l find anywhere else in HK. The rooms are spacious (ours came with a sea view), the food is excellent, there鈥檚 a decent gym and location-wise you鈥檙e on the island with a host of buses stopping outside. So what are you waiting for, get your Octopus card and get exploring with a hearty breakfast inside you to start the day!

I stumble upon this hotel by chance on the webpage and I went to this hotel to explore further.They serve nice lunch at the restaurant and the view facing the sea was great.Despite the slightly distant trip, the journey was worth it.I subsequently went back to the same restaurant for dinner on the same day with my wife and was unfortunately, told that the restaurant is actually opened only to hotel guests.Hence, if you are not a guest of T Hotel, do be aware that you will be denied entry to the restaurant.

We have stayed here for our last 3 visits to Hong Kong.The staff are all students who are studying hospitality and as such are busting at the bit to please! Nothing is to hard or an inconvenience to arrange.The hotel was having a Chinese lunar new year dinner on the Friday. We asked if we could get in to the dinner, we were informed it was booked out :( I mentioned in passing that we were having our 34th anniversary the next day. We left for our daily exploring trip. When we returned there was a message on our phone. The concierge had heard our conversation with the staff and had managed to get us in for the dinner. To say it was spectacular is an understatement. The food & service was the best we have seen in our many years of travelling. Then we came back to our room on Saturday to find our bed was decorated with rose petals, fruit with plates & knife, and love heart swans. Our day was just perfect as there was also champagne waiting for us as the sunset on the balcony.Most people think this hotel is too far from everything, but they are incorrect. *It is an easy 30 min walk to the peak for the best views*There is public transport right out the front to take you to anywhere on the island and main land*There is a free shuttle to the train station & ferry every Monday to Friday (would be good if it was everyday)*The bus from/ To the airport leaves directly in front of the hotel and is an easy 1 hour trip. You get to see a lot of Hong Kong along the way.* The views of the sunset on the balcony are second to none. Really you can't beat this hotel for service, food & valueWe will be back again & again

We visit Hong Kong several times a year and have stayed at the T Hotel on a number of occasions. The T is an oasis of calm as one is far away from the often very polluted areas in town yet just half an hours drive away on the hills of Pokfulam. The service provided is excellent, in particularly the front desk team, under the expert and professional guidance of Elisa, Gabriella and Christie. We were most grateful for the early check in facilitated after arriving in Hong Kong on an overnight flight, and for providing storage for a piece of luggage when we went to Japan for a few days. The only recommendation I would make is to reduce the use of cardboard packaging for the bathroom amenities to be more environmentally friendly!

Arrived very early, had breakfast and were facilitated with early check in. We really appreciated this facility and it meant a lot to us. The view from the 6th floor across the harbour is very nice. The food in restaurant was first class and the attention to us was really good. The bed was a super King Size and it was really comfortable. The room and hotel is really clean. The people are great, it was simply a matter of asking what we wanted and then the information was accurate and very prompt. it was always researched and factually correct. Took taxi from airport, but used the bus to go back out and it was as good a service. Only thing is buses and taxis use cash and many of the attractions are cash transactions. Hotel were very helpful with change etc..

Ssshh. Don't tell anyone but this training hotel has to be one of Hong Kong's hidden best value gems. Easily accessible from the airport by public airport express bus, or a short taxi ride from the central railway station, it is of the highest quality. The bonus is being looked after by a plethora of helpful eager to please students learning on the job. The hotel, on the 6th floor of a hospitality school and near the Chinese Culinary, has about 30 luxurious and well equipped rooms. The best have views to the west out over the shipping channels to the South China Sea. There were six staff to welcome us at ground level, and several to escort us and our bags to the 6th floor where one was nominated to show and explain all the gadgetry from a free mobile phone, to touch screen lighting. Our dining experience - a five course meal with wines - was up there with the best Michelin standard restaurants. Waiting staff were initially nervous but shadowed by a tutor, they were soon at ease advising on the wines, sweeping crumbs from the table and re-laying cutlery for each course. The included breakfast, in the dining room with a view, provided so many choices. We opted for omelettes, skilfully cooked to order by two shy and immaculately dressed young female chefs. All the usual options of cereal, bacon, beans, tomatoes, breads, European cold cuts as well as Asian breakfast styles were on offer. And a barista ! While the servicing of the room by about 4 or 5 young people may have taken a little longer, it was thorough, and the rooms and bathroom were immaculate and the bedding of the highest quality. From the bus stop on PokFu Lam road we headed either into the city, or the other way down to the old fishing community of Aberdeen. The senior transport card, Octopus, purchased at the airport, covered these bus trips for about $A2 a trip. Compared to our previous expensive and hectic experiences in Hong Kong, this was a delightfully restful and rewarding time, knowing we were also helping to foster a new generation of hospitality staff. But don't say anything. Everyone will want to stay here.

What more can we say than has already been said. This is a great "hotel" easy to get to on the A10 bus from the airport and good connections by bus and MRT to all the sights in HK.All the trainees were charming, bit of an understandable language problem sometimes, but always sorted quickly by the tutors.Good size room for HK and great ocean views. Will definitely stay again when in HK.

We stayed at the hotel for three nights in early December. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful and the service is simply great. The location is fine: a bus stop within one minute walk. In addition, the hotel operates a free shuttle to Central three times a day. Rooms are spacious and modern and the fitness center is small but has sufficient facilities. We enjoyed very much the hospitality and assistance of Ms. Jenny Chan.

Recently, returned from a 4 day holiday at The T Hotel. Stayed with my husband and 4 friends. On arrival, I was very impressed with the service received. We arrived late in the evening and we were taken to the reception floor. The staff were very professional and the check-in was smooth.We stayed on the 6th Floor, with a sea view , looking over the South China Sea and Aberdeen. The room was excellent, and very clean. A remote control, by the bedside was available to turn on/off lights and the air con. The mini bar, to my surprise was very cheap for a hotel. Just 12 Hong Kong Dollars for a beer (just over a 拢1). The rooms also provide a smart phone, that you can take with you, when travelling around Hong Kong. We used this to find streets and restaurants. We could also phone local and international for free.All staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. As it's a training hotel, majority of the staff are learning. During breakfast, the staff were pleasant and made our staff good.Can't really say there was anything negative about this hotel. The only constructive criticism I have is, that the breakfast set up needs to be adjusted. On the egg station, the young trainee only had 1 frying pan. This could cause problems if the hotel is busy. This area should have more pans, so that at least 2 people could cater for the demand. Due to language barriers, it would be a good idea to have definitions of different egg dishes in several languages and with visual aids. I found that boiled eggs weren't understood.The highlight of the stay, was eating in the Chinese Restaurant on the 7th Floor. You can book to have lunch here and it was just amazing. The best meal of my whole stay. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Transport is easy, as the bus stop is outside the hotel, and it has numerous buses stopping. The airport bus also stops here A10

My wife and I stayed here for five nights in November 2018 on our first trip to Hong Kong. We cannot recommend this establishment highly enough. The service from the trainees (and their instructors) is excellent; the breakfast buffet among the best we have had; the informal dinners in the lounge perfect after a day out; we could go on and on. The location was perfect for us, outside the busy downtown area but on a main road with good bus links. Do not miss taking part in a Dining Society dinner, a highlight of our stay.

Very nice sea view, and awesome room.The bed is good, and they have a nice bathroom!Very nice staff, good service and very helpful, although some of them are students.Good location, easy to take bus to everywhere.

We really enjoyed our stay at the T Hotel and would highly recommend.Getting to the hotel from the airport is very easy, there's a bus that takes you right to the door in about 45 mins. When you get off the bus the entrance to the hotel is not immediately obvious and when you find it, you feel more like you're entering a factory loading area rather than a hotel.Don't panic! The lobby of the hotel is more what you'd expect and hope for. It is a training hotel and we were checked in by a possy of students, all very polite and the ones that were actively checking us in were efficient. We were very fortunate, we arrived at the hotel at about 08.30, well before check in, but our room was ready for us by 09.30. After an overnight flight this was much appreciated.The room itself was very comfortable and had a stunning view out to sea. Rooms are on the 6th floor but you feel like you're much higher up. The ensuite had both a bath (with TV) and a very good shower. The bed was great (not to hard and not too soft unlike others on this trip) and the proportions of room, bed and bathroom generous. Breakfast was the one point when it became apparent that the T hotel is a training hotel. The food was fine, not the best breakfast but that's largely down to personal taste and there's a sufficient selection on offer to ensure something for everyone. The service was more random with a feeling that there's a few too many students than necessary and as a result they get under each others feet or are tempted to chat amongst themselves. That said, they were friendly and helpful. The girls at the 6th floor reception / guest relations were lovely, very helpful and really friendly. The best and for us, most impressive, facility at the T hotel was the 'Handy', a smart phone provided for our use during our stay. This was enabled to allow us to access the Internet whilst out and about and make calls (including international calls). It was a god send and saved a fortune in international roaming charges.The location of the hotel is not the most glamorous that Hong Kong has to offer, nor the most central. However, it is incredibly well served by buses, there are plenty of buses going to downtown and even direct buses to Kowloon (for the Temple Street night Market and Mong Kok) and Happy Valley. It's also easy to get to Aberdeen. Sadly we weren't there long enough to go to Repulse Bay or Causeway. However, the buses are frequent (we never waited more than 5 mins for a bus when leaving the hotel), efficient and ran late into the night so we never felt too far away from the action. One word of caution, the airport bus was early the day we departed and it only runs every half an hour so, if you're relying on it to catch your flight, don't leave it till the last minute! All in all, the T Hotel represents excellent value for money and we would certainly stay there again.

We stayed for 3 nights over the weekend when the super typhoon hit the region. What amazed us was the great hospitality (exceeds five star hotels I suppose) as well as attentiveness of the hotel staffs, including trainees at each section. Even though my 7 year old son was able to neither speak English nor Cantonese very well, they kindly talked to him many times. On the final day, some staff talked to him even in Japanese! Also, he was very surprised by a cup of cocoa latte with Ponyo鈥檚 art, which was so cute. Such a kindness dedicated to us made our stay superb. Not only human aspect but also the IT support provided is one of their strong points of the hotel. The room featured a smartphone with free internet access, local calls and international call to 10 designated countries, which allowed us to safely return to the hotel and make a delayed flight confirmation call to the airline office outside HK. When it comes to the location there should be pros and cons. I love the location, though.We鈥檒l definitely come back to the hotel when visiting HK next time.

Interesting concept. Mainly trainees run this 4-star hotel at a very affordable price. Also, the location is a bit away from the city. However, we enjoyed our stay here very much. A comfortable hotel with a luxury touch, stunning view and great breakfast. You can feel the positive approach. Gladly again!

I would strongly recommend the T Hotel - we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. The staff were so warm and attentive and the room and facilities were beautiful, very comfortable with a lovely view. The breakfast was superb with a huge selection and the dinner and wine we had was the best we had in Hong Kong. The location was very nice - quiet residential with excellent 10 minute bus ride back into Central. Thank you and well done to all.

We have just spent 4 nights at this hotel and cannot fault it at all. The room had a beautiful view and was so so clean and nicely done. It was serviced well every day. While we were there we tried the restaurant and absolutely loved the lunch. Such great value when you get the three course meal option and it is some of the nicest food we have had on this trip (far exceeding the 2 Michelin star place we went to in Shanghai!). We liked it so much we ate lunch here two days in a row.Spa treatments were good and the facilities looked great too, though we didn't use them. The only strange thing here is men and women jacuzzi and saunas are seperate, but they did look fantastic. The service we had was exemplary throughout. The students are clearly so motivated to provide a great stay and get it right,and their teachers were always there to step in of they needed help.I can't recommend this place enough, everyone should go!

Where to begin! The T Hotel epitomizes 5star quality at 3 star prices. Understanding what it represents will ensure a fabulous stay. The hotel is set up for training students in hospitality, chefs, admin, front desk, room service etc. They are shadowed at all times by their tutors/ professionals and work their way through conversation in a range of languages and could not be more attentive and helpful. The rooms only on one floor are stunning. Awesome views across the waters of Hong Kong were well worth the trek to get there. They are furnished to the highest degree, all different and I believe there are suites too. We had a TV in the bathroom, an amazing range of toiletries, slippers and dressing gowns provided, huge bed, and chocolates on the pillow each night. Breakfast was included for us and it proved to be a wonderful smorgasbord of continental, cooked and Chinese traditional food. Absolutely nothing is too much trouble for the staff who are on hand at every turn. They organised Octopus cards for us to travel, advised us of the easiest way to get back to the hotel and provide free shuttle buses to Central or Star Ferry during the week. The only downside is the location which is a 20 min bus ride (or bus and MTR) to Central but so much fun trying different routes and taking photos. There is a Spa/ gym available for guests and you automatically become a member of the dining society (TDS) which gives the chefs an opportunity to reallly home their skills in both the Chinese or Western dining rooms where English Speaking is part of the experience. Worked for us. I cannot commend the staff and students highly enough for ensuring we had a wonderful stay. A heavy thunderstorm which blew in as we were about the head out to the airport bus (a two minute walk to the road in front of the hotel) resulted in 2 students on the front desk carrying umbrellas and our luggage (though we did help) and trying to keep us dry. They waited until the bus arrived and ensured we were safely on board. Wow! Pokfulam, where the hotel is situated is quite out of the way of most attractions and other hotels so not good for walking to nearby restaurants etc, Definitely a short but easy bus/ train ride to eat out or experience HK attractions. Across the road is the old village of Pokfulam which is quite an amazing sight to see how people still live locally. A highly recommended experience if you are happy to be away from the main hubs of Hong Kong.

As with previous reviewers we can attest that this is a gem of a hotel in Hong Kong and well worth staying at!We stayed for 3 nights on the way back from the UK to NZ and booked it after reading all the amazing reviews on TA. We got a taxi from the airport which was less than the hotel's estimated cost for the trip, great value in fact and if you cant be bothered with shuttles or buses do this! Check in was warm and welcoming. Our room was wonderful with breath taking views out to sea. My husband, who is an avid ship spotter, was in seventh heaven with all the large container ships passing by! The room was large, beautifully furnished and well equipped. The shower (important in the humidity) was wonderful.Every night we ate dinner at the training restaurant and it was delicious, as was breakfast each morning. Our only feedback would be that we would have liked a few daily specials at dinner perhaps, just to break the sameness of the menu each night. Drinks and food were reasonably priced for Hong Kong and brilliant value.The little shopping centre about 5 mins walk away was great for water, groceries and any other extras(pharmacy) you may need.As other reviewers have said the service and attention in all public areas is very intense but the students were so enthusiastic and lovely that this can be forgiven and is understandable.I had a 30min massage while there and it was incredible, highly recommend and would have booked a longer massage but they had no spaces left, so get in early!Thank you to everyone at the T Hotel for making our stay so wonderful. We loved being there and will definitely return! Tina :-)

Almost 9 months after the fact, but need to contribute how wonderful our stay was!!You need to book well in advance and it is worth it! Across the street from a settlement village (not the correct term, but . . .) and the market by the bus stop is NOT to be missed if you want to appreciate local culture. T hotel was sublime and we LOVED our stay. Not sure we loved HK the same, but would happily stay T again :-)

It鈥檚 a hotel that help train hospitality students getting ready for the real world. When we arrived late in the evening, they were already waiting for us. With the supervisor we were ushered to our very comfortable and spacious room. Everything in the room was explained to us in details as that was part of their training. It was kind of nice that one can participate in the training as being the guests. On our part we need to be patient sometimes with the understanding that they are under training. The view from the room was beautiful. You looked into the Bay. The room was well stocked with everything you need.... from bathroom to mini fridge and tea and coffee. There was also a free shuttle service to the city centre So that was very convenient. Breakfast was amazingly well done, again by students and their trainer chefs... TOP quality. Everyone was attentive and service was very good. You can see that the young people tried their best effort and that really made you so satisfied and just wanted to encourage each and everyone of them.Checking out we had the manager and the trainees seeing us right up to our cab. That was some service right till the end. Like I said it is a different kind of experience and you get good quality and great service in this hotel. I would recommend it and I personally will stay here again when I visit Hong Kong.

Booked it based on the trip adviser score and the fact the price was very reasonable for the quality and amenities. We were a little worried about location as neither of us had been to Hong kong before, however don't let it's position put you off. The public transport system is excellent and we had no difficulty getting anywhere in Hong Kong from the hotel. There are buses every few minutes that pass right outside, we tended to jump on one of the north bound buses and hop off at hong kong university mtr which was less than 10 minutes away, then hop on a train to central again these were every 5 or 10 minutes. We took the A10 bus from the airport to get to the hotel which again was her easy as the bus has a digital screen showing the various stops so it was simply a case of pressing the stop button once the pok fu lam village stop was next., the hotel is pretty much opposite the bus stop so was easy to find. It is a training hotel so some of the staff were a little unsure of themselves and occasionally we had an issue with the language barrier but they just call in the more experience staff and it's sorted. The hotel was extremely clean and well run, the room was large with a bath and large walk in shower we had an ocean view the rooms on the other side have a view of the peak ( there are 2 routes up to the peak and Victoria peak from the road the hotel is on which give some great views) there isn't a great deal of local restraunts , but the hotel menu was very reasonably priced and the kennedy area of hong kong is 10 minutes away by bus and has lots of restraunts and cafes. They also give you a handy phone, which is a pre loaded mobile you can take with you on your trips out so you are never without internet, you can even load up your own facebook accounts etc. We found this very useful , especially as it meant we had access to Google maps. Great hotel and we would deffo stay again, one tip if you have a while between check out and your flights hong kong station has check in desks for most major airlines so we just took our luggage to the the train station and checked them in, collected our boarding passes leaving us the rest of the day to spend in Hong Kong.

Isn't it amazing when your expectations and the reviews match perfectly with your actual experience at a property? We absolutely loved our stay at The T Hotel.1. Smooooth pre-checkin and check-in: All my queries prior to the actual stay were handled perfectly well by Oscar, one of the trainee students from front desk.聽 聽2. View to die for: The room had a gorgeous view: The perfect mix of ocean and urban life (half and half). It had a huge glass window, length of the entire room, so nothing comes in the way of your view! 3. Amenities: The room was perfectly equipped with all the basic amenities, and some even more than basic, such as a hair dryer, iron and ironing board. It has a well-equipped gym. 4. High-tech: The room was super high-tech, which included a bathtub with a screen in front with select TV channels, a glass separating the bathroom and living room, which becomes either see-through or opaque at the click of a button!! The lighting and air conditioning were managed by a separate all-in-one control device. A separate handset was provided for use in the room, with which you can make free international calls from within the room only!聽5. An amazing overhead and hand shower!!聽6. Courteous staff: Our phone chargers needed a different socket. They arranged for it promptly! All the students, and in fact the entire staff, greets you with a genuine hearty smile, which just makes your day.聽7. The view from the dining area is perhaps the best I've experienced so far. It was gorgeous!8. The buffet spread was fine, but I had expected more from a property that specializes in culinary skills, in terms of more variety. I'd rate it 8/10.聽9. Proximity and convenience: The main bus stop is literally at the entrance of the hotel, less than a minute's walk. Even the A10 that goes to the airport. It was extremely convenient to go anywhere from the hotel without having to rely on a taxi or Uber.聽

The concept of training young ones in hospitality and tourism is brilliant and well perfected. The hotel provides excellent service. The staff, including the trainees are excellent. Before arrival, the staff helped with my transportation to the hotel. I was given all options from Public Bus A10 {HKD 48} which goes directly from the Airport to the hotel, to the more luxurious limo service. The bus stop is opposite the hotel. On arrival. I met a friendly and welcoming staff at the door and reception. I was escorted by two students to my room. The restaurant serves very good food. The price for food and drinks at the hotel is very reasonable. Superb service. Easy to move around the city from the hotel. Quiet environment. Clean and quality rooms

Stayed 4 nights at The T hotel in Feb with my wife based on reviews I read on tripadvisor. Did not disappoint, live up to all the expectations I read from the reviews.Especially impressed with all the staffs right down to the security.Had meals at the Chinese and Western restaurants and both were equally good.Location is great for walking as the trails are just across the road. Can walk all the way to the Peak , have a meal at the many restaurants there and track back all within a day. Or walk to the Peak and go down Central by the mid level escalator. Lots of F & B outlets along the way down to Central or Lan Kwai Fong. Can also reach the HK university through the trails and catch the MTR there. If you find walking up the peak too steep, take a bus to the Macau Ferry Terminal on Connaught Road Central and take the no 15 up to the Peak. Walk downhill back to The T Hotel from there. A lot easier.Accessibility is also great with many buses to Central , Kowloon or to the south at Stanley and Aberdeen.Ask the staff for assistance to download the Goggle map for the area if you want to do the trails.Thank you The T Hotel , I will be back to do the trails in the south.Michael and Patricia Chong - Singapore

I鈥檇 recently stayed 3 nights at the T Hotel after reading the positive comments on TripAdvisor. The location is out of the usual tourist belt so be prepared for the extra distance if you choose this hotel. From HKIA I took the Airport Bus A10. As rightly pointed out by some earlier reviewers, it is at Stop No. 26 that you alight and the Hotel is just across the road. If you have a big heavy luggage bag, be aware that you鈥檒l need to walk up a little slope to reach the hotel.The guest room is very spacious even though it鈥檚 a standard room. I stayed at a Mountain View room which looks onto a mountain but also a village of congested zinc roof houses very tightly built against each other.The gym is well equipped and I was the lone user that day.The breakfast lounge has stunning seaview and it鈥檚 a real pleasure compared to other city hotels which look out to another very close building.Food wise I find the breakfast of a average quality. I had dinner at the lounge - cod fish with fried rice. I like the cod fish but not the fried rice.Service wise some of the staff (who are trainees) were a bit hesitant to approach the guests and tend to wait by the side. Some did not understand my questions (in English), had to consult their colleagues. However the senior staff are good and they could anticipate the needs of the guests.Transport wise I took the local buses to Central and on my return trips to Hotel I took the MTR to HKU station and then transfer to a local bus back to the hotel. It was quite straightforward after you had tried once and know the system.I did a trekking one morning - walking from the hotel (starting from Pok Fu Lam Reservoir) to The Peak and then walking downhill from the Peak to Central. The weather was cool that day so it was a fun hike.Overall it was an enjoyable stay and I will recommend the T Hotel.

Great view and spacious room. But most importantly its about the service. Simply just didn't expect a training hotel could set such a high standard. Especially thanks trainee Hugo and probably tutor Mr. Kwan who arranged a nice room and extended my check-out time as a courtesy so I could have a good rest after a long night. Purely believe this act of kindness definitely touch the guest heart. At least I do.Do recommend this hotel. Hopefully it wont be full in the soon time.

We stayed at the T hotel because it was five minutes walk from our student son's accommodation at University Hall. What a great decision it turned out to be. As many have said, this is a training hotel so if you aren't willing to tolerate a few 'learning experiences' from the great kids there, stay somewhere else. The guests here are 'props' after all, from which the kids learn, but 'props' who are generally treated like royalty! The kids were great, the staff were great, the views, the rooms, the service and the food were not only superb, but also great value. Even the wine is a bargain, though the wine-list needs to be improved. Not a criticism, but if like us you like a nightly tipple, you might want to bring something back from the supermarket. Thank you EVERYONE at the T hotel for a wonderful experience! We hope to stay again if we ever re-visit this fabulous city.

This is a hidden gem imho. It is far from other parts of Hong Kong. It is by Hong Kong University. You need to take a bus from Kennedy Town MTR station, or use Taxi. Taxi's are not costly, $150HKD from Tsim Sha Tsui to T Hotel. Probably less if you are getting from the Airport Express station in Hong Kong.The rooms are huge. All the room views, as far as I can tell, are facing the sea and fantastic overlooking the sea, with ships sailing past all the time. During the morning I saw eagles hovering in front of the room's window. The staff is extremely attentive. They are students training to enter the hospitality industry. Very helpful, very pleasant and very attentive.If you don't mind the extra commute, this is absolutely the best hotel I have found in Hong Kong.

Hong Kong at 鈥淭he T Hotel 鈥? I just completed my 5th stay at The T Hotel which is a 30 room training hotel located on the 6th floor of a vocational training center that overlooks Hong Kong Harbor. There they train students in all aspects of the hotel industry from reservations, reception, restaurant, room service, housekeeping, business center, gym, massage, security etc. All of the students are monitored very closely by their training supervisors. This is a small 5 star property at 3 star rates. The service provided is exceptional and you are always greeted and attended to immediately. The rooms as you will see in the photos are luxurious, the amenities top notch and the views are exceptional. All I need to say is if you are ever in Hong Kong try it. Everything is within a 10-40 minute trek with the airport and Disneyland on the 40 minute end. Downtown is only 10 minutes away and less than a $1 US bus ride away. Taxis are very reasonable options also.Enjoy Hong Kong, I always do.

The reviews are correct! Take the metro to Hong Kong university B exit. The hotel is across the street from the bus stop for Pokfulam Village. Go to the Chinese culinary institute. The parking garage is in front of you and you turn left up the driveway. You will see the entrance is on your right. When I arrived, four of the employees came to greet me and take my luggage. Service here is impeccable! I went to the spa and it was nice except the jacuzzi water needed to be changed. It smelled like mildew. The views are sooo beautiful! And they gave me macaroons after the spa and turndown service.

I found out about the T hotel by chance and thought, "If what they say is true, then I can't miss if I stay here". Well I did stay there with my wife for close to 2 weeks, and I was very impressed with the room and the service. You must understand that it is a training hotel, so sometimes you will get a server or cook at the omelette station for breakfast in their restaurant who isn't top notch. But most of the time, you will get a server who will do everything in their power to give you the best service possible. The intention to give excellent service is always there even if a mistake is made here and there. At one point, I was joking with my wife when we came to the elevator that "no one has come to push the elevator button for us!" Literally 1 second later, someone came over and pushed the button for the elevator to come for us! We had to laugh. The food is excellent and isn't expensive at all! The room was very spacious and had a nice view as well. I also love that they offer a shuttle service to the main areas where you can get further travel to all parts of the island and beyond. Definitely would stay there again.

What a fabulous hotel. We arrived in the morning with the intention of dropping our bags off and going somewhere until we could book in. A lovely young trainee helped us, when she needed some help she called the manager who finished the booking process. He then informed us our room was ready and we could go up now, wow how fabulous as we were extremely tired after along overnight flight. Yuki the trainee (I apologize if I have the name wrong) took us up to the room and showed us how everything worked. The room was amazing it is what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Everything was spotless, lovely amenities in the bathroom, tea and coffee, floor to ceiling window with a view that you could just sit and watch all day and night. Everywhere we went the young staff who are training went out of there way. The breakfast was great with once again very attentive staff. We ordered room service a couple of times and the food was great. About 6 o鈥檆lock they come with an ice bucket and a little plate of something delicious. A special mention must be give to Tiffany the guest relations person, she went above and beyond to help us navigate our way around. She is a credit to the training provided. The hotel is a fair distance away but the bus service at the front of the hotel is excellent and we had no trouble getting to all the places on our list to visit. We will come to Hong Kong again and without a doubt will stay at the T hotel. Thank you to all for making our first visit to Hong Kong so memorable.

The training environment of the T Hotel means there are people eager to meet your requests at every corner of the building. The smiles and eagerness make up for any times where they are uncertain or need to check with the person overseeing them. From when you pull or walk up, there are smiles to greet you, help with your bag and settle you into your room. I had to leave suddenly for a family emergency and not only did they offer to help me pack, but also arranged for my breakfast to go and called a taxi to be waiting for me when I left my room. I hope to be able to travel to Hong Kong again if not to only be able to stay here.

We love staying at the T-Hotel. We鈥檝e stayed here five times 鈥?each visit has been for about two weeks. We find the T-Hotel suits us very well for its:鈥?Service that is high quality The staff are really friendly and helpful, and the students follow their example to the best of their ability.鈥?Rooms that are a good size, well-equipped, tastefully decorated, quiet and with pleasing views 鈥?and wi-fi鈥?Comfortable beds with good mattresses and a range of pillows to choose from鈥?Cleanliness鈥?Memorable breakfasts, with a wide range of tempting choices 鈥?both western and Chinese鈥?Room service with an acceptable menu, presented to a high standard. 鈥?In-restaurant lunch and dining - western and Chinese - is also available. Really good and reasonable value鈥?Well-equipped gym. (We haven鈥檛 used the spa services.)鈥?More peaceful surroundings than central Hong Kong 鈥?plenty of trees nearby and country park walks鈥?Supermarket, friendly post office and other every-day shops at the nearby shopping centre (nb not designer or international brand shops 鈥?there are masses of these in central Hong Kong) 鈥?Transport links with central Hong Kong/Kowloon/Airport (a bit more on this below)A special feature of the T-Hotel is that it鈥檚 a training hotel. So staying here helps the trainees learn their profession. Understandably, they will sometimes need to consult their supervisors to have tasks explained. This is not problem for us 鈥?we are not guests-in-a-hurry.Transport: If you arrive at the Airport and it鈥檚 your first time in Hong Kong, taking the Airport Express (light rail) to Hong Kong Station, and then a taxi from there, may be the simplest way to the T-Hotel. Or a taxi all the way, but it鈥檚 quite a distance - about 40 kilometres. Or there鈥檚 the A10 Airport Bus which stops very near the T-Hotel (Pok Fu Lam Village stop 鈥?it takes just over an hour and in November 2017 costs just under HK$50). The buses don鈥檛 give change. Much more transport information is available at the Hotel and on websites 鈥?including the Octopus Card, which can be a good buy if you will be staying a few days or longer. Also, the T-Hotel has its own complimentary mini-bus for trips to Central 鈥?you need to book.

Wonderful service, beautiful rooms and great amenities. I especially liked the handy phone you can use on the Island, and never get lost. The staff were really helpful and couldn't do enough for you. Great breakfast. Nice quiet location but with great bus services to all parts of the Island.

-friendly students and instructors - best view in HK-cleanliness A+-best deal in HK-did not mind the travel distance into city center-food is exceptional With the high standard of instructors and managers . All students should have a job waiting for them . Keep smilingI鈥檒l be back for another visit.

This is the second time we have been able to stay at the T hotel in HongKong and like the first time it was a great experience. The service is exceptional and all students are trying very hard to assist in any way they can. The rooms are 5 star and have the best view. We will definitely stay here again, if there is 'room in the inn'. Also we were very pleased to have a local handy with Internet access available during our stay and being able to make local phone calls has been very much appreciated. It made organising our outings so much easier. We also had dinner in the restaurant which was well presented and very tasty.

Staying here is a great experience. The students and their tutors are welcoming and friendly nothing is too much trouble. Our room was spacious, comfortable and offered everything a 5 star hotel does including a TV in the bathroom. The breakfast was fresh and delicious as were the evening meals we enjoyed at the hotel. The hotel is a bus ride from the center but well served by various buses. I wouldn't stay anywhere else now. Keep up the good work.

My stay at the T Hotel was interesting. I absolutely love the concept and the rates. A teaching hotel, spa and restaurant. It was like being in a pretend resort, which I liked. Hey ya have to learn somewhere and the value cannot be beat, right along with the turndown service and the cheery smiles. I have to say, these students are on their game. I felt like I had an entire staff at my beck and call the entire time, although there was a bit of a language barrier when I had to call the front desk for anything. But hey, I am the lesson. The view from the restaurant at the T Hotel was SPECTACULAR! And the food was delish. I wish that had been my room view. I was booked with the "mountain" view room which looked out over a mountain and the village (slums) below. It is hard to see that level of poverty, but the reality is it exists. I would definitely stay here again and almost want to to give the spa a whirl. I would recommend you looking at a photograph of the property. If I had not seen a picture of it, I would never have recognized it by cab. The sign is tiny and the cab driver didn't read or understand any English. Be the lesson, stay at the T!

At first I thought I may have made an error by staying outside of either central HK or Kowloon but in the end I was really happy with the location. It is a 15min car ride or about 20-25 transit ride into Central. The hotel offers a shuttle service in the mornings Monday to Friday which is great. With the money we saved from staying here we didn't mind taking taxi's. There were frequent buses leaving just outside of the building.We took the bus to Aberdeen and onto Stanley, it was convenient. We also took the express bus to the airport from outside of the hotel.The rooms were large and spotlessly clean. The view over the South China Sea was lovely and we watched some great sunsets from our room. We only ate breakfast here and wished we had more time to take advantage of other meal times. The fruit salad at breakfast was really good.The hotel, as others have mentioned, has students who are learning the hospitality industry. If you do not mind the enthusiasm of the learners then this is a great place to stay. The teachers and students were all amazing. We would for sure stay here again and would recommend this place to friends

Staying at the T-Hotel...was one of the highlights of a 4 day visit to Hong Kong. The rooms are high tech...clean ..spacious ...and the ocean view rooms are magnificent. Since this is a training hotel...service is at the highest caliber...and you literally don't have to do a thing...you are waited on hand and foot. We had all our meals in the hotel restaurant...5 star all the way. Best of all...the price...a bargain at less than 50% of comparable downtown hotels. Yes..it's a 10 minute taxi ride to down town...but taxis are cheap...and the hotel will give you a free one way ride downtown, but does not provide return rides. Book well in advance...since the secret is getting out.

This is a good hotel used for training food and beverage students and interns , so you will have overwhelmed warm hospitality from the trainees right from the starts . The hotel has several dining areas and a big lobby upstairs for full sea view . The room is ok and the price acceptable , its good for the family and pleasure . The only thing that has a little inconv is the location , its afar from central and kowloon business area and also its not very well known so your friend has to go a long way to find you . Try it and you may like it !

First off, The hospitality and service of the staff and students are hands down the best! Having elite status with many hotel chains, I can tell you that none come close to the T Hotel. In a way, it did seem a little awkward at first because of how much they go above and beyond but you get used to it.Room - Very clean and luxurious with a beautiful view. We stayed on the floor with the restaurant and it was weird having to pass by people eating and not being dressed up.Wifi - No issues with wifi and it worked fine.Price paid - Well worth the price I paid!Location - If there was one thing I can complain about, it would be the location. Far from most attractions and there isn't anything around the area. Ocean Park would be the number one place to go if you do stay here since it is close by. With that said, you can catch buses in front of the hotel to get where you want to go. Nothing you can do about the location so it wasn't a big deal.Overall, A great place to stay for a family vacation and I would gladly stay here again.Also, quick shout-out to the front desk staff/students who helped me. Eric, Christie Leung and Yannie. Hong Kong has a bright future in the tourism field because of you all.

It's a unique experience to see student staff in training but they did quite well. Service was efficient and they were very helpful. The rooms are quite spacious. It wasn't at all difficult to get around using the bus service since the stop is right across the hotel- Pok Fu Lam Village is the bus stop. Area of improvement would be the mobile device- it would not act as a hotspot so couldn't use our own phones. We stayed during the storm and so one day, no students were around but service was uninterrupted. Recommended!

My 3rd visit and the hotel just keeps improving. I was there at the tail end of a long trip and was ready for some pampering in the lovely room in the proper king bed, the terrace over looking the South China Sea, the huge breakfast with eggs cooked just the way I like them, all at a reasonable price.I get the A10 bus straight from the airport to the hotel and sit upstairs and take in the view. On the return to the airport, I did the in town check-in as my flight left very late and I wanted to get rid of my heavy bag. The, I got the airport express train. The latest T Hotel improvements include a free smart phone loaded with very useful info, to use whilst there including free overseas phone calls to many countries. They also now have a cappuccino machine and some of the students know how to make a proper cup of coffee. The barista training could be improved upon however for some of the others. I loved having dinner on the terrace watching the sun go down, and watching the falcons flying on the thermals, and having room service - it's all the same reasonable price for the same menu. I like the location out of the business of the main areas of HKG. I'll be back.

The only downside to this hotel is how far away it is from Central Hong Kong. I booked the place knowing it was a bit remote but little did I know that it would take about 30-mins each way to get to the city center. It takes a few days to get used to the public transportation and the many buses that drive nearby the hotel to/from Central. The closest MTR metro station to the hotel is HKU about 10-15mins away from the hotel depending on the bus you catch (4, 4X as in express, 7, etc).So just be prepared to the commute as you visit HK and stay at the T-Hotel.Now that I talked about the cons of booking the hotel, its location is also a great place to be away from the city after a long day of walking in the heat & humidity of the island, shopping or touring sites.Pokfulam is a very hilly part of Hong Kong with lush green trees, and so the bus rides can feel like a roller coaster ride especially on the way from the hotel to Central.The taxis and buses really drive fast and almost recklessly per US standards, so fasten your seatbelts and avoid asking questions to the bus rider when in motion if you don't want to cause an accident.As for the rooms, they were really spacious and well equiped for the price... A real bargain for such amenities and space... and what a view as all reviews said... We had the South China Sea view room and it was amazing to behold day and night. The bathroom was nice too and they made sure to clean the place everyday and water the plants in the room, and provide bottled water.The staff is very attentive to your needs and despite the kids in training, they are very professional. Jenny Cheng, one of the main instructors, is a gem like everyone said. The breakfast was decent and affordable, nothing crazy but good.They also provide a free shuttle to Hong Kong station should you book it way in advance. This was great for going to the airport.Overall, despite its remote location, we really loved our stay at the T-hotel which is a 4 or 5 star hotel for 1/2 the price bc of its remote location and its training staff nature. Just make sure to allocate time for going to the city and back. The way to the city is to take the bus to the left right outside the hotel on the same side. The bus stop for the hotel is Pokfulam Village. I recommend exiting at HKU station and take the metro to wherever you want to go. And do the reverse on the way back. There are many buses and the staff at the hotel will tell you which bus can stop at the hotel or go downtown. Also make sure to buy an octopus metrocard from the hotel, it's $150 HKD for all your rides.

What can I say....excellent experience!! Highly recommend The T Hotel!!This is a training hotel so the staff is very attentive. Some things may take a wee bit longer as they are learning and customer service training is key. Location is a bit away from the central station, however, Hong Kong has a very efficient transit system so the location was not a problem, be sure to get an octopus card. Many busses stop right in front of the Hotel as well as the one from the airport.Check in was fast, they have an employee accompany you to your room and explain and show you how everything works. Very nice touch. Rooms are very nice, spacious, great views, very comfortable beds and pillows, great mini bar with very reasonable prices, Very nice bathrooms with tv's and telephones... 5 * rooms and technology for sure.Training Staff was excellent as well as the students. Really teaching them how to approach and engage the clients.Breakfast is included and very good buffet. Again, very attentive staff!! Great way to start your day. Restaurant is very good.This hotel is very reasonably priced, especially given the service they provide. We wanted to just stay and relax and enjoy the hotel however, we only had 3 days in Hong Kong and lots of sightseeing to do. Will stay here again with out a doubt next time we are in Hong Kong. Thank you to The T Hotel, we had a great experience during our stay.

Although this Hotel is a little away from the action, and in the midst of renovations outside,Breakfast was amazing, and all trainee staff very attentive a great place for them to learni would thoroughly recommend it for service ,helpfulness and thoughtfulness.we thoroughly enjoyed our visit here,buses outside to the MTR or taxis available, shuttle service to the MTR, all staff are very helpful with transfers . we will come again

We stayed at this hotel for a week and didn't want to leave! It's so wonderful, our children asked to stay here again if we ever get to visit Hong Kong again. The location worked well for us. There is a bus stop just a few steps out of the hotel. Very easy to travel around. We were treated like VIPs and the room is huge, even for North America standard. We got the ocean view room and the view is just marvelous. As we were hit by black rain one day, watching the weather in the safety of the hotel room was just an amazing experience. As this is a training hotel, you get to be part of the training program. It was a very nice experience and the instructors and managers are all very welcoming to show us the best quality in hospitality. Also, you should try to have lunch/dinner at the hotel. The training restaurants are also at this location. We had the opportunity to have dinner there one night and it was a great meal. We have the best of time staying at this hotel and we look forward to staying there again!

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: I stayed for a week on business in the Holiday Inn Express Kowloon East. It is conveniently located close to the Tseung Kwan O MTR station, about 8 stops and a change of train from Causeway Bay, Wanchai, etc.The room and bathroom are basic, but pleasant. The staff are friendly. But the facilities are just terrible. You have to ask for an iron and ironing board and wait for ages. There is no room service. There is no restaurant or bar in the hotel.However, the breakfast was the final straw. It was served in the neighbouring Crowne Plaza. But not in the Crowne Plaza's own restarant, but in a conference hall where you are treated like the poor cousins of thre proper guests. The food was ghastly. Rubber frankfurters, congealed scrambled eggs. No meat or cheese, no dim sum. Just horrible. It was the worst breakfast I have had outside Russia. After the first morning, I refused to go again and waited until lunch at work.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: My stay at the hotel was very enjoyable. Everything provided was of good quality. I am very happy with the service, everyone was very polite and caring. The breakfast was fresh and tasty every morning.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: The room is clean and tidy. The people are friendly. The location is close to transport. The hotel charge is reasonable.The breakfast is not excellent.The room size is ok but not great.The view is ok.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Rooms are okVery poor elevator system in useAlways needed to wait for long timeWhy I must write in min 200 characters in complaint. I didn鈥檛 know you are so bureaucracy. Now that we talk about attitude, your front desk staff are not friendly but I couldn鈥檛 expect much after all I book in Holiday Inn Express, right?

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: It was very satisfying there.I enjoyed the comfortable bed.My children lpved it to.I think everyone should vist this hotel. P.S I loved the view. P.P.S I ws in room 2032,the view in this room is in pic 2

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Friendly and helpful staff. Emailed prior to visit with a question and almost immediately received a helpful reply from an Elaine Tang. Thankyou Elaine. Located right next to a MTR train station and a bus terminal as well as the Popcorn shopping centre, so getting around is easy. Our week-long stay included breakfast. It was called a simple buffet and that's what it was. Perfectly adequate though.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: I book this hotel for my boyfriend birthday they arrange wine and fruit on arrival and cake on day of birthday. Very happy also price is very good and location is 2 min walk from MTR to go everywhere Very good

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: The hotel is conveniently located near MRT station and right in a mall with many restaurants around. The room is quite roomy with high ceiling. Facility is clean, bright and practically furnished. Breakfast is included and quite good.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: The only bad impression is that the fridge is not working properly. It is no cold at all.The other facilities are all right. I especially like the location of the hotel. It is next to the MTR and in bad weather, I don't have to worry getting wet at all.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Small room, no fridge but there's a swimming pool, this hotel contains a breakfast every morning but the breakfast is bad, not tasty. Although there's many bad points about this hotel, this hotel sticks to the MTR and the shopping mall Popcorn. The room is clean. At last, I would rather stay in the nearby hotel Crown Plaza.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Holiday Inn Express at Kowloon East is a clean well kept property next door to the Crown Plaza and right above the metro train station.Rooms are kept clean and modern with comfortable beds, TV had many channels of entertainment. Furnishing quality was good although there was a few spots in the bathroom where slight maintenance was required to the skirting board. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was provided at the Crown Plaza and was buffet style with good variety of Western and Asian cuisine. Coffee from the urns was very strong and required to be watered down with hot water which was supplied..A bit out of town but easily connected by the Metro directly below in the large shopping center and a bus station next door. A good hotel if you are willing and able to jump on a train (cheap) to see the sights of Hong Kong. Restaurants available both in the building and next door in the Crown Plaza but variety of eateries in the mall underneath that open from 10 to late.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Stay in this property for 3days because of the sommelier exam take place in crown plaza nearby. The staff was friendly to let me have late check out and pronounced my name during any conversation. I stay in 2235 and the was the last room till the end. There are some smells in the room but overall the hotel is ok for business stays.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Great, helpful staff, great breakfast. We enjoyed everything about our stay in this hotel. The room was lovely and the staff was friendly and very helpful. This was very important since we were on our own & needed to know how to use the trains to visit the Chinese University (I was a student there in 1970). The included breakfast buffet was wonderful.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Rooms are exceptionally clean and have modern shower facilities. Space in the room is limited, though we did not feel pressed between the walls thanks to furniture design and big windows.AC worked well. The elevators were in limited supply, it was really annoying to wait 5-10 minuted to get to your floor or to the lobby. The location is great with shops, restaurants and subway station next door. Area is good for sport activities, the jogging path along the coastline is really special. With the price around 100 usd the hotel seemed to be a good choice.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: It was a good experience to stay in Holiday Express East Kowloon. Location was great with MTR just at the door step. Very clean room and was clean up everyday. Staff members were helpful and polite too!

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: All I really look for in a hotel is easy access to public transportation, a clean room and helpful staff.This hotel met all my needs. It is conveniently located next to a MTR station and bus stop. The room was clean and spacious. A friendly staff greeted me when I checked in and housekeeping offered to replenish any items I might need when I told them my room didn't need to be cleaned.An added bonus is the huge mall connected to the hotel.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Good location. Next to the big mall and MTR station. High standard of cleaning ness. Good view. Silence and comfortable atmosphere. Staff are nice and friendly. The breakfast is good enough, at least it is better than many holiday inn express in the world.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Nice hotel in very nice area connected to a mall and adjacent subway station. Plenty of activities right there where the hotel is located. And if you get bored with the activities in and around the mall, you can just jump on the subway and head to Central or another hot spot.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Price reasonable. Room very clean and surprisingly larger than expected. Staff very polite and professional. Just above MTR and shopping mall. Lots of good eating places and Very conveniently to travel around. Bus to airport is very fast and cheap.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Just beside the MTR Tseung Kwan O station is the Holiday Inn Express Kowloon East. That made our commute easy and very accessible especially coming from central part of HK. The location of the hotel is also very convenient as it is also within the PopCorn mall so they are a lot of restaurant choices just a few steps.Compared to other hotels in Hong Kong, the rooms are really spacious especially the assigned accessible room. It has also a good view of the neighborhood.During our stay, we had to go to the other building for the breakfast. The breakfast is limited but good enough for a few days stay. There is also an outdoor lounge on the eight floor where you can relax or do your laundry for a fee.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Never really gave this property a review - stayed several times over the last five years, and for good reason - this place has outstanding value! You'll experience Hong Kong but give you the option of less of the hustle and bustle downtown; most of the major stores downtown are at the mall below the hotel so staying here does give you that choice. The MTR station is also directly below so if you did want to go downtown, you're no more than 30 minutes away. The elevator traffic could be improved; only 2 of the 3 seem to be actively serving the guest floors. My suggestion: let 2 serve all floors and the other one exclusively for guests; that'll solve a lot of issues with the restaurants on the floors below also being served by the same set of elevators.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: This is a nice hotel in a good location. Located right next to a bus stop and a 5 minute walk to an MTR station. Hotel is also connected to a mall so its convenient to go shopping and find nice restaurants. Rooms were clean and functional and a bit small. Double beds rooms are equipped with twin sized beds (I traveled in a party of 4 and had to get 2 rooms).Breakfast was included in my room rate. Location for breakfast was across the driveway at the Crown Plaza. It was buffet style and had plenty of options. It was a nice mix of local food and continental options. The welcome gift at check in is a nice touch for IHG reward members. (Tip: sign up for IHG Rewards, its free)The only issue I had with this hotel is the elevators. It was connected to a mall and several restaurants. During peak times, you could be waiting for an elevator to get up to your room for 5-10 minutes.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Great location comes with inter connect bridges with a few shopping malls, MTR Tseung Kwan O Station 灏囪粛婢崇珯, bus terminal (A29P to airport service) and taxi services. BUT a long MTR distance to city centre.Standard Room, 1 Queen Bed/double bed, Non Smoking is perfect. Noise nuisance from the corridor is the only negative. Spacious with 2 seater sofa.2nd floor to 7th floor great restaurants. Downsides are peak hours, lifts are flooded with diners so pretty hectic a long wait to lift up to rooms.Breakfast, Security and Privacy suck. Hush Puppies Luggage inner ZIP was damaged silently after back to room again. No report, as usual, I am here for holiday happiness so I dont give the F about unhappy things and clowns fall on me.Great surrounding walk up to Tseung Kwan O Waterfront Park灏囪粛婢虫捣婵卞叕鍦抴here sea and hills are horizoning where you can walk and relax with people, dogs and bicycle.lived 5 days. See doctors no problem, many clinics and some specialists are walking away and one MTR station away.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: This place is smack in the middle of the action. Connected to a giant mall, very easy to get to on foot and transit. Loved my stay there.. this is no American Holiday Inn.. highly recommend! Very clean and well cared for!

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Splendid room, clean and large enough to be comfortable, roomy shower room. Air conditioner is on or off - not controllable. Breakfast is across the indoor car park at the Crowne Plaza and is very disappointing. Poor choice, food not replenished quickly enough so left waiting ages, crowded. Irritatingly, fresh fruit and pastries are reserved for IHG loyalty card holders, at nicer tables at the other side of the room. It does not encourage me to join, though!

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: It is next to MTR Station and a large shopping mall. It is a simple Express hotel but more than good enough. Fast to get to Central and Kowloon and much better value than more central hotels. If you want a slightly better hotel, you can go to the Crowne Plaza next door.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Convenient access to the mall for shopping and MTR (i.e. transportation to other parts of the town). More than 5 TV channels to select from. Breakfast is just okay as the selection is the same every single day.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: The room is a little small, yet enough and comfortable (considering the high cost of living in HK). The room view is magnificent. Location cannot be any better: metro, shopping, dining are all just downstairs! Breakfast is acceptable. Will stay again...

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Me and my visited HK as tourist and spent 5 nights of which 3 in Holiday Inn Express Kowloon East and other previous 2 nights downtown in North Point (in cramped room obviously because space is premium in downtown). The conclusion : Stay in Holiday Inn Express. Why? Read further. Location: Although away, but, well connected by Metro (Tube rail). In HK, Metro network is so strong that you can go almost anywhere by changing trains. Time from Airport: 1.5 h when you take Airport Express and Metro. OCTOPUS card is a MUST! Valid on Train, Bus, Tram. The Hotel is just adjacent to Metro station, 2 shopping malls are in the same complex and Crowne plaza hotel is next door. Tseung Kwan O where the hotel is a new suburb and thus everything is new new. The hotel is surrounded by nice residential buildings, school and malls.Exit the Holiday Inn express main entrance, turn left, turn left again and walk straight about 100m and you will reach JASON's supermarket where you can buy everything at right price. It's a big supermarket and right price.We had a very nice stay, shopping in malls below, check out UNIQLO. Lot of walk in the areas nearby. We will come again!

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: This is one of my favorite hotels because I am a frequent visitor to Hong Kong,  I have been here twice, each time over 10 days. I am an IHG member and also stayed in the same hotel brand in the USA frequently. It's at a convenient location, takes only 30 mins to Central or TST by subway. Breakfast provided, don't expect too much but it's much better than the same hotel chain in the USA, with varieties of Asian congee/bun and American pastry/fruit and salad. Staff is polite and friendly, and provide me with a small fridge/adaptor, etc when I request. But there is room for improvement:1) long waiting time for elevators. It usually takes 5-10 mins, but the last day I checked out, it took over 15+ mins2) too long time to check out. I waiting almost 30 mins at the line on Oct 29th at noon for my turn. I realized some were using cash / Alipay or weChat pay. Could the procedure be streamlined? eg. in N America, the bill is distributed under the door/or viewed at TV/etc. Checkout is simply drop in the card and go. There should be one line for "express checkout" where the credit card is on file, another for cash/weChat/Alipay checkout. Imagine we usually need to catch the flight home, and long waiting time on last day before flight agitates us. I don't usually write on TripAdvisor but I really like this hotel brand and look for improvement!

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Quality hotel reasonable price excellent service helpfull staff only minus no fridge in room. Close to public transport. Rooms very quiet we needed extra sleep on a rival. Will stay at this location when next in Hong Kong

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
