review: Conveniently located in Tseung Kwan O above a shopping mall and above an MTR station. 20 minutes to the central business district and close to the scenic New Territories. We are regular customers, visiting family who live locally.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: The hotel location is extremely convenient as it鈥檚 right on the mtr station . There is a big shopping centre here as well so we don鈥檛 feel to have a need to go all the way to mong Kok or tst area for shopping . The hotel room is clean , and enough space. The shower has right pressure and clean They have included free buffet breakfast which is great !! The variety is good !The only thing is we wish there is a swimming pool here .. It has free wifi too !!

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: The hotel itself is well located and hotel room facilities are sufficiently enough. The buffet breakfast is a surprise with reasonable range of food choices and the dining venues are amazing. Our family is happy with our stay at this hotel, and we are satisfied with everything offered by the hotel.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: The room was spacious by HK standard and reasonably priced too. The hotel is located above 3 shopping malls (all seamlessly connected) and MTR (Tseung Kwan O Station). The hotel is an excellent choice for those who wants to move around HK. There is also a bus service, A29P, which travels from airport to the hotel. The only thing that wasn't to my expectation was the breakfast. The spread was minimal and it was hosted in one of the function rooms in Crowne Plaza Hotel (opposite Holiday Inn Express).

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Plus :Convenient and accessible via MTR; efficient room service available; great hospitality; fast check-in processMinus: Limited choices of breakfast menu; location of hotel is isolated from down town area;

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: this is a budget hotel if you are price sensitive, and is alternative to the twin tower next to it that has Crowne Plaza which is more expensive but really nice. You actually walk into crowne plaza hotel for breakfast since they share the kitchen and dining, but food is different fro Holiday in customers :) The room is rather tiny but fairly good,

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Room is relatively small, though it is neat.There should be more variety of food in breakfast.There should be at least one lift dedicated for the hotel customers. Lifts are slow sometimes because of restaurant customers from ground floor to 9th floor.Hotel is convenient to transport, food and shopping center. Good location

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Never ever to stay in this hotel. Breakfast room was small and NOT Enough for customers to seat, they only care about IHG members only. I will sue this hotel for bad service, terrible breakfast. 27th hotel floors for only tiny breakfast room. BEWARE. All the staffs are impolite and they do not care at all. When i complained, the staff ran away. First terrible hotel i have ever stayed in. August 21.2018.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: This is my first time entering Hong Kong for a business trip to The Hong Kong University of Technology and Science. When I looking the possible hotel, Holiday Inn Express was my first choice and it turn out to be the excellent choice. I had no idea how to get to HKUTS and counter immediately help me so I can take the city bus with very low cost. The room is very quite and comfortable to stay, and the location is perfect for me to take public transportation either by bus or MRT.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Convenient access with MTR and large queen bed corner room with sapcious good view. Valuable breakfast in buffet style served at Crowne Plaza Hotel function room and warm hospitality from receptionist.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Liked the city view from hotel room window. Warm and courteous staff. The location is bit far from airport, but it has metro connectivity. There is a mall in the ground floor you can shop till you drop. And below that metro station. Just buy an octopus card and you can go anywhere in the city. Hotel staff can guide you very well for anything.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Stayed here for a week to visit family who are in North Point. The hotel is above the shopping mall and the MTR station, so that was a plus. The only downside for us is the commute to get there and travelling back and forth on the Island line. Also to get to the hotel, you either have to take the airport express then change to the Island line (blue line) then to the Po Lam line (purple line); take the A29P bus, which starts at 11:15am and runs every hour; or take the taxi. Both bus and taxi take about 80-90 minutes depending on traffic.The room itself was quite spacious - we booked a queen standard, stayed on level 19, and the room had a sitting bench against the window. Aircon is always blasting, and the minimum is set at speed 2 (I couldn't set it to the lowest speed for perhaps a user issue!). Cleaning staff are great, you can replace the sheets as often as you like by placing a card there to indicate how often you'd like them to change it.Just note that there is no fridge if you want to store anything, only a kettle with some instant coffee, milk powder, teas are provided. Free wifi in the room was reasonably fast, there is an office work station with the LAN cable.There is a self-service laundry for ~HKD 60, washer & dryer near the lounge area on level 8, check out the view!Breakfast is at the Crowne Plaza, which can be accessed across the valet driveway. There is a range of Western and Chinese choices and if you're an IHG member, you can get a few extra perks. Just be conscious that there are a lot of tourist groups who check in, and the lifts connect to the shopping mall, so you may have to wait a while to get up and down.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: We stayed for 1 week at this hotel. We found reception staff are friendly. Room amenities are better than expected. Cleaning staff are excellent. They moved furniture and turned bed and lounge chairs for thorough vacuum - which is pretty unusual and commendable. Room size is reasonably big. Our room got the view of Junk Bay and the eastern part of Hong Kong Island. Since it is above MTR Station and the Popcorn Shopping Mall, it is very convenient to find restaurants and retail shops. You need to rely on MTR or taxi if you arrive Hong Kong Airport before 11am. Airport Bus A29P service is only run hourly at 10 minutes to the hour from Tseung Kwan O and 10 minutes past the hour from the Airport. It takes nearly 90 minutes. There are lots of Chinese mainlanders everywhere. Breakfast is served at various rooms at Crowne Plaza in the adjacent building. Choices for breakfast are standard but limited. IHG members dine in a separate zone, but is always overcrowded. Additional machine brewed coffee and pastries are supplied. If you need to take MTR to Hong Kong Island frequently, you need to consider the transport costs. Overall, it is situated in a location serviced well by MTR. Staff are friendly and excellent. General cleanliness is excellent and cleaning staff are friendly and polite. If free Airport Shuttle Bus services this hotel, I would have no doubt to rate it a 5 stars instead of 4. Something for the hotel to negotiate.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: On a positive note, the housekeeping staff were very good and helpful. I wish I could say the same of others, and especially the front office. A mixup left us with the wrong bed configuration -- and no means to correct it, we were told....-- and generally front office staff were pretty unhelpful or unknowledgeable when it came to recommendations in the area and answers to hotel policy. In-house restaurants (which are managed and billed separately) are pretty good, and air con was nice during a very warm stay. Otherwise, nothing that other hotels in the area can't provide for same pricing.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: We come to HK yearly & always book Holiday Inn KE as it is close where my family lives. Great location (above shopping mall), friendly and helpful staff and comfortable bed are the main positives. A staff member even recognised us from last year when we went to have breakfast. This did make us feel welcome. A couple of minor negatives (i) the TV in our room was very old with blurry display which also had the wrong screen ratio. But that is ok for us as we only sleepy there. (ii) The hotel is popular with Chinese tourists but they are often loud and rude. I know this is a cultural thing but it can be annoying. Perjaos toruist guide should teach the members how behave where travelling.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: We had a great experience, with very attentive front-desk service. The hotel is located very close to the MTR station and is connected to a very large mall (Popcorn Mall). The breakfast is located in another connected hotel (Crowne Plaza), which is only a short walk away. The breakfast buffet options were good and the staff was very helpful/friendly. Overall, this is a budget hotel that does not disappoint - the rooms are spacious and clean, with free wifi and nice views.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Whilst the hotel isn't close to the centre of everything it is about 1 minutes walk from the MTR (Subway) which allows you to get to everything quite conveniently. I visited friends at the far end of the MTR Tracks opposite direction to the hotel and it took about 1hr 20mins but that is the extreme. It only takes 20 -30mins to get to the heart of Central so easy to get to all of the tourist attractions. The hotel was clean, tidy, and quiet (I stayed during a public holiday so there were many people). The staff were friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was adequate but it was the same everyday, it would have been nice to have a slight change in what was offered each day. The hotel is attached to the popcorn mall a large multi building shopping complex which had plenty of food and shopping options. There is a bus from the airport to the hotel A29P which stops just next to the Crowne Plaza that is adjoining the Holiday Inn Express. This bus cost $42HKD. There was free Wifi in all areas of the hotel.I would stay here again.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: I enjoyed the breakfast. Some of the rooms are better than other ones. One of the room that I stayed in had an old mattress. I talked to the staff, and they moved me to a room with a better mattress. The hotel is very close to the MTR, so you can easily get from the hotel to other places in Hong Kong. It is also close to a bus station and popcorn mall

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Just want to share a conversation with front desk staff. I came to check in at 10AM. Yes, it鈥檚 AM. Me: I am sorry to check in so early. It鈥檚 possible to get a room? If not is fine.FD: Sure, let me check we have available room or not.After check in procedure....FD: All the procedure is done, you can come back around 3pm to get a room.Me: Ok, that mean your hotel is not allow to early check in right?FD: It is depend to we have room or not. You can comeback to check around 3pm.Me: Thank you.The staff is smiling all the time and I can feel his 鈥渟ervice鈥?from the bottom of the heart. I know your just Holiday Inn EXPRESS but please don鈥檛 fool your guest. I am fine with rejecting my early check in.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: Room is good, but the elevator is not. It took aged to wait for it everytime when going back / out. Because it mixed with the people who goes to the shopping mall as well but this is the only way, but the speed of the elevator is slow.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: A far distance from the airport, but there is an airport bus, and it accepts the transit card. It takes 1h10. or train to HK station, then transit (pay again) for mtr. If you need to go anywhere - there is a mall, and only a few metres is the MTR. Swipe your transit Octopus Card and go. The rooms are spacious, and good HOL Inn standards. Wi-Fi in rooms is free. There is a kettle for instant coffee (yuck) or tea, buy your own milk. The breakfast is across the way at the Crowne Plaza. It has a quieter (not by much, but better coffee and great pastries) for Members. The breakfast choices are numerous.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: location of this hotel was great. breakfast was good enough as a starter. service was also good for ice delivery. 8th floor is a great place for chat with friends and gathering. laundry machine and vending machine are also very convenient. If there are harder pillows as a choice, the sleep would be better.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express HONG KONG KOWLOON EAST
review: The hotel is clean and tidy. Staff are friendly. Breakfast is a real treat. Most importantly, it is very conveniently located, close to MTR station, big shopping malls, restaurants and eateries. I stay in this hotel every time I visit HK.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: This was not my first time at the Novotel Hong Kong however, it was the first time I utilised the Club facilities and i was disappointed. The Club is not large but it also wasn't crowded. Unfortunately the coffee machine broke on our first day and being a public holiday didn't help but it still wasn't fixed the following evening. Breakfast was nice but limited and there was a small selection for afternoon tea, that was it, nothing else not even a drink available.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Stay here at least 6 days a month,every month. Staff is fantastic. Very professional and friendly. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Exercise facilities are very good and the pool and pool area are stunning.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Great place to stay if you want to see the night market at Temple Street.Close to ferry for Macau.Close to Hong Kong CBD.Very good rooms. Clean modern, not too small, but not huge. Great treatment by staff.Free happy hour at the lounge !!

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Have to say the view from our window had to be the worst we've ever seen, but that aside the room was great quite big, very clean, quiet, and cool with the air conditioner working perfectly.The hotel is right in the guts of Kowloon close to the Temple street markets and other local markets but boy does it get busy, the only downer with this hotel is it"s lack of a pool, we made our way to the local Kowloon Park municiple swimming poll, saturated in sweat when we got there but had a great few hours in this lovely outdoor complex for $NZ1.60. Almost forgot a big big thank you to the hotel for allowing us to access our room at 8.30am after travelling for nearly 30 hours from the deep south of NZ is was very much appreciated.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Ticks all the boxes. Location - located along nathan road. Walking distance to temple night market and mtr station. Staff - friendly and very professional. Cleanliness - very clean room and toilet. Size - bigger than what we expected in terms of size. Bonus is that they play good playlist

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: The hotel is great near to the Hong Kong metro Jordan station , the breakfast is good , the room is clean and the staff is very helpfully the hotel not is expensive for the service novotel Nathan Hong Kong is a fantastic choice in our holidays

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: This is the third time I have stayed at this hotel and the service gets better each time. After coming off a red-eye flight we arrived at the hotel at around 6:30am and we had bookings for that evening. The staff did everything in their power to help and prioritised one of the three rooms we had booked so we were able to at least have a shower early in the morning. The hotel is perfectly located on Nathan Road and provides easy walking access to all that Kowloon has to offer as well as being very close to the train station. The restaurant caters for both western and Asian tastes and is clean and well appointed. In the end like most business travel it is the staff that make the visit either positive or negative and in the case of this hotel the staff were wonderful.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: As always speedy checking, got my usual 15th floor room, this times 8 nights and with Ms Yoko, Katherine, Neo and couple of other staffs it really make my days and pleasant stay. Thank you very much and look forward to see again in August.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: I chose to stay here for these reasons, reaonabme rates (for Hong Kong), brand reputation, membership recognition and benefits, and of coz the prime location! Novotel delivered itself brilliantly. Worthy to mention the check in staff Ms. Yoko was most helpful and obliging. I was upgraded and late check out granted too. Room was of reasonable size, with typical and recognizable designs of novotel.i had a good quality night sleep due to its quietness. Overall, I was very satisfied with my stay.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: The ground floor is the Concierge. The Reception is at the first floor. You can leave your luggage at the ground floor with the Concierge, they will bring it to your room.The rooms are comfortable, cozy but not too big. Just serve the purpose. We were 2 adults & 1 kid -- the room was just about enough for our luggage & to walk around. But no complaints, since the service was good, quick & with smiling faces and the rooms were neat & clean. The only problem is there was no bolt on the restroom door -- difficult to manage, when you are travelling with kids).Exhaustive Breakfast Buffet -- as compared to similar properties.A very BIG pro is the location of the hotel. 350 metres from Jordan MTR. Famous Ladies Market, Night Market, Mongkok Markets within 5-15 minutes of walking distance.7-Eleven & other convenience stores within 1-2 minute walking distance. In fact, a number of other shopping options also exist in the same area. Plus, there's a McD & PizzaHut within 10 minutes of walking distance. Not to mention the local eateries.Overall, an excellent option to explore Hong Kong.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: First time at this hotel and one of the best I have stayed at. Great location, excellent staff and all other aspects of my stay were just as good. Highly recommended.. Compact but well laid our rooms, comfortable and clean bed. Breakfast was outstanding with a great choice.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Staff was helpful and friendly. It was a 5 min walk to Jordan MTR station.A few disappointments:1) The room was not so clean. I suffered from a terrible case of bed bug bites after my first night there. I also found a stray beer bottle cap under my bed, so clearly it was not cleaned up after the last visitor left.2) The baby cot provided was very small; only meant to fit babies less than a year old. My toddler ended up bumping the sides a lot, causing disrupted sleep.3) The breakfast was great, but I was rather disappointed that their baby chairs were mostly without straps. It took a lot of effort for the staff to look for one with functional straps.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: We were disappointed with the Novotel. The lounge bar area is nice and enjoyed a couple of drinks there but our room was small and outdated. The curtains were very much needing replacing and the paintwork tired. The carpet in the corridors were torn, had large uneven bumps as you walk along and large stains. No assistance to get our large suitcases down escalators upon leaving. We would say this was the only negative experience with accommodation with our trip thru Asia.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: It鈥檚 a great place to stay....nice location, staff were friendly caring and pleasant, special thanks to Joe, Chibi, Brian and Katherine. I would probably choose Novotel hotel next time as I have experience warm welcomes from them, excellent!!

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: All the staff (inc housekeeping) we met or spoke to without exception, were very helpful, friendly and cheerful. They knew the area well, providing very helpful tips on transport and things to see. .we were very sad when our stay had finished, if our travel plans had allowed would have loved to stay longer.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: The Novotel is in a great spot. Right on Nathan Road which is the central north/south axis of Kowloon. It鈥檚 just a few minutes from Jordan MTR station which is a hub of this amazingly efficient transport system and the markets are an easy stroll. The rooms are very spacious by HK standards and the service was good. Would recommend.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Cityflyer A21 goes from the airport to almost the hotel front door. Get off at Stop 11 and walk towards the direction of the Star ferry. Turn left on the first street (Saigon Street), and the hotel is down the street- less than 2 minutes.The bus fare is HK$33.00 for adult.The Jordan subway station is 5 minutes away. There are lots of restaurants, shopping in this area. This hotel accommodates large tour groups. The ground floor is always filled with waiting guests and luggage. The check in is on the first floor. The room we stayed was comfortable and clean but definitely showed wear and tear. The staff was friendly. Be aware the hotel check in is at 2 pm, no exceptions for earlier check in even it was an hour earlier. We will stay again for the location.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: The Novotel was in a great location and the staff excellent. We had a good stay. Our only criticism is that the food we very expensive. You could get it for a lot less at the many restaurants outside the hotel.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Whilst the Island is the commercial centre of the city it is not the 鈥榬eal鈥?HK. Kowloon gives you the genuine article, visceral, alive and full of character and characters! This Novotel enables easy access to a number of the 鈥榯ourist鈥?attractions and markets, not to mention JORDAN MTR, just 200m away. The room I had was quiet, clean and very well appointed. The bed was super comfy. Staff friendly and breakfast was very good. Will return.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Good, clean hotel in a very convenient location. Local markets and shops are just that - local - not the bulge-bracket glitz found all over the world. A21 airport bus access right outside the hotel, while MRT subway to major HK places just 100 metres away. Decent breakfast. Happy to return.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: I've stayed in Novotels in other countries but this one was an utter disappointment. The least this hotel could have done was to have a welcoming staff in order to stand out from the HKG 'crowd' (if you know what I mean). But right from the outset it was disappointment for us. The staff just doesn't bother if you are traveling with a 2 year kid, exhausted from a 9 hour flight. For them 2 pm check in is 2 pm check in with no empathy at all (well except for a few guests from the same region who came after us but were given rooms before us and we had to repeatedly ask them if they can give us a room. The answer was NO even at 1.55 pm and suddenly at 2 pm they are ready with the keys?) Rooms are in poor condition, wallpaper coming out, electrical controls giving up. Nowhere near novotel standards.During check one lady staff told I had to make a security deposit of HKD 1000 (who does this nowadays anyway?) and whether I would like to do so by cash or card. I said I will do in cash aftet I withdraw from the ATM. later I changed my mind and approached another staff to tell I will pay security deposit by card and he tells me sure, it is HKD 500!!! Lol or wtf you decide.They gave a complimentary toy (small soft toy) to my kid as part of their so called novotel "family" (as if they really cared) and when my 2 year kid lost it and I asked the reception if they can give the kid another one, they gave me such a disgusting look and asked for my room and stay details as if I have asked for buying out the property!! The only plus point is the location but the terrible hospitality of the hotel staff eclipsed everything else about this hotel. You may be better off at other properties. Wouldn't recommend at all.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Location is very good, rooms clean and serviced well each day so at least the most important things were good. Rooms are small though.Check in was a bit of a disaster, as it so happened many guests who got off a cruise ship were all checking in early and at the same moment. Difficult time for the front desk staff but they really did not handle things very well. We were entitled to priority check in due to our Accor Member status and we could not get near the desk as other non priority guests were being served, I guess to try and clear the big line.When we eventually got to front of the line it was then 9.30am we were at first very happy despite the wait as we were promised our room would be ready by just after 12.00pm, (normal check in is 2.00pm) so we went and had a coffee (our bags were with bell staff on first floor) and then went to explore the surroundings. Got back at 1.00pm and still a big line and were told sorry your room is not ready yet, try again at 2.00pm. A little frustrating but we understood, no big deal so went and had a drink at the bar and spoke to many guests waiting for their room, some were Accor members most were not and all were complaining as they also had been promised their rooms by now. Went to desk again at 2.00pm - sorry still not ready. Then at 3.00pm a lady came over and spoke to what was now a big group in the bar and said your rooms are ready. - All of a sudden at least 12 rooms were ready, surely many of these were ready earlier. Of course the 12 of us had to line up again to get our key cards etc. Not good enough for so called priority check in.Another time, my wife left breakfast before me and I did not have my key card with me, you need the card to operate the lift so I could not get to our floor to knock on our door. I used the house phone to explain and was asked my room number and name and was told by the operator that no one by my name was registered in that room and to go to the front desk. You guessed it - big line once more. No problem getting a key card once I got to front of line but hey I was not happy. Front office staff said they would speak to the operator - That did not help me though.Breakfast buffet was OK but nothing special. A la carte dinner service was also slow, meals always took a long time to come out. When they did arrive they were very good quality and decent size servings so that partly made up for the wait.Staff were generally pleasant but appeared to be understaffed as they were always run off their feet.It is doubtful we would stay at that hotel again.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: On 6/2 morning around 9.45 am, I checked into Novotel. Unfortunately the front desk girl told me that the room is not ready. Come back later. ( I did online check in and there was a message that my room key will be ready upon my arrival). Then at about 11, I came back and the same girl say that the room is still not ready and told me that she already told the House Keeping . I was pretty upset. Then a few minutes later Jackie came over to with the room keys and apologized for the delayed. She saved the day. The first was not apologetic. She sound like the housing keep was at fault. Nevertheless, I did had a wonderful stay at Novotel Nathan. Catherine at the executive lounge was very friendly and always smiling. Novotel is still my 1st hotel in Hong Kong.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: A great location for Shopaholics and close to public transport. Excellent value for money, especially if you book during an Accor sale. Friendly, efficient staff. The usual good standard Novotel buffet breakfast with plenty of choices. Small but comfortable club lounge offering a very nice afternoon tea and a good selection of evening canapes with beer, spirits and wine.As an Accor platinum member, I was given club lounge access, room upgrade, generous welcome amenity, welcome drink vouchers and late check out.Pre-stay emails were answered promptly and requests granted.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: The hotel is easily accessible via airport bus or if you travel light and have time to spare, use the subway. It is just 5 mins walk from Jordan Station. Nearby to many retail shops and restaurants. Check in/out was swift and many friendly faces. Room is clean and everything works well. Breakfast was rather busy and plenty of choices. Avoid during peak hours.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: This is a good 4 star hotel in a great area. Been to HKG 11 or 12 times and always stay near the harbour. Wanted to try another area this time. This is about a mile walk to the harbour and a pleasant walk. Or you can take the metro. It is within a few blocks of theTemple Street Night Market which is where we dined every evening. The hotel had all the amenities of a 4 star hotel and then some. Clean, courteous staff, good A/C, In room coffee maker and lots of convient stores nearby. Also on the free bus line from the airport express train terminal. I would stay there again.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Basically had nothing to complain about. The room was clean and tidy, the breakfast selection very good, and the staff very friendly. I had a room at the 11th floor, which was very quiet. The place is not entirely new, but still seems to be in fairly good condition.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Disappointed Novotel hotel,Have stayed at many a Novotel, and I don't expect 5 star, but this is by far the worst Ive stayed at, its very tired and needs a refurb, the one save was it looks like the bathrooms have had an update but that's it,.the breakfast was very ordinary, tables and chairs are old even the plates are so old they have dark scratch marks all over them, its just a touch grubby probably due to age and a lot of wear and tear.The staff seemed very disinterested in guests, look after your own bags, no assistance.The street access to the hotel is on the side street but the reception is on the first floor with no lift so you struggle up the escalator with your luggage so for some people this could be difficult . Location suited but I won't be staying there next time.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Room felt smaller than the advertised size of 24 square metres.Besides that, room is furnished with the needed facilities. Aircon was working well.. room is nice and cool.These are lots of food options near the hotel. There is also a subway station about 5 mins walk away.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Stayed at the Novotel Nathan Road. Hong Kong. It is pretty central to a lot of things. Temple Street markets about 5 mins. Walk. About 20mins.walk to the ferry terminal to take you across to Hong Kong Island.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: I鈥檝e been a ACCORPLUS member for few years. This is the 2nd time I stayed in Novotel Nathan. It will be great if breakfast is included for complimentary rooms and for ACCORPLUS members.Location for the hotel is good.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Lately the competition for reasonable hotels in the Jordan/upper Nathan Road area has become fierce, what with lots if revamped and newer hotels in the area. The Eaton just finished a major renovation. Their rooms at around 14sqm are tiny though newly designed and that hotel has a newer, hipper vibe. Hotel Stage which is around the the corner from Novotel and Eaton is more sleek and luxe鈥攂ut you pay for the look and not much else. I think Novotel strikes a great balance in getting size 24sqm and style right. This was my first stay here and certainly one I鈥檒l be checking out during my frequent trips to HK. First, location: less than 100m from Jordan station. The airport bus A21 also stops right by the corner (at 33 hkd that鈥檚 unbeatable if you don鈥檛 mind the 50minute ride). The Airport shuttle bus also passes by if you take the Airtrain. At 90hkd plus about a 20-30 minute drive via shuttle to the hotel, I say the bus is better value both to and from the airport IF you have small to little baggage. There are lots of places to eat in around the area and the shopping in nearby Tsimshatsui is incomparable. Service wise, I was given a free upgrade by the very warm and welcoming assistant manager Sanki. She very kindly allowed us early check in and even free lounge access. This may have something to do with booking direct via the Accor site. Membership is free and obviously comes with perks and benefits! The prices on their site were lower than Booking.com so do have a check. It was all warm welcome and smiles all around, something Hk isn鈥檛 always known for so this was quite refreshing. Breakfast at the lounge was a more basic and relaxing quiet affair. The main breakfast room is huge and can get raucous with people, though the choices are more plentiful. I tried each one and since I prefer a quiet start, it鈥檚 the lounge for me. Rooms are spic and span with slightly larger space than most other hotels in this class. The bed was very comfortable. Housekeeping was prompt and polite. Not much tv entertainment channels but carries the main news in several languages. Bathroom was serviceable and lit very well with everything you could possible need. A few things weren鈥檛 renewed though like the vanity kit but other than that not much else amiss. Temperature could be easily adjusted and WiFi was a joy to use. Gym was very well equipped and a great place to use. Wish there was a pool but I鈥檓 sure this would drive up their price. All in all an above average stay, and with check out available at the lounge, things couldn鈥檛 be easier. If you don鈥檛 mind staying up further up Nathan, being surrounded by great eateries and local color, this is the hotel for you.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: The location of this hotel is close to the MTR subway and multiple buses pass along Nathan Rd. If you feel like walking, it isn't that far from many attractions in the area, including markets which are about 2 blocks away. The hotel was exceptional in all ways. It was comfortable, immaculately clean and all service staff were wonderfully pleasant and helpful. We would definitely stay here again and recommend the hotel to our friends (as well as our travel agent).

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: A great location close to transport and shopping. Room was quiet and comfortable. The staff were attentive and Cathy, the front office assistant manger, went above and beyond with creating a memorable stay for us.THANK YOU.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: The hotel is nice. Room is nicely designed and quite spacious in hk standard. Location is good with lots of eateries nearby. Few minutes walk to jordan station. Near some famous eateries like australian dairy company. Breakfast is quite okay. The tap water is drinkable which is nice. Room is a little bit old but still good. Very well priced.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Novotel Nathan road is a good place to stay. It is located near the subway and you will never have to worry about food as there are many food choices especially the popular Australian Dairy Company. It is also possible to walk to Tsim Sha Tsui. The rooms are clean and of a comfortable size. There is a gym on the lower ground opened 24 hours which has the standard machines. Overall, i enjoyed my stay in Novotel Nathan Road.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: We always enjoy our stay at this Novotel . Conveniently located to Jordon MTR and bus route to the Star Ferry . The staff on the Executive Floor are efficient and friendly ,particularly Katherine and Neo ( ? )who go out of their way to help . The rooms are clean and of adequate size .

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Novotel Nathan Road has been my hotel of choice for every visit to Hong Kong for about a decade now, and although I do check my options every time, I believe this property remains the best overall choice. If you're looking for superior value, this is where to stay. What you get is a clean and comfortable room, a convenient location for subway connections to all the main neighborhoods, and if you get the breakfast buffet option (which I highly recommend), a multicultural daily spread of an array of choices for a hearty filling breakfast to start your busy day. Even though I end up in the Central district to see friends sometimes, this hotel is still the most convenient (as compared to some very pricey options) because Central is actually just 10-15 minutes away by subway -- it actually takes longer from many hotels on the Hong Kong side.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Stayed for only one night but it was again really good.Booked the Executive Floor as we really enjoyed this on ut previous stay. Not disappointed. Quick check in and followed this with a short time in the Lounge as we were early - did not take long and we were in the room. Had drinks and food in the lounge in the evening happy hour (free) and also a light breakfast (included). Staff were really nice.Fully recommended

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Had a fantastic stay. Easy to get from the airport on the A21 bus which stops right outside the hotel. Room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast excellent with lots of choice. Staff were friendly and helpful. We will be back!

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: We had a stopover in Hong Kong. The room was basic but good. Staff were helpful. The location was off Nathan road so plenty of shopping centres around. The reception is on the first floor and concierge desk is on the ground floor. Next time we are in Hong Kong we might book another hotel.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Being an Accor member, they were very prompt to attend to me at the priority queue. Room as a bit tight but since in HK, I guess space is always tight. Location is pretty decent with a short walk to shopping areas. They also have some noodle and seafood restaurant as well as convenience store right in front of the hotel which is really convenient.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: I happened to booked the hotel through Accor believing that I get the best rate. But, it wasn't. Although, the hotel manager, Mr Manchun assisted me with respect expained well about the rate situation and he matched the price I inquired. Very helpful and great attention! Thank you to all staff and I will definitely be back here in the future!

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: We travel with kids and when check-in process finished, receptionist gave us very cute dolls to the kids. It was first impression. And the room is so clean with good facilities. Location is super great as it 鈥榮 just 5 min walk to Jordan subway station and many restaurants around the hotel. When check-out late as we required in the first place(5pm) ; they gave us one more hour (6pm) as my son was still taking a day-time nap. It is very kindness of the hotel to understand us. We are so pleased.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Checked-in was smooth but checkout a bit slow. Front desk staffs was helpful and welcoming. No assists on the luggage when arriving the hotel front door, a bit disappointing.Booked two rooms and was given a connecting room which was a bonus. However, there was a bed in between the connecting doors (according to front desk is for sound proof purpose), I requested to be taken away so that we can crossover easily. The bed was taken away from the door but was left in a corner of one of our room (which i think no big deal but still not a proper way to do so).The room we stayed i think need some refurbishment as the sofa has few stitches on it, looks kinda wear and tear. The location of the power outlets are limited to the desk side next to the TV only.The bed was comfy but the pillow was way too soft, even we requested a harder pillow but it was still soft. First day of room keeping forgotten to refill the amenities then the rest of the few days no issue.Location is good for sure, near to MTR, restaurants, shopping areas, MongKok etc.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: I鈥檝e been to other Novotel Hotels and checking in to Novotel Nathan Road disappointed me a bit. When we alighted from the car, there was no assistance with our luggage. We had to push them ourselves.CHECK INThe process was smooth, the staff was polite but not welcoming, not smiling. I noticed that the countertop was dusty. I wiped it with my finger to confirm it was really dust and not just a design of the surface. We checked in at 7pm and when I asked for a late checkout, I was given 13:00.ROOMI鈥檇 say, for the published tariff rate/cost, the room size and amenities didn鈥檛 match (it is very costly!). We got a generous king sized bed as advertised but the space around it, especially the front was really tight. I can鈥檛 push the luggage through it, it has to be pushed sideways. All other furniture (desk, nite stands), were built-in type to save space. The closet and bathroom share the same sliding door. If someone is using the bathroom and you open the closet, the person won鈥檛 be able to come out at will unless you slide it out and it closes the closet. The hanger area is too far inside that it was a challenge to hang clothes. The bathroom is also tight. The lavatory counter is right beside the toilet seat.A safe is provided, iron, ironing board and the usual stuff. The slippers are so thin they tear easily. At least for the price we paid, the slippers could have been fluffy and durable. But they are replaced daily.Along with the drawer for making coffee and tea, a condom is displayed with the Pringles! Of course with a price tag. It鈥檚 the first time I saw a condom displayed and made available along with the minibar pricelist. I was concerned that our young child would see it! Maybe having it in the pricelist is enough but not display it upfront.QUALITY OF SLEEPIt was good, however we could hear the other guests walking and talking along the hallway. The window has a sheer curtain plus a blackout shade which was good. We actually slept in and missed our breakfast.ENTERTAINMENT The TV provided a variety of English channels to watch. In the lobby there鈥檚 an area for children to hangout and use their computers. Unlike in other Novotel Hotels, the play option is varied.BREAKFASTThere was a queue getting in because the staff recording the room numbers is the same to usher the guests to their tables so there was waiting time until she comes back. Food choices offered a variation and there were a lot of fruits, cheeses, fish, meat, bread, drinks varieties which also offered choices for young guests.CHECKOUT It was very quick. I noticed that my fingerprint was still there. The countertop was not wiped since I checked in two days ago.Good concierge service though coz our flight was late at night. We left our luggage for some shopping time.LOCATIONIt is the main reason guests have chosen this hotel despite the cost and tight space. It is walking distance to the Temple Street Night Market, the bus stops, Jordan MTR station and shopping places in Mongkok. Everything is within reach. There鈥檚 a mall across Nathan Road, Starbucks within the block, and money changers.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: The hotel is very conveniently located to shopping, public transportation and sight-seeing spots. Room is well furnished though a little small but being in Hong Kong, it is acceptable. There are many shops and restaurants close-by. Room rate are acceptable depending on time of the year.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: We had a great stay here. The room nicely decorated, and was a decent size with a lovely big, soft bed. The bathroom was good and the shower was powerful. The hotel staff were polite and helpful, and everything was clean and tidy. Only mild issues was the drain was a little slow and it made the floor wet after taking a shower. The TV was also a little old and could be updated. It would also be convenient to have some USB ports in the room to charge phones and stuff. But these are just very mild issues.Take exit B1 from Jordan MTR to be sure you are on the right side of the road for the hotel. It鈥檚 only a few minutes walk which is great for exploring the city. There鈥檚 also a 711 opposite the hotel which was helpful to pick up late night snacks or milk for coffee. Overall, great hotel! Perfect for enjoying a holiday in Hong Kong!

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Enjoyed the stay here albeit not my preferred location. Rooms were good, club lounge was great and location is ok but its only a short taxi fare to most places or the tube is close by. Not a massive fan of the downstairs breakfast area, and chose the Club lounge more often than not for my morning meal. The club lounge staff and setting was really good excepting no toilet in club lounge... quick trip back to room required.... but overall a cracking club lounge to drink eat and meet people, albeit on the smaller side. A good hotel and enjoyed the stay. No problems recommending this hotel.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Excellent in all respects: reception, concierge, room and overall facilities. Dinning represented variety and value for money. There were also specials that attracted both western and Asian cuisine. Would stay again.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Was underwhelmed by welcome but delighted with room which was very comfortable.The hotel is in Kowloon very central, handy for underground and easy walk to Star Ferry. Plenty of restaurants close by. Temple Market just across the road.Breakfast was good with plenty of choices. We didn't eat in restaurant at night but did have a bite in the bar which was good. Disappointed in bar however. During Happy hour one night we ordered a pint and a half of beer. For some reason that didn't qualify for buy one get one free? For that we would have had to order 2 pints. If we had done that I would have only had to pay for one pint. As it was I had to pay for 1 pint and a premium price on the half pint. Given what we had already spent on the hotel for accommodation, food and drink it left a bit of a sour taste and cost the waiter a tip.Overall whilst we did have some great service there were some failings along the way.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Our hotel was pretty centrally located. The room was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was good but should have some more options for vegetarian clients like me. Overall it was a very satisfying stay.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: Hotel is located in a good location, near to Jordan MTR and if yo ucoming from the airport, the bus A21 stop is next to it. Entrance is along a small street. It is also near eateries so if you dont have breakfast with room, can go nearby for breakfast. Decent size of a Hong Kong hotel, but the only problem is the pillows.... it is not fluffy, it seems that it has been in used for 10 years and not changed. that is the only gripe.

Hotel: Novotel Hong Kong Nathan Road Kowloon
review: I only stayed a night but it was a pleasant stay. Was being welcomed by local famous biscuits made my stay started well. Except it鈥檚 a bit slow on the lifts even though it has 4, everything is good. I love the cleanliness and quiet floor.

First of all, I am a true fan of the hotel which have stayed for nearly 10 times in the recent 6 months. And I used to work in the hotel industry. Bedding, room, swimming pool, gym, especially the staff are really good. If you are not staying at the club floor or going to use the lounge, you can skip the below. The only downside that I want to share is the arrangement of executive lounge. (1) Bad crowd control: You will have to queue up at entrance (if you are disciplined as no one at counter). Some guests have to stand/ sit at the computer area. No one check your room number so literally saying - anyone can just come in and enjoy the service at the lounge. (2) Quite a lot of kids: May be due to the hotel is a family friendly hotel and no kids policy at the lounge. No offence as I love kids as well. But I do not think it is a good decision to allow kids in club lounge especially in happy hour session (alcohols, glasses, bottles are everywhere). Especially, the area in this lounge is not that big. (3) Staffing: The staffs are all very helpful, if we able to locate them. Take 6:30pm-7:30pm cocktail peak time, all 3 full-time (+ 1 causal probably) are serving a full-house lounge. Filling up food drinks and cleaning the dishes occupy most of their time. The management should look more into the staffing issue. And I strongly suggest at least having 1 staff at counter as crowd control is very important. The above are some of my personal sharing. I can鈥檛 control whether there would be a change. But if the management take the Marriott brand and service standard seriously, I do hope these can be improved in the upcoming future.

I choose this place based on TripAdvisor and the Mc Donald close by .This place is depressing. I wish I would have never book this place . I looked other places to move but no luck . The location is DEPRESSING, this location is sad. Besides to top with a cherry not even breakfast bc I am only Gold Member and die to changes in Marriott now Gold is nothing . We are talking Cat2-3 here.

Location is convenient, supermarket Wellcome next door, Circle K convenience store across the street, 5 minutes walk to Train MTR Shek Mun Station or local bus stations. Hotel has scheduled shuttle bus service to Chinese University & Science Park, Train MTR stations in Shatin, Kowloon & Tsim Sha Tsui. Of the 3 interesting sculptures in lobby, the middle one even portrayed a Hong Kong map & guide book. Apart from the usual at breakfast, I was impressed with Saturday breakfast, there were 8 dim sum choices in the huge steamed bamboo container, an Indonesian rice dish, an Indonesian dessert, & even had salted egg yolks as one of the rice porridge condiments. Delicious. Thank you.

After staying here once in Jan of 2018, I decided to stay here again recently because of the great service and big and clean rooms.Location isn鈥檛 center but they have free shuttles to downtown and there鈥檚 a bus stop right there. Not super convenient but the rooms make up for it.Last time I stayed, I booked the Deluxe Double and although the floor we got wasn鈥檛 high, the view was still nice and rooms were super big, which is the main reason why I booked it again this time. I didn鈥檛 get an upgrade before because I was only a silver member but I am now a Gold elite so I was expecting an upgrade. Jacky told me I got an upgrade but I am sure that wasn鈥檛 the case. I did get a higher floor but once I walked in, immediately I knew the room was smaller. Not to mention, the beds too. Because of the smaller rooms, and thinner walls, I can hear whenever someone sneezes and even heard when someone was pulling the shades. I didn鈥檛 have that problem before when I came here last time.Needless to say, it wasn鈥檛 as pleasant as last time because not only did I not get an upgrade, I felt like I got a downgrade lol. I woke up 3 times because of the thin walls whenever someone closed the door.

The hotel was great. Had plenty of amenities the room sizes were very good for being in Hong Kong. It was a bit on the pricey side considering the location and a 10 minute walk to the MTR subway. Overall, a more budget friendly hotel that is still relatively new. Staff were nice and helpful and the rooms were very clean and neat.

overall happy but our first stay hotel didn't impress us from the rate they re charging, 1 major issue shower door leaking water wch can be fatal for kids to slip and get hurt badly, told reception abt the issue twice, no feedback or follow up from staff........apart from that rooms are pretty clean and looks new.....free shuttle from hotel to town a great service to have but only if u can get a seat, either do it more frequent or get a bigger bus plz...great shopping and lots of resturant nearby also amazing view from the room

I stayed here twice in the last 18 months and have had excellent experiences.The hotel is away from the City center, no question, The hotel offers very dependable shuttle service to Kowloon. The MTR is 3 blocks away. Neighborhood has lots of restaurants. Wide walking / biking paths line the the river and are filled with locals until late in the evening. It鈥檚 a short metro ride to Sha Tine Racecourse.The staff is happy and welcoming. Special thanks to both Fai and Cora at the front; always friendly and helpful. On the 29th floor Christy gave truly exceptional advice and assistance.Cuisine is challenged and leaves room for improvement.

Was here during wk of 24 Apr - 2 May and we received great, hearty welcome, always good, fast communication with staff and I would like to point out the super-efficient cleaning staff of this hotel. Very thoughtful especially to tie up our charging cables and a couple of other details. We could tell that the staff thinks of the guests and caters for their needs proactively. Will definitely return here.

Let me share with you a horrible experience at Courtyard Hong Kong Sha Tin. I stayed at room 2005 on 22 April 2019. After my nap I went into the bathroom to take a shower and I closed the sliding door. Then I realized that I left my underwear out of bathroom, so I tried to open the sliding door, but it did not move at all even though I had tried my best to pull it. More terribly and astonishingly, I looked around the bathroom but fail to find any emergency SOS button or telephone.However, I was at least lucky since I just happened to bring my mobile phone into the bathroom, so I called the hotel service center right away. Then came a housekeeper and a guy who carried my welcome fruit, both of them could not open the door. The housekeeper called the engineering staffs and the front office for help.Duty manager could not open it by himself as well. Finally, several strong men joined forces to pull the bathroom door open.More importantly, as I told the duty manager, the hotel has severe problems with security settings. I was scared when I was trapped in bathroom for no one would know me locked in bathroom even though I shouted for help, if at first I did not bring my mobile phone in. People may die alone in the bathroom, and no one knows he is dying in this situation. Why is there no any SOS alarm buttons or telephone in the bathrooms of your hotel??? How can you make sure that it would never happen that someone slips or gets injured or just like me is trapped in the bathroom? How can the hotel open with such unqualified security settings? How can the hotel pass the security inspection by Hong Kong government and Marriott International? The hotel should be suspended of business immediately so as to rectify the security settings, many people say it including security and legal professional persons who know what I have experienced at Courtyard Sha Tin.After being locked for nearly half an hour, my journey was ruined and my mind was hurt. I was suffering from the SAFETY THREATS and PSYCHIC TRAUMA. So far I still dream with a nightmare that I was locked in the bathroom of Courtyard Sha Tin and no one came to save me, I shouted and shouted but no one hear me. You probably can understand in what kind of dangerous circumstance I was? Isolated and helpless. The management team repeatedly apologized but never present their apologies in an earnest or sincere way, and never made a satisfying compensation. What鈥檚 more, after my complaints and a few emails with the resident manager, I do even not see their real action plans they would take to improve their security settings, only some general perfunctory words like 鈥淪afety of guests is the top priority of our hotel, we have conducted examination and taken necessary precautions to eliminate the influence, in the hope of preventing similar issues from happening again鈥?blablabla, never mention that they would install the necessary bathroom telephone or SOS Emergency button. Therefore, I do not suggest you stay at Courtyard Hong Kong Sha Tin for your own safety.

This is our first time experiencing the Courtyard Shatin as it is close to where my husband鈥檚 family lives. We contacted the hotel Front desk assistant manager several times, Jacky Chan, about an upgrade because we are Gold Bonvoy members. He was resistant and very unwilling to acknowledge our gold member status. On the day of check in, we again asked and he refused an upgrade despite a studio suite being available. We were appalled by his actions that I demanded to speak to the Resident Manager. At this time, the hotel鈥檚 Assistant Manger, Nicole Chan, came out and kindly resolved the upgrade issue by offering us an upgrade for being Gold members. As loyal Marriott members, we should not need to beg for an upgrade because it is one of the advantages of being a gold Bonvoy member. This benefit should be offered to all Marriott members instead of holding rooms iso upgrading its members and that is what Mr. Jacky Chan did. It is shameful to have employees like him representing the Bonvoy brand!We paid for an executive club lounge room so our upgraded room was a Studio suite which can fit an extra bed with enough room to move around. Thank you to Ms. Nicole Chan for taking a pro-active approach in resolving an ugly situation. Our upgraded room, unfortunately, had a very strong smoke odour from the previous guests smoking illegally in the room. I am asthmatic so the smoke smell worsened my condition. I did not want to complain because it took so much out of me already with the upgrade issue. We stayed only 4 nights so I just had to use my inhalers more during our stay.Our room 1223 is a good size with good duvets and comfortable beds. The carpeting is clean as is the washroom but the chaise lounge is stained and should have been cleaned. Some of the furnishings have taken a beating. It was handy to have a safe in the room as well as a fridge and kettle. Th hotel has complimentary shuttle that brings guests to Tsimshatsui every 75 minutes or so and the trip takes about 40 minutes. We found this service very helpful and convenient. There is a McDonalds next to the hotel as well as a Circle K that sells noodles and fresh pastries. In addition, outside the hotel is Wellcome, a little supermarket and a Chinese coffee shop, Wah Kee, that has great breakfasts and lunches. The executive lounge is okay with a small selection of breakfast but if you prefer a larger buffet breakfast then go to Momo Cafe downstairs along with other Conference attendees and the crowd. The food selection at Momo Cafe is extensive but the food quality is mediocre. We only had time during our 4 night stay to utilize the executive lounge once during happy hour because we were always out. From 5:30 to 7:30 pm canap茅s are served like cheeses, cookies, gyozas, little desserts, cucumber rolls, but again the food quality and the taste of the food is below average. The one time we were there, I had a gin and tonic but they ran out of gin so we had to find alternative alcoholic drinks. It is tacky to run out of alcohol especially when it is a lounge serving drinks!The pool is very clean but also very cold as it is outdoors and not heated. The steam room is very clean and large along with a smaller dry sauna. The showers and changing area are all spic and span. The only inconvenience is that the pool closes for one hour from 1 to 2 pm, smack in the middle of the day. I think perhaps it is the towel attendant/life guard鈥檚 lunch break?I gave this property a generous 4 stars because of the cleanliness of the fitness and pool areas and the comfortable beds/duvets but this particular Courtyard has lots to learn from North American Courtyards in how to value its members and in offering friendly guest services. If you are expecting North American Courtyard standards, then this property will disappoint.In the future, I hope all staff at Courtyard Shatin gets proper training about the importance of valuing Bonvoy members and we the members earned this privilege by being loyal to the Bonvoy brand when there are many other competitors we can select from,

The management is not service and customer oriented at all. A couple of days before the trip, it was impossible to change the booking. After contacting they finally agreed to change just one day before coming and they asked me twice the price of the room. Usually with big companies like this, the advantage is the customer service: they try to find solution to your issues. It was not the case at all with Marriott.

Although far from downtown and shopping mall, but close to bus stop and MTR station. The hotel also provide free shutlle to Tsim Sha Tsui. Staffs are very helpfull. Room equiped with very comfort bed, bathtub and shower (rain and hand shower).Unfortunately, the hotel didn鈥檛 inform their swimming pool operation. Since swimming pool is one of my consideration when I choosing a hotel, so I little dissapointed about this.

I used my points to redeem one nite at this hotel and the following morning I went down for breakfast. One of the male chef (I think his name is Dickson) at the egg station was so busy and after he heard my order - 3 egg whites and 1 egg yolk he didn鈥檛 give me an annoying face and was so efficient. I don鈥檛 see this kind of service in HK lately and very impressed with the service of this hotel.

I stayed for two nights participating in an IB workshop at a nearby school (business stay).The hotel is near an MTR station (Hong Kong metro). It is just off the city centre but deep in the urban area. Its location is ideal for those coming from the Shenzhen border by MTR. The hotel offers regular complimentary shuttle service to major malls with MTR stations (e.g. the "Elements" next to West Kwoloon station).The rooms are spacious, and offer a really relaxing experience. Breakfast is good.The check-in/check-out is usually fast. Overall it was a good solution for my visit to Hong Kong on business. I only noticed that there were inconsistencies between restaurant offers advertised in my room and what was actually possible to order in the hotel's restaurant.By the way, the hotels' restaurant is rather expensive for what it offers.

Second stay in this hotel. What can I say? Okay. First, checked in at 22:30 on my birthday and indicated at the time of reservation, my ID was shown and registered, but the check in colleague never realised nor said anything relevant, or he did not bothered to? I don鈥檛 know. Well, second we were checked into a room which the double lock never worked, and this room also surprised us with a very lovely handwritten card that never had my name on...Mr. Lok? alright, so it was my birthday and I was checked into someone鈥檚 room? Called to request for another room so the right person could have this room back.. 20 minutes later I was switched to a room with another lovely card on the table, so hopefully this time everything was right.. or maybe wow me with a simple word of happy birthday? Noway. Not even a correct spelling of my last name, which was as obvious as stated on the paper of my registration, not to mention you were already welcoming me back so you should know my name pretty well on your system?I鈥檝e decided to put it aside as it was a birthday celebration. Breakfast buffet at momo cafe was okay with variety of options, but the fact that you need to go to the bar counter to order the coffee by yourself and then retrieve the coffee yourself again when it鈥檚 done still weirded me out. Pretty disappointed with your name affiliated with the Marriott..I know you are quite reasonably priced with the facilities you provided. Stayed in budget hotels before in HK and service was still better. I still think there are rooms in the humanity part you should fix. Maybe ASAP.

Price : Affordable. Except location is slightly farRoom : Modern, decent size with a good viewLocation : About 5 mins walk to MTRPool : Was closed for winter seasonLounge : Not much food offerings, was crowded.

Initially we thought it is little outside the city but the location was very nice, We stayed in a room with nice facing the river and the adjoining roads. Hotel has good breakfast and offer shuttle service to fixed locations nearby. MTR station nearby. Overall we enjoyed the stay. Calm and quite atmosphere.

The hotel is away from the city. It was a good stay, the breakfast spread was good. We stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms r big and have all facilities. Nothing exceptionally good or bad about this hotel. The staff is not very friendly.

As always, the Courtyard Shatin provided a flawless stay, and an incredible value. Thanks to Danielle Tsui, the Front office manager, for exercising her greatest flexibility to pre-upgrade our room to a corner suite. Her flexibility along with the professionalism should earn some respect.Though we can't see the stunning harbour views like properties in Tsim Sha Tsui and Admiralty, we can overlook the beautiful Shing Mun River views. In the evening, around 5 pm, we can enjoy the golden ball like of sunset in the executive lounge. It's gorgeous!!!All the butlers in the executive lounge have gone above and beyond to make us feel like at home. YoYo is one of the best.Whenever you have any issues and/or questions, the front office personnel will handle them smoothly and effectively. Jacky Chan, one of the Duty managers, has presented himself in an extremely professional way that the Courtyard will always emphasize on the top quality of guest services.

Stayed here a couple of days for meetings - hotel was lovely and I was surprised that it has been opened for a couple of years now as there was no signs of ageing. Rooms were clean, comfortable and with great views. Bed however was too soft for my liking.Service was also prompt and friendly. Food-wise the all day dining restaurant had a great variety - I was pleasantly surprised to find some local treats like egglets, portuguese egg tarts in the options. In-room dining however was a little sub-par was it was tasteless. However do note that there is nothing in the area to explore as it is a residential area. Taking a train down to the city takes awhile too and taxi is very expensive. Will only recommend for business travel, in the hotel itself.

My mother and I stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott Hong Kong Sha Tin for 2 nights while I was attending a conference in the area. So to speak, our stay was for both leisure/family and business, and this hotel was a great choice, away from the noise and crowd of the Hong Kong main districts. The hotel was very clean and with a spacious lobby. Waiting for check-in was just fine because there was continuous flow of complementary nuts, cookies, cold coffee and tea in the waiting lounge. The rooms were big and with adequate space for movement and for luggage. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The airconditioning system, hot shower water and wifi were functioning. We were lucky enough to have a room with nice, relaxing view of the city and mountains in the background. There was a pool as well as a gym/fitness center with equipment for both cardio and strength exercises. Right across the street was a convenience store, and right in the hotel ground were a supermarket and cosmetics store. There were also a number of taxis waiting outside the hotel entrance so transportation was easy. Uber was also readily available.The people at the reception spoke basic English so it was not too difficult to communicate. We tried the room service and it was fast. The room service staff were courteous, and the food was good. Buffet breakfast at the MoMo Cafe offered a good spread of both Oriental/Chinese and Western dishes. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my relatives and friends who are planning to visit Sha Tin and the New Territories.

Back in HK and back at the Courtyard. The reasons we come back to this hotel are many and varied. It is central to the airport, shops restaurants and all of the fun stuff Hong Kong has to offer.The staff are absolutely wonderful, the rooms are quite large, well appointed and spotlessly clean.

Back for 3rd stay at this hotel. Great rooms as before, and took the city flyer bus to airport. I could only say it is very convenient and accessible from airport despite its location. The room rate is also quite decent as there is train to Mongkok and later this year there will be direct train to Kowloon area. It is definitely a hotel location worth a consideration if you plan to travel to Shen Zhen and Kowloon during a visit to Hong Kong.

Make sure you request for a river view room. It鈥檚 walking distance to MTR station. Bus A41P from airport stops at the opposite side of the road, so the bus stop going back to the airport is just in front. Rooms are spacious. I would have to say the staff from the gym would be great in the front desk as they were very warm and welcoming. Shuttle from the hotel to TST or MongKok is on the dot, but make sure you queue early as it is first come and first served. Commute from hk island or tst back to hotel via MTR could take almost an hour and 3-4 tranfers.

This hotel is located in Sha Tin close to the MRT station in around 500m, not far away, few minutes you would find it, the modern, excellent building is the only high building in this area and you could even take it as a road sign when find your direction, there is a but station just in front of the hotel and makes your journey to the airport fast and easy.For the service, when check in, reception recognized my memebership, they are very polite and professional and won't take you too much time, the staff will help you with you luggage on a barrow, well done.For room, it's big and clean in HK area as usually the room in other hotels are quite small even you paid a lot. The view from the room would be a plus as it could give you a very fantastic view to the local river and superb neighbourhood view.

Though it might out of town, do take advantage of their free shuttle bus service from town and nearby mall. Alternatively download their walking map as it's only about 10 minutes walk from the nearest MTR. The hotel itself is modern and well kept. Borderline luxurious as well. The rooftop bar can be on the dearer side of this part of town but view is indeed breathtaking for those who enjoy a getaway from the city. Buses are available all night round, and does go to a broad range of places.

I booked a room in this hotel for four nights, I was able to use my free night certificate, and some MR points so that it works out to paying one night.Pros: big room for Hong Kong, close to metro Shek Mun, free shuttle bus to central Hong Kong (need to wait 10 minutes ahead) by doors at front reception. It鈥檚 about 45 minutes to central Hong Kong by metro and 30 minutes by shuttle bus to Kowloon Station (bullet train). Shower pressure is excellent. Facilities are very clean and new. Very quiet, and front desk are very nice and attentive, and can speak English proficiently.Cons: everything in this hotel costs money. The breakfast works out to 198HKD per person. The drawer with snacks and ramen you think are free costs 30HKD and above. And the prices are hidden, price list is deep within the drawer.They also charged 3000HKD in pre-authorized costs. That seems to be a bit much when most hotels charge like one night hotel cost.Hotel is located really close to McDonald鈥檚, so walk past Wellcome supermarket and you鈥檙e arrive at the hotel, need to go up two flights of escalators to get to front desk.A41P stops in front of hotel (to airport) and across the street (Ravana Garden, from Airport). We took A41P to HKG airport and front desk gave me a schedule and told me to add 10-15 minutes from schedule鈥檚 time (as it only shows first stop time) so it works out to approximately the bus will come at :00 and :30. A41P takes Octopus card, costs 27HKD from Airport and 22.3HKD to airport.

Nice hotel set amidst river views and mostly what seemed like a residential surrounding. Easy access to the MTR and a free shuttle service to Kowloon and Tsim Tsa Shui gets you to all the tourist attractions conveniently. Well maintained property, Spacious rooms (Corner rooms offer great view of the river), good breakfast and decent executive lounge. Helpful staff.

The hotel stay was booked by my company. It was comfortable and cozy stay. I like it so much especially the hotel did provided mobile app for hotel requests. I can request extra amenities for my room and my colleague as well. For example, I ordered a foam pillow my colleague when I鈥檓 outside, it was delivered before I back to my room! It鈥檚 a great invention.

We stayed at this Courtyard for 2 nights in October 2018. We picked this hotel due to location 鈥?this is the closest Marriott property to my family. This is not your standard-US Courtyard property 鈥?this hotel is new and beautiful with a grand lobby - something you expect to see at a Marriott Marquis in the US. The location is convenient for my purpose - it is also a 30-minute bus ride from the airport (the bus drops you off right across the street). The hotel also offers a free shuttle that takes you to TST/back to the hotel from TST. This is pretty amazing. I didn鈥檛 dine at the hotel but there are many (local) dining options about 5-10 minutes鈥?walk, by the train station. The guest rooms are very spacious and modern (again, not your standard-US Courtyard rooms). It has a nice gym and even a rooftop pool. I would absolutely recommend this hotel (if you look to stay in the area), and would go back.So why 3 stars? I have 1 gripe 鈥?and it鈥檚 a big one: we chose a Marriott property because we are Marriott members and towards end of the year we are collecting points to get to Platinum status. Since we got home (over a month at this point) we haven鈥檛 been credited the nights we stayed at this property. We contacted Marriott numerous times, starting by submitting missing stay request online, and then calling in to customer service 2x, to no avail. We did provide our Marriott number at check-in so I really don鈥檛 understand why this is so difficult.

Our room up 20+ floors was very good as we had an amazing view of the river in Sha Tin. The staff were very pleasant and very welcoming. The room was well-appointed with all the usual things you would expect in a Marriott. The international breakfast offered a very good choice for all and the catering staff were very good to ensure the place was clean and tidy for the many guests. The hotel was very convenient for a metro station a few minutes walk down the road. There are plenty of shops nearby and the hotel shuttle, or frequent taxis, can take you into the main town centre to the mall for serious shopping. Minor criticism - the Club Lounge did not really offer much in the way of food. Alcoholic drinks were limited and unfortunately, I was not given information about what was going to be available and when. The service was average and impersonal. The views were very good though I've had much better experiences in other club lounges in other hotels. Buses were also very convenient, a short walk from the hotel main entrance. One bus goes directly to the airport.

Wonderful hotel with the nicest Lounge in Hong Kong if not the world.Top 10 worldwide Courtyard.Trained staff - check in and out works quickly and efficient. Spacious rooms, nice environment and space everywhere. Yes not in downtown but location is know before booking.I return from time to time and love it more ever. Would recommend Club Level.

The room is very big (HK standard), in good condition, with a comfortable bed (none of that hard Asian mattress!). There were 2 bottles of complementary given water each day but housekeeping often left few more for me which was very nice. The front desk staff is super friendly, helpful, and efficient. The location is fairly convenient if you're familiar with HK and are comfortable taking local buses. I suggest downloading the HKeMobility or KMB apps to help you navigate the bus routes. I was given a monogram bathrobe and welcome points as a Gold Elite member. I stayed during the mid-autumn festival and found 4 mini moon cakes in my room. Those are some very nice touches to make me feel special. I'm very happy with my experience and will stay there again.

We stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Shatin Hotel to celebrate a special occasion. We chose this hotel because it is managed and led by a Hongkonger, Peter Sih, General Manager as we are Hongkongers too. We want to break away from the routine and get refreshed. The views from the hotel is spectacular, the hotel has a pleasant and comforting ambiance, the food is of high standard, it is conveniently located and most important, the hotel team is home welcoming. We have enjoyed our stay and been received by staff members with a high standard of hospitality. Names to mention who have made our stay so special and memorable, Nicole Chan, Danielle Tsui, Asst. Front Office Manager, Miko Ling, Front Office Staff, Ricky Lam, F&B Director, Joe Ng, Restaurant Manager, and Desmond Wong, Restaurant staff. Our thanks to them for their great services. Highly recommend to Hongkongers and tourists for good value for money!

A good and neat hotel to stay. Rooms are bit small but equipped with all modern amenities in. Breakfast was also good and good view from hotel gallery if u stay on high floors. It also has good big parking space.

Location is nice, near the mrt and there are shops at the ground floor like mannings. Room is very clean and modern. Wifi is fast. Breakfast at Mono is exceptional, noodles are really good. Wide variety if choices from Indian, Western to Japanese. Service is very fast. Receptionist are very accomodating

Great Hotel in Shatin. Very accessible with bus station nearby if you want to go around and explore Shatin. The staffs are very friendly. Our room is nice, facing the riverside giving us a great view of the river and the mountain. The food in Momo Cafe also provides a great variety of foods, really enjoyed it. I will definitely recommend the place.

We had a lovely time. This time, I鈥檓 travelling with my brother.We have a double bed. A view of the pool and surrounding neighbourhood. It鈥檚 about 45 minutes to Tsim Tsa Shui.
