Courtyard Marriott provides free shuttle service (there is a timetable provided) for pickups and drop offs. I thought that was a nice surprise and delight!The free shuttle bus ride was a bit hectic. We are not too use with the fast driving here in Hong Kong hehe. So, we opted for the local public transport the next day. It was only 7 minutes to Shek Mun station. It鈥檚 also a local hot spot for snacks and eateries. A nice and small selection, but we are happy with that.Everything is nice and clean. Lovely pool to swim in. Pleasant and friendly staff. English is not their first language, so they do their best to help. We learned a few Cantonese phrases, and it helps :)Thank you again Marriotts for a pleasant stay!

If you are going to HK for fun then I would suggest DO NOT stay at this hotel as location is very bad. It almost feels depressing. Check in process was slowThey only have restaurant in the hotel and executive lounge is average. Overall I would give this hotel 3.5. Nothing special about the hotel, service, location, restaurants, etc.

Room are very basic, but clean. Being a platinum elite member, the upgraded room is about 24-28 SQM, so not roomy I assume. We stayed here for an extended period, mostly because of its location and it鈥檚 the only decent hotel nearby beside Hyatt regency. First time staying @ courtyard anywhere. It鈥檚 better than expected. Staff are polite, although not everyone conversant in English, the concierge are helpful, special thanks to Andy and Alex. Will only stay if we need be back to Shatin area, but won鈥檛 recommend for tourists( kind of far from all sites), nor for luxe/comfort ( smaller room with relatively basic offers). Staff in general still need training in many area. The hotel however has a club lounge for access. Also pool and saunas, although they may not clean it regularly, still for a courtyard, it鈥檚 good to have.

Price: Cheap for HK standardsRoom: Large for HK standardsLocation: Located in outskirts. Only downside of this property. But can't complain due to its cheap price.Breakfast: Good spread. Lounge: Staff were friendly, interior was modern and spacious with high ceilings. Fantastic view of Sha Tin area.

Stayed at the Marriott Courtyard Sha Tim for a night and I had one of the best experiences. Checking in and out was flawless and the the front office staff Andy and Venus were simple fantastic. Breakfast the following day was also also although the orange juice tasted off, I informed the person in charge and he quickly removed it. Maybe it鈥檚 best to try before putting it out. The highlight of my stay was on my way back from Kowloon just past midnight, I left my mobile phone in the taxi. I informed the person working and front desk and James (either security or F/O associate) assisted me. He even asked the security team to review the CCTV to check the licence plate but as it鈥檚 was raining they could not see the number.He even called me phone number hoping to see if the driver or someone will pick up the call., but no one did. After an hour I called my mobile phone and the driver of the taxi answered and was kind enough to drive back to the hotel and return it back to me. I told James and he assisted to call the driver again and spoke to the. The driver came back with me phone andJames was there to help out as well. Great to see such helpful associatesThank you James...

An amazing stay! Mr.Andy checked us in, he was professional and friendly. The room itself was very nice, high floor with an awesome view of Hong Kong. A must visit the health center, inside the locker room have Sauna, feel so relax. The staff in the health center was very nice too. Overall, an amazing stay definitely will be back!

The location is kinda meh to everywhere else but I stayed there in April for a wedding reception held at the hotel so I actually didn't leave the hotel until checkout. That was when I realized how inaccessible it was.This is a big hotel for Hong Kong standards. I splurged out for the Club lounge access executive room. The room was spacious and comfy and had a amazing view. The bed and linen were comfy. The Club lounge (not to be confused with the rooftop lounge) was nicely decorated and have amazing views. The selection of canapes and drinks selection was a little limited. The gym was well equipped and quiet. Perfect for a morning workout.The checking in process was efficient and quick. The Club lounge and rooftop lounge staff are so friendly and cheerful and looked after us very well. However, I felt that the hotel restaurant could do a lot better in terms of quality of food. The food was in one word - bad. The staff at the restaurant also appeared to be less experienced and didn't seem to know what they were doing. The restaurant looked chaotic in the morning during breakfast service. There was not much options around the hotel so we ended up having more meals there than we would have liked to.

We stayed at this Courtyard Marriott for five days in June. At check-in, we waited for quite a while and when I realized that the line didn't seem to be moving, I stopped one of the staff and asked whether there was a priority check-in for Gold Elite members. We were later directed to the Executive Lounge where we were checked in quite efficiently. As a Gold Elite member, we were upgraded to a room on the executive floor with a nice view of the Shing Mun River. We also enjoyed the complimentary breakfast as well as the afternoon drinks and snacks (served at the Executive Lounge). There were much wider breakfast selections at the MoMo Cafe though. Even though the hotel is located in Shatin, we were able to get to Tsim Sha Tsui in about 25 - 30 minutes by taking the complimentary hotel shuttle (which stopped at the New World Plaza and Elements where the Kowloon Station for the airport MTR line is located). The hotel is also within walking distance to the Shek Mun MTR station.

The hotel is quite new and the lobby seems a class higher than courtyard. The room on the high floor has an excellent view of the river, not something you get to see often in Hong Kong. The hotel is out of the way, hard to arrive without a taxi and hard to find food.

Kindly read my review from last year for full details.This year, the breakfast got better with more variety, including smoked salmon.I stayed in a room facing the river this time. Excellent view. Traffic noise from the road below does trickle into the room, but not much.The only strange observation was that the concierge asked for $HK5/- fee to bring our luggage down from the room at check our. I've never heard of this before anywhere. The concierge manager confirmed that this is a normal procedure. Anyway! We got our luggage down ourselves as we had nothing better to do.

We recently stayed for 4 nights. Overall this is a great property with good hardware and the service was friendly! It's much better than N. America Courtyard hotels. LOCATION: Sha tin is a bit far from the traditional tourist places. However, the hotel provides a convenient shuttle service to Tsim Sha Tsui (to and from), and the ride takes only 35 minutes or so. A bus schedule is also provided for the main tourist sites. Public transportation is clean, cheap, and super easy to navigate.ACCESS FROM/TO AIRPORT: take bus A41P from Arrival. HKD 27.7 (USD 3.5). Get off at the 3rd stop: Ravana Garden. The hotel is directly across the street. Super easy.Stops are announced in English and Chinese.ROOM: good size for Hong Kong. Excellent open view. Modern and new. Bed very comfortable. A/C works well (important as Hong Kong is hot and humid). Wifi fast.RESTAURANT: breakfast spread has extensive Western and Chinese food items. Restaurant usually busy in the morning.EXECUTIVE LOUNGE: crowded in the evenings. Evening snacks include hot food, enough for a dinner substitute. Has excellent view of the city.NEARBY: has a super market (Wellcome) and a Manning (similar to Walgreen's) on the ground floor. A Circle-K (similar to 7-11) across the street. Has ATM by the entrance. No restaurant nearby except for a McDonald's but the free hotel shuttle can send you to a nearby mall which is super big with tons of restaurants.SERVICE: warm and friendly.Overall this is a great property and an excellent value especially if you are Marriott Gold or Platinum. I have two suggestions:1) Check in & out were very slow. Each transaction took 5-10 minutes! We stood in line for 30+ minutes each time.2) It's obvious to me that non-guests took advantage of the free shuttle! On return trips from the mall, many ladies with big suitcases got on. They are professional "buyers" for mainland customers and fill empty suitcases with purchases at the mall. They are not staying at the hotel and simply get off at the hotel and move on.

This hotel had amazing service! The staff were very helpful and polite too. The hotel was clean and was pretty much like all other Marriott hotels I stayed in. It is further from the city, so it's nice and quiet.

As a Gold, I got a good upgraded room and access to the lounge. Both were fine. I used the A14 bus direct to and from the airport and the free shuttle to Tsim Sha Tsui. The staff were helpful, the food good and I鈥檇 stay again.

Located at Sha tin area, nearby hotel has a few convenient shops, walking 6-8 mins to Shek Mun MTR station and can find food stalls/shops. Hotel also provides free shuttles to 3 MTR stations at certain timings. Overall hotel is very new, room is well equipped with amentities, very clean, very comfortable and good services. The only down point is cant find restaurants nearby to hotel especially breakfast.

Being a Marriott gold member, I can guarantee Marriott Courtyard is the best bargain in the city and truly worths the money.The hotel staff are very helpful and very friendly, especially Christy, Yvette, Tracy, etc. They are always cheerful with smiles, and exceedingly courteous. Christy has always given me valuable advices on the trip and her service is excellent which is for sure above most 5-star hotels. All staff in the executive lounge has shown incredible genuine eagerness to help and to serve, and we believe every one in the trip will love this hotel definitely.***The room was modern, clean and quite spacious for HK hotel rooms. We had a nice harbour view, and a spacious bathroom. We loved the marble finishing in the bathroom and the luxurious walk-in shower. The bed was among the most comfortable I've ever slept on. The same hotel in Central District would cost you double or triple! Marriot Courtyard absolutely worths the money.***The location is excellent, cabs right at the door. You can take advantage of the free shuttle to the Kowloon Station Airport Express station by which you have no worries on delay to the Airport. Walking to nearest MTR station takes only 10 mins and Central is only within half an hour once you get on the subway.

Overall: 4.3/5Value: 5/5, weighted 30%Location: 3/5, weighted 30%Service: 5/5, weighted 30%Design: 4/5, weighted 10%For similar hotels in this class, the hotel is very good value, particularly in Hong Kong. The rooms are large and quite comfortable.The hotel is located in Sha Tin which is fine if you are visiting the Chinese University of Hong Kong but it is quite a distance to Hong Kong (60 mins).The hotel staff are very friendly and clearly well trained. I received a complimentary upgrade (status related) which I appreciated. I also received a welcome gift which was unexpected but a nice touch.The room amenities are standard and functional. I was pleasantly surprised to see bathrobes provided which is typically not the case for a Courtyard hotel. It was a little odd to find bathrobes but not slippers provided in the room. Perhaps it was an oversight.Elite members receive complimentary access to lounge (which was quite large and comfortable) and complimentary breakfast.

This property is ideal for people who intend to work in and around Sha Tin area. As Sha Tin is far away from the city center, make sure when you select this property, you only stay here for work in the places near by. Property is great and staff is hospitable. Service is good. Only thing disappointing here is they don't offer breakfast by default, so negotiate better when yo book.Kudos to CbM team.

We booked a 5-night stay at JustInn from February 7-12.The owner, Samuel, was very accomodating and even allowed us to checkin 2 hours early!The location is perfect! Very near Tsim Sha Tsui MTR Station, 7-11, and a lot of dining choices along the street. There's also a nearby international supermarket. And for Filipinos like us, Jollibee is very nearby as well! :)The room is what we expected, based on the photos we've seem online, so no surprise there. Despite the small space, we slept comfortably. Shower is a bit tiny, but it'll do. Plus, free instant coffee and warm/cold water in the common area.If you will just use the room to sleep in and shower, this is the perfect location for you. Will definitely book here again when we come back!

My wife and me just visited HK and stayed at Innspirit. Nice location near MTR, Bus stop to Airport (A21), I square mall, nice restaurants, and minimarket. The room was clean and neat. Good connection wifi. The host, Sam, was very friendly and informative.....excellent service......see you TRIFENA&GERISCAIndonesia

This is NOT my first time stopping at this wonderful guesthouse and certainly won鈥檛 be my last. This is without a doubt a great find and I have stopped here with both friends and family on numerous occasions.The location is 10/10, 5 minutes from Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station, Kowloon Park and Nathan Road, in a street packed full of some of the best restaurants in Kowloon. You are spoilt for choice with retail here also (Marks and Spencer is across the road.) If you are thinking of getting jewellery made, Hong Kong is the place, and there are 2 top jewellers within a block of Inn Spirit. (Allow as much time as possible for manufacturing )At the airport purchase an Octopus Card immediately for public transport at the Service desk (THIS IS A MUST) If you鈥檙e over 65 years of age purchase a Seniors Octopus card. Load the card with a few hundred $ HK . (Money on the card is fully refundable at the end of your visit.)From the airport to the guesthouse it鈥檚 less than an hour, and is an easy, stress free commute. Take the Airport Express train from the airport and get off at Kowloon Station. Take the FREE K2 bus (leaves every 12 minutes) to the third stop at the rear of the Peninsula Hotel. Walk up Nathan Road for 5 minutes to Peking Road (on the left) and turn left here. The first street on the right is Lock Road.The guesthouse is on the left-hand side of the street. Keep walking until you see the yellow FIRE PLUG on the footpath. This is the entrance, too easy!! Take the lift to the 6th floor.You鈥檒l be welcomed on arrival by the delightful owners Samuel and Fanny. Nothing is too much trouble to explain or sort for this dynamic couple. It鈥檚 like staying with family, they make you feel so very comfortable.The guesthouse has 8 rooms of different sizes from singles to doubles to family, and is on the top floor of an apartment block with retail at ground level. Its secure, modern, spotlessly clean and a good night鈥檚 sleep is guaranteed on their uber comfortably firm mattresses. Their bathroom provides the best hot shower after a full day of sightseeing. There鈥檚 crisp white linen, clean towels daily, shampoo, liquid soap, hairdryer, air con and a TV (with English station.) You鈥檝e access to a communal hot/cold water fountain with complimentary tea and coffee facilities and any plates or cutlery you require. The rooms aren鈥檛 big but that鈥檚 Hong Kong (even in 5 star.) If you are after an affordable place to stay in the best location this is it. If you want a bigger room, go 5 star at $900 AUD a night where you鈥檒l get another few feet. The choice is yours. If you are budget conscious and want to enjoy the finer things Hong Kong has to offer like High Tea at the Peninsula, or a beverage or two at Ozone Bar (above Kowloon station in the Park Hyatt Hotel, commute there on the K2 free bus) save your $ and stay here.The China Ferry Terminal (to Macau) is a 10-minute walk from Lock Road at the end of Kowloon Park and if you are cruising from Ocean Terminal it鈥檚 only a short distance on foot also from this address.Don鈥檛 miss the Cheung Hing Kee- Shanghai pan fried pork bun restaurant (opposite) for their fabulous Michelin starred take away buns in 4 packs. (The truffle buns are to die for!!!! and don鈥檛 underestimate how many you can eat,) or the great restaurants on the ground level under the guesthouse with their mouth-watering Portuguese tarts.Inn Spirit ticks all the boxes for us and you won鈥檛 find cheaper or better accommodation anywhere in Hong Kong for the price you鈥檒l pay here. I can鈥檛 speak highly enough of the place, and its fabulously central location. Hong Kong is a great destination for a week鈥檚 vacation and has too much to offer the tourist.Do yourself a favour, look no further鈥︹€?. this is it. I have never had any concerns with anything at this property. It鈥檚 a great place, just think SMALL and use your room to sleep in not entertain in.

Room was clean and very modern with good facilities. Very reasonably priced compared to other properties and the staff were friendly with good information for finding the place (it is tricky to find the entrance). Location was great and ideal for kowloon and close to ferry to get across to island. The only downside is the rooms are "Hong kong sized" i.e. tiny. No problem for me as a solo traveler intending on spending little time in my room but not if you are intending on spending a lot of time in your room and couples will find they will need to juggle the luggage around as there isnt space for more the one suitcase open on the floor. Overall though recommended and probably the best you will get for this budget.

Pleasant small but ensuite shower & WC Guest room right in the centre of TST - well situated for transportation, restaurants etc etc. Very helpful owner runs a small efficient, friendly operation - good light view from my room with little noise despite location.

The location is great. MTR around is the corner, Star Ferry is within walking distance. There are loads or restaurants in the area. Our hosts Samuel and Fannie were wonderful.The room was really tight but clean and pretty quiet. My husband and I were walking on each other because the room was about the size of my walk-in closet, but let's face it, we weren't there to hang out in the room!

As other reviewers have said, the location could not be better, close to MTR and restaurants. And the fact that Kowloon Park is around the corner is a huge bonus. Get yourself some egg tarts from the Macau Restaurant just up from InnSpirit and have your breakfast in the park, watching the gorgeous flamingoes.We stayed for seven nights. Samuel and Fannie are wonderful hosts. The room was spotless and quiet at night. Highly recommended!

We stayed here for 5 nights and would definitely recommend Inn Spirit as a great place to base yourself for a similar stay.The location is perfect. You're right in the heart of things in Tsim Sha Tsui so there's every kind of restaurant and shopping on your doorstep. The waterfront and Star Ferry are a 5 minute walk away. MTR station is a 1 minute walk so you can get to anywhere you want in HK very quickly.The hosts, Samuel & Fannie, were very warm and welcoming. They provided us with lots of information on things to do and helped us with everything that we needed.The rooms, like the majority of budget to mid-range accommodation in HK, are small; however they are well designed to utilise the space (drawer under the bed etc.) and extremely clean. Bed was very comfortable and pillows were excellent. Free WiFi and drinking water, tea/coffee is a great help.

Near MTR, park, mosque & numerous other facilities. But its superb location is not what sets it apart (coz there are thousands others within the same vicinity).The host was informative & welcoming. Room was clean & functional. Inn was equipped with continuous supply of tea / coffee and cold / hot water.However the general rule of B&B/inn rooms in Hong Kong applies. Definitely not for claustrophobics!

The moment my kids entered the room, they said it was so cute and neat. The place is very near everything, MTR, restaurants, money changer, shopping area, 24/7 score. Mr Sam was very helpful that I don't need to have a tour guide anymore. He gave me specific instructions on where to go. I will definitely come back.

I'd choose this place again definitely!This place is located at the central part of the city and right next to metro. With many restaurants nearby and just walking distance to ferry terminal. The room is small but very clean. The host , Samuel is extremely nice and helpful. He gave me booking information with transportation advice, so that I can easily found the location of the guesthouse. I was travel alone and felt safety staying here.

Well it is what it is. You pay for what you get. Rooms are very small but they are clean and tidy which is what matters most for me. The manager - Samuel, was extremely helpful in helping us find our footing in Hong Kong and recommending us to local amenities all around the inn.

Just next to TST MTR station,location is really great, The hosts are very friendly and helpful. Samuel took care of the guest house by himself and I felt so safety.Room is clean and tidy. All basic facilities are provided.

Amazing and Fantastic Stay! Room is extremely clean. No dust or dirt. Although the Triple Room appears small, it is sufficient for 3 persons. The host Samuel is very helpful. Location is excellent. Surrounded by many eateries. Just 100 m to the MTR.

I stayed for 5D4N at Inn Spirit.The hosts are friendly and helpful :)It is located at a strategic location near Tsim Sha Tsui MTR, approx a short 2 minutes walk.Facilities are great, there is air con, and necessities like hair dryer, shampoo and soap, bath towel etc. are provided too.Definitely recommend Inn Spirit to anyone who wants to find a good, affordable stay in Hong Kong!

Stayed for 3 nights:Pros: 1. Clean2. Access to good food- Mak's wanton mee, macau caf茅, etc.3. Helpful owners4. 2-3mins away for TST MTR5. Room is small but sufficient for sleeping, bathing. No luxury of space to walk around so most of the time will be spent sitting or lying on the bed. Cons:Pillow was really flat.... asked for another but because they are rather used, 2 was still insufficient. Hope the owners will consider refreshing their pillows.

Perfect location close to everything you need in Hongkong. The subway station Tsim Sha Tsui is only a 2 minute walk away. The host, Samuel, is really friendly and helpful. The accommodation is easy to find and very clean.

Me & My husband just visited Hong Kong on 24-31January 2017 and stayed in Inn Spirit.We really love this place so much! Small room but thats okay! He already told us about the size room and he sent us picture of the place, so we can easily find the place. The location was great, strategic position in Tsim Sha Tshui. Very near to MTR Station (inside the ISquare mall).The most important, there're many restaurant nearby This guesthouse was very clean.After we got back, we always find the room very clean everyday, as well as new clean towels. 鉂reat wifi connection too.Mr. Samuel was very kind and helpful quick response

This is a great guesthouse, so centrally located and with pretty much everything you could want on the doorstep. Very well connected with transport, and the road it is on has great selections for food. If you have any questions about anything Hong Kong related, ask Samuel - absolute fount of knowledge and very friendly. The rooms are clean and tidy and a fair size for being this centrally located in Hong Kong and in this price range. You won't regret staying here.

In spite of the small sized room for 2 people, it fits the budget and we saved further transportation costs being located in the center of tourists' areas! Commute to and from airport was convenient as well. Room was perfectly clean and basic amenities were all there! Service staff are friendly and helpful.

Excellent hotel! Nice and clean all the time.... perfect location...next to shopping center, MTR, ferry, restaurants and everything... I really recommend this place! Samuel and Fannie were lovely and helpful....Could not be better

We stayed here for 4 nights and really appreciated the central location. Our budget did not allow for a fancy hotel, but this served our needs well. Samuel, the owner, was very helpful and communicative throughout our stay and The room is pretty small, understandably so in Hong Kong but some additional storage off the floor would have been appreciated. Even some simple open shelves would work great (thinking of the IKEA Grundtal). The same in the bathroom, so that guest could hang their toiletries up out of the way. There is a Mak's Noodles a few doors down and another cafe that served delicious Pineapple Buns too!

Great location, Middle of shopping area, close to MTR and Ferry, delicious food is all around. Room is very clean, Very nice Staff. I would definitely stay here again! when i visit hong kong in future.

I have three criteria when I am looking for a hotel room: cleanliness, affordability and in a good location. Usually I have to sacrifice one for the other, but Inn Spirit fulfilled all three criteria!! It's located near the subway and all of the great shopping Hong Kong has to offer. It's extremely neat and clean (even my mother remarked upon its cleanliness - and she has a high standard!!). And it's extremely affordable for Hong Kong. Rooms are small but that's Hong Kong for you. To top it all off, Samuel is a blessing in the hospitality world - he gave us precise directions beforehand, gave some travel advice, looked after our luggage when we checked out -- and even dried off my umbrella when it got soaked from the rain. I would definitely recommend this place for others!

This is a guesthouse-type of accommodation in HK so basically if you are looking into a decent place to relax and sleep after a tiring activities in the city, but without shelling out too much on room rates, this one is recommendable for the following reasons:Location: Very strategic location. It is situated in Tsim Tsa Tsui area where lots and lots of shopping complexes, shops/bazarres, and affordable restos can be found. You will reach the nearest MRT stn (via I-Square Mall) in just a minute and the Victoria Harbour for about 15 mins by foot.Room: Like most of the typical guesthouses and inns in HK, room is very small and compact that might be of discomfort if you are carrying even a single medium-sized luggage with you.. but there is a wide window, though, that helps remove that kind of claustrophobic feeling. Despite of the tight space, a separate shower and bath is inside equip with daily replacement of fresh towels, big bottles of shower gel and shampoo, and hot-and-cold shower with strong water pressure. A/C is good, no issue with it.. and the wifi, it has a strong and very good signal even inside the room. In fact I found the wifi speed here much faster than the one I had in SG the last time. And one more thing, the room is being housekept daily even if you do not request for it (which is not true for some of the guesthouses around).And its most strong point, for me, is its so helpful and accommodating owner, Mr. Samuel. From the point of booking up to the last day of your stays, he'll always give his very best to assist and help you in any ways to make your stays hassle-free as much as possible. You can approach him anytime.. be it some concerns or some suggestions on how to make the most of your stays in the city.So there.. once your turn comes to visit HK, I recommend to give this place a try.

It's a nice little hotel and we were welcomed friendly. It's situated very central in Tsim Sha Tsui and you can reach Victoria Harbour in 5-10 minutes by feet. The room was very small, but clean and cozy and there was a window, which is not the case in many of the cheaper hotels in Hongkong. The shower in the bathroom was right above the sink, so you could basically shower and brush your teeth at the same time :-) Outside the room was a free water dispenser. All in all we were happy with the hotel, and if there had been breakfast included, it'd have been worth the price (we payed 75鈧?for two), but without breakfast I found it still a bit too expensive.

In the heart of kowloon,,affordable, very clean, helpfull owner, room is small but its make sense in hongkong. Location hard to find at first, its behind mall Times square, next to kowloon park. Walking distance to Public ferry, and Observation deck.

Sam made our stay in his guesthouse so very welcome and he is always ready to assist with a smile. The guesthouse is super clean. Okay it is not the Peninsula Hotel HK however, everything was more than adequate for us. Be mindful that the rooms are small but again this is Hong Kong. You can freeload tea, coffee and filtered water 24/7 and a communal fridge is provided in the reception area. The guesthouse is very centrally located and is easy access to public transport ie Star Ferry (15 mins), subway-MTR Tsim Sha Tsui (3mins), bus A21 (2mins) direct to airport (HK$33) are all within walking distance. There is abundant eateries along Lock Rd and you will be spoilt for choice.

This place is a real gem. The location is perfect, best price you can find in the heart of Kowloon, the rooms are impeccably clean and the hosts are friendly and helpful. I would stay here every time!

What a fab place to stay! Such a convenient location - so easy to get around, close to Star Ferry, Nathan Road, Canton Road, etc. Very easy to get to from airport.Samuel and his wife Fannie are so welcoming, friendly and helpful. Our room was spotlessly clean. Fresh towels each day, the amenities were all there - aircon, fan, free wifi, TV, coffee/tea making facilities, drinking water,Felt very safe there, Room was very secure.Would definitely stay there next time we visit Hong Kong and would thoroughly recommend.

My 4 night stay at InnSpirit was fantastic. The airport express was an easy transfer from the airport (25 minutes to Kowloon station, then 15 minutes on the K2 hotel shuttle bus), and Samuel and Fanny stayed late for me to check in after a late flight. The room was small (Samuel did warn me in advance!), but very conveniently set up with drawers under the bed to store my things out of the way 鈥?the perfect size for a solo traveler. It was cozy, exceptionally clean, and a nice quiet place to relax after a long day exploring.I was initially unsure whether to stay on HK island or Kowloon, but I definitely spent most of my time in Kowloon. The inn is fantastically located a 2 minute walk from the Tsim Sha Tsui station, directly across the street from iSquare mall (with a great grocery store in the basement), and a short walk to the Star Ferry. Less than 10 minutes to HK island by any method of transport!The street has a number of wonderful restaurants in walking distance 鈥?breakfast at the Macau restaurant on the 2nd floor was okay (crispy buns with butter and condensed milk!), but I loved the Shanghai pan fried bun stand across the street, Din Tai Fung (Michelin star dim sum) has a location at Silvercord mall on Canton Rd, and Sing Lum Khui noodles next door had the best (and spiciest) noodle soup I had in Asia! Would recommend in a heartbeat, and look forward to returning in the future. Thank you Samuel and Fanny!

we enjoyed so much staying inn spirit!the room is spot on (clean and quite), floor is so clean you even can not find a hair on itthe best thing is the customer service from owners. they are so nice and willing to share everything they know in HK.other services include free tea and coffee and maps. you can use your credit card as well.the location is so convenient, from where you stay you can go to hundreds of local restaurants and one of the biggest shopping mall in HK (only one thing needs to be aware, don't go to the restaurant on second floor, they are so rude!)we believe staying in inn spirit is the only right decision we made about Hong Kong trip and if we go there again, this is the only place i want to stay!

There is a reason Inn Spirit is so highly rated - the hosts, Samuel and Fannie, are exceptional and have clearly thought through every detail of their accommodation and service to provide a great experience for their guests. They are welcoming, thoughtful and supportive - yet professional and unobtrusive. Our room was small but the space is fully optimized. We had a spotlessly clean family room with comfortable single and double beds, a wall-mounted flat screen TV, a well equipped bathroom, air con and fan, with windows - very tastefully decorated. A shared fridge, hot and cold water, tea and coffee, dishes and microwave are available, and umbrellas were provided for our use. The location is right in Tsim Sha Tsui, so walking distance to Victoria Harbour and the Star Ferry and right beside the MTR station, shopping and restaurants, yet surprisingly quiet. We highly recommend the Inn Spirit for the best budget stay in central Hong Kong!

The location is amazing. 2 minutes walk from the main Tsim Sha Tsui station, which is just a couple of stops to Central, Mongkok, Causeway Bay, etc. The street where the inn is located has loads of food - Macau, local, Shanghainese, etc. 7-11 is just a few doors away.The staff was really helpful - giving us free maps and food recommendations. And the pre-arrival email from Sam is top notch. We found Inn Spirit easily due to his help.The rooms are clean and comfortable. They even upgraded us to a slightly bigger room for free!We were really, really happy with our stay here and will come back again..

The Inn Spirit hostel/guesthouse has a perfect location in Tsim Sha Tsui. Just a short walk away from Victoria Harbour, the Star Ferry, Harbour City and several other great locations. We were welcomed and serviced in a supreme way. It was all very friendly, professional and thorough. Five-star service.The rooms were clean, and had good space, bearing in mind it's in central HK. Could definately recommend this place!

Nice hotel with a perfect location to explore the city. The next metro station is not even 5 min. away. Tiny and a bit noisy (well, its HK) but very clean rooms. Unfortunately, there were heavy construction works right above our room, but that should be temporarly. Very friendly staff though!! Anyway, good value for money and a good choice for sure..

I stayed here in June for 4 nights. I had never been to HK before so when I arrived, I was a little nervous about how I was going to get there. But I followed the directions that they gave me. Take the Airport express to Kowloon Station and then take the free bus from there to the Holiday Inn (first stop) and then Locke Street is right across the street near ISquare shopping center. So easy. The location of this hotel was amazing. So close to everything that I wanted, right near the metro, star ferry, shopping, restaurants etc. The room was clean but small but I didn't mind because I was always out and about. The owner was very nice and helpful.I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here when I return to Kowloon.

- The location is extremely convenient, very close to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station, Harbour City, and Ferry Harbour. - The room is very clean. - The host is very kind. She waited for us to check in until 11.30 pm. When we left the inn, it was raining heavily and she gave us an umbrella.

Yes it's small and cramped. But I look at it as being cosy. The location is great, price is great and the owners are really friendly and helpful. Don't be afraid to ask for their advise on things to do, they're very knowledgable and have incredible English

Stayed for 5 nights this April. Fantastic location and Samuel and his wife were incredibly kind and helpful. While the rooms were extremely small (just enough room for bed and one suitcase - we had two and it was very cramped), I'd stay again due to its overall convenience and service.

We loved our stay here. It is good value, convenient, clean and well-appointed. Though only 9 square meters, the space was used well and we had windows that opened for fresh air. Lock Road has a range of great places for breakfast, we never ate at the same place twice, and there is a shopping mall on the corner with more dining options.

Excellent location and a host that was absolutely amazing. The rooms were very clean, filtered water was provided, and shared refrigerator. The host Samuel seemed to always be there at the front desk ready to help (I swear the man never slept 鈥?he was always there to assist travelers). He was full of tips of where to go, how to get there, etc. He helped with everything from transportation to the airport, to where to buy a coat (we visited during an unexpected cold spell). The rooms are small (the bed touched 3 walls), but very cozy. I鈥檓 183 cm and I fit in fine, but much taller and you might not be able to stretch out in the bed. The bathroom was a combined shower, toilet, sink glass box 鈥?very efficient use of space. You have your own hot water heater, so showers are always comfortable. The location was amazingly central with lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. You are super close to the metro (get an octopus card). The Tsim Sha Tsui stop is across the street 鈥?from there, it is a quick train ride to anywhere (airport, HK island, big Buddha, etc.). I would strongly recommend the Spirit Inn to my friends

Service is the make or break factor for accommodations. Inn Spirit with Samuel and Fanny made this hole in the wall superb. The couple is very hands on and made their guests feel as if they are valued visitors in their own home. Case in point, after checking out, we came across Fanny outside the inn. She recognized us immediately and wished us well in our trip. Great location, immaculate rooms, and safe surrounding area. Samuel and Fanny, more power to you guys. We'll definitely be back to Inn Spirit the next time that we'll be in Hong Kong.

Lovely couple host, place is tidy and everything is provided, drinking water, hair dryer, coffee, tea, fridge. Samuel (The host) will be glad to help you with your itinerary in HK & Macau. During our time of visit, it was raining and they provided us with umbrella's! Thanks Samuel, hope to visit you & your wife soon again :)

Inn Spirit (Samuel and his Wife) really made everything so easy breezy for my trip to Hong Kong. Good communication from the outset. Rooms are extremely clean and modern. Great location next to metro and the Irish Pub Delaneys. Will be staying here again next time I'm in Hong Kong.

Our primary goal for our first 3 days in HK was to explore the city, eat, and EAT! We know we were going to spend a lot of time out so we didn't really need to stay in a posh 5-star hotel. Inn Spirit was perfect for my family. A No-frills place, it has comfy beds and very clean t&b. The size of the family room was decent enough to accommodate my family of 4. My son had the single bed while my hubby, myself and our daughter had the queen bed. Multiple power cord with international plug adapters are provided. The entire place has 7 other rooms. I got to peek in one of the rooms and it was spacious as well.All guests have access to cold/hot drinking water, a microwave and a refrigerator. They also have available instant coffee and tea. Inn Spirit also has a good security system. The guests are given a security code to open the main door. A key card and a normal key for the guest room. There is a CCTV camera at the main door for added security. Samuel, the owner, was almost always there to receive & assist his guests. He is very friendly, helpful and polite. We really like the guy! Location-wise, it is perfect for TST area. It's a 5-min walk away from TST station Exit A1. 10min Walking distance from the East TST station. It's near the bus stop - we took the bus from the airport and got off at Middle Road Bus station (5min walk to inn spirit). It's also a 5min walk to DutyFree, Harbour City Mall. 10mins or less walk to Harbour Terminal to see the Symphony of Lights. There are also quite a number of food spots beside the building of the inn. There's a Hui Lai Shan just 12 steps away. Mak's 2 doors away. Try the Macau eggtart and the Fried dumpling (Michelin reco place). My family and I really had a pleasant stay at Inn Spirit. It was a home away from home. I highly recommend this place if you want to stay at TST/Jordan/YMT/Mongkok area.

We are very happy with the stay. The room n toilet is very clean and the location is very good too. the owner Samuel were alway there to help us and advise us. We felt that he is like a brother to us . Alway so caring and helpful.

I stayed here for 9 nights, and it was my first time travelling on my own, but the owners made me feel very comfortable when I arrived and helped me throughout my stay. When I was booking the room, they would respond within minutes and were very easy to communicate with. Even after I moved to another hotel, Samuel sent me an email telling me about some events that he suggested I should check out!The room itself was very clean and secure. Even though it was small, it was private and as the roof was fairly high, it didn't feel claustrophobic at all. Despite it being in such a busy area, the only noise was from other guests in nearby rooms. The location was fantastic, with the MTR station just across the road and the harbour and ferry terminal within a few minutes. It is also one street down from Nathan Road, and easy walking distance to the night markets. I would certainly stay here again.

A wonderful stay in Hong Kong. InnSpirit is perfectly located near ISquare in Kowloon within easy reach of the Harbour. Samuel and Fanny are excellent hosts, giving care and advice throughout our stay. The room was small but very clean with a hot shower. We had the use of a fridge and hot water for complimentary coffee. Highly recommended.

We spend two nights in this super clean hotel! The rooms are quite small but well organized and the hotel very well located. Samuel is always available to give you information about the city! We will come back!Sophie & Benoit from France and Singapore

Place is strategically located, just MRT rides away from the attractions... rooms, facilities & beddings are clean & as good as the photos & reviews....owners Samuel and Fanny are always responsive & helpful from my inquiries, even before my booking, up to our last minute of stay in their place. If we will go back to Hong Kong, will definitely stay there again.

It's small, it's tricky to find, and you won't get a view. But it's also central, clean, friendly and very well priced.Let's go through those in order: the rooms really are tiny (and the bathrooms more so). This is not a place to go back to relax in - it's a place for sleeping in and then going out for the day. Several people have posted photographs of the entrance; memorize these, as there's no sign. Once you've found it however, you won't have a problem finding it again - it's just the initial hunt! The inn itself is on the sixth floor, but there's a small lift that will take you up. The lift and corridors are on the dingy side, and you may wonder what you've let yourself in for - but don't worry, as once you're in it's a bright and clean oasis!I had a back room, which looked out over... an air conditioning unit. I had a quick peek in one of the rooms out front, which looked out on the street but would likely have had some street noise.And yet, and yet... it's location really can't be beaten, and certainly not at this price. You're really in the middle of everything in Kowloon, with a metro stop about 60 seconds away. Within minutes you'll be at the waterfront, with the Star ferries to Hong Kong Island.The two owners always seemed to be smiling, and on hand to offer information and advice. All in all, for 'independent' travellers, this is a great option.

Really enjoyed our time staying with Samuel and his wife, they were very gracious and welcoming people, they really made the trip for us and I wouldnt hesitate to recommend InnSpirit to anyone! The room itself is cozy without being cramped, good by Hong Kong standards, especially for the price. Spotlessly clean (cleaned daily) with great hot water in the shower, which is awesome! The location is perfect, right opposite iSquare Mall, close to the MTR (entrance at iSquare) and the ferries (a quick walk), groceries (7Eleven and Marks & Spencer food) and some great food (Mak's Noodles, Nabe One and Nanhai No.1 are some excellent places close-by). Samuel and his wife were very helpful in recommending what to check out nearby (or even far away, as getting anywhere in HK is pretty quick and simple with the MTR), when the best times are and how much is appropriate to pay. Stay here, you wont regret it!

The rooms and in-suite bathroom are VERY tiny, but this is Hong Kong and that was expected. It was very clean and the available refrigerators (down the hall) were appreciated. Best of all, the owners were so helpful - they not only had maps but were really good about showing us exactly how to get around. The location was great - close to good restaurants, museums, ferries, subway. Would stay again.Note: Be sure to clarify where the motel is located before arriving. The website tells you to take a picture of the sign as it's not in English. The sign itself was easy to find but when you get in the building, there is nothing to tell you which floor it is on. We asked and no one seemed to know of it, so we just stopped on all floors til we found it.

One subway stop to Causeway Bay, perfect location and convenient. Great value for the room size and hotel is environmental friendly offering filtered water to help reduce use of plastic bottles! Excellent front desk service, both check-in and check-out.

I liked this hotel well presented lobby and common areas, well orginised transportation from and to airport, clean room and bathroom, comfortable bed. Nice dining experience. Very friendly and helpful staff.

City Garden Hotel room 1406 had some mould on the walls and a slight damp smell. The shower was good although over bath, WiFi good you get drinking water from cooler beside the lifts so no bottles. Chris on reception was very helpful. Turn left on leaving the hotel walk uphill and keep the levi shop on your left you will find a tram stop at the top of the road. The hotel has plenty of restaurants and markets within walking distance.

The hotel is located at a convenient and accessible place. And there are many restaurants nearby. The environment is comfortable and quiet. But the service of the staff was a bit disappointing. At first, the staff arranged the corner room for us. But it was really dimmed with little smell that we asked to change another room. Yet, the staff sounded unwilling to help us. And we had to go back to the main lobby to exchange the key card. It was quite an unfriendly arrangement. The second room was much better, i.e. bright and clean. On the whole, it was still a comfortable stay, which was good value for money.

We chose the hotel because the room is spacious and the price is nice. Overall condition is nice, clean, and near MTR and bus station. Reaching the hotel is very easy since there is a free shuttle service.

We stayed at the new rooms. 2 beds. Apparently enough for us and 2 kids. Rooms are great n clean. We can fill up water at the water station on our floor. We stayed on the 25th floor and cannot hear traffic noise. All the staff are great. Very helpful n accommodating. They help us with the luggages when we went to macau. Location is great. Just a few steps from bus A11 that we took from the bus at the immigration coming from macau. Eateries are plentiful nearby, fu wah cafe, hong kong cafe, tim ho wan. Their own restaurants are great. We tried garden cafe. Prices are hotel restaurant price. Just a short walk from fortress hill mtr station n the ding2 tram stop. Overall it was a great experience. I was debating between staying at holiday inn in tst area and this hotel. But i am glad that we chose this hotel, suitable for our family. There is a playground in front of the hotel and the hotel has a swimming pool. There is a laundromat (with laundry machines) that we can pay using octopus card. Laundry detergent was being provided. Octopus card can be refilled at the nearby 7 eleven.

This is the second time( 5 nights) we have stayed at this hotel. Loved it last time and also this time. Well located with subway, busses and trams nearby.All staff very friendly. Nothing too much trouble.Would definitely recommend the City Garden Hotel.

Hotel was nice and in good location, near to MTR and also my office. Service was great and check in and check out were a breeze. Only gribe was that there was a strong cigarette smell on the blanket and pillows, probably due to previous guest smoking in the room.

City Garden Hotel in Hong Kong is an excellent place to stay.Very helpful stall and location is really good for getting around.Breakfast a real treat.Bedrooms are very well appointed and clean.Always met with a smile by staff.

I love staying at the City Garden Hotel. The price is reasonable for room and breakfast bundled together. I also enjoyed eating dinner and dim sum lunch at Yue restaurant on the first floor. The ten percent discount for hotel residents eating there is a bonus to the delicious food they serve there. The location is very convenient because it is within a five-minute walk to the nearest MTR (subway) station. I will definitely stay there again next time I go to Hong Kong.

The staff was great, location is a bit far from all the hustle and bustle of the other sights but it's only a 500 m walk from the station. The cleanliness and space of the room was wonderful. I am definitely coming back in the future.

Nice and quiet with many eateries nearby. Although the Fortress Hill MTR is not far away, still some walking after a tired day of sightseeing. All employees, even housekeeping, can speak English. I also apprecaite the full size mirrors in the room. Some hotels are so stingy that only one small mirror in the bathroom n a small one in the room!Cost only HK $ 60 for taxi from Hong Kong MTR station after taking the Express from the airport.A good experience every time.

Very nice hotel situated in a great location next to rail links. Bed was comfy, provided tea and coffee, room was clean and staff were helpful. Restaurants were near by so you won鈥檛 go hungry with lots of choice.

The service was great except the carpets under the bed were not cleaned properly. The staff were accommodating, the food was good. The hotel has a good location. Overall experience, not bad, but needs improvement.

Didn't realize that it was the exhibition season in Hongkong, a lot of guest are either checking in or out then, but they (front desk) were efficient and politely informed me that the rooms were not ready then but did there best to have one ready for us. They suggested that our group have lunch first and by then the rooms will be made available, which they did. Our stay was as expected since I've been staying in this hotel for the past couple of years. On check-out day, we encountered a medical problem and the front desk personnel was very accommodating in extending our stay, pointing us to a nearby medical facility, even extending assistance in securing an ambulance if necessary. Once our friend is well enough to travel, they extended further assistance by providing wheelchair and helped us in securing taxi for our airport transfer. To the staff, our heartfelt thanks!!!

The location of the hotel is perfect. The staff is friendly and professional. Always an excellent service. Bed and cushions are very good. Really nothing to complain about. Maybe the door of the minibar that creaked when opening/closing, but that didn't really bothered me.

This is our first stay in the hotel. We chose the hotel because of its location. We were very happy with our stay in the hotel: close proximity to the MTR, restaurants and shops, and the overall service provided by the hotel.

Very comfortable room, with nice details such as quality linen. Breakfast was quite good and fresh, and had a high variety of fresh fruit. Conveniently located at 10 to 15 minutes taxi ride from shopping areas.

Spent to nights. Good hotel n room spacious for Hong Kong. Room clean n neat. Staff friendly n helpful. Not a far walk to metro, area is lively with a good selection of eateries n bakeries. Well done on doing your bit for the enviroment. The hotel has water dispensers placed in the hallway instead of complimentary water bottles in the room. Also has airport shuttle to the Metro. Will definitely stay again.

The rating that Hong Kong now holds as one of THE most expensive cities in the world is well deserved, so when I came across this 3-star hotel, I decided to forget the usual Marriott choice and give this place a try since the reviews were generally favourable. It certainly must rate as one of the 'jewels' in Hong Kong with regards to value for money. Don't expect Marriott standards but for the money, the hotel is clean, well run and staffed by very helpful people. The rooms were well tended with daily towel changes and comfortable. The views are not great but this is Hong Kong where tower blocks of flats for the local residents abound. If you want a 'harbour view', expect to pay around 拢400-500 per night!! The buffet breakfast here offers excellent and plentiful choice although I found informal dining options lacking so took to local eateries for help in that direction. Absolutely happy to recommend this place.

Great location, 24mins from the airport and a 15min courtesy bus from the station. Walking distance 20mins from the stadium and 8mins from the MTR underground. We came back to watch the HK7s tournament and stayed for the same weekend. We paid the extra for a suite (two family rooms - one with bedroom other with sitting / dining room great to have a bathroom each. The lounge on the 25th floor was a great bonus, small but adequate buffet, replenished throughout the evening and plenty of alcohol til 9pm. Staff were lovely as usual, breakfast was plentiful and lots of choice. Bit of a bun fight from 9 til 10am with all of the other guests charging between the tables (not much room for elbows) Will stay here again, good value.

We chose this hotel as the pool is open all year, however we never used it in the end.Paid for room upgrade and room was lovely, very clean, comfy bed and great shower. All the staff we met were polite, friendly and helpful, especially Tom in the bar.This hotel is in a residential area, lots of local shops nearby. Lots of Chinese tourists use this hotel. There were events and gala dinners which meant the bar area wasn鈥檛 open to other guests which was disappointing on a couple of nights. No bars nearby to get a drink.MTR and tram are less than 5 minutes walk away. About 15 minutes into central on MTR.I would stay here again for price but if you鈥檙e looking for a Hong Kong city hotel it may not be for you. It鈥檚 very local!

Convenient stay, very good location for my work. Room is generally clean however there's smell of food all the times on the 8th floor. Water pressure for shower is good but bathtub needs maintenance or change, I couldn't use the bath because it's rusty and surface peel off. Lobby is quite busy all the time. There's free shuttle bus to airport express train station which is very convenient for airport transfer.

I haven't stayed in this hotel for almost three years, but it remains a place I like to return to. The rooms are very comfortable and well-appointed. The bed is excellent, the bathroom very good. If you are on the inside ring of rooms you have a view of a city garden; the outside ring of rooms has city views. The breakfast retains its wide variety of offerings (although, strangely, this time I could not find the chopsticks at breakfast). What it always has is my favourite custard-filled xiao long bao. The underground is only a block away. Staff are very courteous and professional.

The hotel has been renovated and the service is excellent. There is also a free shuttle bus service from Hong Kong Express Train station. The rooms are big. We stayed in the renovated room on the higher floor which is bright and stylish. It is also very quiet and comfortable.The location of the hotel is very near to all amenities and surrounded by restaurants and shops. The area is very safe and there are a few 24/7 shops nearby.They have a swimming pool and a good gym. The Chinese restaurant is excellent. There are 4 lifts so there is no waiting time.

This year I stayed at the Trump Hotel and was amazed at the service and hospitality, But hands down the City Garden Hotel did a better job in every category, That is an impossible feat, but the staff of City Garden Hotel did this! Amazing!

Only advice is that they need to refurbish the rooms at lower levels... The rooms are very spacious comparing the price. This hotel was a very convenient location as it was close to the MTR and transit, as well as having a taxi stand in front of the hotel. Across from the hotel there was a dry clean place which was very convenient for us as they would deliver it back to the hotel for us at the end of the day.

Excellent location. Close to MTR, bus and tram stations. Plenty of rerstaurents to choose in nearby areas. The hotel was obviously well-managed. From the moment you stepped into the lobby, you are welcomed with smiling and cheerful faces. Check-in was quick and efficient. Our room was immaculately clean. Would definitely come back again on our net visit to Hong Kong.

We took the Airport Express train to the station in HK city and from there we boarded a free connecting bus to the hotel. The driver was very friendly and helpful. As we had booked 6 rooms, the reception took some time to check us in. We asked for information to visit places of interest and the receptionist was very helpful. He even drew a map and wrote down all the stations and transport modes available. The Fortress Hill station was just a few minutes away and the jetty and main bus terminal are not too far away.The rooms were relatively big in a congested city as Hong Kong. The Wi-Fi speed was very fast too. Thank you to all the staff at the reception.

This was our first time in Hong Kong and we spent two nights here on our way back from Bali. It was a nice enough hotel. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is in a good location and the room was clean however the carpet was a bit worn and stained. The breakfast was quite good with lots of variety.

A very well run and maintained hotel. Not the newest hotel, but clean and well maintained and for that reason I highly recommend it. Staff are friendly. A good location with the MRT only a few minutes away and 7 Eleven just across the road for late night snacks. Some good restaurants nearby too and also A11 Airport Bus from King's Rd outside the MRT station.

this was my 4th time staying at city garden hotel. it is beginning to feel like home. i'm quite familiar with the neighbourhood. the staff at the hotel are always helpful. the rooms are spacious, the amenities are nice. service is prompt. it's very close to the MTR, which is really nice. i've enjoyed my stay at city garden hotel very much.

My family and I stayed at this hotel for a total of 12 nights. Throughout our stay, we received amazing service and sublime comfort. The room we stayed in on the 2nd floor was newly renovated and spacious, even able to fit 3 people comfortably which is rare in a city famous for compacted living. Large windows made the room look bright and cosy. Clean and new, the room is definitely top notch and quiet despite facing the road and on the second floor. Just note that there wasn鈥檛 a heater in the room so it may get a little chilly at night but other than that, good room.  However, the staff is what made this place amazing. Firstly, was our 2nd floor house keeper, Anna, who took care of us during our stay. She is detailed and flexible, always providing multiple timings for her turn down services to best suit my family's erratic movements in and out of the hotel. She constantly greets us with a smile. Great impression on housekeeping and the level of cleanliness they provide. Secondly, were the staffs at the reception. Unfortunately, on one of the days, a family member left his phone on a taxi close to midnight on his way back. Upon contacting the reception for help, the manager provided help and support to get the taxi information. In the end, we managed to get the phone back. It took a few days but throughout the time, the manager followed up daily on the incident and made us feel confident in apprehending our phone back. Overall, great stay and appreciated all the efforts.

The hotel is a bit old but overall is good and value for money. Good location, many restaurants near by, 7-11 at hotel entrance, convenience for transportation, shopping, etc. Will come back when travelling to Hong Kong

It is clean hotel good rooms quite big, very good value of money.. a bit far away from the main places in HK.. you need totake the MTR to anywhere.. no close Bus station from/to mainland China.. The Crew is very welcoming and helpful.. I asked for additional 1 hour for Checkout and got it with no issue..

Well placed and centrally located with close to most amenities and excellent transport systemThe rooms were well appointed with cleaned bedding, bathroom were well maintained, the entire experience could not be faulted.

Strategically located with easy access to MTR and food outlets. Quiet and exceptional clean and the staff are very friendly, helpful and courteous. The LED TV is equipped with wide variety channels to choose from and you can watch the movies from the comfort of the bed. The lift service is excellent without have to wait too long for the next lift.

The hotel staff are very helpful and friendly. Definitely worth the extra for use of the club room. location is ideal for the MTR for getting around to sightseeing. Could have just made an extra effort as it was my birthday. Will definitely return.

great location if u have business or reason for being in northpoint area of hong kong island. i stayed there last year & they were still giving compli bottled water per day per room. just last weekend, i stayed there again, and was pleasantly surprised that they've installed a water dispenser in the hallway and a glass pitcher in the room. so not only can guests get unlimited water, but it helps the envirenment in its own little way by not using plastic bottles anymore. good job on that!

Stay in the newly refurbished room. Cleaner, brighter, modern, comfortable but slightly smaller. Use to have a good sized desk that is good for work but with a smaller size room, that is not available. The hotel is well located and overall still very affordable for the price we paid. The bonus add-on it the portable handphone device for quick internet access and checking on stuff.

Convenient, with MTR nearby and lots of public transportation within reach.Helpful and courteous staff always ready to help. Lots of good eateries to choose from. Cleanliness of hotel. Value for money.

We were staying at City Garden Hotel for 7 nights, Oct 27 to Nov 3, 2018. When I was unpacking on my first night, I got bitten by unknown bugs in Room 2113. We went downstairs to tell the lobby personnel, she acted arrogant. The manager, Albert Au, came out and offered us to change to Room 2009. It is not that we are greedy and want compensation. But, imagine you got 6 bites in a hotel room on your birthday, Albert didn`t offer us a meal or buffet. Yes, they changed the room. But, they won`t go the extra miles to correct the wrong and make the customers happy. Once in a lifetime, will never come back to this hotel.

I've stayed several times and always been impressed. The rooms are clean and well equipped and perhaps I was lucky but no noise at all from any adjoining rooms. The lobby staff are friendly and I found them to be very efficient.It's in a good location for Fortress Hill MTR and plenty of coffee bars,shops etc close at hand.A pleasant walk through Victoria Park to Causeway Bay shopping centre.Will stay again on my next Hong Kong visit.

This hotel, if you're in the old rooms, is not good at all. We upgrded to the top floors with renovated rooms and felt comfortable afterwards. There is not lounge, very boring area currently. We did not try the restaurants. Service however was very good and attentative.The pool and gym were in a very bad shape and were boring. Nothing to recommend

- Good and nice staff. Can be little more helful.- The location is good. Near to a subway station (250m)- Reasonable size of the room- Clean but not top notch room and bathroom- Priceworth room- Environment thinking hotel.

Very nice hotel, although not very new. Staff is vrry nice, the pool is nice , especially the super warm bath in January. Breakfasts ate exceptional. The only big downfall is the matress in the room. It is absolurely terrible.

We always book our accommodation at City Garden every time we go to Hong Kong because our relatives live in the same neighborhood. Nevertheless, the hotel still meets expectations鈥?simple, clean, good location (5 min walk to MTR) and every room has a Handy phone which you can use as a wifi hotspot. Only downside during this booking was that the rates were expensive because we stayed during peak holiday season (New Year鈥檚)

Stayed two nights in their newly renovated City Room as an upgrade during a recent visit to HK. The decor is relaxing and the bed very comfortable. A gigantic flat panel TV adorns one of the walls. The efforts of going "green" and the reduction of use of plastic containers mean that a carafe is provided for obtaining water from a dispenser in the lift lobby on each floor and a pair of metal insulated mugs are provided. The updated bathrooms have a nice shower but no tub (this serves me just fine but may annoy others who prefer a relaxing soak after a long day out as a tourist); in addition, these City Rooms do not have work desk like the older rooms and there are no doors to the closet space (these are some of the reasons for a 4 instead of 5 stars rating). On the other hand the wifi connections are very stable and the signal strong (a hub is hidden in one of the drawers in the room thus ensuring the quality of the signal). Service and food quality are reliable as in my previous stays and so there is no complaint here. I am happy to see that the management has decided to renovate and maintain the quality of this well placed and reasonably priced solid (upper level) four star establishment.

I would like to ask your cleaners to clean thoroughly the hallway carpet, make it look brand new always & may be ask some of your staff to always stay at the main doors to open the doors for guest especially for senior citizens

Not our first time here but always have a comfortable stay. Love the location, not as crowded as causeway bay, lots of restaurants and easy access to MTR. Rooms are big in HK standard and staff was helpful and polite.

Excellent. Keep it up. Location is good.... minutes walk to MTR and just a few stops to shopping paradise. Room is comfortable and clean. Room is well equipped. Frontline staff helpful, efficient and friendly. There are good restaurants and cafes near to hotel.

2nd stay in this hotel. Great location with Good accessibility to the MTR stations. Area surrounded with many local cafes giving opportunity for good local food. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Room that we stayed have been renovated and is spacious while comfortable. Definitely our hotel of choice when in Hong Kong.

The newly renovated city rooms are worth the extra cost as they are nicely appointed. The bed is really comfortable and the new shower are great (but only if you don't miss the tub); the great work desk in the old rooms will also be missed by some. The "green" touch of only providing a water station in the lift area on each floor rather than bottled water may border some people but for me is not a deal breaker at all. Good value overall for the price.

Almost always greeted at the front door. At arrival and departure, porters are very helpful in carrying the luggage. Concierge staff are courteous in offering assistance. However, the coffee cups in the room are quite small, and there is not enough creamer, have to ask for more. Like the shuttle bus service. Ample loading and parking space. Hotel looks classy from the street. Prices are reasonable. On the whole, the hotel offers consistent good service which one could rely on.

This was my third or fourth stay and again I can't find any flaws. Ok, not the most modern and flashy hotel, it is rather classic and neutral. But staff is extremely friendly and efficient. The superior rooms are large and clean, with all modern comfort and amenities. The lounge for breakfast and dinner is a quiet place to unwind and enjoy. Excellent location etc.

Especially the bath top curtain, it will be stocked on the body when having shower. As a opinion, shall the curtain to be superseded by sliding door or fixed petition or any other facility to avoid the sticking.

You have an amazing chef Lot鈥檚 of choices on breakfast menu Add a little bit of Indian and Filipino cuisine though Add more choices on fruits and fruit salad and vege salad helpsTable set up are great

Frontdesk staff upgraded my room and marked late check out as my birthday is coming. Room is spacious and clean. Buffet breakfast and therefore many kind of food choices. Directly inside a mall so no worry with the weather; Will sure come back if have chance.

I鈥檓 actually a local who booked a room with a bunch of flowers for a rest and birthday celebration. The flowers are in good condition and high quality, they have even upgraded my room to a river view large room so I have enjoyed my 1 day stay so much

The hotel corridor was smelly due to renovation work in some of the rooms and stale air smell inside the room. The air-conditioning unit was noisy. Location is easy access from the Airport by bus.Staff are friendly and helpful.

When we arrive, the hotel know that it's my birthday and they upgrade my room to Executive Room with River View and it's so beautiful. And also they send a small cake to my room for my birthday and it's so nice to me. When we go to swim, the swimming pool is so clean and nice, we did enjoy a wonderful holiday in this hotel.

I keep returning to the Royal Park Hotel for its superb location, a few minutes walk from its third floor coffee shop through an aircon mall to the KCR trains that whiz you every 3 minutes to any place in HK via interchanges. Signs throughout the MTR stations are ubiquitous and invaluable. I keep staying at the hotel for its superb service, quick, efficient, friendly, not attitudes common in most dense frenetic cities. And with free wifi, free local calls, and all the amenities of international hotels (good toiletries, hairdryer, iron, mini-fridge, kettle, coffee, tea etc packs, bottled water), daily newspaper, it makes more sense to use the hotel rather than a full-service apartment as a base for a long business visit. The superior room is large, with a table/desk, sofa, excellent mattress on a huge king sized bed, a full tub and shower, and very quiet. The towels are thick and fluffy white, the housekeeping good, and there are lots of closets and drawers to make a long stay comfortable. The gym and pool on the second floor are excellent. The hotel is in Shatin, and is linked to multiple malls with literally hundreds of stores and eateries from luxury to middle class; you never need to emerge into a street to shop and eat! The managers on duty are always ready to soothe anxieties and offer assistance. (Ask for Mr. Jan Cheng or Danny Szanto.) In short, I return to the Royal Park Hotel as a business traveler who needs a secure home away from home to do her work. It seems to be not so much a mid-range as a luxury hotel, yet the room pricing is reasonable.

A super convenient hotel as you are situated right in the middle of a shopping, banking and transit hub. It is less touristy than TST and Causeway Bay, so that means restaurants are much less expensive. HOWEVER, the shopping mall that you have to get thru day in and day out, is the most crowded one in Hong Kong. If you want to avoid the crowd, then this hotel is not the one for you. BUT, as a visitor to Hong Kong, you should be prepared for the overwhelming crowd anyway. Great underground parking which would save you big compared to the mall parking. Also shuttles to TST and Mongkok. You must book ahead. Good service and friendly housekeeping.

I have used this hotel a number of times and again enjoyed my stay with the family. The room itself looked like it had new curtains and a new bed compared to other times I鈥檝e stayed and also when compared to other relatives rooms who were also staying at the hotel which had the old style curtains. Not sure if the hotel is renovating their rooms but did think it made the room look fresher and found the bed was extremely comfortable.The kids enjoyed using the pool on a daily basis aside from when there was a thunderstorm which is understandable - safety first. We look forward to our next visit

All staff are nice staff. Thanks for the upgrade . The room is big and with nice view. We can see sunset with river view in the room. The location is perfect , it is very convenient to travel around either by bus or metro. We had a very pleasant stay for our anniversary. I鈥檓 looking forward to my next stay in mid autumn.

I have stayed at the Royal Park many times over the past 12yrs. The first time was when it had a major renovation and the hotel looked fantastic and we had welcome drinks whilst waiting to check in. In my opinion, although it is still a lovely place to stay with large rooms, it needs updating. The house keeping do a great job and i would like to thank Keny Liu for looking after us throughout our stay, always happy, friendly and polite.The doorman who has been there for many years is always polite and friendly helped us with our suitcases to the bus stop.We always prefer to stay in rooms on higher floors.We will be hopefully booking to stay again later this year.

We chose to stay at the Royal Park Hotel as we were off to the Sha Tin Horseraces. The room we had was a decent size and was clean ( Grand Double Double). It was very handy to New Town Shopping Centre and easy to get to the train station. The concierge staff were very helpful and friendly. Decent hotel at a reasonable price.

A great stay. Staff very helpful and friendly. Room pleasant and quiet. Perfect for transport connections especially for exploring the new territories. Restaurants in the hotel ok but lots more choice in the adjacent New Town Plaza with all sorts of excellent dining options.

Located in the centre of Sha Tin. Next to the main shopping centre, a river and a park. Can walk in the park for leisure and along the river. Closed to the HK Heritage Museum . Everything is good for a tourist. Highly recommended it to everyone

The best way to arrive is airport bus A41, arriving at the gate. The hotel is connected from a shopping mall, and the metra station. The rooms are spacious and quiet. The gym is also decent. Will come back ...

We spend 7 neait et this hotel It was perfect .very close to the mtr and big mole.bus number A41 from the air port stop there. Good breakfast and comfort room. very clean and wonderful stef!! We will return for sure.

We stayed for 7 nights. The room was good size. We had 2 double beds. The pool is pretty good and part of it is outdoor.We were unlucky and stayed on a floor which was very noisy from the cleaning staff (7th floor). Our friends staying on a different floor didn鈥檛 encounter the same problem. We had some amenities not replenished properly on some of the days( ie given 4 shampoos and no conditioners, no slippers etc) But a quick call to the housekeeping and it was sorted. The location of the hotel is ok, v close to the train station and shopping centre. But the shopping centre is very busy. We had a really bad experience in the Chinese restaurant called Jade something which is part of the hotel. We had dim sum there and the food was quite good but our experience was totally spoilt from one female staff. After we order, our bill was put on our table. We ate and left the correct money including the service charge onto the table. A waiter saw us as we left and nodded to my husband. However after we left the restaurant, we were chased after and were told we didn鈥檛 pay the bill! We told the woman we left it on the table, just like how they left the bill on the table. But she asked us to go back. Then as we approached our table, she loudly asked someone if the found the money! ( which was clearly on the table). Then someone else took the bill and without saying anything to us, just amended the bill and said this is the new bill with tea added. But there were no apologies for the mistake of missing the tea on the bill. ( and we were unaware to be fair) Worst of all is the woman made us felt like we left without paying!! Such an awful experience. If she explained when she saw us, there would be no problem at all but instead she said we never paid!! Made us feel like we ate and left!! In the end the assistant manager came and apologised on her behave although she still raised her voice to us. The assistant manager told her, she should have checked the table before bothering us and she seemed very annoyed he told her that. Needless to say, despite the apology by the AM, we will never return again.

A little bit long waiting time when I check-in on 5pm. That's around 15 mins.Good location for transportation. there are main bus stop under the mall and near the train stationGood view for my room facing the greenery and swimming pool.Nice bathroom with enough

Disappointing hotel, rooms are dated and in serious need of a good overhaul.Service is spotty and the staff are inflexible. Normally after a long flight the best remedy to fight jet lag is a good workout however the Gym will only open at 6:30 and there is no amount of cajoling that will convince the staff to have it available. The area around the hotel is barricaded and hard to navigate wouldn鈥檛 recommend it for business travelers.

Stay at this hotel whenever we need to go to our HK office in Science Park. A big shopping complex is just next to it with many famous brands available. The MTR station is also located there. Food wise, there are plenty of good restaurants and cafes including the fabulous Lady M. Room is big and well maintained. About 15 min taxi ride to Mongkok and 30 min ride to airport.

Hotel is located in Sha Tin, next to a shopping mall. Easy access to central Hong Kong by using the overhead train then change to the MRT. Also, there is a direct bus (A41) to the terminal for the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau bridge crossing. Room is spacious and staff are welcoming.
