Clean, well organized and overall very nice experience. The breakfast was OK. The overall service was excellent. I would stay there again when I am back in Hong Kong. This trip was business but I often go for pleasure and this was a good value

Accessible to all points of destination, walking distance to the nearest MRT station (Sha Tin Station). Local restaurants around and good spot because the hotel is surrounded by malls. It has a very nice view of a park and the river

Very comfortable and rooms are of a decent size. This hotel is in a shopping centre. It is very convenient for public transport and the bus stop for the airport is just outside! Love the swimming pool! Good location if you to be in the new territories and easy to get to kowloon too!
Great location awayFrom usual tourist places, next to massive local shopping centre in shatinBy the river, can get loan bike from hotelOn top of shatin rail and metro station, My regular hotel for hk

I stayed here for a couple days and really enjoyed myself. The rooms was a really nice size in comparison to other hotels i have stayed in around Hong Kong. Great English speaking staff and a big selection of food for the Breakfast buffet. The Free Wifi was decent also. If you鈥檙e on the fence about this one, go for it. You won鈥檛 be disappointed.

One of my favorite hotel as price is reasonable, near to Shatin train station/MTR, direct bus from/to airport and easy to travel to GZ/ Shenzhen via LuoHu. Can book hotel one way free shuttle bus in advance to Sneakers/ladies street (depart 12noon), free shuttle to few places is shown in a card in room. Can request extra different type of pillows (eg latex, memory). Only con is not sure why my room this time the air-con is a little noisy, other than that was fine. Check in was a little slow as need passport of all occupants, check out is a breeze.

Thanks to Apple and Ms Joey Siow for all their help. We had a lovely stay. The room was very clean, beds were very comfortable, service was brilliant. No request was too much. Another chair for the children, change of towels, they came up trumps. Convenient location for MTR, New Town Plaza shopping mall and the older malls. Great as a base. Husband made great use of the gym. The housekeeper assigned to our room kept the room clean and sweetly placed the kids cuddly toys on the bedThanks Royal Park for making out stay so memorable. See you again.

It's far from attractions such as Ocean Park, Disneyland and Victoria Peak by MTR. Need to change at least 3-4 times to reach destination. MTR is always packed even on weekdays non-peak hours so be prepared to stand throughout the journey. Hotel free shuttle runs at wide intervals: 10am, 12noon, 3.30pm, 6.45pm, etc to Tsim Sha Tsui. Need to book in advance as it only has about 20-pax capacity. From TST, we couldn't board the free shuttle as it was always full. Even worse when some rude guests cut queue. No advance booking is available. Hotel staff are very helpful to even bring forks to our room when requested. However, we weren't informed that the room heater wasn't working so we had a very cold first night of sleep in the hotel. But we were given a portable heater upon request the next morning. There are a Mcdonalds and Delifrance outlet at Hilton Plaza which is nearby. Go to the 3rd level of the hotel, press the button to go through a security door and cross the bridge located on the left and you will see Hilton Plaza. To New Town Plaza, also go to the 3rd level of the hotel lift, through the security door and walk through the cafeteria. Need not go to the first floor hotel lobby and then go up the escalator to these 2 plaza.

Right across from the big shopping mall. No need to go outside , just across the enclosed bridge from hotel coffee shop. Rooms are big and clean. Staff are very pleasant. Good place to getaway from the city.

Although it鈥檚 not located in the centre of Hong Kong, it鈥檚 conveniently located to Shatin MRT and you can easily catch the train into TST or Mong Kok (about 20mins). There鈥檚 a huge shopping centre next door with lots of restaurants and the usual chain stores. Rooms are large and beds are comfy. Nice indoor/outdoor pool and sufficient size gym.

Good points:(1) Location - Easy access to MRT, Shopping mall, restaurants, Bus stop, the bus stop in front of the hotel will bring you directly FROM and TO the international airport. Save you a lot of money.(2) Bed is comfortable.(3) They have family room, nice.Bad points:(1) a bit pricey when I book for that day, fair price should be around HKD 800 to 1,000(2) Swimming pool closed at 9 pm, what a shame.

Amazing staff. From the concierge, bellman, FO, HK and room service. Stayed their with unforgettable moments. Big thanks to Hassan (bellman), Candy Lee in FO and to Ricky, i think part of the concierge team, very accommodating and never left us hanging. Big applause to the management for having this staff part of your team. The lobby is very tidy and have very good smell. From the moment we dropped off from the taxi, bellmen were very attentive and assisted us with our luggage.We have few request in room service and immediately it was being attended. Everything was perfect.

Had an excellent stay at the hotel, the room is spacious, toilet is clean and the beds are comfortable to sleep on. Breakfast is reasonably priced and has a wide selection of food. The hotel is also located beside a cluster of malls, offering various shops and restaurants. The mtr also leads to Shen Zhen, should you want to visit for a day trip. The staff are attentive and friendly, making you feel at home.

My family had very good experience with the hotel staff and housekeepers - very friendly. Check in and out were quick and efficient. Large room with comfortable bed. We enjoyed fitness center, but limited hours.

I would like to commend the honesty of the staff at 2+2 Cafe for securing my jewellery, I had a great breakfast at the cafe and didn鈥檛 notice that one of my gold earring was unlocked and fell on the floor, just noticed it after an hour when I get back to my room, luckily it was one of the staff who found it, considering there busy work with other guests. Thanks to 2+2 and Royal Park Hotel team. I鈥檓 happy and still enjoying my 10 days stay at your hotel - Janice

Although this hotel is in new territory area (so far from the bay, but close to large shopping mall), but you can get large and comfort room in good price. Breakfast is also very good. I've stayed here for one week, I found that the menus different each days.

This hotel is beyond my expectation. It should be rated as 5* instead of 4*. With a very nice location, beautiful lobby & friendly Front Office Team. Room are also pretty nice and very clean. I will surely recommend this hotel to my friends & family .

Everything is good including the location, the service, the breakfast and the free shuttle bus. The only thing I would like to draw everybody's attention is that if you do not like noisy and crowded places, avoid staying in this hotel during weekend and Sunday because the nearby shopping mall are flooded with people all through the day.

Every time we visit Hong Kong, we always stay at this hotel. It's the 4th time we have stayed here, again the service was excellent. All members for staff are extremely helpful, from the front of desk to the chambermaids. The hotel is very convenient to shops, restaurants and the public transport. What more can you ask for.

We always travel and Hong Kong always is my stopping point. Definitely royal park is my choice and I am quite impressive that the staff remember me always. Remember my preference, remember what I need. Nearby Movie town and Yata shopping center was completed renovation. This visit is short, and will spend time there on next travel.

Everything started with a failed early check due to overbooking. Then the room with insufficient and pretty noisy AC that we had to turn it off to sleep. Good breakfast and acceptable swimming pool. Basically everything should be refurbished! I鈥檓 Hong Kong it鈥檚 not difficult to find s good alternative!

Whats good:The room was 'spacious', views were good and had good noise insulation.The hotel is connected to 2/3 malls, direct connection via malls to 'Sha Tin' MTR (train) & Bus Station.Movietown (cineplex/movie hall) was less than 50 meters from hotel lift - can go and catch movies on your leisure day on in the night.The breakfast buffet had good spread and restaurant food was reasonably priced and quite good.What can be improved:Some items in buffet breakfast gets over pretty fast and needs reminding to get it refilled (sometimes) - eg Orange Juice, Sausages, Jam.Can add some variety to some items (only 1 Jam available, same dimsums available everyday and its the same sausage everyday) - can get boring if you staying for long.

We had a family reunion in hongkong and most families live in shatin area. Others from us stay in Royal Park for 2 weeks. The staff make sure we are comfortable and clean the rooms as we needed. We had kids and toys everywhere but they accommodated us really well. Hong Kong rains a lot and staff help us stay dry as much as they can with umbrellas and led us through better route then our usuals. The place is clean and nicely decorated. The pool is awesome too. We love the convenient locations to shops and restaurants plus the subway.

Like the swimming pool very much, because it will not affect by the weather condition, but the opening hours can be longer, the hotel colleagues are nice, the manager extend the check out time so we will not so rush to leave after breakfast and swimming time the location is. easy to find, near supermarket and plaza ,they offer delicious breakfast with different kinds of food, is a good choice for family

Stayed for 27 nights in a family room, Easy check in and checkout, good swimming pool half indoor half outdoor, excellent location in Shatin close to many shops and all public transport. Would highly recommend.

Booked a grand double double room for 4 persons. First impression of the room is clean, spacious and has all the standard amenities, everything was in working order. Downside of it is the main door is not sound proof. You can hear everyone that talk while passing your room.

I came here as soon as I got off fromA 4 day trip from Phuket as it was a short stay before we headed back to ukI waited several hours as check in was suppose to be around 2pm but an excellent staff 鈥?Roy鈥?got me in at around 11am as travelling with my 6 year old with asd wasn鈥檛 as easy as I thought in hk .The room was ready early for me at 11amThe room was spacious with two double beds. Complementary bottle every day .This hotel was very clean and inside was a shopping centre where I was able to shop for 4 days .On the last day of check out I was able to check out at 2pm . Luggage was stored away till I left to go airport.

Since our main event was in Ma On Shan, we chose this hotel for its convenience and easy access to the Central and our event. This hotel has everything you need for! Mall and Sha Tin MTR are just a stone throw away, with indoor corridor to connect you to these facilites. The room is big for us, 1A+2 Kids who need to do their homeworks and practice inside the room. The staff are very helpful, from the manager, front staff, even the room service who cleans up our room everyday. Breakfast has a lot of variety and my kids totally love the taste. We will be back again!!!

I stay here at least once/twice a year and I鈥檓 a member of the hotel which offers a small discount. Such a convenient hotel in terms of location as it is right beside the new town plaza and a food court. Staff are very accommodating and helpful, whenever we鈥檝e had requests they always try to meet our demands.

Had a week holiday with my family, friend help booked at the Royal Park Hotel in Shatin, which is very conveniently located with shops, restaurants and public transports within minutes away. We've had a wonderful time and the staff in this hotel were exceptionally friendly and helpful, we would happily return the next this we visit HK.

Royal Park Hotel is situated at Shatin linked to New Town Plaza, the largest shopping mall in the vicinity. During the Peking Olympics 2008, the hotel made a renovation to become an Olympic Village for the Equestrians conducted in Hong Kong. There are many catering outlets within the hotel, Chinese, Italian, International buffer are provided there in. Hotel facilities are worldclass, indoor swimming pool, gym, function rooms etc. Regarding the lunch, we took the semi buffer in Italian style, the salad bar was full of green vegetables, the main course that I order is fish and which is good. We had a great time having our lunch here.

We booked the grand double-double room, it fits all 4 ppl conveniently. nice bathroom, great pool, steamroom and gym, super accessible thanks to the free shuttle to TST and Sha Tin Station located just 5 mins away, and u dont even have to walk outside because the station is in the mall and the hotel connected to the mall. nice breakfast, will definitely come here again.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Great location and great service. Super clean rooms. The only thing that bothered us is the size of the room. It's really small for us. I'd recommend it for its location and service. If you don't mind the size of the room. To paint you a pic, we are two brothers in a twin room and we could barely move inside the room.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: I made reservations for a three night stay at the conclusion of a SE Asia cruise. The hotel is roughly mid-way between the cruise port and the airport, which made it a good choice for my needs. An email was sent just prior to my arrival which had the hotel information in both English and Chinese, which made it very easy to get a cab- about $20 USD from the cruse port. Everything went smoothly at reception and my 7th floor room with a king sized bed was ready on arrival at 1 PM. The hotel is located adjacent to the business and market districts which allowed for great shopping. There are also endless restaurants in all price ranges nearby. The room was a bit small by US standards, but comfortable for a single person. The bathroom was good sized with a large shower. It was cool during my stay so I never fiddled with the AC but the thermostat loos to allow for plenty of adjustment. The room has plenty of USB hubs in various locations, including on the night stands. There was a large TV but I never turned it on. The upstairs gym has a fantastic view of the city but it was too early in the season for the pool to be open. The hotel staff were attentive and helpful, including talking to the taxi driver and giving him directions to the hotel when I got hopelessly lost in the center of the city! Gladys and Isaiah get special mention for there special efforts to help me, a first time visitor who was overwhelmed by Hong Kong. Bottom line: I'd gladly stay here again.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Check-in and check-out were very smooth and the staff was very professional, Emily. Room was well-maintained and clean. Bed was very comfortable and I have a very good, relaxing sleep. Housekeeper, her name is Candy, was very nice and friendly when I left the room for check-out. I somehow left my computer and phone in the room, and she was quick enough to come after me at the elevator. She was wonderful. Breakfast was very good, with good quality choices.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Hilton Garden Inn at Mongkok has become my "go to" hotel whenever I come to Hong Kong. It is convenient to many public transportation options. Easy walk to a decent size shopping center and many HK Tea Cafe for food and snack. What also makes this Mongkok facility stand out is the great Front Desk staff, especially the assistant manager - Isaiah and the Front Desk rep - Moore. They make my every stay pleasant and enjoyable. I only wish it is easier to contact the hotel front desk directly. The HK phone number listed in the hotel directory indeed connects you to a Shanghai office where no service representative have any clue of my reservation or my questions. What a shame that the Corporate Shanghai Office of this facility is also not friendly.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Excellent service! The staffs are very friendly and thoughtful, they left a note in the room told me to borrow an umbrella from the front desk because the next day might rain. Also the room is very nice and clean. The location is convenient just a few minutes walk to the popular shopping area..

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: The hotel is very acciessiable! The room is very clean! The staff are very friendly! The survice is very nice! The only problem was that the aisle outside the room was so noisy in the moring that I was woken up really eraly, maybe I was too nervous or sensitive. Anyway, it is a nice trip!

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Great place to stay in Hong Kong. Easy to get to and walking distance to the many "market" streets if Kowloon. Great and very helpful staff. Real nice rooftop pool and fitness room. Will stay again when I return to HK.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Very limited bar and restaurant offerings. The bar menu lists a dry martini, but the server mentioned that they did not have the vermouth nor olives. i go to the restaurant for an early dinner (I was starving due to the time difference) only to be told that restaurant was full for the next hour. I got a burger from room service, very sad looking. Location not the best.....Rooms were OK

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: 1. The rooms were clean2. The staff were friendly3. Good environment for resting4. It gave me the perfect vacation.5. The swimming pool was clean and the facility was convenient6. Overall, it was quiet.Thank you very much.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Stayed for 5 nights in Hilton Garden Inn. Clean room, good housekeeping staff, and service. Although just for one night our fire alarm went on but guest service dept was kind enough to give us a plate of fruits. Such a good gesture! I would also like to give credits to MATTHEW of the FO department for the great help during our stay!!! Jolly, genuine, and made our stay more convenient. Two thumbs up Hilton! Thank you for d good service

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Despite the room space is so small, this is literally as part of the garden. The service was very good, all faculties can speak English, Mandarin, Cantonese. It is very convenient to connect the local cuisine and shopping mall. However, the Gym is much smaller than any other Garden Inn. All in all, it was a good place for a budgeted trip.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Staff very helpful. Helped contact our airlines to locate our delayed luggage. Location is good. Staffs helpful in recommending areas of interest to eat and shop.Super helpful with a big smile! Keep up the good work!!!

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Hong Kong is a world class city with world class prices. However, the HGI is a lovely 4**** hotel in Mongkok, which is a little less "touristy" but an easy trip to HK Island.The service and staff is great. Room are on the small side, but clean and modern. Excellent combo Chinese and Western breakfast. As a diamond member I also got a complimentary welcome drink and appetizer at check in.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: This was by far the best HGI we have stayed at. Their product and service far exceeded our expectations. The hotel provided excellent benefits for Hilton members (from providing a late check-out to complimentary welcome drinks and snacks) which was beyond the standards required of a typical HGI. We also enjoyed the breakfast with good quality local food. Much thanks goes to the excellent staff of the hotel, we would like to appreciate Natalie who was very helpful during our check-in and check-out and also Candy from housekeeping for her sweet gestures.The location of the hotel is fairly good in Mongkok and about 7min walk from the MTR station. Getting to the airport was also easy and it took about 45min on the bus A21. The size of the hotel room was decent and comfortable for 2 adults. A minor issue was that the hotel faced a major road there was slight noise pollution. We enjoyed our stay and will be back again!

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Staying at this hotel was an excellent experience! I was here with family for a family wedding and we had four rooms at different times. Breakfast was outstanding and the service from the front desk on all our requested changes and Jedda was exceptional. I travel a lot for business but this is one of the best experiences so have ever had anywhere in the world.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Unexpected great service from the front desk, even the clearing lady, they are really heplful!! I will highly recommended all my friend travel to Hong kong to stay in this hote! I am really appreciate their help especially Natalie and Cherry! All the hotel staff made my trip way easier!!! Thanks again!!!!

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: The hotel staffs are very helpful and responsive even before im arrive. Every single question that i sent by email.... they answered precisely and detail. Thank You Hilton Garden Inn Mong Kok. Recommend for everyone....

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: I stay at this hotel all the time when I travel through Hong Kong. I know my way around in Mong Kok area and I really appreciate when staff recognize that I am a return guest. However, during my past visit in early this month, the service went down from what i experienced. When checked in, I had to remind them my Diamond Status and claimed my own welcome drink coupon as it was not recognized/ offered upon check in. The room I had this time was on 19 floor, nice view but it has a very thin wall. My terrible next room neighbors were up talking and partying all night so i could not sleep at all. I called down at 1 am. and again at 2 am. but no one could help about the noise. I ended up checking out before 4 am so i could take a snooze at the lounge at the airport. Staff at check out was very condescending about my situation but she played dump like she didnt understand my complaints. Not sure if i wanted to stay here again. Swimming pool is open only during Summer, this is this first time i used its pool after many stays.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: This hotel is about 10 minutes walk through Olympian City (濂ф捣鍩? from Olympic Station. Of course, you can walk to other stations in Kowloon area. As it is a Hilton brand, the room is comfortable. The front reception is great! And the great points of this hotel are that there is a swimming pool on the roof and a casual bar on the ground floor. Enjoy at the hotel stay.銉涖儐銉伨銇с伅銆丮TR濂ч亱锛堛偑銉兂銉斻儍銈級椐呫亱銈夈儮銉笺儷銈掗€氥仯銇﹀緬姝?0鍒嗐亸銈夈亜銆併倐銇°倣銈撲節榫嶃伄瑜囨暟椐呫亱銈夈倐寰掓鍦忓唴銇с仚銆傘亾銇儧銉嗐儷銇礌鏅淬倝銇椼亜銇ㄣ亾銈嶃伅灞嬩笂銇儣銉笺儷銇屻€併偘銉┿兂銉夈儠銉偄銇偒銈搞儱銈儷銇儛銉笺亴銇傘倠銇撱仺锛堛儚銉冦償銉笺偄銉兗銈傛湁銈婏級銆傘儝銉儓銉炽儢銉┿兂銉夈仾銇仹蹇仼銆佹湞椋熴伄銉撱儱銉冦儠銈с倐婧€瓒炽仹銇嶃伨銇欍€?,June 16

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Nathan Street is where all the shopping is you are at least 10 minute walk from mongkok MTR station and if you go on Nathan Street towards the pier the shopping gets better and that's where all the nicer hotels areRooms are pretty cramped.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Clean room but very compact. Nice enough and reasonable value. I'm an engineer so having to walk around heavy construction and block after block of hardware and building materials stores was OK by me. Only 5 blocks to the MTR, which is an awesome subway system. The teenager liked being close to Sneaker Street and I liiked being close to a park. Breakfast was a ripoff.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: We stayed here for five nights and in the end were glad we did. There are lots of hotels to choose from in this city and we debated where to stay. It's not in the thick of things (i.e. HK island), and in some ways seemed a bit out of the way. But based on the things we wanted to do and see, ranging from Disney to the Peak, this hotel seemed like a good, middle location. Plus it was a brand we were familiar with -- so we booked it. And we were glad we did. The staff were great, the breakfast was pretty good, the view from the pool was nice. The front lobby is nicely done up and the self-playing piano is a cute touch. The room (1713) was very humid so we asked if there was anything they could do and they brought us a de-humidifier to use in the room, which helped a lot. The room was a bit snug for the length of stay and the luggage we had, but we figured it out. All the rooms face Cherry St Park.The interesting thing about the location of this hotel is that it's a shiny, new-ish hotel in an area that is not. The buildings around it feel old and run down, and the little businesses along the sidewalks are all trades -- like an outdoor Home Depot. But it's completely safe and no one really pays you any mind as you walk by, so the "contrast" starts to feel normal. Ultimately, you're experiencing real life Hong Kong -- sounds, smells, and sights -- and then escaping the heat and busyness in the comfort of a Hilton hotel.The hotel is a few blocks away from both the Mong Kok and Yau Ma Tei MTR stations, which means you have easy access to everything in the area. We found it easy to learn to use -- you just need to know your end destination because that's how you buy the fare. (We didn't buy the Octopus card for this trip.) The Ladies Market is close by as well as Sneaker Street, and lots of other shopping areas. Mong Kok station is right beside the fancy, skyscraper Langham Place Shopping mall with its brand name stores and massively long escalators. There's also a variety of restaurants (western and Chinese) and coffee shops inside (including Starbucks), plus a couple of grocery stores in the basement. A Jollibee restaurant is outside the mall, along with oodles of Chinese restaurants. We also hailed a couple of Uber rides from here since the cabs in HK require cash and we didn't always have enough on us. But the hotel is happy to help you with this if you need it. Overall, for our trip this time it was a good location. Mong Kok is a vibrant, busy part of Hong Kong so this location gives you that experience and also puts you in a good spot to explore other attractions around town.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Staying for one night this time. Check-in was a breeze with Melissa, she is charming yet very informative. I was recognized as a member and even offered late departure as my benefit. Location is next to Holiday Inn Mongkok and a mere 4-min walk from MTR Mongkok station (took Langham Place exit)As for the room, I got a corner room this time which is spacious and greatly appreciated. The bed is super comfy and overlooking cherry park (all room have this view and on the upper floors have harbour view). Bathroom comes with shower, sink, and toilet with Crabtree & Evelyn amenities. This time since I visited in May, the swimming pool was open and it has a stunning view over the harbour, despite smaller size, still enough to get few laps. Breakfast was excellent and I always like the waffle station! Service was quick and attentive. Check out was swift with Isaiah and feels like returning home when being able to see familiar faces upon my return this time.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: A well appointed hotel, whilst rooms are a little small they have everything you need. Friendly and fast check in, the maids who maintain the rooms are simply fantastic. So happy and always acknowledge you...I got left a little personalised note with a couple of bottles of extra water which was a really nice touch! Location is good, not far from the subway and there鈥檚 decent shops a few blocks away. I took Ubers to most places I couldn鈥檛 walk to which weren鈥檛 unreasonably priced. The brekkie is decent, however room service not so much (& overpriced). A good pool on the rooftop and basic gym amenities which I used. I鈥檇 stay again.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: My recent business stat at the Hilton Garden In Hon Kong was an excellent experience. Every request was handled professionally. My room was exceptionally clean and functional for my stay. I would suggest the hotel consider additional tv channels for English guests. I would remiss if I did not mention Matthew at the front desk who provided exceptional service and was of assistance in transportation and other requests. My thanks to Matthew who is a true asset . Frank Shea. Fshea@alphagp.com

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn and almost everything was perfect! Pool, restaurant, location and courteous staff. We could walk to most shopping; restaurants; money exchanges; markets (7-11 style)

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Kudos to the management of this hotel! You can really tell when the staff is happy and well trained. So many good things to say about this stay - from the alert email I received before arrival - which had specific instructions on how to arrive including by metro, which exit to take coming out of the station and where to walk to reach the hotel. After 3 weeks traveling I was wondering when the hotels would figure this one out! When I arrived I asked for information regarding my departure as I wanted to prepare myself even though it was a couple days away. Out came a complete binder with photocopies already made and ready to pass out on airport options, dinner options for western style and Chinese food, shopping, maps etc. These guys definitely know the hospitality business. The hotel itself is in kind of a strange location especially if you are walking - but don't let that stop you from booking here. The rooms are small - typical for HK - but the linens are wonderful and the hotel has all the amenities you need. A special call out for Moore - the friendly front desk clerk who went out of his way to say hello each time I saw him at the desk. Great Stay!

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: I arrived after 11pm at night, as I Gold member I asked about an upgrade and was told that all rooms are the same so no upgrade. I thought fair enough.. it was pouring down outside and there was no food available at hotel and no pantry as they have in other countries so tried to deliver on Deliveroo or Uber Eats and both not available, one of the reception staff tried to help but to no avail so went to bed hungry. Room was small but clean and shower was great pressure, bed was comfortable and at breakfast they changed most items each day which was great. No problem with staff and English and they understood everything I asked and said.Would be great if Hilton had other properties closer to the city and waterfront.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: I loved every aspect of this hotel, from the check in to the room, the cleanliness, the area, especially the staff to the pool the gym and the breakfast!!! I had a great time, the staff got every request I had fulfilled with joy and they were so attentive! I would definitely stay here again!

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: We arrived and were greeted by smiles and a great welcome. The front desk staff, especially Mathew, thank you for a great end from our vacation. Gladys was a great pleasure to talk to on checkout and gave us tips for what to do on our only day here. The view from the rooftop pool is great!

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Nice lobby, room was small but okie. Quite environment for resting. Staff are nice, and always very helpful.Location - little bit far from the MTR station, but manageable. Many nice food around the area. Highly recommended to stay with Hilton brand of property. great!

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: hotel has good amenities, beautiful facility, with great service. King deluxe room spacious enough for two adults and kids , The bed is comfortable and we slept well. Room nice clean, walking to the MTR station just took 6 to 8 minutes.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Hotel. Lose to just about everything. Staff helpful and go go out of way to provide just about everything we requested. King deluxe room spacious enough for two adults and kids but had to use extra blanket and pillows. Man was thIs good value for the money!!

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: This hotel has good amenities, beautiful facility, with great service. It is a little bit of a distance from the public transport system, MTR. It is easy to get to and from there. I found the service staff to be friendly, professional, and courteous unlike some other hotels in that area. Good value for the stay in overcrowded Mong Kok.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Many of the things folks have commented on are true. Service oriented front desk staff, helpful all the way around for taxis, places to go, how to get there, etc. Breakfast is very good for the level of hotel property and the wait staff are well trained. The rooms are small (220 sq.ft.) and the street noise to be expected much like a hotel in downtown Manhattan. Easy access to nearby transportation - subway, MTR and even the coach bus to Zhuhai-Macau are all conveniently located within 5-10 minutes walking distance. The neighborhood is lined with many good eateries even well into the evening. Shopping mall, convenience store and drug mart and also nearby.For some unknown reason - I don't think it's b/c the walls are paper thin - perhaps the ducting - you can at times hear your next door neighbor talking like s/he's sitting right next to you. The voices transmit clearly but don't go on for very long. I agree the television channels are limited.Overall a new and very good hotel property offering good value in an expensive city.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Staffs are helpful for taxi and direction. Good quality of bed, lighting and facility insider room. Breakfast is good. If transport by MTR is ok. Unfortunately, no CNN and sport to watch on TV. Overall is ok to stay.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: This hotel stands out in busy, hectic Mong Kok. On a peaceful street corner, the Hilton is located. Great friendly staff, comfy beds, extensive breakfast and the hotel smells really nice! :) Would highly recommend when staying in lovely Kowloon!

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: This was our first visit to Hong Kong. We were not familiar with the areas in which to book a hotel room so we went with the Hilton brand. Most of my review will be positive. The hotel itself is very clean. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom was spacious. The lobby area and hallways were clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. HUGE kudos to MOORE who was so helpful to us when we arrived. We arrived early and although check-in wasn't until 3pm, he asked housekeeping to prepare our room and it was ready by 11am! There is a restaurant on site that offers a breakfast buffet or ala carte (both for a fee) We had the breakfast buffet each morning and there was a wide variety of offerings including an omelette bar and waffles. We did not use the restaurant for dinner. There is a mini-bar and it is stocked with 4 free cans of pop/beer (after that, there is a charge for the replacements)The pool was not opening until May 1st so we were not able to experience the pool area.There is a shopping mall within walking distance and a large, night vegetable/fruit market that is fun to see. The negative? Although the area is and feels very safe, it is in a more dodgy area. It is not within walking distance of the Woman's Night Market, the Fashion Walk or the Waterfront Promenade. We did the Hop on/off bus and were able to see many of the areas and get off at the stops that we wanted to tour. There is free Wi-Fi and a PC that is free to use in the lobby.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Avoid this hotel. It is worse than a Premier Inn or Travel Lodge! Rooms tiny. Hotel noisy. No proper bar - just a small area off reception. No Lounge. Service not great. Located in a grubby, run down part of Hong Kong.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Excellent Location/Good room Size / Good Amenities . One of the few Hotel that actually designed their rooms accordingly to travellers need such as enough usb charging points , power point for hair dryer next to long mirror .

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: From the time I checked in to the time I checked out the experience was just 鈥淢eh鈥? Small rooms, extremely slow elevator, ultra busy breakfast and lack of some staples.. Busy hotel and rooms show signs of wear. Strange welcome gift.. (a towel) that I didn鈥檛 want to add to my (expanding) luggage. How about offering either a welcome drink or bonus points as an alternative? IMO this hotel goes not come close to other HGI鈥檚..

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: The hotel in very close to the Mongkok metro station and all the shops and restaurants and markets. Very convenient, yet quiet enough to get a good night's sleep. We booked a standard king bed room, it came with a very long sofa that spans the entire width of the room. This is god-send for our two and six year old children. They can sleep on either end of the sofa without disturbing each other. The hotel staff are very polite and make us feel welcome, which cannot be said for many other hotels we stayed in Hong Kong. When we checked in, the staff at the front desk also gave us a very brief yet comprehensive introduction to the nearby area, with many interesting suggestions of things to do. There were complimentary coke, sprite, beer and tonic water in the fridge, as well as bottled water. We had a fantastic stay.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: The location is very accessible to buses, uber and/or MTR (only 7mins walk). There are many restaurants, store and shops nearby. Rooms are clean but very very small. Toiletries are average and view is nice especially at night.I asked for high floor, but the staff said that they are fully booked....so funny thou that during our stay I havent seen any guests in the lobby, in the 7th floor or anywhere inside the hotel. Well I just tried but they are the one that decide the room anyway. Then in the evening, we were celebrating my son's birthday that is why we are in HK, but for the 2nd time the staff at reception wont help me in finding a small cake or dessert in their dining restaurant that I can pay for him to blow candle... they said they dont have any dessert in their hotel restaurant. oh well...

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: The property is quite recent but definitely showing some highly visible wear and tear.The management team is pleasant but perfectly useless and inefficient. Nothing behind some needless speeches.The housekeeping is doing strictly minimum efforts only with signs of zero devotion to the property.The property's guests (mostly from Mainland China) are visibly don't pay attention at all to the property's cleanness & amenities issues, and, moreover, even don't aware of Hilton's acclaimed hospitality standards.The breakfast area is quite noisy, barely clean, with look-like asleep and totally indifferent robotic staff.Bottom line: A dusty, quickly & badly aging property full of the one-time middle class tourists and visitors. With no intention to return and with my 2 (two) points only. Regretless...

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Great customer service, Mr Moore was helpful with our stay and with information about a unfamiliar city. Rooms we clean and comfortable with a fairly good view of the high rises. the hotel is bit of a walk from the mtr, and the restaurant and in room dining is good but mainly Cantonese cuisine with no international options,no luck if your craving ice-cream either.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: This hotel is located in the most busiest area in HongKong with a lot of restaurants, stores, and night markets around. It is very suitable for tourists and you can find anything easily in walking distance. The hotel itself if pretty new, clean, and comfortable. In higher floors, the view overlooking Victoria Harbor is fantastic. The only pitfall is that its size is pretty small, typical for most hotels in HongKong. And one thing to be aware is that if you like big bed, the king size bed listed is actually a queen size bed.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: This is a nice place, somewhat upscale for the HGI brand. Interesting old neighborhood with a lot of old hardware stores (stalls) but short walk to Lady Market (the night market), upscale shopping and MTR. One tip, have the Uber app installed as the desk will tell you that they have trouble getting taxis to come for shorter rides.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: I am sitting in HGIM鈥檚 2nd floor breakfast buffet room looking out its floor-to-ceiling window walls onto another bright building-humid day that will with absolute certainty explode into rain later this afternoon. Pea-soup-thick humidity does this. This is my 9th or 10th stay at this new-ish Mongkok mainstay and so I guess that makes me both a regular and loyal. Why?Location, room/bed/value/quality, rooftop pool, breakfast, laundry, and customer service execution. Let me take on the obvious to get to the meat. Obvious: Location is Mongkok - the heart of real day-to-day survival HK...a crowded checkerboard of commercial streets that offer anything and everything. Some lux on Nathan and Langham Place but by far mostly catering to residents for whom money is a far cry from 鈥渄isposable income鈥? Mongkok beats to the tune of earnest hard-working people who know that riches lay elsewhere but getting to next week is very much here. Legacy b2b commercial shops that slice niche paper thin...need a custom iron chain - it gets machined somewhere here by a guy who knows chains like I know espresso, which is a very humbling realization. BTW, an easy 4-block walk to MTR and access to all that HK offers.Room/bed/value/quality is great by HK standards. Owing to its just-off-center-Mongkok location it can command only so much, yet its fantastically affordable room rate provides a very ergonomic room with a Hilton bed and pillow menu, an enclosed shower (no half-glass wet-floor bs here), thick curtains, good WiFi, and breakfast (below).Rooftop pool - Wha?! For this room rate I can take the elevator to the rooftop and swim in cool waters overlooking HK?! Insane.Breakfast seems your basic melding of east and west but surprises lay in store. Yes, custom egg and waffle station if you are desperate to avoid local eating culture, but for the more curious can start their day with congee and dim sum offerings. And need a little pop in your step beyond caffeine, add chili oil to everything and your eyesight will let you see through walls. Breakfast is included in my rate so life is good.Laundry is of the coin-operated variety on the 5th floor. This seems a minor matter but oh-my-god-no-it-is-not. For those of us who travel light to enable speed and flexibility, the in-house availability enables a 2-day wardrobe to last into infinity. Sure, you can use the typical hotel laundry service here as elsewhere, but then you are repurchasing your wardrobe each time, and you can鈥檛 do it on the day of arrival or departure. This is my idea of a travel luxe amenity. Meat:Customer Service at HGIM is not - I repeat NOT - of the standard Hilton HGI variety. Quite to the contrary, the HGIM provides the same standard of service that I enjoy at a 6-star property like 4S, Mandarin Oriental and their peers. The staff at HGIM executes at the highest possible level. Reception through all front-of-house staff are all smiles and hospitality, and accommodate my requests happily and without fail. I return time after time, unflinchingly, joyously because of the people skills here. I cannot day enough about this extraordinary aspect of HGIM.Having said all this, I have a teeny tiny irritant. The elevator and breakfast room music is a single song loop that reminds you each and every time that you are in the HGIM elevator or breakfast room. There鈥檚 a bit of water torture in this.But I ignore this minor irritant because on all other and more important counts this is a 10/10 hotel and hospitality experience.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: I enjoyed my stay and would revisit this location again. It is conveniently located in close proximity to MTR, steps away from Ladies Market and food options. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was delicious. There was a variety of food options from breakfast to lunch. Yummy!

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: On the departure day, the front desk staff Mathew was super nice and thoughtful. He provided us drinking water when my family were waiting for the bus to airport. He helped me found the bus driver and directed the driver to the hotel front door. The services I received in the hotel really exceed my expectations. Thank you Mathew.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Classy and relatively new hotel, with good service and well-appointed rooms. Felt more like a 4-star instead of a 3 (which HGIs are usually). Twin Room was an acceptable size for Hong Kong and was well-cleaned and nicely done up. Service was good, with a warm welcome and efficient check-out at reception (Joseph Ng - great service). Free breakfast for Hilton Gold - breakfast was good with bacon, spaghetti, salads, Chinese porridge, made-to-order omelettes and the usual breads. Location of the hotel was interesting - in a bit of an old-school HK neighbourhood, but aside from being a bit run down, was safe and quiet. About 8 mins walk to Mongkok Station and Mongkok malls like Langham Place.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Overall the hotel stay was quite good. It is within walking distance to the subway station nearby. The room was quite simple and small by Australian standards but I think okay for Hong Kong. I was not offered an upgrade on my room despite being Gold but not a huge deal. The elevators are extremely slow when going up or down, so be prepared for that. Food options in the hotel were limited. The lobby bar only sold finger food, and none of it was vegetarian friendly. The main restaurant was quite expensive and again lacked a lot of vegetarian dishes. Room service was good, speedy and the servings were a decent size. I tended to stick to the garden with a bowl of rice. My child had the fish and chips which was a large serving. Staff in the hotel were friendly and approachable. They were able to guide me which trains to catch to get where I had planned to go for the day. Overall I would recommend this hotel, however the price is fairly high given the room size. Shop around for a good price if possible. You may however find a better deal at a hotel more central to the tourist areas.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: I stayed for 4 nights at HGI Mongkok in April 2019. I read through some tripadvisor reviews before my stay and was not 100% sure what to expect as those reviews seemed to be all over the place. Also, Mongkok - the area - seems to have a bit of a reputation, but I honestly felt like it was the real HK which was really charming.As a gold member I was upgraded to a harbor view room, which was very nice. The rooms are quite small but thats to be expected in HK. I was especially impressed by the breakfast spread which you could tell was made with a lot of care and love. I must say this was likely the best breakfast I have had at a Hilton property so far. There is a gym thats also quite small but again this is HK. One just has to learn to deal with it I guess. In all, this HGI will be my go to property when I am in town and need a functional hotel with great breakfast. Well done HGI Mongkok.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Stayed for two nights on business, hotel booked by travel consultant. On arrival realized its in entirely the wrong location for meetings on the Island. Its touted as being a few minutes walk from Mong Kok MTR but in reality its a walk along dirty crowded streets in an area of light commercial shops - the sort of places that sell hardware, steel piping, electric fittings and the like, with dogs defecating and people expectorating in the streets where you have to walk and pull your luggage.Asked the hotel if I could cancel booking and go to Conrad, which is where I should have been; but of course, once Hilton have their claws into you with a first night, they would rather turn down the opportunity to get twice the price than show any flexibility.The hotel itself is depressing, situated next to a noisy multi-lane freeway and has zero lobby ambience.Avoid.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Being a member of the Hilton Honors j have seen and stayed in many Hilton hotels around the world. This one is exceptionally good. People are friendly, service is good and amongst my favourites.Will definitely come back

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Excellent location, friendly, competent and very helpful front desk staff. Great breakfast buffet.Disappointed with evening meal at restaurant. Slow, not very tasty and older head waiter very condescending to foreigners. Treated Chinese guests much better with better, faster and friendlier service. Highly recommend hotel, but would not return to restaurant unless for breakfast.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Beautiful clean and modern hotel! It鈥檚 always amazing to see a USA brand being done better than it would be in the USA. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location was perfect. Be sure to make time for the traffics surrounding the hotel. I will definitely stay here again

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: I have been a Hilton Honors member since 2016 and the experience I had at Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong has left me disappointed to say the least. I felt that the apathy on part of the front office at the time of check-in - something I do not expect of a Hilton Hotel. I reached the hotel at 9:30am on a red eye flight. At the time of check-in I requested for an early check-in (a request had made before my travel too) which I understand is difficult to fulfill due to occupancy situations. My problem is the way I was treated and made to feel - 1) we will not update your HH number because you will not get any credits since the booking is made through a Travel Agent. I know I will not get any points but what is the harm in updating the membership number. After much debate, the executive agreed to take note of my HH number.2) you can sit anywhere here till we get the room ready - a lobby which was akin to a fish market at the time! Where can I freshen up - well, we do not have any place. You just have to wait here! And this does not make one feel any better because the toilet in the lobby is a unisex toilet!!!3) after an hour and a half I was hungry and tired and asked if I could have a cup of coffee. The breakfast closes at 10:30am and it is 10:25am now, we cannot give you coffee! When I insist, I am obliged with directions to the 2nd floor where I am not even allowed inside. The lady confirms that I am the same person who wants coffee and when I ask for a cappuccino with soya Milk, I am informed they do not have any Soya Milk. So I go back to the lobby and just sit there.4) I am finally given a room at noon - this is noteworthy and commendable because the check-in time is 3pm. I go upto my room which looks like it has just been trampled all over. The seating area wass dirty as was the "ergonomic" chair. I had to get the housekeeping staff to cover both with clean bedsheets so that I could use them.5) A big dampener is that the room service is only from 5pm to 9pm and as mentioned earlier, the restaurant / coffee shop works per stipulated timings.6) The area in which the hotel is located is not the most pleasant either. I did not want to venture out and for a vegetarian Indian like me, there weren't going to be many options anyways. 7) The in-room dining menu is limited with the vegetarian options only being the 2 types of salad and 1 soup (which I could not have because of my food allergy restrictions)8) Requested for french fries on one evening and after the order being placed was informed that they only had potato wedges!9) The day I checked-out which was after a week's stay, I struggled with my bags to head out to the porch to get into my cab while the staff just looked on and held the door for some young girls who were there to write an IELTS exam.The staff is well trained to say "no" to most requests and be apathetic towards the guests.I am disappointed and the stay has become memorable for all the wrong reasons!

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Almost all rooms facing busy street. Impossible to sleep without earplugs. And even in earplugs still bad...Pluses:- rooms are new and well decorated;- Comfortable beds;- Ok service;- Good location - 5 mins walk to Mong Kok station, 10 mins walk to Olympic and 1,5 km to Kowloon station.Minuses:- misleading name - 'Garden' makes u think u will stay in chill relaxing hotel.... NOT THE CASE! First it is facing super busy highway... so noisy - could not sleep without earplugs. And even with earplugs can hear all the night passing cars.... sound isolation is not enough; - Breakfast is so-so... cant believe hotel is asking 180 hkd for this poor selection and low quality breakfast... would recommend to go outside and grab a breakfast in Starbucks or whatever. - Wifi is poor. All the time was disconnecting. Called few times - solution was not found. In general - would not recommend. Sleeping is essential during travel. U wont sleep good in this one.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: The hotel looks beautiful and modern, although it poses a sharp contrast to the old buildings in the vicinity. It offers good services, and has impeccable facilities.Being extremely close to the Mong Kok MTR Station, you can get anywhere you want relatively quickly. Meanwhile, enjoy the the buzzing street markets, the food stalls, the local restaurants... but in case you prefer something more "sheltered", there are plenty of malls around to choose from, with the Langham Place being one of the most notorious.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Were there for 6-7 days and the stay was just perfect. Hotel has a super and friendly service. Their Gym is at the top floor were they also have a swimming pool with a very nice view. It is easy to go from the hotel to the metrostaion. A nice park is just around the corner from the hotel. Worth visiting the park, quit large.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: I traveled with my family here in HK, it was an pleasure stay, nice sleep and breakfast! The staff were all enthusiastic and patience Good for kids! We do enjoy our stay in Hilton Garden Inn here!......

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Beautiful and bright lobby to welcome you. Close to both Mong Kok and Yau Ma Tei MTR stations. Clean rooms, comfortable bed, and nice shower. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Good choices of meat, fruit, dairy items and also a made-to-order omelette egg bar. Stayed on the 13th floor. Lifts/elevators were fast. I enjoy all of Hilton properties in the world. I will be back.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: As a hilton member, this hotel has treated me well, quick and helpful check in process and provided with member benefits as well. The hotel is clean in general, i had no complain in that area. However, it felt like that this hotel is a bit far from points of interests. Although you can do a little walk from the hotel to the bus or train station, it was just not as convenient as I thought. Overall, it was a good stay, although I would probably look for other hotel that is closer to public transportation stations.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: As a Diamond HHonors members I found this hotel disappointing. Firstly I did not like this area of Mongkok. Secondly the hotel is right next to a highway and has a piano playing in the foyer to hide the traffic noise. Rooms are described as "Garden View" and yet look over a busy highway and onto an Hong Kong housing estate. Road noise is audible from even the highest floors & may impact light sleepers. The north Harbour is over a mile away and cannot be seen from floors 1-18, obstructed views from floor 19 and distant views only from floor 20 or from the swimming pool or gym on the 22nd floor. Rooms are very small although modern. Breakfast was disappointing...not the worst I have had in Hong Kong but not the best.I was glad to leave after 4 days. If you are looking for Harbour Views in this grade of hotel I would recommend the Marriott Courtyard or Hotel Jen on Hong Kong Island instead.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: I broke a flight with a one night stay in Hong Kong and chose the HGI Mongkok as it fitted my budget and was accessible from the MTR. It's under 10 minutes from the MTR station. I had checked the map before arriving as some previous reviews had mentioned it isn't straightforward to find, but armed with a map it was easy. On arrival I was greeted by Emily on the front desk. She made check in very easy and made my day by allowing me an early check in. The room was compact, I just booked a basic twin guestroom, but clean and tidy. The bathroom again was compact but clean with a good range of products. I didn't take a meal or breakfast during my stay so can't comment on food or drink provision. For a budget hotel it was a good base. I would book again on next visit.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Have stayed here multiple times as a Diamond member. Very Small rooms, ok breakfast and no Executive Floors or Lounge that business travelers are accustomed to in Hong Kong. This is a Garden Inn, but should have some amenities to compete internationally and take care of Hilton Honors guests.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: It is actually a clean and nice hotel. But you may encounter difficulty in finding out the place, especially when you walk from Mongkok MRT station. If you know the way, it is only 7 to 10 minutes walk, but if you don`t, you may be lost. A staff will send you a map before your trip, but the map has to be improved.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: This is five stars for the value at this price point. The Hilton Garden Inn Mongkok is a great value for those who know Hong Kong. It is deep in the Mongkok district, around the corner from Langham Place - but the location is neighborhoody. I mean that though the hotel is a tall, thin, contemporary glass edifice, itIs plunked down in the middle of a regular neighborhood. For me, this is good. I like the working class feel and the simple shops. This is not the place to bring someone who needs a pristine environment. It is not posh. For example, I would not bring suburban Americans or Canadians who had never been to Hong Kong to this location.The hotel is what you expect from Hilton鈥檚 Garden Inn brand. Very very friendly and adorable staff. The common areas are very nice - again an enormous contrast between the sparkling glass lobby and the usual grubby but fairly pleasant streets outside. The rooms are typical Hong Kong small, but very clean - comfortable beds and very good bathrooms. I must have a fridge and tea making apparatus- this is all good. The desk is small - and it was a bit worn - but the desk chair is very good, so I got lots of work done. The WIFI connection is excellent- much better than what I had at the Conrad recently. The view from the 19th floor is advertised as harbor view - it鈥檚 really just a whisper - just a sliver of harbor water that can be seen - and some nice mountains and hills. But, it鈥檚 bright and cheerful.Check out the MTR station locations - a few blocks to walk. (I walk and take taxis usually.)At current market rates of exchange, it鈥檚 possible to get a room for US$130 or 拢99, which is a most excellent price for Hong Kong.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Excelent thank you for your service the people is very nice we are from mexico we webt in hon kong with my wife because honeymoon and you proze me a bottle thank you so much ill hope see you agaij soon

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: The hotel is clean and tidy. Apart for the size of the room and the occasional noise from the main road. Not good if you are a light sleeper though I was too sleepy to hear any. Mattress is quite comfy too.Short walking distance to Mongkok MTR via Langham plaza and ladies night market . Lot of eateries nearby The pool was closed during my stay so didn't check.Overall, pleasant stay and would recommend.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: This hotel locates at the heart of the Kowloon peninsula. Five minutes walk to the Mongkok MTR station. Easy access to food, shopping and entertainment. My family stayed here for 4 nights and we enjoyed. Front desk clerks are friendly. They are willing to help. Price is reasonable. May be it was not the high season during our stay. We will stay at this hotel again on our next visit to Hong Kong.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: The clark Michelle really helpful and help me to assign a preferred room when I check-in, and the concierge was professional to get my taxi when i need to do my business call.Look forward to stay again with Garden inn Mongkok soon.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Our stay this time is for five nights, arriving at the hotel just before normal check in. We stayed here last August and loved the staff and service, enjoyed the good quality breakfast and were very comfortable in the room provided.Our check in, meeting Frank and Natalie again was like meeting old friends, fast and efficient check in and getting a quiet room on the 20th floor.We had a fair amount of luggage being at the end of 10 weeks away from home, so the room did felt a bit tight in space. But this is typical of most hotels of this class in the region. It was very clean and received top class housekeeping service each day.The bed is comfortable and we slept well.We did asked for a room with a bigger bathroom on the 2nd morning and we moved to the end room on the next floor down, which does have more vanity space in the bigger bathroom.Breakfast food and variety is definitely the best amongst the hundreds of HGI of my previous stays. Flora always gives us a table near the window with fewer people squeezing pass. Restaurant service was also excellent.We also spent a bit of relaxation time at the ground floor bar each night and were well look after by Eric on each visit. Quite pleasant there, but perhaps the piano music could be turned down a little.As with our last stay, walking to the MTR station took 6 to 8 minutes, the pavement and street crossings are not great- but this is next to one of the busiest spots in HK, and this time, there were construction work going on nearby. But our ride around 8am back to the airport was just a easy 25 minutes. So will be back again, next time in HK.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: We are experienced travellers and as such wish to give an unbiased review that may help others in the choice of accommodation.We found The Hilton Garden Mongkok decidedly average. Nothing hugely wrong but there were a couple of issues: Noise ingress into the room (13th floor) from side to side and above was very noticeable. Even normal conversation (and worse) in neighbouring rooms could be heard, noise from guest traffic in the hallways also intruded. Exterior noise was noticeable too. Poor for a modern hotel.The reception/lobby/bar area is too small and there is a seemingly constant loud pianola playing .Staff were helpful and friendly but decidedly corporate.There is no shuttle-bus provision. We stayed for 4 nights as booked which was definitely enough. Wouldn't stay again even as HH members.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: As expected the rooms are small and so there's no complaint about it. Despite the tiny room size, bathroom is considered spacious and the room has everything you need. It's about 6-7 mins walk to Mongkok MTR and most impressive thing is the service standard of the staff. Amazing.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Hotel is conveniently located in Mongkok and Olympic MTR. Front desk and house keeping are well trained and polite. Room is very clean and comfortable. Price is reasonable and good as compared with same level hotel.Highly recommended for all travellers all over the world.5 stars

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: On arrival, we were warmly greeted by efficient reception staff. The room was clean, modern, with a good size bed. Location is convenient. Walking distance to many of the busy, hustling shopping streets in Mongkok. Breakfast is reasonable without being outstanding. Didn't try the pool or gym. Would recommend to any wanting a modern clean hotel for a weekend break at reasonable prices.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Service was very good in all departments, especially at Reception which, in addition to its main job of check-in/out, has to deal with all requests i.e. for taxis and even to put calls to rooms, etc., etc.The buffet breakfast and its cooked to order eggs, etc is good, I particularly enjoyed making my own waffle with its various toppings. The food at the Chinese Restaurant is excellent, both at the lunch and dinner. The Bar next to Reception opens from 3 pm and the only place to get a bite of Western food. Would help if it could be opened earlier.On the down side, it is frustrating to call the hotel as it has no telephone operator - just an automatic machine and one has to wait a long time if Reception is busy. The location is not convenient - the 7-10 min walk to the MTR station is not pleasant and the MTR station is one of the busiest in Hong Kong - the area full of traffic with taxis difficult to get. A shuttle to Tsimshatsui should make our stay much more enjoyable.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Disappointed. The Pros: Excellent reception staff. The fitness center was excellent, well equipped and maintained with good machines and a great harbor view while working out. That was the highlight of our two nights there. Cons: On our floor we found service cart and dirty laundry collecting bins left in the hallway often until very late both nights. As a result the narrow passageway was hazardous in an emergency. Rooms had thin walls, were on the small side for a King Deluxe, appearance rather drab and tired.We went to the bar area and the 1st night found it unattended. It was essentially tiny and unappealing as a lounge area and immediately adjacent to check-in area/waiting area. Went back the 2nd night to order a burger and beer and found the bartender there but a bit bewildered when we ordered food, even though there were ads in the elevator about ordering/having food at the bar.Then there was the restaurant... good reception, dinner menu with excellent Asian-centric foods and eclectic dishes. The service was average and removes slow. Wait staff was language challenged [very limited english] and a minor problem when ordering. Of greater concern was entree serving uncoordinated such that my entree served 15 minutes before my spouse. I complained [unusual for me] and got a smile and shrug. Breakfast buffet selection was very good but the same staff and organizational issues similar to the evening debacle. As I moved tongs to select from the fresh fruit offering it was suddenly whisked away for replenishment instead of bringing a newly refilled tray as replacement. Restroom next to the ersatz bar was poorly maintained and we observed street folk coming in to take advantage of it.Management issues abound here.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Hilton's branding in terms of hospitality and quality of stay came through. However the location is right between 2 MTR stations which require a minimum of 7 to 10min walk. Not recommended if travelling with kids or elderly where too much walking is a concern. Suggest hotel to provide regular shuttle service to Tsim Tsah Tsui or Hong Kong Island for better connectivity.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Service was excellent. Rooms were decent size for Hong Kong. Only issue was the AC unit made ticking sounds 24/7, even after the Engineering Dept came to fix it. The breakfast dim sum was dry but the egg station was good.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Great room, clean, spacious. Service was great. The language was a little difficult at times with the folk at the reception. A bad experience when we asked for a taxi to take us to the Cotai Ferry as we were going to Macau. They informed the taxi to take us to Kai Tak. Which is where the international boats depart. There were no boats leaving and no one in site. We were stranded there for some time until a taxi showed. This cost us a hefty amount for taxi fares.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: I really enjoyed my stay at the hilton. The staff were first class and really looked after my on arrival and departure. Nothing was an issue. The only thing is i would had preferred more daily replenishment of the fruit.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: This Hilton Hotel is located in the older part of Hong Kong where the streets are lined with local shops and vendors. There is a daily farmers market just a few blocks away and also a stop for the hop on, hop off bus is also close. It's an amazing cultural experience. The rooms are very nice and the bed was super comfortable. The staff are knowledgeable and helpful. We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: This location was only 2-3 blocks from a 13 story mall with a full food court and better restaurants on the 13th floor and the subway to all locations with ease! The rooms were a bit small, but very clean.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: This hotel won best new hotel in Hong Kong last year and I can see why. This is a brilliant hotel, only 2 years old, and we had a great stay. The hotel has all the amentities you would expect from a Hilton, including a large safe in the room, hairdryer, plenty storage space for luggage and clothes etc. Our room also had a fridge which was very handy. The AC also worked well. The breakfast was good (best of any Garden Inn I鈥檝e stayed at - plenty of choice). The hotel鈥檚 location is only a short walk from the Ladie鈥檚 market and the MongKok MTR. It is also close to the Argyle Centre for easy transfers to the airport should you wish to use the CityFlyer bus. Overall we had a great stay and would recommend this hotel.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Stayed for two separate nights before and after a visit to Macao. Extremely friendly staff who genuinely care. Room is standard HGI but with a nicer shower. As a Diamond member got a room with a partial view of the Harbor. Nice small gym on the rooftop and what looked like a nice pool. Breakfast was a good variety of western and chinese. Service was brusk but efficient. The A21 bus drops you off about 5 minutes easy walk to the hotel- efficient service and very cheap from the airport. Would definitely stay here again if on my own. Its not a romantic hotel like the Intercontinental Grand Stanford but is much better than the standard HGI you might find in the US

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: Friendly reception. Everything was prepared for my arrival and I just needed to sign the contract on the dotted line. I got the recommendation to use Uber instead of booking a taxi which saved me money and it was a good recommendation as it worked well.

Hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Hong Kong Mongkok
review: This was my first time in Hong Kong and it was comforting staying here. The hotel is within walking distance of many shopping areas (malls, women's market, sneaker street, night market, etc). I don't know the Chinese language and the front desk staff was eager to help me get around and make recommendations! Even after I checked out and moved on to a new city, the staff helped me figure out how to get there! Thank you Hilton Garden Inn staff!

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Great hotel with nicely decorated rooms. View of the room was pretty good and had a comfortable shower. Not far away from Mong Kok station, which works well as a starting point for various sights in Hong Kong. The staff was very friendly and helpful at all times. Just the entrance of the hotel can be overlooked quickly and passed without knowing. Reception is on the second floor, not on the ground floor, which might be a bit confusion when just arriving.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Very small rooms but it is to be expected in Hong Kong. I probably wouldn鈥檛 stay here again as it was right for space and a little dated. Overall an ok stay and the location is fairly close to transport and supermarkets.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Not the 1st time in this hotel, still nice and clean as usual. on the center of Mongkok and very close to the metro (allowed me to meet my daily steps targets!) Agree with all other TA reviews on unbeatable great service; like front desk gave me some ice-cream while sweating after walking from street. And Manager - Mr Simon Lee is awesome and friendly, always give a helping hands! Must back!!

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: A nice hotel in a great location, just few minutes walk from the MongKok station. The hotel is well decorated, and the room is very nice, clean and comfortable. Special thanks to the front desk staff- Vivian and Cheryl who provided excellent service, they offered us a free late check out and reserved a taxi for us to the airport. We do have a memorable stay in this hotel, I will of course be returning sometime soon.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Location is super, very close to the mtr. Staff are polite. The bathroom is spacious and the bed is comfy. i have requested late check-out but declined due to fully booked and hope they will be more flexible in the future. Price is value for money.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: I was surprise to be able to find such a comfortable stay at such reasonable and affordable rate for a central location in Hong Kong. Its well maintained and rather new. I was initially abit worried about the hard mattress as per other reviews, personally I鈥檓 quite okay with it. The furniture are quite well-maintained, even the bathroom. Consider quite spacious for the trio i鈥檓 traveling with. Staffs are friendly, able to communicate fluently in English. Definitely will return if i鈥檓 back in Hong Kong. The location vs. price is too good to be missed!

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: We had been stay there for several times.The front desk manager Simon lee and his-team are marvelous, very attentive and professional.I would like to thank them and appreciate their service with great hospitality and will definitely recommend my freinds to stay in this hotel in coming future.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Room was very clean and fully equipped amenities :) And above all things, the Chief manager - Simon Lee provided us best service which of making us late check-out to take shower and packing our luggage convenient. If I will visit Hongkong again, I'm willinmg to stay this hotel again :)

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Was a bit hard to find, but we were happy once we got there. Front end staff were very accommodating, offering us advice on where to find places and what to do. They booked taxis when we needed them, and allowed us to have a late check out on the last day. The rooms were average, but served us well for our three nights there. It is located in a side street, but is only five minutes walk to Mongkok MTR. Lots of places to eat along Nathan Rd, which was also five minutes walk.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: first of all, front desk & catering staff service standard are good. BUT room cleanliness was very poor. 1st , a lot of brown stains on the bathroom ceiling & rain shower head. 2nd, moldy smell in bathroom. 3rd, brown & sticky stains on the bedside mobile . 4th ,washbasin tap and cloth hook are loosed. 5th, bedside picture and closet are VERY & VERY dusty. I should have a good improvement in the future.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: The location is very convenient as it is very close to the subway and there are a lot of local restaurants close by. The services and facility are great and clean. I want to praise a staff called Sano at the front desk. He has a great pleasant altitude.The only really disliked is the clear glass walls enclosing the bathroom. Even though I have been married for many years I still didn鈥檛 appreciate the clear view of my husband engaged in bathroom details.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: I had a nice dinner with some friends of mine at canton pot of the hotel last week. The food was very fresh at a reasonable price and had a great variety for us to choose from. Besides, I felt the environment comfortable and the service was great. The staff at the car park, Mr Kenny, who was very friendly and helpful, did a good job by guiding us to a car space which was near the elevator so that we did not have to walk a long distance to get our car after leaving the restaurant. He also accompanied us to the elevator. We were really impressed by his professional service.Although I forgot to reserve a car space when making a reservation, it was very kind of Mr Kenny to arrange one for us. I am sure I will come again with my family in the near future.Chris

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: I have been staying here almost several years which means I was fully happy with rooms and its prompt service. Specially Simon Lee who is always very helpful with excellent customer service which makes me to stay here again and again.  All the front desk officers are also very helpful and give a warm welcome.  I would recommend this hotel to my friends as better place as a second home.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: We had an amazing last minute stay at this hotel. Our airbnb that we were supposed to stay at had fallen through, but luckily we had stumbled across this gem and boy are we lucky we did. This hotel is within walking distance of the famous ladies market and sneaker street. It鈥檚 basically walking distance to ga lot of great eats, shops, etc. The location was great.
