It was in a safe area and easy to navigate to. The hotel itself was gorgeous; you can tell it鈥檚 fairly new. Our room was gorgeous and the huge rainfall shower was a big plus. The best part of our stay was how wonderful the staff was, especially Simon Lee, the director of operations. He was the first person we met upon check in and he was so welcoming and friendly. He got us checked in fast and I believe he even upgraded our room for free. He then asked about our travel plans and we mentioned how we planned to spend our 3 day short trip shopping and going to Hong Kong Disney. He provided us with great advice on where to go, how to get there, and how to bargain!! For Hong Kong Disney he gave us great advice to bring 2 big bottles of water and it was the best advice ever because we saved money and didn鈥檛 have to buy a drink once. Simon also gave us 2 pins that he said we could keep or use to trade at the park. We both decided to keep the pins he gave us as a souvenir of our fond memory of Simon and our amazing stay at the lodgewood. We plan to stay here again when we return and to recommend it to all our friends and family.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Great staff always ready and willing to assist. The service was excellent while we were impressed with the friendly and helpful manager- Kasey at the front desk She was very prompt and responsive to our requests. I will definitely stay here again as it was as also value for money. Great hotel! Thumbs up!

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: What a wonderful experience from beginning to end. I checked in for one night, and ended up extending four times for a total of 9 nights. Lodgewood is a boutique style hotel minutes walk away from a huge district for shopping and wonderful places to eat. The rooms are smartly designed, comfortable, and super clean. The staff is welcoming, helpful, and all smiles; which made me feel like I was home. A special thank you to Cheryl who was super helpful and accommodating. Can't wait to go back, Thank you!

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: This hotel is located Canton Road, a busy street for renovation contractors in the day time. However, it is a quiet place to stay if you don't like the hectic and noisy life of Mongkok. Just few minutes walking to the famous streets in Mongkok, MRT station and Langham Shopping Mall. Ideal place to enjoy Mongkok lifestyles but without the noise at night. Hotel is clean and spacious. I will stay here again if I go to HK again.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Tim, Matthew, Harry, Jackson, Jason, Daniel and I went to here. Tim, Harry, Jason, Jason and Daniel walked around to see the facilities. Matthew and I were too tired, we just sit down and kept chatting. Suddenly, Matthew found that his iphone was lost so I wanted to find someone for help.When we felt frustrated, James who was a great staff, came and helped us to find Matthew鈥檚 iphone. We are so grateful and luckily Matthew found his iphone on bag.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Booked three room for my clients from China and Europe.All of them felt the service here was excellent, and they are really surprised such a high quality service at a reasonable rate, and especially very warm hospitality from the staff named Simon Lee, who took care of them while I was busy in Hong Kong office.Location of the hotel is excellent too, perfect for business and shopping.Highly recommend, and my client request to stay this hotel next time.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Thank you Simon and Staff for another wonderful and pleasant stay again. Will look forward to our next visit soon. Your service always exceeds our expectations!Will definitely refer and advise anyone who wishes to stay at your fine establishment.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: The hotel is located in a light industrial area of Mongkok and could be slightly rowdy in the mornings. However, the hotel is pretty new and has easy access to eateries, cinema and shops. We were given a free upgrade to a bigger room as we had a kid and the smaller room cannot fit a baby cot. Moreover, we were given a late check out at 3pm as our flight was late in the evening. Thumbs up to Steven Lee and his team for the great hospitality and pleasant stay! We enjoyed our 2 nights (7-9 Mar19) at the hotel too as it was very convenient to Langham Place and Mongkok station. Thank you!

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Not very easy to spot the hotel even we took taxi there. It is a building in between some renovation shop. Yet, once you know your way, it is actually quite easy to navigate. 10-15min walk to the subway depending on the speed. But there isnt any convenience store nearby, need to walk 5 min to the main street to the convenience store. And I agree with most of the comment, the bed is on the hard side.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: The location of the hotel is near to Langham which is abt 5 mins walk. It is also near to many cafes so we can have a yummy breakfast without walking too far. Room size is not big as usual but good enough. Overall a good stay and will return the next time we visit HK.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Don鈥檛 read all the nonesense pointing out all the negatives. I鈥檝e stayed in the worlds best 5 star hotels for business and I could pull them to pieces too. This trip was for leisure and I wanted modern, clean, comfortable and well priced. Bingo! I got the lot. Add in a helpful front desk team and you could not ask for more. Close to Mong Kok station, near major malls, 10 min walk to Nathan Rd etc To the people who complained about the hard beds....you may not have liked it but my bad back loved it! Sure they are hard but for me it was comfortable on crisp white sheets and good pillows. If you鈥檙e looking for lots of space pick somewhere else....for me there was plenty of room.....king bed, good bathroom, hot strong shower. For my purposes this hotel met every requirement.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok is a short walk away from Mongkok MTR Station. At the same time, it can be reached also by taking the K5 Airport Express Shuttle Bus. You can omit the hassle of taking your luggage on the MTR. It's situated at a quiet estate, away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The room is compact and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Overall, we had a pleasant and nice stay.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Excellent staff from concierge to cleaners to the guy that walks around on the ground floor helping when you arrive. It's a modern hotel and very clean. The maid does a great job. Beds are a bit on the hard side and pillows a bit on the soft side. Lots of closet storage! They even have a microwave, and small fridge for wine and drinks. Location is great and a 5 min walk to Nathan st. It's worth the money.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: What a beautiful discovery!Back in Hong Kong for 2 nights, we decided to try a new hotel on Kowloon. We weren鈥檛 sure about Lodgewood. But it had a few elements that we did not encounter in other hotels in HK but there鈥檚 a Chinese restaurant, which we did not experience.Lodgewood is well located, in Mongkok, you can go walking to Nathan road. Landmark mall is just a 5mn walk away with plethora of restaurants and culinary experiences. There鈥檚 a fruit market just across the road. The hotel is eco-friendly which was a plus for us. There is no option for breakfast at the hotel.The hotel has a very modern feel with its interior design from entrance to rooms. Every detail has been looked after and that s very rare, this is a detail oriented person who鈥檚 talking!! There鈥檚 a nice mixture of natural elements like stone and wood material in the bathroom which we really loved. Rooms have a good stand of cleanliness.At the reception level, there鈥檚 a sitting area were you can sit and take tea or coffee and fruit while waiting. Other hotels should take a note. We were welcomed by Vivian who was very professional, nice and willing to help. We were given room #2003 which was very small. I had crutches and couldn鈥檛 move around without bumping into things. We told Vivian and she offered another room which was differently set so a little better for me but still a little difficult. Then as we went back to reception to get some information Vivian had searched for us, she said she had talked to the manager Mr. Lee and he offered us an upgrade to a bigger room for the second night. We were very surprised and a little embarrassed as we did not expect such an outcome. Thank you Vivian for being so genuinely concerned.The suite is just fabulous, well set and designed with beautiful furniture again every detail has been well thought. We had the corner suite # 2004. It is for 3 people, I would think 4 could stay in. Two toilets (very useful. With toilet tissue at the very right place. Thanks to the designer). The bathroom is bigger with, O what a surprise, a Jacuzzi.There s a microwave in all rooms for those interested. The beds in both room types are very comfortable. It feels just like home. We wish we had had more time to appreciate the suite. All staff from entrance to reception and management are very eager to help and so very welcoming.We met the famous Mr. Lee. We鈥檒l make him even more famous now that we have met him. We had a very interesting existential conversation! Because he鈥檚 just as described in other posts. I had a double ankle strain and he helped me find a TCM doctor, which was very helpful, together with TCM shop ( Thank you, we went to Yue Hwa and found what we were looking for). He also came to our room to put a bandage on my ankle. It is very rare to find a manager, in a hotel of this size and standard, who is genuinely concerned by the wellbeing of the guests. Mr. Lee is and that reflects. Professionalism and genuine interest. Thank you all.We definitely recommend this hotel. We ll stay again at Lodgewood.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: We stayed there for 4 nights on the 17th floor. The location is excellent, only 5-6 minutes walk from exit A Mongkok station. Lots of local diners around for budget meals. Our room was an interconnected room 1702 in front of the lift. The walls are very thin and we could hear whole conversions from the guests next door, as well as people who use the lift.Free coffee on the lobby floor is useful.Staff were polite.Room was small but adequate. Our view was an unobstructed city view given the high floor. There's slippers, shower gel and shampoo. No body lotion or conditioner. The hairdryer was powerful. There's mugs, plates, bowels, cutleries, fridge and microwave which was very good. Ample TV channels and high speed wifi.Apart from the noise, I would recommend the hotel.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Great spot. Rooms were good size. Close to trains and buses. The service was really good. We were there for my birthday and a card and bottle of wine were waiting when we arrived. Lovely touch. Definitely recommend

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Hotel is acceptable but the bed is too hard and pillows too soft. Had stiff neck from sleeping on the bed for three nights. Housekeeping need to improve. We accidentally stained the bedsheet but we forgot to 鈥渋nform鈥?the staff to replace the bedsheet by putting the card on the bed. However, I thought seeing the stain on the bedsheet the staff should have changed the bedsheet without instructions from us since it was stained. Reception staff were friendly though. Generally okay hotel for the price but the hotel is housed around industrial area.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Great Stay with Great ValueAlthough I arrived way earlier than standard check-in time, I still could enter my room after a cup of complimentary coffee at lobby and few minutes of waiting. Hotel serves complimentary coffee, tea and fruits at lobby floor. It鈥檚 really a considerate service to all in-house guests who have early flight out of Hong Kong or early birds who need coffee to start a day.Hotel is just 5-10 minute walk from A2 exit of Mong Kok Station. There are a lot of convenience stores, fruit vendors, Cantonese & dim sum restaurants, money exchangers on the way from subway station to hotel. Hotel doesn鈥檛 provide breakfast, but it was not a problem to me, since there are a lot of choices close to the hotel.The room was nice and clean. Just like most of the hotels in Hong Kong, the guest rooms were smaller than the standard rooms you stay in the rest of the world. The mattress was slightly harder than standard, but it was really comfortable. Pillows were solid and supportive. Unfortunately, there was sewage smell as soon as I entered the room, which didn鈥檛 have the aromatic smell at lobby. Despite the sewage smell, the room was great with French window. Housekeeper also did an excellent job on making up the room.Hotel staffs were nice. It would be perfect if the receptionists have had smiles and warmer greetings. Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong is a great place to stay. If I stay in Kowloon, I will choose this hotel again.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: We are first time travel at HK. We choose this hotel cuz locate at Mongkok-very convenience. Foods can be easily found within the areas.If you wanna go to shopping mall juz take 5 mins walk. The hotel is near by Mongkok Station.The hotel staffs are very friendly and helpful- especially Vivian. She introduced many different travel attractions to us. For the hotel room, it's very clean and modern.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Stayed three nights at this hotel.They鈥檝e have all I wish to find in an hotel: clean, quiet and functional room, easy access to transportation means and restaurant, nice staff.This hotel have them all, but comes also at a very fair price for Hong Kong.Staff is very helpful: for instance they鈥檝e printed out for me a 25 pages document and then said, that鈥檚 ok, it鈥檚 free. Or they help you and guide you to your taxi after checking out. Very nice, thank you.My room was not big (the cheapest one), but very nice, quiet and so functional! You can find plenty of storage and very smart way to arrange everything. So you can feel at ease. The only thing is that it seems they don鈥檛 provide breakfast. However, that鈥檚 not a real problem as you have many shops around, and free fresh coffee in the lobby.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Excellent staffs with fantastic service provided, especially staff named Tiffany, James and Simon Lee are friendly and approachable. Have provide us many informations and help during the stay. Rooms are clean and comfort. Free flow of coffee and tea are provided at the lobby all time. Definitely will come back for next trip!

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: I鈥檝e slept 6 nights in this hotel, perfect room, comfortable and clean, good location, just 5min walking from the subway Mong kok station, one of the main line and just 2 stop away from the city center. The staff is nice and the hotel manager Mr Lee really helpful, warm and caring. The lobby is nice and quiet, we have taken our coffee every morning in the huge chair before visiting the city. It was a really pleasant stay. I recommend this hotel, to spent a really good time in HK and to stay away from the stress of the city center ! The thing that I have enjoyed the most was the interior fragrance when you come in the hotel, in the lobby, lift, corridors...

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: This is my 2nd stay at this hotel, the last time was about 7 months ago. The condition of the room is very good and clean, same as first time. Additionally they have live World Cup 2018 games on TV at no extra cost. Pleasant surprise.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: This is my second stay here. First was with my wife only and this time round with my kids also. Hotel is still good... small but just nice for my family. We took the corner room. Check in was good and staff speaks good English. My favourite time is to hand out at the lobby wirelessly charge my phone, drink my tea and read my newspaper. Asked for a slightly later checkout and they obliged. As mentioned, walkable dist from Prince Edward or Mongkok mrt. Personally prefer to A2 exit of Mongkok Mtr. Took A21 from HKIA and alighted at somewhere along Nathan Rd after Lai Chi Kok. Took the same bus back to HKIA from Mongkok market. Good stay and will come again.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Stayed with L'hotel brand for the first time. Loved the city but often felt overpaid for outdated hotel with small rooms. This time is the total opposite as I felt I am getting a good value for a spacious and modern room! L'hotel Mongkok was a modern contemporary hotel with spacious rooms tucked away in the quiet side of Mongkok and yet within walking distance to the hustling and bustling shopping district/restaurants and mtr station. There's a playground park and local market steps away from the hotel. The Hot Pot restaurant is a must try!Mr. Simon Lee was very quick in responding to email and he's a very at his trade. Ms. Kasey Chan/Guest Service Manager assisted me during check in and she was very friendly and professional.Overall I am very impressed with my stay and L'hotel brand that can rival a more established international hotel chains. I will definitely return on my next trip to HKG!Thank you!

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Everything is fine , good hotel service, definitely comfortable stayed for my overall Hong Kong trip . Near Mongkok station around 5 min walking distance, but surrounding majority sold household products, it's quite peak & difficult to walk while some car/van block the road.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Good service and reasonable space for the price. Remember, if you want to have Dim Sum in the hotel restaurant, it only opens on certain days and hours (can't remember them now). Wish that it will open early so you can have brunch there. Food looks so good on the pictures.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: We were visiting our son in Hong Kong and chose this hotel to be closer to where he is living. The Lodgewood is in the middle of a commercial district related to building and plumbing supplies. It is near the Prince Edward and Mong Kok MTR stations and close to the Ladies Market and Sneaker Street. It is not a touristy area, but it does show you a different slice of what it is like to live in Hong Kong.I wouldn't have otherwise chosen the hotel for its location, but it worked out fine. The Lodgewood rooms were modern and nice and somewhat larger I think than the average Hong Kong hotel room. There was a microwave and plates and dinnerware for two people which I didn't expect. The beds were Asian firm with nice pillows.It almost seemed like a micro apartment more than a hotel room since reception is one floor up from the entrance. The staff was pleasant and helpful when we had questions about the area.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: This is a nice and quiet place to stay in Mongkok. The hotel is located in a area where many shops doing home renovations and selling household items. However, it is short walking distance to many famous shopping streets, Langham Shopping Mall, and Mongkok Subway station (MTR). A very convenient place although the street may look like a commercial and office area. No problem for us to access to grocery store (towards Prince Edward direction) and convenient stores. There is a fruits street market just a few steps from the hotel.We got a room that have quite an interesting city view and see sun rise too. Overall, we are happy with the stay. Fast check-in, spacious room (especially in Mongkok area), clean and awesome contemporary room design.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Did a five night stay. It's an average and suitable hotel for its cost, but I don't know that I would stay there again before giving a few other hotels a try Positives: - good location that's a quick walk to multiple transit stations- basic, no frills amenities for travelers- quiet rooms that filter almost all of the noise from the hallway, adjacent rooms, and streets belowNegatives: - tiny and cramped rooms with very limited space for luggage and ingress/egress- showers have mould, area underneath the wooden slats in the bathroom are dirty, and a third of the bathroom sink is blocked by the mirror- automatic doors at the ground entrance are unmanned and will open for anyone, which is mildly unsettling from a security standpoint

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: This is our second times staying at Lodgewood Hotel Mongkok. The staffs are always helpful, polite and accommodating.The operation manager, Simon Lee is especially helpful, professional and warm. Rooms are clean, bright and nicely decorated. Location of the hotel is excellent, it鈥檚 at the more quiet area of Mongkok but yet only couple blocks from all the action. Only a few minutes walk to MTR, Nathan Rd and Langham Place. Highly recommended!!! Will definitely stay there again

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: It was a very nice hotel with good accommodating staff. And great advantage of the hotel is located near park & MTR stations. Well the hotel nicely clean. It is a very good hotel that you can well relax yourself after a while day visits in the beautiful places in Hong Kong..

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: We had a great stay at Lodgewood Hotel Mongkok. Location and staff are great. Nearby Mong kok station only 5 mins by walk . The staff are polite and helpful, special thanks to Tiffany for everything she did for us .and add value for our family trip .i highly recommend Lodgewood.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: I am surprised by the number of positive reviews of this place! I guess they are basing the review on the price (which was cheap, I鈥檒l admit) so I鈥檒l start with the positives.Great location, not too far a walk from Prince Edward and Mongkok MTR stations and an easy walk to 7-11 and loads of eateries that stay open late. Midnight wanton noodles? You can find them here. Also close to the fresh food markets so fresh fruit was always available nearby.The Wi-Fi is free and super fast! Staff polite and friendly, though we did not interact much.The bad - small rooms, hard bed (back-breakingly hard!), soft feathery pillows that weren鈥檛 comfortable and bathroom a little dirty (toilet and shower). Average amenities provided. Dirty windows.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: We spent another fabulous stay again at Logdewood, this was our second time within a year. Our stay was even more pleasant due the excellent service from the staff. Special kudos to Jessica and Simon, please look them should you ever visit.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Due to work related issues I had less than 24 hours to find and book a hotel in HK. After a relentless search and numerous disappointments, I somehow stumbled across this somewhat hidden hotel. Situated in the heart of Mongkok, the hotel's modern facade ensures that it stands out amidst the decaying buildings surrounding it. Inside is no different; sleek, clean and meticulously designed, not at a far cry from its previewed pictures (unlike other hotels). Traveling alone, I found the room to be more than what I had expected and well kept.Though other reviewers have already mentioned the high quality and unequivocal service of the Lodgewood's staff, I would like to personally thank Jessica, Cherryl and Simon for being absolutely amazing.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: I would recommend this hotel very much because of its good location, tidy room and friendly staff. Although the room is not very spacious, we could not really have asked for more in Hong Kong. It is definitely a very good choice!

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: This is a lovely, comfy hotel situated in a quiet yet convenient location. We first picked this hotel among others because of the rate they offered online. Soon we found out that it has a lot more to offer. We took bus no. A21 from airport and got off at the 5th stop, then walked about 5 mins to come to the hotel. The lobby is on 1st floor. Check in was very efficient and simple and soon we found ourselves in a room which is, though not very spacious as understandably this is HK, very clean, neat and comfortable. It's got almost everything a room is needed (even slippers too) and the bathroom is spacious with toiletries included.After settling ourselves down, we went down to the lobby again and found that there were teas, coffees and fruits that were free for the hotel guests all day round. There were usb charging ports on each coffee table which's convenient when we were there enjoying our time & coffee.Though situated in a quiet street (which we prefer), it is within 5 mins walking distance to the nearest 'Mongkok' subway station, and the same to the nearest Langham Place shopping mall where a variety of cuisines are available. In addition, there is a good Chinese restaurant just round the corner for morning 'yumcha' and 2 supermarkets within 3 mins of walking.We stayed on 2 occasions in this trip, as we took a week off to Australia in between our stay there. The hotel staff have been very polite and helpful throughout our stay. They helped us with any questions we had, and let us store our big luggages during our getaway to Oz. There were 3 staff which caught our particular attention and gratefulness for their service, working attitude and willingness to help: Simon, Jessica and Tiffany. Towards the middle of our stay, they were not only hotel staff but we felt that they were like part of our family. One thing which we are particularly grateful for: Simon, who we found out on the date of our departure is the Operations Manager of the hotel, offered to help us with our luggages (total 6 pieces for the 2 of us is a little too many) to walk to the A21 bus stop together. What a gentleman he is and we wish him all the very best in his future endeavour!We certainly will stay here again!

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Stayed in this hotel for 3 days in March 2018.Let's start from good points:1) Location (close to MTR Mong Kok and East Mong Kok, just few stations away from Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade)2) Room size ( quite big for Hong Kong)3) Wi-Fi (fast connection)4) Restaurant (serves amazing Hot pot - MUST to try!)5) Free fruits, coffee and tea in a lobbyBut all this doesn't really matter when there's NO SERVICE in a hotel. I'm particularly talking about reception staff (restaurant team was good) who careless. They were paying attention to Chinese guests only, nothing to European ones! I felt bad, honestly,,,Upon c/I lady couldn't explain well anything about facilities in English and tried to get from us 1000$ HKD as deposit which I rejected to give.No greetings from staff during entire stay... And upon c/o no one asked how was our stay... This isn't hospitality!!! Won't be recommending to anyone stay in this property.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: Location is Great. Near the center of the busiest streets of Mongkok but quiet at night for a good sleeps. My wife is a local and she found this hotel to be really convenient.The staff is professional and really friendly. Special thanks Edgar who is a professional handling our check-in and go out of his way to help us with our request. Jessica and Vivian was also very professional helping us throughout our stay.Overall we really recommend this hotel giving it's bang for the buck, great location and great staff.

Hotel: Lodgewood by L'hotel Mongkok Hong Kong
review: the staffs are very friendly and helpful, they willing to help you solve the problem and try their best to provide a comfortable staying experience. the guest room is clean and nice, and the location is convenience

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: The team in the lobby bar and at breakfast were great. The ladies who cleaned our room were also very accommodating. I would have no hesitation in recommending a stay at this hotel, particularly as it is on the mtr line

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: We booked 5 nights in this hotels as the reviews were good and Crowne Plaza never disappointed, We are happy we picked Crowne Plaze Kowloon East. We checked in and were shown to our rooms. The room came with all the amenities. Everything was neat and tidy and the room was welcoming. On the 2nd night we noticed a leak in the toilet. We let the reception know about this and a lady came up to check it. She said maintenance needs to fix it and they would move us.Since it was past 11 pm. we asked if a temporary fix was possible and do the rest next morning as we needed to leave early. It was not a problem. Next evening when we came back, there was a letter saying that they needed to change our room. I called and was arranged. we were moved to a higher floor. Only then I noticed a second letter stating all was fixed. Anyway they moved us. It's a running business and of course things will go wrong occasionally. But the way they took care of it was perfect,Breakfast was included and we enjoyed it every day. you have all sorts of cuisine to choose from. Fresh juices, salads noodles eggs, breads rolls cakes etc. etc. We really liked the European cheese and smoked salmon. The hotel is next to or part of a mall Popcorn Mall and there is a MTR station in it. This is very convenient. And being next to the mall (2 malls actually. Connected), meals were never a problem.Pool is situated on the 5th floor. my daughter (7 years) went swimming. It was hot so I stayed inside the door. There were 3 people watching the water. They checked with me if she can swim. She can. I was impressed how they were watching to keep everyone safe just in case.We had a wonderful 5 nights stay and if and when we return to Hong Kong, we will certainly consider this hotel.Thank you for a wonderful first impression of Hong Kong. This was our very first trip there.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Other hotels should send their staffers here to show them how service is done: listening and solving demands quickly without any fuzz. The pool did not work when we were here, but room was great and breakfast extraodinary.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Everyone on staff have been very courteous, accommodating and supportive. Makes our stay very enjoyable. Rooms are spacious. Convenient location to MTR and buses helps with the fact that we are staying away from city center.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Has good service锛宎nd all the people have smile on the face .There are a lot of varieties of blackfast ,and foods are very fresh銆俠ut one point ,the swimming pool can be more biger ,and Umbrella-chair can be Provided in large quantities锛宎nd it's ok.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: This is the third time I have been staying at this hotel but for sure the last time.Disappointed of the service at all. Breakfast staff unfriendly, checkin desk staff the same with very pur english skills and considering that Iam an platinum IHG member that spend thousands of Euros per year at this group that's unacceptable for crown plaza.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Price - Rating: 5/5. Considered reasonable based on its location right on top of MTR and shopping mall and top class service. Friendliness of staff - Rating: 5/5. Staff were friendly from the receptionist, housekeeping and the door guy. Provided hotel shopping bag, plaster to cover my wounds and extra towels when needed. Cleanliness - Rating: 5/5. The hotel room, bed linen, bathroom, hotel and surrounding are very clean and clean daily.Location - Rating: 5/5. Right on top MTR station and Popcorn shopping mall and variety of restaurants at the surround estate area. Facilities - Rating 5/5. Complete hotel facilities and amenities. Minibar is available but chargeable. Breakfast - Rating 4/5. Standard breakfast selection but could be improved further by providing different breakfast. Get bored when you stay for a long period.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Crowne Plaza is a brand I trust and this one is no exception. The hotel not only upgraded me but gave me free breakfast, afternoon tea and happy hour. Plus they gave me 50 percent off for dinner buffet. Basically I didn't have to go out to eat if I didn't want to. The Mall is located right at the Popcorn Mall/Tsueng Kwan O MTR so is easily reached by MTR, about 40 minutes from HK Station. And they have buses that go to hotel from airport and vice versa. Another thingnice about the location is that it is one bus ride to Sai Gun, where great fresh seasfood can be had. And the staff was great, from the door people, receptionists and especially those ladies at the happy hours. Another big plus are the pool and sauna. The pool is long, not too crowded and there were 2 days I was there with 2 other people. The showerroom and sauna were beautiful. The only complain I have is a staff at breakfast was not that friendly and that's a bummer because she was the first person I saw that day. Other than that, this is a great hotel and I highly recommend it.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: I had a pleasure to stay over for few nights in Crown Plaza and I must admit it was something. From the moment I arrived till the very end. What is the best about the hotel is not its nice and comfy rooms, it is the amount of effort that every single employee puts in to make your stay as comfortable and pleasant as possible. Special thanks to the crew that helped me getting in shape before my fly back home. Despite the fact I have checked out, they stored my luggage and when getting back to pick it offered me a shower and a moment to get rest before long way trip to Europe. I appreciate it a lot guys! Fantastic and hopefully see you soon!Thanks from curly girl:)

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Overall room clean, service good. But the facility is not suitable. The swimming pool only open 11 am where we already have the breakfast and cannot swim immediate, and close at 8.00pm which we still out there for dinner. So I can not enjoy my morning swim before breakfast and than nee do go out rather than waiting to swim after breakfast, This is totally wrong timing.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Great staff can't do enough for you, breakfast is excellent, rooms are clean , and we'll managed, lovely reception area and speedy check in, rooms cleaned to a high standard, hotel location perfect for MTRm

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: we have stayed at this hotel a few timesuntil this trip it was always a good experiencethis time we had a number of serious issues which were compounded by it being a holiday weekend and the hotel being taken over by mainland tourists.our complaints,were listened to and the staff try to make us more at ease despite it being so over runmaybe management should consider the effects on good customers by filling up rooms with low paying China tour groups who come in, devour, and then leave, probably never to returnI would close by complimenting most of the staff for having to work under such conditions

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Deliberately assigned one day to stay away from home and relax myself. This hotel is very clean and modern. Staff are nice and helpful. Amenities are up to my need. I stayed one day here with very good sleep and rest. Good privacy and quiet environment. In general very good choice of stay in the busy hk city centre. 鐗规剰涓€澶╅仩闆㈠眿浼侊紝鏀鹃瑔鑷繁銆?閫欏閰掑簵闈炲父涔炬法鑰屾柊绌庛€?宸ヤ綔浜哄摗寰堝ソ锛屽崝鍔╁埌浣嶃€?瑷柦瀹屽叏绗﹀悎鎴戠殑闇€瑕併€?鎴戜韩鍙椾簡涓€澶╁緢濂界殑鐫＄湢鍜屼紤鎭€?鑹ソ鐨勯毐绉佸拰瀹夐潨鐨勭挵澧冦€?鏁撮珨渚嗚锛屽湪绻佸繖鐨勯娓競涓績锛岄€欓厭搴楁槸闈炲父濂界殑閬告搰銆?"June 6

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: One generally doesn't think of Crowne Plaza as an upscale hotel, but more like a glamorized Holiday Inn, but this hotel breaks that mold. Located in a more residential area of Hong Kong, East Kowloon, it is admittedly not the place to stay if you want the aura of downtown Hong Kong / Kowloon 鈥?you need to use a cab or metro to get to those touristy and business areas. However, if as in my case, I needed to be near the Hong Kong Design Institute (where I had meetings), the location is excellent. It is also adjacent to indoor / covered shopping malls. And the rooms are fairly reasonably priced, especially by Hong Kong standards.This hotel had large, comfortable, clean rooms with excellent furnishings. (I have had experience in other much more expensive Hong Kong hotels with minuscule rooms!) The bathrooms had both tubs and showers (most business travelers have absolutely no use for a bathtub and a stall shower is really appreciated). The bedding was quite comfortable.Internet (wired and wireless) is available at no extra cost and provided a very good and reliable 20 mbits/second down and up bandwidth.All staff that I encountered were exceptionally friendly and helpful.The breakfast buffet (included with some room rates) was excellent with a wide variety of fresh offerings including both Western and Asian.The hotel has three restaurants. The restaurant on floor 1 is primarily for buffet all day with a la carte offerings available for lunch and dinner. Although least expensive of the three restaurants, I actually preferred its food over the other restaurants in the property.The restaurant on the second floor is strictly Chinese cuisine. The restaurant on the 47th floor (which also has an outdoor terrace bar) styles itself as a cross between a steakhouse and Italian restaurant. For better or worse, I was not at all impressed with the restaurant on the 47th floor; my experience was that the food at the much less expensive first floor venue was actually much better. All three restaurants seem to attract not only hotel guests, but local families with children and all three be very noisy. If that bothers you, look elsewhere for dining.All in all, I would recommend this property and wouldn't hesitate to come back if I had a need for lodging in this general area of Hong Kong.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Admittedly I have not stayed anywhere else in HK, but this means they must be doing something right. It is perhaps 10 minutes more from the airport, but for the price I find it worth it. I stay primarily in Crowne Plaza and Intercontinental in mainland China and this was is very comparable if not a touch better, particularly with the staff. There is a mall for grabbing a bit next door, as well as, metro and cabs readily available, so location really isn't an issue. I love the outdoor pool for laps and the bar on the 47th floor is really fantastic. Ginny at the front desk was particularly helpful during my last stay, I am sure I will be back.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Hotel is very good quality. Cleaning is very good. Rooms are good for sleep and relax. Breakfest include europe meal. Thanks to all hotel person. We stay 8 nights and no problem. Climate is perfect. No dirty sound during night. You can sleep good.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: hotel was a bit far from the city. it's about 40 mins by taxi from the airport. but, the hotel is right next to MTR so getting around town is easy and convenient. the hotel is also part of the mega complex of buildings which has 4 interconnected shopping malls with tons of restaurants, cafes, and shopping stores.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: The place is clean and spacious. The buffet breakfast is also excellent.. the in room toiletries are not enough during hot weather because as Filipino need to shower more than once.. but overall experience is superb.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Crowne plaza is a fantastic hotel to stay,the only drawback was the distance from Tsim Tsha Tsui,even though the metro train connectivity was very good, there was a good mall adjoining this property called as Popcorn mall.The rooms in crowne plaza are big enough much bigger than the other Hong Kong hotels.The breakfast spread was simply awesome,they had so many options.The other facilities were also good ones like the health club and swimming pool.Since I am IHG member I was given a complimentary drink coupon as well.One guy Ronnie who was at the reception desk was quite helpful.Would definitely repeat this place The minus points were too far from the airport,took about 45 minutes taxi drive from airport,there was no hot water in the wash basin taps,plus had to wait for 15 minutes to check in as there are only 2 or 3 counters for check in,the hotel has about 400 rooms.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: For a supposed upmarket hotel, the breakfast area was more like a basic cafeteria. The coffee was rubbish and the food very disappointing. We had booked a club room and were supposed to enjoy a 'happy period' with free drinks and food. We made the mistake of including a friend who had worked with us during the day and we thought we would catch up during the evening. The hotel staff could not handle this at all and despite my repeated assurances that I would pay for anything that she ate or drank, they kept reminding us that she was not included in the room rate. When I complained the following day, the response from the hotel was condescending saying that they looked forward to my next visit. What a rubbish hotel and no we will never return under any circumstances. There are many far better hotels in Hong Kong.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza Kowloon East from May 1 to May 4th. The Hotel was super busy during the golden week but the staff were always available and happy to help. My family and I had planned a trip to Hongkong to celebrate my parents 40th wedding anniversary and our 10th wedding anniversary. However due to the closing of operations of Jet Airways in India my parents and my sisters booking was cancelled and they could not fly. I reached out to The Front Service Manager Edgar Chee and Matthew Wong were quick to realise the situation and promised to refund the booking without charge which my family had booked for 7 days. My wife and I went to Hongkong for 3 days and the service was superb. We arrived early at around 10 am and Matthew organised a early check in for us. They also went through the trouble of sending us a couple of goodies as a gesture for our 10th wedding anniversary.The buffet breakfast was a good spread.I will definitely visit Crowne Plaza again and I do acknowledge the service provided by Matthew and Edgar.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Nice hotel, was given an upgrade ;-)Great views but a bit out of the way from the main part of Hong KongMeals were a little bit hard to source, only that which was available in the nearby shopping centre

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: I have stayed in Crowne Plaza Kowloon East a few times and have always enjoyed the level of comfort and quality services in the hotel. Their excellent lounge on the top floor with a sit out offers near 360 degrees view. The tea service and evening service in the lounge serves nice snacks, desserts and drinks. The club floor rooms are fairly luxurious after a tiring work day. Although the breakfast spread is quite elaborate, I'd suggest that they should add some south-asian and middle-eastern cuisine items to make it better.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: We live in Hong Kong but when we want a special treat we come to the Crowne Plaza Kowloon East. It is much more affordable than other hotels in Hong Kong and the rooms are much larger. The staff is incredible & the service is really outstanding. They have a wonderful breakfast buffet with lots of choices. The hotel is attached to a mall with good restaurants and shops and even a movie theater. The MTR is in the mall too so it's easy to get to the tourist areas of Kowloon and Hong Kong. We highly recommend the Crowne Plaza Kowloon East.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: This hotel really surprised me.. I was expecting something smaller and basic.. it was great the staff were really polite and the amenities were really good. The location was the best part it was right next the MTR station which was awesome since we were going everywhere via the MTR.. and the shopping center next door had all the essentials if we needed anything. I would definitely stay again if I were to come back. I would also recommend it to my friends and family. Get the breakfast package it saved us quite a bit of money.. since we are used to eating like two meals a day! But the food in Hong Kong was fairly cheap any ways!

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Room was very clean and spacious.Staff were great and helpful.Relaxing trip.Hotel well located with shopping and amenities and transportation.Breakfast buffet was a variety and tasty. Dining staff were great too.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: This hotel is great! There's swimming pool, gym room and there's wonderful breakfast if you pay and this hotel is near the MTR. The room is big and there's free drinks in the fridge. Great locations, you can go anywhere if you want. This hotel sticks with the shopping mall Popcorn. In conclusion, this hotel is great and i recommend you guys to go there.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: The property looks very clean and well maintained although we only went there for breakfast every morning. Buffet was held in different places but advertised at the desk for the Holiday Inn guests. Food good and staff friendly. Cannot review the rooms.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Always feel welcoming when I returned to CP Kowloon East, It like returning home. nicely arranged room with my special request on extra waster.Samson and his team, always helping me with information and receiving my icoutier items.Chloe's warm greetings

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: The personal of lobby are very nice with us, in special Mr. Lau and Manager Wong they help me a lot like help me to call to laundry to get hurry my clothes, a health problem that my kid had we were need to go to hospital they help me to call a car. We feel very pleasure in this place.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: The hotel is well located close to MTR and shopping centre. Only 25 minutes from city centre The rooms are a good size and nicely decorated. The breakfast is good with plenty of choice both Asian and western. Staff are always friendly and helpful.My preference for accommodation in HK.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Paid and reserved a family room - three guests. Please check dates and length of stay. On arrival informed that I had to pay for an extra bed. First time ever that we have been asked to pay and it was not a small amount for a kid of 9 years old. We have travelled extensively all over the world. Last time I set foot in a plaza.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Lovely hotel with friendly and attentive staff.we had a corner room and it was very clean and spacious. The hotel is situated on very close to the mtr and it is very quick to get into Hong Kong island and the busy parts of kowloon. Popcorn shopping centre is right next door with loads of shops and good restaurants. The hotel it self has a lovely rooftop restaurant and bar with great views all round.we are very sad to be leaving this comfortable hotel.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Booked the hotel without really doing any research and as a first time visitor not knowing about the geography of Hong Kong.On reading different TA reviews almost cancelled due to the adverse comments about location, but am glad I didn't.Whilst the hotel certainly isnt in the hub of the tourist areas, it is very clean, comfortable and quiet, close to loads of resteraunts and right by the subway which even for a novice is incredibly easy and cheap to navigate.Breakfast was fantastic with a wide selection of both Western and local dishes and service throughout top notch - we were able to check in early which was a much appreciated bonus.You wouldnt expect bar prices to be cheap in this kind of hotel, but became acceptable by taking advantage of the various offers.Didnt use the hotel resteraunts - they did look expensive (with so many other options around), but we were told by another guest that it was possible to significantly reduce the proce by getting a voucher from reception - not surprisingly the hotel did not advertise this!One slight downer, we travelled in March which meant the Hotel pool was closed (no problem it was mentioned on the website so we knew in advance), but this ocmbined with weddings taking place meant that there was no out door space (that we found) where we could sit and relax in the warm spring sunshine,All ni all happy t recemmend the Hotel

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: I love their bed though their curtains cannot close properly leaving a glimpse of the sunlight may wake you up in the morning. Spacious toilet and shower area. Wordings on hotel inhouse phone can be bigger, too tiny.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: The service here is really much better than the other "outside" of HK hotels. Look for Poeye in the lounge as she is very accommodating and helpful. The view from the 47th floor is excellent and the beer is cold.:)

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: I stayed this hotel for participating company sales meeting. The room I stayed in is quite spacious and some facilities such as a restaurant for breakfast and meeting rooms are also perfect. Two negative points: Location and elevator. The location of this hotel is a bit far from the airport and the city center. / As the elevators have to cover many floors, therefore, sometimes we have to wait for it for a long time. And depending on the staying floor (especially lower floor), even though the elevator come to the own floor, we cannot ride it because of the full passengers.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: That's average Crowne Plaza 4 star hotel, away from Central district, though with subway station next door. Taxi ride to Central would take 30 minutes and incur 200 HKD, Tsim Sha Tsui is 20 minutes ride and 150 HKD. Hotel has everything you need including good service, and I am thankful to staff for the great service which helped me and my family a lot. The hotel is new and clean, rooms are big enough. Nevertheless, the quality of furniture, linen, amenities is mediocre and luxury in limited supply :) Good business hotel, but located away from main business districts.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: The hotel has a great location in Kowloon. I judge hotels by five categories: location, amenities, customer service, luxury and price for the value. The hotel located right next to Popcorn mall which has a lot restaurants and shops to explore while you visit Hong Kong. I treated as customer by all staff members especially by the Jessica Ng, the person that checked me in who gave me all the information during my stay in Kowloon and the amenities of the hotel. The room was beautiful spacious, nice bed, elegant bathroom and the latest technology to access the high speed internet, watch television and listen music. The valet staff was exceptional in helping get around and calling taxi and Uber to get around the city.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: ideal hotel for a business trip short or long term and better value by far than hotels on the main island. Short MTR journey from TKO to Central HK and situated in a good quality shopping area with plenty of restaurants near by.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Room was clean, tidy, fully equipped, friendly staff, wired and wireless internet, business room to cater a few people, easy access to MTR and shopping malls, gym but no swimming pool during Winter, bed was terrible, bed sheets felt weird, room tidied/serviced only every other day during my 8-day stay, and semi-ok buffet breakfast (except for their refrigerated poached eggs!?)

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Nice customer serviceRoom is tidyIs normal big roomFree drinks and beersThe price is attractive compare with room size in other location of Hong KongI will visit again if have similar price next time.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Stayed at Crowne Plaza Kowloon East for a conference in February 2019. Our company made the reservation for me and my colleagues and assured us that everything had been paid for. When we arrived at the hotel, we were told that our reservation had not been paid and that we would need to pay for the total amount before checking in. Turns out, there was a miscommunication on 3rd party authorization between the hotel and our company. It took a while to resolve. On the other hand, the hotel's location was excellent as it had easy access to Popcorn mall and Tseung Kwan O station. Breakfast buffet was excellent. The room was also very clean. Upon check-out, the concierge also helped us get a 5-seater taxi for our trip to the airport.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: It seems to be away from popular places but hanging around is so easy with MTR trains as it is steps away from the station. Room is spacious when compare with some others that I visited before. Staffs are very helpful and friendly and it is our sixth visit so far.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: i made the booking from home with the hotel ,2 persons,by credit card,received confirmation etc,when myself and my wife arrived,the desk clerk wanted 20000 hk $ deposit,he informed me that my stay has not been payed,after some discussion and he made a few phone calls,i sight a bill statement ,and i was assured that it was payed now,the room was typical crown plaza,roomy clean,functional,breakfast was a larger buffet breakfast very good,evening buffet dinner was close to morning buffet,just with seafood and shellfish,the Chinese restaurant was very uncustomary,the way the charged ,at sett menu no discounts for hotel guests ,at ala card the discount was 30%,in the dinning room Kelvin Kwok was most helpful,front deskHita Wong was good

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Very disappointed with the front desk service, will not help to book a 5-seat taxi from hotel to airport, was told to hail taxi from the street out side. What type of service is that in the hotel? So disappointed. Finally got a local friend to help book the taxi!! May be the hotel should learn a bit about the meaning of hospitality.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: The hotel is next to the MTR station and very easy to take public transport to where you want to travel in Hong Kong. The service at the hotel is excellent with well trained staff. Breakfast is a great place to relax and take your time to eat and chat.I have been travelling to Hong Kong for a number of years and always select the Crowne Plaza to stay in during my visits.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Easy check-in, accepted our group last minute, close to the city center and the airport. Only there for a night but really enjoyed the clean and high quality rooms, really nice bath and shower, and welcoming feeling of the hotel.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Very friendly staff. They signed me to the room even though I arrived early morning. The room is spacious and well-equipped, the location is comfortable, just above the subway and mall. Breakfast is good with a lot of choice. Nice gym

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: One of the best and must value for money hotel ever. First time visit in HK and was very impressed with the service and quality of the hotel. Price point was very affordable and the facilities are great. Very clean and spacious, classy and grand. The breakfast buffet was very nice too. Thank you so much for the accommodation! Definitely staying here again whenever I visit HK!

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: disappointed by this hotel to be honest. I am used to CP all over the world, but this time was not a good experience. I felt not comfortable and not welcomed. Internet was crap. Since i am member of IHG Reward, i had access to the lounge which is next to the rooftop restaurant, on 47th. Once reached there, we sat on a table outside since we did not know we had to ask for lounge access, we were told that the minimum order to stay was 130 HKD per person...

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Nice location, near to train station and malls. Friendly staff and clean rooms. Breakfast spread is big but the food can be better. Maybe more different variety of good. Overall very good experience with crowne plaza.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: I enjoyed staying at Crowne Plaza hotel. Service is fast and crew is very helpful. Rooms are spacious and well equipped. Very nice choice of breakfast which is served longer than 4 hours in the morning which makes it convenient to all guests.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: We have visited this hotel many times since its inception a few years back. We chose this location because it is probably the best in the neighbourhood. Over the years, hardware needs to be refreshed, e. g. mable counter top's protective coat is completely ruined. It needs to be scraped off and re-coat. Today as it stands, one can see the dirt embedded in the scratch mark as well as feel the scratches. Flushing of toilets are noisy, one can hear your neighbours.TV is dated.Drapery feel unclean when touched. May be it is the material, or it may be simply cumulative dust.Elevator service seem slower than previous times, recommend split level controls to be implemented and perhaps incorporate one of the three service elevators for the exclusive of the upper 15% floors. Service wise, housekeeping seems to be above average, but overall in both the first floor (european buffet), and second floor (chinese) restaurants, wait staff lack enthusiasm.In the European restaurant, you can find often times, three up to five servers congregate at the coffee machine stand and chit chat, while waiting to get coffee for customers. The entire seating area covers easily 400SM, with perhaps 200 plus seats, but with only one coffee preparation station. Servers will walk by your table, with nothing in their hands and not pick up any used plates.I have witnessed a young mother fixing her todler's hair for over 15 mins in the restaurant with no regards to other customers. I certainly do not want any dust or hair into my buffet. Noodle chef and the reception / cashier are both efficient and friendly exception.While in the Chinese restaurant, there were no smile coming out from any of their wait staff. They do refill hot water diligently.Front Desk was not performing its duty as promised. We had an early (7:15) flight arrival which the Hotel reservation is well aware off. We understand that it would be based on availability for early check in, thus we purposely went to the Hotel after a full breakfast elsewhere till 10:30. Of course, there were no rooms available, but the Front Desk staff informed us that there should be availability by noon, and even promised to call or messaged if there is an earlier room. Obviously, there was no call or message, and we returned after 13:20. There were no upgrade of room, even though suposedly when one reaches a higher level of IHG this will be one of many benefits. For a party of three, we have only set of two amenities in our room as well as two complementary drinks tickets at the Lobby Lounge. The Hotel was informed during reservation, that we are travelling with a young teen.Only reason why I try to provide details of this experience is that I do not have much other choices if I wish to stay in the same neighbourhood. I do want the Hotel to improve for my enjoyment.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Staff very friendly and helpful, and the room quality was excellent. A good bed, desk and bathroom. Even a fridge with some free drinks.Not much of a view because you are surrounded by a forest of equally high residential towers, but this makes for a spectacular curtain of lights at night.The Cielo restaurant on the top floor has a good view and some reasonable value food options.The breakfast had a very good range of nice food. Like everything in Hong Kong the tables are quite close together so don't expect private conversation.The hotel is directly connected through the Tseung Kwan O MTR station, simply by walking a few yards through the "Popcorn" mall (well signposted). The hotel is fairly well connected on the MTR system for getting around Hong Kong.The downside is getting here from Hong Kong Airport. One option is the E22A bus taking about 100 minutes for HKD24. You need exact change so buy a bottle of water in airport to break your new notes. This bus makes a tour of the airport freight forwarding facilities then gives an authentic look at non-tourist Hong Kong so has some interest!The other option is the Airport Express train. Go all the way to Hong Kong station then a longish passageway to Central station and take the MTR to North Point (direction Chai Wan) then change to line for Tseung Kwan O (direction Po Lam or LOHAS Park). Ignore the MTR website recommendation of a more complex route. It seems that the Airport Express and MTR tickets need to be bought separately. Note that you can check in and drop luggage at Hong Kong station before boarding Airport Express when leaving.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: We arrived after a very long flight to this hotel and was greeted with friendly smiles and given a free upgrade. Lovely room with comfy bed and rain fall shower which is to die for! Hotel is a bit further out of the main tourist area but it's certainly worth it. Everything you could need is included in the room. Drinks in the mini bar (2 cokes and 2 beers free) toothbrush, toothpaste, dressing gown, slippers and even a comb. 2 vouchers for a free drink in the bar. Honestly, feel like I could stay here forever (shame I need to go home to my kids) Next door to the mall with a huge selection of dining and anything else you may want. 5 mins to the MTR, easy to use this transport system. Breakfast is fantastic (great coffee) I love it!

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Absolutely loved our weekend here, and have already booked our next weekend. The room was lovely and clean with a great view from the room. Breakfast was delicious with many options. The breakfast was open till 11:00, which allowed us to really relax, chat and enjoy the time with family. Awesome view from the breakfast restaurant. Friendly and helpful staff! Everything you need and more!

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Another great stay at this property. Top staff, great service, ample size room. Club lounge service from Chloe was exceptional. I enjoy the breakfast here every time. No complaints, highly recommend this property.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: I stay w crowne plaza hk kowloon east from march 5-9. From check in to hskp everything is fine until th last day. I believe only guest in house are allow to access to th floor and their key card are only able to access to their own floor. But how can a stranger allow to access to my floor and standing outside my door constantly knocking on it? Is a big question mark to me.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Staff in all areas are warm, helpful and welcoming. Guest service and front office managers were all highly engaged. Great team. Convenient to everything, such as the MTR station, shopping malls, cinemas, bountiful restaurants and supermarkets. They are all next door about 50 feet away at the Pop Corn Malls and Tseung Kwan O Plaza. Very clean room, beautiful views from their floor to ceiling windows and great food at Chef's Table buffet. Stayed here twice in the last two months. Thanks to all the staff for making our stay enjoyable. We will be back very soon.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: The experience was seamless and enjoyable--from airport pick, check-in, room service, and check-out. The breakfast buffet was also nice and well maintained. It's a worthwhile booking if you're in the HK area.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Surprisingly pleasant and big hotel. The rooms clean and nice size. The food was very good and hotel employees very tentative to your needs. I will be returning to this hotel for all my business trips.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: I had an excellent weekend getaway plus birthday celebration with my partner in this hotel. Thanks to the great staff Joey who were sweet and kind to offer upgrade, welcome drink and birthday amenity (dessert - macaroons) as a member of the IHG club. The room is comfortable with large bed and nice view. Bathtub is huge with a TV. The hotel is next to a big mall where you can find everything you need.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Every time I visit Hong Kong 2-3 times/year, I have a manicure and pedicure at the Spa on the 3rd floor of the Crowne Plaza in Tseung Kwan O. It is always the best service I have ever had in the world. I travel internationally for work and find this Spa the very best! "Jelly" is my main contact and she is an exceptional hostess and manager. I love going there as it is relaxing, professional, and the best of service to their clients. Every time I go, it feels like I am among friends and family.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Very clean and very quiet,close to subway and shopping mall,very comfortable and the staff very kindly the swimming pool is very clean breakfast buffet is a lot of choice,but the breakfast room not too big, not comfortable for the chair

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: We stayed at the hotel for 6 days, using it as a base for seeing the city. While the hotel itself was excellent and the MRT incredibly cheap and very easy to use, we found that the travel from East Kowloon tiring with a minimum of three trains needed each way to visit the main tourist attractions in the city. The staff at the hotel went out of their way to make our stay pleasant and we were impressed that the senior staff were especially welcoming. With an excellent shopping Mall on its doorstep, its facilities and pricing make it ideal for a restful holiday, rather than as a tourist base. With the construction of new connections already underway linking East Kowloon with Hong Kong Island, access to the city will be improved but this will not be completed for several years. Until then, the hotel does remain isolated for the tourist.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: The rooms were lovely. Large space for Hong Kong. Beds were super comfortable and love the pillow menu. Great location next to large malls and the MTR. Concierge was super helpful! Would be nice to have a shower curtain on the bathtub. Service for the breakfast buffet was slow, and food was running out way before time for breakfast to be over. It seemed there wasn't enough staff on duty to support the number of guests. Elevator slow.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: I stayed at this hotel because of a professional development workshop. And the group partnered with the Crowne Plaza. So as I didn鈥檛 have to pay out of my own pocket I鈥檇 have to say this was a great room for the money. LOL. But it really was a lovely room. Incredibly spacious bathroom with the tub and separate shower. I separated area for clothes. And lovely soft cool feeling linens. Friends and I ate at the restaurant on the top floor. It was pricey but that鈥檚 to be expected with this kind of property. But all staff were gracious and welcoming and very helpful.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: I spent three consecutive nights in a comfortable and well appointed spacious room. Excellent bedding; good quality amenities, tasteful furniture and superb view on the mountains and typical HK appartment builidings.The staff is very coureous and helpful, eager to assist effectively any guest. The presence of a acceptable shopping centre next door is useful; a good cafe "Agnes" just near the entrance of the shopping centre, just a few steps from the hotel. The hotel is located in East Kowloon, which is 20-30 minutes away from Mongkok or Central HK by MTR. If one avoids traffic peak hours, a taxi ride to the same destinations is possible within the same time frame.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: It was my first time to celebrate my birthday at Crown Plaza Kowloon and I was treated with a birthday cake for this special day. Thank you for the arrangement of the guest relation team. I would surely come back for my next celebrations !

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: my letter is not for the hotels Im not impressed at all of it but there is always an exceptionim guest in the room 1608 I decide to spend the last 9 nights in Hong Kong here so I decide to note complen this letter for tanks to the duty manager I don't know your name I called the reception AT 4 in the morning to call me a doctor. he explain to me that the hospital will be better and he arrange me the taxi also the water he was so helpful person in unhelpful hotel so tanks you for you help and you are very professional other ways the foods of the room service have no taste I did not find any towel when I arrived to my room so I need to ask for it I need to ask every day for water and sugar and tea aa long queue to take breakfastthe staff speak English badlyreally so disappointed

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: I arrived at arround 1pm and was politely greeted and went through simple check in process with great English which is quite hard to find in this Country. Room is nice. Spacious. Next to at least 4 malls for you to eat and shop. Also next to bus stop and MTR Station. Will definitely stay here again.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: We chose to hold our wedding party at Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East as we believe that it is an international famous hotel and is well-known by providing high quality service to its customers. However, we are so disappointed that we have a very bad experience on 15 December 2018 in the hotel.We checked in suite room on 14 December 2018. On the next day at 3 p.m., we received a call from your Hotel front desk Assistant Manager, Mr. Matthew Wong that we would have to pay an extra HK$5,000 as a penalty due to some damages found on room鈥檚 desk.We would like to express our complaints to Mr. Matthew Wong as below:1) Unacceptable attitude throughout the whole process;2) We have explained to Matthew Wong that the damage is not created by us, but he refused to listen or investigate further. Instead, he chose to solely rely on internal record;3) Inconsiderately making frequent calls to us during the day that seriously influence our marriage ceremony;4) Refused to provide any official documents for the settlement of extra charges;5) Refused to provide any assistance from him and from any other hotel colleagues and insisted that we must settled the extra payment before leaving the hotel. Not to mention his frivolous attitude of asking us to complain to Consumer CouncilWe had spent over HK$400k in hotel and we believe that we are not supposed to receive all these unfair and impolite treatments especially on this special day. Due to this matter and extremely bad service, we felt very depressed which is is seriously affecting our sleep and emotion till now, i and my husband will remember this matter forever.We would like to have follow up and revert us the appropriate responses, providing us all necessary investigation results including the reimbursement of the unreasonable charge of HK$5,000.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Stayed there for 9 nights over the year end-new year period. This place offers a decent enough stay, considering how far away it seems to be from the city area, major tourist attractions and the airport. However as it is sitting right on top of the Tseung Kwan O station and a big shopping mall, we found it accessible enough. Rooms were nice and pleasant, staff were friendly and helpful. All considered, quite a nice stay. One major inconvenient though was the glass partition between the room and the bathroom, which does not offer much privacy even with the blinds pulled down fully because the blinds are still translucent in certain light conditions.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Location 5/5 next to mall food etcService in breakfast area 3/5Food 3/5Very far from few tourist attractions like disney, ngong ping but well connected by mtrStaff should learn to smile, looks mostly constipated unhappy, communicating was a bit challenging since most staff unable to follow English

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Overall, the place was great and very convenient because it is connected to a shopping mall and MTR station. Though it is far from the tourist attractions and airport, you can easily travel through MTR. Service is good and very approachable.Bed and pillows, aren鈥檛 that comfortable. Our toilet didn鈥檛 have bidet.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: We are coming to the end of 7 days stay at Crowne Plaza. While it is a long way out of the main tourist areas it is right on top of an MTR which in HK is worth any location. Being able to walk out the front door, about 50 yards and down to the train is a bonus as is the Popcorn Shopping Centre that the hotel is connected to. The room we had was quite spacious for 3 single beds. Housekeeping did a wonderful job of keeping us tidy and replenished with water and bathroom essentials. The 3rd bed was as hard as a concrete slab but the linen fresh and comfy. The Cielo cafe on the rooftop had great Italian food and the service was friendly and fast. Cocktails on the deck with a nice surround view was a welcome retreat after a day of shopping. The cafe on the foyer was a little disappointing as the service was slow. The cakes there were magnificent tho. All Xmas themed.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Stayed in CP 2 nights at end of a cruise. Hotel is beautiful, and room was very spacious -- more than I expected in a crowded place like HK where real estate is so expensive-- and well decorated.. Service was excellent, and staff were very helpful. Wifi worked great, even for streaming Netflix on my computer. Location was convenient, with a metro station in the Popcorn mall next door. Bed was very comfortable. Our only complaint was that the bed has a duvet, instead of a sheet and bed spread. I realize that much of the world prefers a duvet, but it's always a mystery to me why that should be the case, and this trip was an example of the problem. We had a hard time keeping the temperature low enough in the room to make it comfortable to sleep under the heavy duvet, and so we ended up having to sleep either with no cover at all, or else we would wake up sweating. That would not happen with a sheet. If we had been staying longer, I would have requested a sheet and comforter, but it wasn't worth it for 2 nights, and I'm not sure they would have accommodated that request. In any case, all things considered, I would recommend this place, and would come back here again. But I still wish they'd get rid of the damned duvet!

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: There is a subway station (Tseung Kwan O) in the same building: very convenience! The staff is professional and empathic. The roof hosts the club and a good restaurant with an extense menu and a terrace where to enjoy nice views. You deserve it.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Crowne Plaza is conveniently located next to Popcorn Mall and TKO MTR station. Very convenient with an array of shopping and dining choices. Top location.Staff are very friendly and hospitable. I would like to take this opportunity to highlight Mr Kevin Kwok. He was very helpful and even though I asked him for several rounds of coffee every time I went down for breakfast, he was patient and had a nice smile. Great person to talk to about politics also. Cheers Mr Kwok, keep it up!Rooms are very comfortable and homely. The bed was clean and soft and the view was amazing. Room service is fairly priced although the wait is quite long. Bathroom is nice and spacious.Very little traffic so I had a good sleep every night. Nice.Moving on to the amenities and facilities, there is a small gym with a few treadmills, ellipticals and a stairclimber. A variety of machines and dumbbells also. Sadly, there are no barbells. But it's still great.The lifts have nice music and nice black mirrors.Overall, it was an enjoyable stay. Worth the money.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Very helpful staff, excellent room, no noise. Well located with MTR station within compound too. Priced fairly. An overlooked gem, as it is not right in the centre people might think it is too far away. Did not try the restaurants in the hotel, as there were so many good places in the attached shopping mall.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: what i like about this hotel is the comfy bed, nice bathroom, spacious for hong kong standards, usb for tv if you want to watch movies on your own.its connecting to a mall so easier for food, grocery and also easier access to the train the mall is connected to the train. and theres a bus going to the the airport on the back of the mall. downside is its a bit far from center of hong kong but since its connected to the train we disnt had problems.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: Horrible experience. First room stank of smoke with white stains on coffee table. Have to wait more than 5 mins for a lift. Room has a menu that is a 20 min quick menu but turns out to be closer to 60 min and admitted by room service staff. Curtains don鈥檛 actually close properly so in the morning the sunlight will wake you up.Puts IHG鈥檚 brand to shame.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: The hotel is located quite far from the city center, but really easy to reach because the MTR station is just a step away from the hotel.The hotel is also linked with shopping malls, make it very convenient to find a place to eat and shop.The hotel room is spacious and very clean, with bathtub in the bathroom. At night it was quiet, good for resting after our full day activities during the day.To us, the only downside is it is quite far from the places that we wanted to visit during our holiday.
