But if you don't mind spending some time to travel on the train, this hotel is a perfect place to stay.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: This hotel in Tseung Kwan O is a 15 to 30 minutes subway ride from the city center; but it is really good value if you don't mind the travel. It sits on top of the MTR station and also a big modern shopping mall with lots of restaurant choices. The hotel itself is relatively new and the rooms are comfortable and modern. The staff provide good service. For the price, it is hard to beat in Hong Kong.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: I stayed in that Hotel from 25/11 to 28/11 (after a relatively longer tired overseas trip ) for the purpose of visiting my senior elder age family members in Hong Kong . Upon check in, I were surprisingly informed that I could no longer be able to make use of the usual self laundering service in their sister hotel Holiday Inn Express next door of which it had not been advised to me earlier, upon my booking and or prior to my arrival. However, I met a very helpful front office staff Ms Jessica Ng and her supervisor Mr Matthew Wong who had tried their very best efforts to get exceptional approval for me to access this laundry service. This usual laundering service is very beneficial to / convenient for me as I had used it when I stayed in either one of their hotels ( I had been their customers whenever I visited Hong Kong in the past few years ). More than that, Ms Jessica Ng had done an extra value added services to find and provide information of external self laundering service firm nearby just in case they could not get approval from Holiday Inn Express. This value added and proactive attitude are deeply well appreciated. I was also impressed by his Senior colleague Matthew Wong who had also tried very hard to convey my request to their sister hotel.I respect the decision and policy of each hotel but I believe customers鈥?need will be considered and taken care of in particularly no prior notices of changes have been sent to the customers earlier. Keep on your good work.....Jessica and Matthew. You both established a very good example of providing well attended hospitality services to travelers in particularly for customers with a comparatively longer staying period in the hotel .

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: We selected this hotel during our first days in Hong Kong. The overall experience was very nice, our room was very big and comfortable with great city/mountain view. The cleanliness was very nice and the breakfast was remarkable.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: We have travelled all over Asia for the past 2.5 years and whenever in Hong Kong we stay at the the Crowne Plaza Kowloon East. The service at this hotel far exceeds all other 4 and 5 star hotels in all of Asia. The breakfast buffet is excellent and the servers are always so kind and attentive. They will even give you a "coffeee to go". We especially like the Crowne Plaza Loyalty Programme. When you are on this programme you are treated like royalty. The servers in the Club Lounge make our stay so memorable. "Chloe" has been our server many, many times and she has taken care of us on such a personal level. Even if we have been away for several months, she will remember you and welcomes you back and makes us feel very special for being a loyalty member. The Crowne Loyalty membership is such an excellent programme. Thanks, Chloe, for making our stay so special. Janet and Kevin

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: We chose this hotel because of past positive experiences with the Crowne Plaza brand, and because Hong Kong is very (very) expensive and this was the cheapest we could find. It is far away from downtown and taxis are expensive so maybe try a public mode of transportation. The hotel itself was beautiful and the room was fabulous. It is connected to a mall which makes for easy access to shopping and restaurants, though quiet. We didn't have a chance to go to the pool but it looked beautiful.

Hotel: Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East
review: my second visit everything was great, service from staff organised another room & change very quickly. my stay was great, convenience but when I checked out ridiculous service from the woman who checked me out. I got refunded my deposit but also deducted an adapter that she said I had taken from the from. when I said I never took it and is still there in the room, she goes ok I'll just deduct it of then if you say you didn't take it. Not even an apology, saying that I stole the adapter. I am very disappointed as the other staff that served us were excellent.

We stayed here recently and were happy with the hotel and our room. It was a bit small but sufficient for our needs. The AC works very well so that was a plus for us. It has a mini-fridge. Shower works very well.

Nice hotel with modern design, room was bigger than I thought, receptionists are great and friendly. Love to spend time with my family at lounge after a long day of sightseeing. Simple breakfast, coffee and snacks are available too at the lounge! Would definitely stay again!

Excellent hotel, very clean and newwith the excellent harbour view roomand really nice house keepingaround the hotel, we can find all of the restaurants and supermarkets easilyand experience the local lifehotel provides the free scheduled shuttle bus, can reach us to MTR station and Airport express station etc. as we take the airport express to airport, is really convenience for all of us.last but not least, all of the Iclub hotel staffs are really nice and helpfulexpecially Ms Joe Lai, thank you so much for your hospitality.

New hotel, small rooms but perfect for what you need it for, comfy bed and very clean. A place to drop your bags and explore!Only downside is the walls to the toilet and shower cubicle are frosted glass and I felt a bit exposed.Perfect location, buses to everywhere you need to go within 2 min walk, nearest MTR is about 20min walk but you can get bus there easily.Staff at hotel good, would recommend as a budget hotel at its best.The breakfast is free and it's got the basics, fresh fruit, bread croissant jams coffee and tea.

You need to turn on the light switch at doors to enable TV and other lights. If you want dark during night you need to turn this switch off. But when you wake up during night you cannot switch the light on from your door, yofu need to go to the doors again. This is so stupid.

Our family had a pleasant and enjoyable experience during our short holiday. The staff were friendly and very efficient with our check in process and sincerely greeted us throughout our stay. Specifically, one of the managers, Jay Fung, was extremely helpful in giving us tips of cool restaurants, shopping areas, and things to see around Hong Kong. Jay had a friendly demeanor and he provided us detail descriptions and even the easiest route to get to get there. We definitely maximized our trip and had great fun. In addition, the clean ambiance of the rooms and lobby made us feel relaxed and comfortable. We were happy with our stay and would definitely come back in the near future.

Room:Not very big but feels spacey, also has a small massage sofa.clean enviroment.Suspected bluetooth and plug-in audit system, but did not try out.Position:Not in the centre of hongkong, but a older district close to that. Makes it very economical while convenience. 10min walk from ho man tin mtr, or 3min from bus stop. High floor room with open old-town view.Close to 24hour mcdonald's, also located in urban. Parking:No parking.A few public parkings around, 8-18min walk.Service:Housekeeping provide towel as requested within 5-10min and good attitude.Express check out with key collection box, solved weakness of limited staff.

Excellent service by Mr Jay Fung. Check in process was really quick as he was efficient and very friendly. The room was clean, cozy and had everything we needed. We would definitely come back to stay here again.

I stayed there for two weeks. It was clean, convenient (bus to Wan Chai or Kwun Tong), had a laundry machine in the building and two laundry services across the street, a 24hr grocery on the other side of the block <1min walk, and a lounge on the 2nd floor with exercise equipment and unlimited coffee.Perfect for a long stay at a low cost.

Got this hotel from my fri,, We got a big window in room that could see the view outside. But not tall enough to see the sea view because we just have a nine floor room. Anyway,, it鈥檚 worth to choose this hotel,,no matter for the view or the price,, also the good service :)Ps: really enjoyed it when the sun comes in

Nice, clean hotel and very quiet for the most part. The rooms are small (on a par with the small hotel rooms in New York) and the complimentary breakfast is very basic. On the plus side, the staff are very helpful and they run a shuttle bus to and from Kowloon Station if you are connecting to the airport. I would return if I come back to Hong Kong.

The room is generally small in HK, so i dont have any high expectation. It's decent enough for one night's stay.If you are looking for a budegt hotel at HK, this is IT.VERY CLEAN!!! REALLY REALLY SPOTLESS!The shuttle bus is quite great!Friendly staff, and speedy check out!~one thing is.... the bluetooth media player is not working...

I booked the room for my family as it is close to my tiny apartment. I expected the room to be really small but it is actually in good size, clean, new and has ample sunlight coming through the window. The staff are friendly and has been patiently introducing the hotel surroundings and restaurants even I am a local.

Affordable place to stay and close to everything (shops, public transportation, laundromat, etc) though its 15 mins walk from the nearest train station. The room is compact but modern and clean. They provide complimentary food and drinks, light breakfast and internet. It has everything you need. It has a small alley beside the hotel which will take you directly to the main road with all the buses and taxis. 15 mins away from Wahpong Garden and 18 mins away from Kowloon Station where you can get their free shuttle bus.I booked directly online and sign up as member and i got further discount and also late checkout (2pm). They put me in the top floor. I will recommend this place since its near the tourist area and its not an expensive location.

A great hotel within my budget, the commute with public transport is easy. Just ask the friendly staff at reception for directions and you can access places with octopus card for payment on the bus for equivalent of US$1 or less.

My husband and I stayed here her 3 weeks and found it very good value for money, The rooms were clean and the shower was wonderful, the room was cleaned , sheets and towels changed 3 times a week. The bed was comfortable , the air con worked correctly, Bottled water was free, The only point I鈥檇 make about the rooms was the lack of hanging space, i understand that the rooms are small that鈥檚 fine I can live out of my suitcase but you do need a little more space to hang items that will crease.Tea and coffee is also available to make in your room , There is a small safe and fridge too. You get a couple of tokens a week to use in the laundry room downstairs , the wash is quick and our clothes were washed well, the drier was quick too , there is also an iron, There is gym equipment and a massage chair down there too and a lovely open air space to sit and relax in the evening in comfy chairs if you wish, There is also hot and cold drinking water and free tea and filter coffee .Breakfast I believe is extra but good. All this is available on the second floorThe staff were helpful and polite, Location was good too, We would stay there again x

This is a small friendly clean modern hotel with plenty of local facilities. The rooms are cleaned every day. We stayed here as we had relatives in the area. I am so glad I chose this hotel. I am not sure why people are giving such low reviews. I鈥檝e stayed in 5 star luxury hotels. I work in travel. For a 3 star it is what it is.

This low priced hotel is a great choice for both westerners and mainlanders. Clearly there are busloads of tour buses pushing through this hotel every day and creates an environment that may feel harsh to westerners but in reality requires you to step back and observe rather than criticize.If your interest is a low priced, clean and convenient offering, please consider. We stayed on a higher floor with lovely views of the street scenes, rooftops and hillside. Great photographic opportunities of rooftop clothesline鈥檚 and 鈥渓ife鈥?in HK.While we were afraid we might be isolated in this corner of Kowloon, after arrival we realized that the bus connections are incredible and get you into the city in less than 15 minutes. The bus stop is only two blocks from the hotel. Make sure you use Google maps or equivalent to navigate you to the stops. We intentionally brought the smallest amount of clothes and planned to launder. There are many, many laundry facilities within a two minute walk (and also in the hotel) that offer either self wash, drop and pickup or automated lockers. We chose the later two and quickly understood how to navigate this modern automated approach. The automated lockers were our favorite as they are autonomous, 24 hours and same day completion. Beware though as it requires that you have a HK phone chip in your phone because they text you a code needed to pickup. Machines all have EnglishI read all the negative reviews about the hotel staff and while we experienced some of the bad comments, having lived in HK for 9 years we certainly were able to understand the cultural differences causing these comments.Keep in mind that you are getting a small, clean and modern room at a low price because this business is simply a 鈥渕achine of convenience鈥?that pumps travelers through on a daily cycle. If you want a fancy four start hotel then go to one!Whatever we asked from hotel staff they gave us.....iron and board, changing of bedding when we thought dirty, extra soap/toilet paper/water/etcWhen we arrived in the room the bed seemed to be positioned facing the shower wall instead of the TV. We simply turned it around and all was good.Enjoy

Can't remember how many times we have been staying at this hotel, we got our membership upgraded to Platinum.Part of the reasons we chose this hotel was because of its price and its 24-hr i-lounge services. You can grab a nice cup of hot water or tea whenever you need.I remember I had sent an email to the head office of the hotel commenting on some issues we've found the very first and second time we visited this hotel. Many of them actually had already got resolved and we saw improvements there when we visited again maybe half a year later. That means you guys really would care about the comments your customers provided. That is good!The rooms were cleaner and more tidy. Even for the attitude of those front-end staff, to be fair, not everyone of them were rude. Some were quite friendly, but too bad it might be just one or two staff members' manner or personality that ruined the overall score! This is yet to be improved. You should understand that the front-line staff is a status symbol of a hotel. Maybe they were working in pressure all the time and you could tell from their faces that they were not very happy.Talking a bit more about this visit, firstly we were given a very high floor room which was good (at least for the first few nights). One night when our next room was occupied, not sure how many people were there but we heard lots of people talking & yelling loudly at the corridor and from the room, it was almost midnight. They just treated the hotel like their home....Sigh! There was a door in between the 2 rooms and we could hear that they had tried many times to open that door. That was really disgusting! We could smell some cigarette and the next day when we left our room, we even saw a piece of cigarette butt in front of the elevator door! We reported the case to the front-desk staff. But, what can you expect. That front-desk lady just said she would send someone to take a look.... Another suggestion to you is : I hope when your front-desk staff gives the hotel card to the customers, please remind them to tab the card before pressing the floor number when using the elevator. We have seen many customers just did not know about that and we had to show them how to get into their floors many times. They were quite miserable and this can be eliminated.

The only thing is the bathroom too small with 1 door bi-usage.No formal or family restaurant nearby, but with low end restaurant for those tourist from Red China.Lots of family restaurant and noodle stalls with 10 minutes walk at the main street at backside. 1 supermarket at the back, and 1 gambling center on left side. A lot of mid-Asian / south-Asian guys always walking around.As a member asked for late check-out only allows at 1:00pm not 3:00pm.Environment not so safe at night.

The staff are very friendly and accommodating. I felt at home the moment I arrived. The rooms are always clean and you can have coffee and snacks at the lounge which is open 24/7. It's close to the airport and most attraction around Hong Kong

I went to Hong Kong in late October and stayed at this hotel for three nights. The hotel is very clean and only a little over a year old. The rooms are small but have everything you need. The breakfast isn't the typical American fare with bread, bananas, apples being the main stays, but it worked. There didn't seem to be very few (if any) public water fountains so take advantage of the free bottled water the hotel provides every chance you get. Other than some communication problems (which seemed universal in Hong Kong; mostly related to directions) the only potential downside to this hotel is that it isn't near Hong Kong island, the airport or the tourist attractions. They do offer a free shuttle, which we had to call to get them to come and get us at the airport upon arrival and sign up for a time to go back to the airport, but getting back to the airport at a specific time to go back o the hotel seemed like a big effort. So instead we were able to take the bus which picks up and drops you off on the street directly south (behind) the hotel and then it is a quick walk thru the lighted alley to the hotel. You can also take the subway which has two stations that are about a 15 minute walk from the hotel. The buses run something like every 6-9 minutes so that was and easy option from the Victoria Harbor area, but I recommend getting an Octopus card because the buses don't make change. Note you have to have Hong Kong dollars to get money loaded on the Octopus card because you can't use a credit card to load money onto the cards (weird ,but maybe because of fraud (?)). Anyway, the hotel is in a neighborhood so I think you get more of a taste of the local culture staying here or somewhere like it and we felt very safe. I recommend it.

My family likes the hotel for its cleanliness. Surrounding area is safe and easily accessible to public transport to get us to many places of interest. Real value for money to stay at iclub Ma Tau Wai hotel.

The location is very good.The check in was very quick and easy the room service is good ,the Wifi network also strong ,The hotel Cleanliness and sleep quality very sweet dream Overall our stay at the hotel was very pleasant and I would rate the hotel as an excellent 5 star hotel

Hotel is very clean and all the staff are very keen to make the customers satisfied. However the shuttle bus driver who I experienced before behaves worse though I lodged a complaint on his dangerous driving attitude. This time he stopped the bus opposite the hotel entrance though he knew I had four baggage. I told him I could not manage n he just ignored me and told me to fix the issue. I said his behavior is unacceptable n I need to lodge a complaint. He just said go ahead :(I feel sorry his bad behavior destroys all the other staff effort

Booked this hotel through British Airways and had a very good deal. There were four of us so we had a taxi from the airport as we were advised that it would be as cheap as using the Airport Express and would also be easier - cost of the taxi was 320 Hong Kong dollars and it is easy to do as there are people who sort them for you and tell the drivers where you want to go in Chinese. Check-in was very efficient. We were a bit shocked to see how small the rooms were as we kept having to ask each other to move so that we could pass! The room was set up as a double and think it is really meant to be a twin room as, when the two single beds are put together, the person on the inside has to climb over if they need to get up through the night due to the bed being pushed up against the window and there being a table at the end of the bed which blocks access. Also the light switches are at the back of the bed and it is easy to knock them on and off by mistake when the bed is set up as a double - they would be between the two beds otherwise. The bed is also quite short - my husband is 6'2" and his feet were touching the table at the end of the bed. The bed is also quite uncomfortable unless you are quite light as the mattress isn't very sturdy and we were aching after each night's sleep. The room also lacks storage facilities with only two very small drawers and a tiny hanging area with only four hangers - we asked for more but were only given three extra. The bathroom is also very small and has very little space for toiletries - however, the shower is really good. I am sounding very negative about this hotel but there were lots of positives - everywhere in the hotel was really clean and room service was excellent. Reception staff were really helpful whenever we had questions. There are three lifts and we very rarely had to wait very long for one. There was a free breakfast until 10.30 with juices, coffee and tea, toast, rolls and croissants as well as bananas and apples. Tea and coffee were available for free all day in that area and there was a lovely place to sit outside. We loved the location as it is where the locals live and shop so it was really interesting - however, some of the apartments weren't very pleasing on the eye and this was our view from our hotel room window. There is no MTR near the hotel (although one is being built) but the hotel provides free hourly shuttles to Kowloon and Hung Hom stations where you can catch the MTR trains. We caught the local bus - the 5C - down to Tsim Sha Tsui which is where the bars and restaurants are and the bus journey was really interesting though took about 25 minutes depending on the traffic. That bus also takes you right down to the Star Ferry terminal where you can get ferries over to Hong Kong Island and Central and Wanchai piers - that was really worth doing as you get to see the Hong Kong skyline which is amazing, especially at night when it is all lit up. The hotel allowed us to check out at 2 rather than midday which was great - we asked about a later one but it would have been 770 HKD just to have the room until 6 which we thought was too expensive.Verdict? Think the rooms would be great if you were staying for just a couple of nights rather than a week as we did as the lack of storage facilities became irritating as the week went by. Also, perhaps the bed would be more comfortable if you were shorter and lighter than we are - also, as I said, it is better set up as a twin as a double. Great staff there and the standard of cleanliness is excellent. Nice breakfast and seating area. Very modern hotel.

Positioned no so far from the MTR station and to Kowloon center , room is cleaned and enough comfortable for a short stay , I had appreciated especially the breakfast already included in the room fee it is very simple but could be sufficient for who travel for business .

1. The breakfast is too simple. There should be some basic food like as milk and eggs. And it is better to offer more kind of bread.2. There is no restroom in the resturant. 3. The servicers do not transfer their jobs clearly.

The rooms are small but very clean and modern. We had a room in the 16th floor with an amazing view on the harbor. Bus stops for many major lines are 5 minutes from the hotel an your very fast at all important places. Only negative point is the "gym" which consists of a handful of fitness devices located in a corner of the breakfast room. Combined with the very small room this gives you no place for a workout.

Booked last min for 10 of us.. upon arrival called hotel and asked for shuttle service , was told NO we don鈥檛 do shuttle. Fine. Arrived and was greeted ( not even) by an unhappy clerk who didn鈥檛 even ask how are we doing or didn鈥檛 even acknowledge our arrival. I had to walk up to him and asked to be checked In. He was more interested in talking personal things with another person. He was very cut and dry and not even looking at you in the eyes. When asked about a queen bed was told with attitude 鈥測ou booked twin beds鈥?I can鈥檛 change it 鈥?Hotel is fine clean and for one night we managed. We were not told about breakfast, gym, or other services just handed out key cards that鈥檚 it.

Great service and enjoyed my room. Oscar and colleagues did everything possible to make my stay comfortable for 3 months long stay. The view was good and they accomodated all extra needs etc to make me feel like home.

Clean and new hotel. Location is good but with no MTR station nearby. It鈥檚 a new hotel so the room is pretty cozy. Although no mtr station nearby but there is still a lot of public transport choices. Overall I will stay there again next time.

Room is small but it鈥檚 efficient with everything you need. The bed is comfy. Breakfast is basic only but okay. It is not close to subway station but it鈥檚 well served by public transport as well as the shuttle run by the hotel. The neighborhood is an old district, which I find interesting and charming (although not everyone may agree). The main complaint is the elevator service as there are group tourists who may take up the lift service for quite a long while, keeping the others in a long wait.

My colleague is a member of iclub hotel.Every time he visit, I got welcome pack with potato chip, lemon tea pack, peanut pack and green apples... it has been no change for years... why can鈥檛 there be change and refresh periodically? It can change to soy milk, other fruits, snacks..

Stayed 8 nights in Room 916 in July 2018. PLUS: Complimentary shuttle bus service pickup and drop off from select MTR stations; free mobile wi-fi device and free during sightseeing in the days with recharger cable and adaptor (leave a deposit for return). Free in-room Internet. Continental-type breakfast of rolls, fruit, juice and coffee/tea in lounge. Use of exercise machines and token-operated washing machines and dryers (1 free load cycle) also in lounge area. A young assistant front desk manager, Mr. Angus Wong, who is very professional in handling problems. A friendly and helpful housekeeper despite a 'green' policy of scheduled bedsheet replacement in the room with overall cleaning every three days (we had full garbage pails that needed emptying, wet towels that needed replacement); 2 complimentary bottles of water. Negatives: long queue checkout if there are large tour groups in front of you. (2 front desk clerks man the counter); standard rooms too small for our four large checked bags/luggage. I would stay here again as it is accessible to main route public transit and taxis and there is a nearby ATM on the same block, a 24-hour McD, local noodle places and a Wellcome supermarket around the corner. Excellent overall (4 stars) and good value considering it was less than $100USD per night (with tax included). Definite need advance reservations during the height of tourist season. Jim & Ann W of NYC

I was allocated to a room of 23 floor, the view is good, the room is clean and modern. the shower is good. the bed is comfortable. only bad point was just found some hair that was not belonged to me on the floor of the washroom.

House keeper Ms Chou Lam Ching has done a great, super tidy job than any 5 stars hotel. She is extremely polite,hard working & wear smiles at all times. A real role model for its other hotel staff. Her high commitment to her work should be highly recognised & complimented. A lounge male staff (name forgotten)who is about 60 years old is another role model who is a person does service from his heart. He is very attentive, polite & shows lots of care to every customers. I wish iClud can compliment these 2 staff for my behalf. Much appreciated!

The staff in the check in counter is pleasant and very efficient, it takes less than 3 minuets to complete the process! The free light breakfast provided is satisfactory and the coffee makes one totally afresh after a good sleep!

Hotel, located at a good location, quite a lot of restaurants with delicious food near by. Staffs of the Hotel are polite & helpful in general, except Belinda, front desk lady, with rude manner and lack of professionalism.

We have 5 rooms and all of us love it!! Very comfortable bed, great view and clean. Price excellent in Hong Kong. We will come back again! Thank you so much to all of your staffs and shuttle services.

Location of the hotel is far from metro station. There is schedule for free transfer to metro. By check-in wasn鈥檛 told about breakfast ... so one we skipped... On reception they don鈥檛 have plug adapters Rooms are clean, schower is very good.

Very clean hotel. I used to live in this area 15 years ago. Good to have a nice hotel in this area. Restaurants everywhere around it . It鈥檚 a good deal as I booked though their website. People are nice and friendly.

Have just completed a 19 day China Uncovered tour with Webjet and Asia Travel. Last two days of tour we were booked to this hotel and have to say extremely disapointing. It is claimed 4 star by Asia Travel.I met the General Manager, Mr Elgene Lee,who acknowledged the hotel is only Budget. This hotel is not in a tourist area of HK. Streets are littered with rubbish.The hotel is brand new and courtesy bus is offered. The rooms are extremely small. Breakfast is continental only and basic with toast, juice, tea and coffee but served on paper plates and plastic cutlery. Towels are only changed after 3 days. If you have the luxury of a double bed and need to go to bathroom, but sleeping on window side, you will have to climb over your partner to get out of bed. Signage on doors of lift indicate late check out of 3.00pm but when you request this you are told midday only. I mentioned Mr Lee's name and managed to get late check out.Tariff may be okay but would not consider again

It鈥檚 a bit off the city center. A 5-ish minute walk to the bus stop and a 20 minutes walk to the MTR station. If you鈥檙e familiar with HK, it would be easy to get around. Free shuttle bus doesn鈥檛 run so often but it鈥檚 really convenient to take an airport express to Kowloon station. The property looked new and up to date. Room wasn鈥檛 so big but it was literally clean, it had everything I needed for an overnight stay. TV had about 10 English channels. Staff was nice and friendly. However, there was one thing I felt kind of disappointed. When I asked if borrowed a plug adapter, the guy at the front said 鈥淣o.鈥?Instead, he said I could get it from a vending machine on site. It was HK$50. I was standing in front of the vending machine for a while and wondering if I bought it. Then another hotel employee at the parking lot talked to me and told me I could get it for only HK$10 at the local store. He gave me the directions to the store and I didn鈥檛 waste my money thanks to him. Overall, this hotel is good for tourists who want a clean and comfortable room at an affordable price in HK. I would stay here again.

I have chosen this hotel because its newly built and very close to all the buses to Hong Kong and Kowloon. The hotel itself is not very impressive to me because its simple decorated and very small. The price for this hotel was acceptable. The main key was couple of stores down the street, there's a coin laundry machine available 24 hours. $30 HKD per load for wash and dry. I'd stayed at this hotel 3x in April 2018 just for the convenience. I would recommend this hotel to any solo travelers only.

We had the misfortune of staying at this hotel last weekend as part of a Webjet tour of China. It was our last hotel of the tour. All previous hotels had been of a high standard. This is rated as a four star hotel. First impressions were of a an extremely small lobby with 2 people manning the desk. Second impression was of our room which didn鈥檛 have enough floor space for 2 regular sized cases. Third impression was of the queen sized bed which was actually a double bed pushed up against the floor to ceiling window 17 floors up. But on arrival in our room the smell. Stale cigarettes. This is a non smoking hotel. So off we went back to the small lobby with our luggage to complain to be given another room only to find the same problem. We were then given our third room and one of the 2 gentlemen came with us to check. Finally a room that had no stale cigarette smell. We decided to go downstairs to get something to eat and/or drink, but no facility like the other hotels on tour this except a vending machine, a kettle, microwave and some mixed nuts with paper cups and paper plates. Four star? I don鈥檛 think so. Breakfast was a limited choice of 2 juices, teabags, instant coffee and croissants and of course all on paper plates, cups and plastic knives. In the room at night the only way to stop the cold air from the airconditioner to stop blowing on my neck as to turn it off. I didn鈥檛 have enough room to sit on the toilet. I鈥檓 not 6 foot. It was a very disappointing end to a successful tour of China.

The staff at checkin counter are very very rude and unfriendly, there tone and attitude is very loud but ther are very good with local people and other forigners. This should not happpen with the customers

What I like the most is the white floor that you can see the cleanliness. As a whole it is a clean room but a little bit tiny. The shuttle bus service is convenient to get to subway but even better if they have a free airport bus pick-up.

Would 100% recommend to anyone and return when I get back to Hong Kong. Staff was amazing and especially Belinda was very nice and helpful.Don鈥檛 expect too much for the breakfast but there are plenty of cheap spots around the hotel.

The hotel is OK, apart from the tiny rooms with terrible noise isolation and the questionable modern design. However, we were very disappointed by the breakfast - half an hour before closing time there was nothing left to eat apart from toast and coffee. Moreover, only disposable plates, cups and cutlery are available - like in a cheap motel. Not very eco friendly. For some reason, during our entire breakfast a single, annoying song was running on loop.

Awesome hotel in a great location that is close to the Ho Man Tin Metro Station. The staff was amazing and very helpful with me finding my way to Macau on the ferry. I really appreciated the help. I will visit and stay again soon. Thank you.

Soap my laptop is dead for the whole day can't use it cuz The hotel doesn't provide It what da hell So you gotta buy it from them What hotel this days doesn't Provide either a universal outlet Or an adaptor ?

The hotel was built last year and it's bright, clean and stylish. However the staff are too young and inexperience in the hospitality industry. They don't look at you when you talk and they never had a smile on their faces, which I think it's very important for the impression of a hotel. Never heard a thank you, welcome or good morning, they just don't care. The most ridiculous thing is, the staff told me the check out time is 3pm in the afternoon (which was also advertised in the hotel), on the day I left I was taking a nap in my room and suddenly someone open my door with their keycard at 12:50pm. They said they just wanted to check if I wanted to extend my stay or checking out. I just cannot believe what happened, lucky I was not sleeping naked otherwise it would be a disaster. I have never written any review about any hotels I have stayed and to be honest, I would rather pay a little bit more and stay elsewhere, rather than having someone to open my door anytime they want.

I stayed for around two weeks in this location, which is my first. I did stay in other iClub and Regal hotels in Hong Kong and I am always quite happy with my stays.Location: This hotel is situated in a so-so neighborhood which I believe was mostly factories and older apartment buildings. It is very convenient if you use HK buses and mini-vans, the A-22 bus stop from the airport is about a block away. There will be a MTR station nearby opening in 2018. There are many local restaurants nearby as well as a 24-hr MacDonald's and Welcome Supermarket. The hotel also runs a free shuttle to Hung Hom and Kowloon stations every two and one hours respectively during the day. Room: standard iClub size with fridge, safe, TV and two single or one double beds, although bed is on the hard side. I don't believe this hotel has bigger rooms to upgrade. Internet in the room was good and water was hot and the pressure was strong.Service: The check-in, check-out was fast and efficient. Belinda and Oscar on the front desk were very helpful and pleasant to deal with. Since I stayed for about two weeks with discount, there were only twice weekly room services. However, you can ask for water, towels, etc. if you need them. The cleaning staff was very polite and professional. They also included one do-it-yourself free laundry per week on the second floor.Breakfast and hot beverages: Breakfast is a simple continental breakfast with bread, croissant, apple and banana. Coffee and tea makers are available 24 hours a day. I don't consider this is a touristy area but I heard recently some of the old factories were converted to hostel type accommodations which are mainland tourist favorite, you do see a few mainland tourist buses cruising around. All-in-all, if you don't care about a little older neighborhood (very safe) this is a good place to stay.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Hotel with high standards at very good prices, central position at Kowloon, near metro and the harbour. Breakfast with very good choices, there is a pool on the last floor to relax after long walkings.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: I appreciate the early check in at 1pm considering we had our small kids with us. I find it odd though that they did not check us in at the executive lounge knowing we are booked at the executive floor. Also they would not accept a different credit card for the deposit other than the one used at booking. First time I experienced it. Check out was the fastest I have ever done. Good job! They also got us a cab to the airport (fare hkd 290)Booking the executive room is the best. We love spending some time at the lounge. Food was great, different each day, plus unlimited drinks. Very good deal. Breakfast is also good. Almost the same menu everyday, but we are not complaining.Staff were a bit stiff to be honest, but there are a few who are friendly and smiles and greets guests.Location is perfect! Do not think twice if you want to be in the center of everything.Wish we had spent more time in the hotel. The pool is inviting but we did not have enough time. We were out almost the whole day on tours. A week is definitely not enough..P.S. no bidet in the toilet :(

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Stayed there early June for a couple of nights. Location is amazing, couldn't ask for a better location. moreover, the room size is quite big comparing to other hotel in the area of the similar price. we're family with 2 small kids with double bed room.the staffs are very helpful from the front desk and concierge. They are very helpful. overall, I cannot fault this hotel and recommended.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Friendly staff and great location. Fabulous hotel. Would recommend to anyone. Staff go the extra mile and buffet evening dinners are scrumptious . Great for access to MTR and all the little hidden gem Hong Kong side streets and bazaars . Great that Starbucks is just across the road and all the local facilities in TST are readily to hand

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Great value right in the middle of Tsim Sha Tsui. The pool area is spartan (no hot tub or kids area), but enjoyable. My only issue is that this hotel makes it difficult to book a specific room configuration through partner booking services. From reading other reviews, this is not uncommon. We booked this hotel for a family of 7 because they have rooms with 2 beds (queen+double, or double+double). But these rooms are apparently given the same type as their 1-king configurations. Makes it highly unpredictable when checking in, and they had no immediate availability for the room we needed. Fortunately, the front desk staff tried to be accommodating and helpful. We had a 5 night reservation and they were able to split us on different levels for a couple of nights with one of the king rooms until more suitable options opened up.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: I stayed 3 nights at Holiday Inn Golden Mile HK due to conference. - The hotel is at very central location of Tsimshtsui, close to all subway station and all shopping malls. If you are tourist in HK, it's no doubt one of top choices; - The room is not too tiny, quite clean; but there is no view when looking out of window as all high buildings surrounding; - Check-in and check-out is very fast, and room service is quite good anytime when you calling for; - The breakfast is just ok, nothing impressed. I only had once, then all went out to have local DIM-SUM, which is perfect; - The price is very reasonable if comparing to other hotels just nearby; Overall, it's very good hotel in HK with great location, nice service and acceptable charge.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Part of room make a so different vision than the rest of HotelRoom are old - rest are perfect - Breakfast, dinner, Desk Lobby, Staff - all is charming and performed.Thanks for the momentPlease install Waterjet in your commodity !!!

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: We stayed in this hotel from 13 June to 18 June 2019. My sister in law booked this hotel for us. There is free shuttle bus from MTR to the hotel. The Lobby looks decent and grand. Upon check in, the counter told us that they do not have our booking...Found our booking after a more experienced staff taken over. We were given room number 404 and 406. The room seem to have some minor touch up reno done to suit the modern needs of traveler but still it is unlike the pictures as shown by others. Am not too sure is it because we booked the rooms without breakfast and was given such or otherwise. (Toilet looks old with two knobs for hot and cold water.) Old wooden doors and cupboard. The lobby hotel staff looks unfriendly everytime we pass by. Probably I would try other hotels if back to Hong Kong. Oh and by the way the room I am in 404 is very noisy at night. I can hear cars or motocycle vrooming past...

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Love the place. Easy access to all the places. And the staff, Anna is really helpful in doing checking to help us to get in our room. She was so helpful. Lucky i choose this hotel. And also love the breakfast.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: We stayed at this hotel from 13th June till 20th June on third floor room 306 . The stay was very comfortable.We requested for a room change on the very first day which was promptly handled & we were given a room 306 with road side view . The location of the Hotel is excellent with MTR in close vicinity and excellent market near the Hotel .The hotel staff is very polite, the rooms however need a little make over .There are a lot of good tourist spots near the hotel "Avenue of stars",Hongkong Museum .The Hotel provided a Phone through which could remain connected and didn't have to buy any other Internet source in Hongkong. We requested Hotel to pack our breakfast as we had an early morning flight and we got our breakfast packed as requested on time at 4.30 Am in morning. One point which i would like to highlight here is the Taxi arranged by the Hotel to Airport TK 6519 highly overcharged us .He took 90 dollars extra on top of metre reading(metre reading was 240 dollar and he demanded 330) and would not let us go until we paid this . We had to give him 330 dollars in spite of meter reading 240. He boldly said complain to Hotel if you want.We took pictures of the taxi as we felt highly overcharged.Except this experience ,the overall stay was excellent and I would highly recommend the hotel .

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Location is the best! Got there from HKIA via the A21 bus. Got dropped off at Nathan Road, about 300m from the hotel. One entrance is right on Nathan Road, the side entrance is on Mody Road where there is the N5 exit of the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station. There's a 7 11 just across it from Mody Road, too. Our hotel room was quite spacious though dated (read: aged). The breakfast choices were very good, however, and the staff were always helpful. They also have a smartfone phone that you can borrow and an adapter to charge your stuff with. Wifi connection was good as well.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Truly located in the very heart of the continental part (not island), the hotel is across the road from the exit from metro station. It makes the trip from airport hassle free. Staff is nice, but behaves like in a reasonable IHG hotel, not in the very polite Chinese style. Breakfast is good.Rooms advertised on the web site of the hotel are not all alike. My room was in the style of 1970s, but in a good condition.Surroundings are all the Chinese eateries and shops and shops.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Very convenient from airport train, many food places around, money changer with good rates also nearby, near mtr station, shopping places all around, good food selection at breakfast buffet, fast check in and check out

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Location is very strategically located in the heart of tsim sha shui. Close to harbour city, avenue of stars, and directly opposite and sides are shopping centres which has plenty of food and shopping to ypur liking. The MTR station is also just right below which is excellent. The stafd were friendly and were generous to upgrade our room and also extend an hour extra late check out.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: I love this hotel. Staying at this hotel made my HK trip pleasurable and special. Esp. like the Handy phone they provide for the guests as it is useful for when I need a map and internet access when roaming around HK. Hotel also has excellent location. Will definitely stay here again.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Excellent work keeping my room clean maintened temperature, keeping clean wash room. Required amount of drinking water And toiletries. Room freshness Friendly aproch, welcoming with respect, creating good atmosphere for stay.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: We had an extremely pleasant stay at Holiday inn Golden mile. The USP of the hotel is the location that is right in the middle of the bustling Tsim sha sui district. Lots of food and shopping options close by. The hotel itself does justice to the Holiday Inn name. The lobby and check in are beautiful. Andy at front desk made things really seamless for us and gave us an early check in for we were tired after the travel. Breakfast was great with lots of options. There were some Indian food options also which we really enjoyed. All in all a brilliant and very comfortable stay.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: The only plus point I see is the location. right next to TST station makes it an excellent location for tourist. But rooms are like a small cave, one can barely walk, no wardrobe, no table, no chair, no sitting...I mean it's basically a bed and TV .. nothing else. Micro sized rooms only good for 1 pax at Max. Staff was nice & helpful. Breakfast options wide but always too crowded.u basically have to hunt for a table & stand in queue for everything. Not coming back for sure

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: We hadn鈥檛 been to HK in years, and it鈥檚 so hard to read through all the reviews, whats important etc.TRANSPORT, from the airport to Kowloon, you would be mad not to take the train, 20 mins and you鈥檙e there. A free bus then takes you to your Hotel door, why would you do it any other way!HOTEL, i was told it had to be close to this and to that, the end of Nathan Rd is the place to be, close to the ferries and to shopping, (not that that is important!) This Hotel is great for location and access to rail if needed.Staff are very good, and my recommendation would be to upgrade to the Business Lounge, free breakfast (OK not free, but included) all drinks all day and closes at 11.00pm.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Located in the main shopping area of Hong-Kong, the hotel has the best access to MTR Station and all kinds of shops and restaurants.The staff is very courteous and helpful. They serve a good breakfast spread.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: the hotel is a great location close to trains and harbor goods shops, great breakfast such a good way to start the day, loved the roof top pool so nice out in the fresh air.Rooms good size and clean my only complaint is the staff from check in to checkout each day no smiles,no thank yous just very unhelpful and unfriendly.. The cleaners and the pool staff very nice but not the staff at counters , such a shame.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: I had a short stayed last week and on my departure day I asked Eunice from the Executive Lounge if there was a party shop nearby where I could buy some simple balloons and decorations for my daughters birthday, as I would arrive home and need to decorate for her party. Eunice apologised that the nearest party shop didn't open before I would need to leave for the airport. However, she then offered me a bag of assorted balloons, streamers and other colourful decorations that she said may be useful for my daughters birthday decorations! Thank you Eunice! you were the shining star of my stay!

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: We had a grand time at this hotel over the weekend. My sister and her daughter celebrated their birthdays here. we were even upgraded to their premium deluxe room and they gave us a nice birthday cake. will surely come back.However, there were drillings going on in the late morning without informing us. Kids got irritated with the sound. Good thing we were checking out in a bit.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: We stayed here for 5 nights with out two children 8 and 9 yrs. The location is great close to MTR and water front lots of shops near by. We have a room with two double beds it was pretty small for 4 people and beds were very hard. Probably just normal by HK standard though. The hotel is very business like and formal it has a pool and very fancy restaurants and bars not really suitable for children but did the job. Hotel room came with a cell phone which was helpful and free bottled water. Staff were friendly and hotel was very clean and tidy.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: I recently visited Hong Kong and stayed at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile, Kowloon. The hotel and staff were marvellous. The rooms were spacious, however the bed was very hard, so if you have a bad back beware. The location was great, straight onto Nathan Road for shopping.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: I just stayed 6 nights with my wife and 2 kids 9 and 7. We started on the 17th floor in a double room. We didn鈥檛 realise this meant 2 double beds but managed well for the first 3 nights. When asked how our room was at the executive lounge (highly recommend this) we mentioned how we were a bit cramped for room bed wise. The very friendly hotel staff were great and kept looking each day for us until a room with a queen and double became available. Although we were in a less 鈥減restigious 鈥?room on the 8th floor we were much happier. The executive lounge provided a nice place to sit, eat and drink the complimentary food and drinks. I would give 5 stars except we found the beds rock hard.Many reviews said this place was dated and run down. We did not think this was the case at all and thoroughly enjoyed the stay here. Good location close to both the piers and MTR stations.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Great location! Shops, restaurants, and supermarkets are meters away. Once you step out of the hotel, you can choose any direction you want to take. You're right at the center of everything. Be ready though for the volume of people around you! Crowd density was very high.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: We stayed in April on a family holiday. (2 adults and 2 children 6,8)The hotel could not be more central on Nathan Road in Kowloon. 2 blocks from the harbour front for the light show, across the road from Isquare. You can walk to Kowloon park and a little further to the Temple st night markets. You can also walk to the Science Museum and the Star Ferry Terminal.We had an older style room but it was fine. 2 x double beds. The pool is on the roof with lots of deck chairs, a bar and a life guard. There is also a good size gym, steam room and sauna. The breakfast was awesome, amazing service and everything you could want to eat. Highly recommend this for an affordable family option in the heart of Kowloon.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Hotel is centrally located in nathan road whcih is the golden mileNot new but well maintainedMall inside the hotelBreakfast is okayRegular sized Rooms Complete toiletriesVery helpful conciergeIGH member privileges

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: For our first stop in Hong Kong, we wanted something reliable and familiar as we adapted to the new time zone and the family's first visit to Asia. Reviews were uniformly good, the location was strong and we landed a good price so off to the Holiday Inn we went.Holiday Inn isn't among my first-line choices for a chain hotel, but this outpost was fantastic. From our initial checkin and every time thereafter the staff were friendly and attentive to our needs. All of the staff spoke excellent English and would walk with you to ensure that you were going the right direction when you left the hotel. Concierge was excellent - every request was honored and their suggestions were great.The room was spacious, clean and on par with what one would expect at a Western 4-star hotel. They upgraded us to a family room which was a nice touch, and we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast that came with our booking. Again, this was a fantastic place to come home to after a day of hard touring. Will stay here again next time I am in HK. Highly recommended.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Reviewing this as a mum travelling with husband and 2 kids. Awesome things - one of the only properties on Kowloon that fits a family in one room. Tight but not as tight as we had expected - 2 x doubles. Level 11 in a refurbished room. We didn't opt for breakfast as there was a Starbucks across the road and we did Dim Sum and a few other breaky options offsite. Location is THE BEST. 2 minutes to Star Ferry, 1 MTR stop to Jordan (Temple St Market) and 2 stops to MongKok (Ladies Market. We requested to change rooms after our first night as we were located by the lift well and this was dealt with swiftly and easily and we appreciated the switch. An item was left by accident in our first room and this took 2 days to return to us despite calling on a few occasions. Unfortunately, we left on a rather sour note as prior to leaving for the airport, we asked if we could please have a key to the toilet to change and freshen up as there are no toilets in the lobby. The gentleman(?) said we could use the facilities at the health club for a quick bathroom stop and change for the plane. He held the lift for us and said just walk up one flight of stairs at the top....we did and all the doors were locked, the pool, the health club, the toilets. Went back down to the lobby and he was furious and advised that we should just ask someone up there. After I advised that there was no-one up there, he slammed his pen down marched to the elevator, slammed the 16th floor button and was quite aggressive. When we got up there and he realized that there was no-one there to let us use the toilets, he swore loudly under his breath, swiped us in and left in a huff. Honestly, this 10 minute exercise to use a toilet was absurd. We had a wonderful stay at this property, we'd stay again however the performance at the end was so unnecessary and left us feeling rather sad and disappointed. The rain that whole afternoon had been torrential and we simply wanted to use the toilets to change into dry clothes for our flight - the mezzanine toilets would have more than sufficed. My children couldn't understand what we had done wrong. I assured them we had done nothing wrong and that the cranky man on reception must have had a rotten day.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: The staff here are very good Club lounge though is going through a training period and staff a bit unsure of themselves and hotel proceduresRestaurant a plenty in the hotel and outsideRooms good sized

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: This hotel is one of the most professionally run and managed Holiday Inn hotels I have ever stayed in ! From the senior management to the polite and efficient cleaning staff (LAN and Candy), this hotel is terrific. The Executive rooms are slightly more expensive but includes breakfast, complimentary drinks and light snacks between 6-8pm every night, so actually great value. Also a perfect location for visiting Kowloon.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: We booked a 3 day stopover in Hong Kong on the way to New Zealand and stayed. at the Holiday Inn. The staff were extremely friendly & helpful. The location could not be better situated within easy walks rom the harbour & shopping areas. The hotel bar was very good and with the happy hour the drinks were reasonably priced. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Booked a 2 double-bed deluxe room for a 4D3N stay. I normally would stay in Hong Kong Island due to familiarity but decided to try a hotel at TST for a change. Check-in was a breeze. As we were IHG members, we were each provided a welcome drink voucher. I was expecting a very small room; however we were pleasantly surprised that the room was fairly decent sized. The room could still accommodate a study desk, 2 arm chairs with a small round coffee table and decent space for 2 luggages. However, while well appointed, the room is quite old and a refurbishment would be very much welcomed. Location is very good as it is just next to one of the exits to TST MTR station. There are also quite a number of restaurants(cha chan teng) around and there is a small mall (isquare) opposite of the hotel. During cooler seasons, you could also take a short walk to harbour city shopping mall. Would definitely consider staying again the next time I visit Hong Kong with my family.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Notice a new uplift in the lobby and the rooms. Always the friendly greetings for the staff whom some have become friends over the years. Great location - walking distance to iSquare and K11 mallswalking distance to MTRairport express shuttle

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: We wanted to stay in downtown Hong Kong to be able to explore the city for a couple days. The location of the Holiday Inn Golden Mile is ideal as it allows easy access to the metro, lots of shopping within a couple metro stops and good places to eat within walking distance.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: The stay was too short to get unbiased impression. Along the stay we experienced great hospitality at the reception and almost hostility in the overpriced bar. Rooms: are made without any touch of design, though quality of beds and shower is acceptable. Location is great, right on the main shopping road of Tsim Sha Tsui and 5 minutes walk from everything in Kowloon. Crowds of guest are inside, but we never had to wait for an elevator or check-in and check-out. Next time will book here only with the good rate offered.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: it is in a good location on nathan rd. however, for a holiday inn it is expensive especially considering other options. and it was loud. yelling in hallways till 3am every day. many wedding and lots of drinking. staff was of little help. at checkin the clerk spent most of the time trying to get me to upgrade to things i did not want. pushy.i will not stay here again.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Stayed here twice in March on the way to and from New Zealand. It's in Tsim Sha Tsui on the Nathan Road so relatively close to the front. Theres nowhere quiet in Hong Kong so you have to accept what you get. First visit was on the 6th floor facing back. Good room, clean and well equippped. Three or four restaurants there, and we eat in the Italian which was excellent. Easy check in and check out, friendly helpful staff. On the second visit we arrived around 8 am, obviously 7 hours to early to check in due to early flight. They took our cases in, checked us in and told us to come back at midday. When we arrived back they upgraded our room free of charge to one on the 14th floor. One of their newly appointed rooms apparently. Excellent room, and the cases came up shortly after we arrivedHong Kong is a bit in your face, to say the least. It was nice to have all the amenities in the hotel (more peaceful) when we needed it. Break fast was interesting. Lots of choice, but as you might expect it was very busy.Great place to stay in HK in a good location

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Room was clean, staff very accommodating, birthday cake, wine, fruit and card provided for my birthday.Kobie from reception went above and beyond to make sure our stay was special and one that we would remember.Thank you!!!

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Hello friendsI am there in March 2019, and I must tell that the Location of this Hotel is Perfect, specially for the Indian and Vegans.Many Indian Veg Restaurants Near with a few min walking distance, and The Hotel is in on Nathan road , shim sa Sui which is one of the Posh Localtity in town.The Hotel staff is kind & Friendly, Food Quality is good but not much for the Vegans, taste is ok.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: The location is good in the heart of Kowloon. Close to MRT. Meals and restaurants are ore expensive in the area. We go to Monkok for meals. I used one of my free nights for the night and breakfast does not come with it, even thought I am a Platinum member. Never had this problem in the US. Room was clean and quiet. Staffs were nice and helpful. They were repairing the AC system and the room and the entire hotel was warm.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: The hotel is extremely well located for getting around. (Near buses and good shopping). We took the train from the airport and connected immediately to the shuttle bus. It is the first stop on the bus route that directiion. Going back, we took a short taxi ride to the train, so as not to stop at several hotels after we were picked up. We found the bar to be "ok" for a drink at the end of the day--quite noisy, though. The Chinese restaurant in the hotel was superb. Rooms, while not luxurious, were clean and comfortable,

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.Apart from being in the best location the staff are so friendly and helpful.We stayed on the 3 rd floor for 11nights and enjoyed every day.Tina and staff were exceptionally friendly and caring nothing was to much trouble.It made our stay so pleasant. We would not hesitate to stay again.Tina gave amazing customer service.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Modern typical IHG property in a great location just off Nathan Road at the bottom of Kowloon just off Nathan Road. Adjacent to MTR (underground) for getting around inexpensively or 10 minutes walk to the Star Ferry to take you over to Hong Kong Island. We got the Airport Express train to Kowloon interchange and then a free connecting bus to the hotel, but a taxi back to the airport, and would suggest that if three or more of you are travelling together, its cheaper to get a taxiStaff were really good...felt like it need a coffee shop on site (unless we missed it). Really enjoyed our stay.....Rooms were great

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: We just came back from a 3D2N trip to Hong Kong and stayed at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile. We chose the hotel due to its location and proximity to the MTR station. We loved being in the heart of everything. Shops and dining options were easy to go to and we had no trouble finding what we needed or were in the mood to eat.We requested for connecting or adjacent rooms since we were travelling with the kids, and they were able to get us a couple of rooms on the 4th floor. We would have wanted a single bed for one room (our room), but none was available (not a big deal). Though not the newly renovated rooms, our stay was quite pleasant. The size of the rooms were adequate for our needs, the beds were comfortable (though one of the mattresses was sagging in the middle, again not a problem as we didnt have any trouble sleeping), and most importantly the rooms were clean and did not smell musty. No trouble with the bathrooms either.On the second day, we decided to request for the latest possible check out time and we were told that the latest they could hold the room for us was 12:30PM. Since our flight was at 7PM, we decided that we would pay the half day rate and keep one room. Phoned guest services and the person on the other line informed me of the rate and told me that if I was ok with that, I could go down and sign some papers. I went down to the front desk and was attended to by Franky. He explained the rate to me and suggested another option. His suggestion was to we keep the 2 rooms and check out at 4PM, with breakfast at the club lounge. The rates he gave was a little higher than the rate to keep one room til 6PM, but it was a total no-brainer. So I went with his suggestion. Eric, the lobby manager was equally helpful and accommodating. Kudos to Franky and Eric, great customer service.I highly recommend the hotel and we will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Hong Kong.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Great location for public transport, museums, shopping and many food options. Stayed in one of the cheaper rooms that hadn鈥檛 been renovated recently - was a bit dated but perfectly fine. The hotel breakfast was really good. Most of the staff were pleasant and helpful.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: i checked in to holiday inn golden mile for business.i stay here 4 times a year,thanks to the exceptional service and courteous staff.special mention for mr ANDREW at the reception who is always ready to welcome you with a smile,he goes out of the way to make sure all the guests are comfortable..i just wish i meet people like MR ANDREW in all the hotels i check in to.thankyou so much MR ANDREW.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: First the good things , the hotel is very centrally located and easily accessible by subway , ferry etc. Shopping and food is all around. My room was recently renovated and quite big. Bathroom was also big enough and everything was clean, there is a small sitting corner with 2 chairs and a low table but no desk to work on a laptop. The room was facing the street and in the very early morning hours a lot of shouting to be heard (seems to be truck drivers unloading goods in the street ). The walls are thin and I could hear the neighbours very well. At check in they had a wrong address on the registration form and I asked them to correct it. At check out it was still the incorrect address and I told them I needed my bill to show my address and not one in China. Somehow the person doing the check out got annoyed by the request telling me that it would take a long time to update ... As I insisted to have my address on it he disappeared to a back office without a word and when he came back it was done but he was clearly unhappy and very unfriendly, not saying one word to me for the rest of the check out. For the location I can recommend the hotel but for the staff seems to be depending on the mood.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Though the hotel's lobby is not so impressive like the other hotels in the TST area, Holiday Inn Golden Mile is really a nice place to stay in HK. It is very near the MTR station so very accessible. The welcome drink was such a nice gesture and the ambiance in the Haris Bar is very relaxing. Fit to cap the night after a tiring merry-go-round in the ever busy HK streets. Staff are nice, except the one who assisted us during check-out, who is quite snobbish and was such in a hurry to check us out. LOL! The room is surprisingly big and the beds are nice. Breakfast is good as well. Also nice that the IHG members are given a separate dining area from the other hotel guests. The golden coins given as CNY giveaway is also a sweet touch. Will definitely stay here again.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: I stayed at this property as an IHG Platinum member during my most recent visit to HK as I had a late arrival and a reservation at another nearby IHG hotel for the following day.While the room and location are both really good I found the service and management at this property to be lacking of professionalism. It started to rain (common in HK) and it wasn't even possible to get an umbrella from the concierge. They offered a disposable plastic rain coat. Really? In 25 years this is the first full service brand hotel that can't give an umbrella to their guests. Insane!I mentioned this to the duty manager and again upon checkout, requesting some follow up from management without any response. Filed a complaint with the Ambassasor Service!I also discovered that the front desk didn't use the previously made pre-authorization from the credit card to process the payment. Instead I now have two transactions linger on my IHG Mastercard.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: Excellent location in Kowloon, large hotel but good service and clean and new rooms. Was very comfort and very kind service at the reception. The underground station to the airport and to HK city is just a cross the street.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hong Kong
review: I鈥檝e stayed at this Holiday Inn Property many times in the past. They are refurbishing the rooms floor by floor. The new rooms are very nice. The Lobby has been refurbished too. There鈥檚 a decent bar on the Mezzanine level called Harri鈥檚 that is a classic HK bar. And a good Italian restaurant too. The hotel is walking distance to TST east and the Star Ferry to get to the convention Center

I like this hotel in HK. I stood the second time there. At night the area is quiet and peaceful. As well it is conveniently located. It takes maybe a brisk 6 - 7 minute walk to Whampao station. And within two station you are in TST. The rooms are a bit small. But that's nothing unusual for HK. Its clean and serves for me exactly what I am looking for. The restaurant downstairs serves a great breakfast. And real good food overall. Love the Chicken Wings.

Hotel has plenty of restaurants and eatery outlets around it. MTR station is about less than 10 minutes walk away. Staff are all friendly and helpful. Room is clean and comfortable. I will come back to stay again

Booked three rooms here for five nights and we were not disappointed , first of all we got from the Airport to the Hotel in Taxi's cost was about 鈧?25 , and was good value as were all the taxi fares in H.K. ,Hotel itself is situated in the "real" part of H.K. among the locals and you will be amazed at the vibrancy of the surrounding area , most of the local area is high rise apartments and many shops selling very local products and many many small food take away shops with some sit down cafe's ( very little english spoken here), dont expect anything fancy but it is a great place to immerse yourself in H.K. life, It is also a short taxi ride about 鈧? to the waterfront where you can get the ferry to H.K. island Hotel itself is great , rooms are small with very little wardrope or storage room , but they are clean and well kept . they have safes and tea makers in all rooms which is great ,A word about the staff they are wonderful , and cant do enough for you . the concierges were exceptionally helpful , front desk was great and the restaurant/bar which is run by Cuman is an experience in how to look after clients ..

nice and cosy hotel...but not suitable for muslim travellers with kids as there is no halal food nearby. And the deposit needed by the hotel is way too expensive even though my room was fully paid before our arrival.Staffs are friendly and room service was good.Hotel pick up and drop is abit confusing for taxi drivers,u have to inform them to pick or drop off at Marsh street.

From the moment you walk into The Nightjar聽bar, you will be greeted with smiles and all your favourite cocktails. This charming vintage bar has a wide range of drinks, from pre-prohibition to prohibition era styles. Each drink has a unique name that will make you savour each sip. You will also have the choice of ordering from their very famous spritz menu. Some of the drinks go back centuries into a classic flavour that holds their ground on their London roots. The bar also offers some speakeasy jazz and blues tunes that will give you a rare atmosphere that you won鈥檛 find anywhere else in London

Truly embrace spectacular Singapore! Here is a list of different places selected by handy聽to make you fall in love with the cosmopolitan city.Singapore CablEnjoy stunning bird鈥檚 eye views of Sentosa, Faber Park, the harbor and more on either of the two cable car lines. Take the Faber Park line to cross over the harbor, whilst the new Sentosa line takes you over the island and its attractions.聽Combine the ride with a buffet on Faber Park hilltop surrounded by forestry and more sLearn about the city鈥檚 historical bond with the water on a heritage tour of Singapore River on its, you guessed it, heritage bumboats. See Singapore from within, instead of above with front-seat views of Clarke Quay, Boat Quay and the famous Marina Bay, along with commentary.聽Take it in the evening where the lights and cooler air make for a much spectacular journeIf you鈥檙e tired of the usual cityscape and feel adventurous, venture out to the MacRitchie Nature Trail. Cross the 25m high and 250m long wobbly, free-standing suspension bridge offering you a serene vantage point of the jungle (also perfect for photo Visit the world鈥檚 highest alfresco bar on the 63rd floor with only a thin glass panel separating you and the atmosphere. A popular jaunt to watch the sunset with great drinks, live entertainment and panoramic views over the islaOne for the beer connoisseurs. As the name suggests, this bar is on the 33rd floor, and is the world鈥檚 highest craft brewery offering splendid views of Marina Bay. Get views of both its giant copper brewhouses behind the bar, and of central Singapore from over the bar.聽

we stayed here for a month with a monthly rental agreement. the rent was affordable. although the room was cleaned every tuesday and friday, the bins were picked up daily. hotel location is excellent with airport bus close by and free shuttle bus daily to 4 locations.

Prosspecial Sav collection鈥檚 roomRoom is spacious, romantic, chicFree wifi Free minibarFree mineral Iceland water Friendly staffLocation-5min to Whampao subway stationFree shuttle bus to TST and hunghom train station Good shower pressure with rain shower Bed is comfortable CleanMany restaurants around hotel areaCutest welcome gift Good rateConsIt鈥檚 not in the business district, it鈥檚 in a residential area but still very convenient Will definitely stay again

We stayed one night in this hotel in our Hong Kong stay. The location is good and is accessible by city bus. The location is not very touristic which we liked better than staying in the touristy areas. The staff were good in providing us direction to place we wanted to see. The room is pretty small (but then you are in Hong Kong where most people live in a small apartment) but it has everything we needed. When we were going to sleep, we noticed a hair on our bed and we asked for the sheets to be changed. They quickly sent someone to change the bed sheets, even though it was late at night. Overall, a nice experience in this hotel.

My parents were meeting us in HK for the Chinese New Year holiday. We live across the Bay in Shenzhen so we are no strangers to the ins and outs of Hong Kong. I decided on Hotel Sav as I figured my parents (first time in HK for Dad) would prefer to experience Kowloon and the more local side of HK, especially during Chinese New Year.The hotel:The hotel did not disappoint. Customer service was great - especially concierge and crew at the hotel's restaurant Moreish & Malt. The rooms are fine...though SMALL even for Hong Kong so bear this in mind when booking. If you prefer more space, then definitely opt for the bigger rooms. Since we were out all day, the rooms were fine for us. The free shuttle to/from key Kowloon stops - Hung Hom MTR, star ferry area, Kowloon station, etc. is great. We took advantage of this each day.Surrounding area:Hung Hom is a residential neighborhood. Surrounding the hotel's immediate vicinity are shops, banks, pharmacies, and great HK cafes aka cha chaan tengs and local hole in the wall joints w/ great Cantonese food. Two blocks down is the Whampoa housing estate which also houses a mall w/ local and international food chains, stores, etc.Overall, we enjoyed our stay and definitely recommend staying at the Sav!

gGreatlyGreat location in Hong Kong. Loved the shuttle bus offered at Sav. Updated and modern with good size bed. Wish my view from my room was better. Used the fitness room and some addition are needed. no pool or sauna here. Wish a steam room could be added. Staff seemed sincere and genuinely helpful. Not bad Sav

Our stay at the Sav Hotel Bolongna was an absolute pleasure. I choose the hotel for our first time visiting Bolongna and I'm so glad I did. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable.
