The breakfast daily was great, especially that the cater for gluten free peeps like myself. We also had dinner there every night and they were always there to help with my food intolerance. Will return on my next trip

I was surprise by the hotel quality and service. While the room is small (as of many other hotels in Hongkong), the amenities provided by this hotel is amazing. Friendly guest relations (even though sometimes I dont understand what they are saying ) but I really had an enjoyable stay here. My key highlight of this hotel is they provided a mobile set in-room in which you can used anywhere. Simply to say, the gave u a mobile phone to use. Free of charge. And u cam share the internet with mobile hotspot as well. So, staying in this hotel will save you on your mobile charges.

I stayed for two weeks and found the hotel good value for money with breakfast (western and Chinese) included. The staff were very friendly and attentive, especially at breakfast.The room was small, but adequate for my needs. It was very clean and bright. There is a gym, a roof terrace with a bar and games, as well as two restaurants with very good food.The location was very convenient for me and is close to public transport: an MTR station, buses and the ferry. There is also a shopping center.The area is also very vibrant and there are loads of places to eat to fit all budgets and tastes: from traditional Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Thai, Vietnamese etc to European and American foods.

The check in process was pretty simple. They only required my credit card for a deposit, that I would get back once we checked out.The room was definitely on the smaller side:basically a bed, some walking space & the bathroom, but since we spent a lot of our time touring around Hong Kong, it wasn't too much of a bother. For the location and the price of the hotel ($858.88 USD for 9 nights), we definitely got more than our money's worth.

It is an extremely busy hotel, but was very impressed by the efficiency of the staff, may it be at the reception, the restaurant or the house-keeping. The room was small, as expected in HK, but was immaculate. Despite being on a busy road, the rooms are super quiet, windows are 100% sound proof. Their check-in time is in the afternoon but having reached in an early morning flight, they let me have my room much earlier on request, as soon as the house-keeping completed. After a long sleepless night, I was extremely thankful for this.Definitely recommended.

wonderful 4D3N. room size is acceptable. tidy and clean. bathroom facilities good. staff polite and speaks english. very helpful (assist us to get a taxi), housekeepers greet with a warm smile along the corridors. local vibes nearby. good, cheap food all around. walking distance to MTR.still dont understand why there is a need for HKD1000 deposit..

Staying at this hotel was a nice surprise, the rooms are very clean and the beds are super comfortable.The staff is friendly and very helpful, the location is perfect. There's a bank right at the corner, pharmacy and money exchange place right across the street, MTR 5 minute walk. A lot of shopping and restaurants nearby.I definitely recommend this hotel, the only suggestion I have is to change the breakfast menu daily. We bought tickets for the buffet breakfast, and they served the exact same menu each day. By the 3rd day we were already bored of the food. Please add a little variety each day, the food was still delicious so we ate it anyways. Great part of town to stay at, you should book this hotel!

Having stayed in couple of hotels in HK already, my expectations were quite low. But, this hotel was way better than my expectations. It鈥檚 relatively spacious as per HK standards. Rooms were clean, neat. Lobby is good. Lifts were prompt as well. Would definitely love to stay again. Deposit, though is quite high.

Good points:- Location - around 5-8 minutes walk to Whampoa MRT. Whampoa area has good fashion shops. There is another MTR station near to it but we opt to take Whampoa instead. Only few transfers to HKG island and Disney.Currency exchange shops are also near but across the street.From cheap to a bit pricey food shops / resto are located from MTR to the Hotel. Make sure you pass by the back street always to find these food shop. Good thing there is a Jollibee branch also nearby. If you booked a city tour, shuttle bus can usually pick and drop you off near or next to the hotel.- Free Mobile Phone with DATA! : Maybe one of the new innovations of these kinds of hotels is this phone. With free minutes to some countries and most important is the mobile data. A big help during roaming around HKG.- Free Mini Bar - Drinks were free / soda / water / juice! But not refillable.- Bfast Buffet - Good selection from Noodles / rice / Continental choices - but same menu for 3 days..- Language Barrier - Not much issue there .. staff can speak English which can be understood well- Concierge Team - Very helpful with bags and booking our shuttle service back to the APT. They also suggests to go via taxi to save some bucks and this was helpful to other pax. But we were forced to take the shuttle service which was a bit expensive than the taxi coz we needed the receipt for the reimbursement. Taxis dont have receipts. And it was excellent coz we had our own mini van all to ourselves!- WIFI - Available in all areas / Signal is good and fast. I still got connected even after Check out!Not so Good points: - Room - I think most of this trendy / stylized hotels have smaller rooms?? We were 2 adults and 1 child and the room was just enough for us to move around with 4 pcs of luggage. Hallway is a bit narrow. Reception is located on the 2nd level so better leave your bags with the concierge if you arrived early.- Check in/out timings - Hopefully thay can change the timings ... Check in is 1500 >pls change to 1400 at least? And Check out is 1100 > possible to change to 1200??We arrived around 1400 and room is not yet ready (probably they are fully booked) We were asked to come back by 1500. we returned by 1515 but the lady handling us in the reception said the room will be ready in another 40 mins. Good thing she checked with the lovely girl next to her and she was able to get us a room immediately. Wished I got her name! She saved the day for us!- Bfast Buffet coupons - We stayed 3 nights with 3 pax / Hopefully they can find a new system in handling Bfast Buffet coupons: total 9 coupons / 3 per day / 1 cpn for child and 2 cpns for adults / with corresponding dates! Be careful not to mix them up!- Shuttle Bus to the Hotel - I thought the Bus will go directly to the hotel but you are sharing it with other pax on separate hotels. We first dropped pax on 5 hotels before we were dropped .. we were the last one. But Shuttle back to the Airport was smooth as we were the only pax and taken by our own MB mini van!- 2000HKD deposit- I dont know if this is for all pax but hotel was booked by our Travel Agency because of Club Membership. They said it will be returned after 2 weeks... thats a bit long.. up to now the amount hasn't been credited back.

I did a booking on 10th Oct for a night stay at this hotel on 14th Oct via a travel website but I keyed for 15th Oct instead. This booking was non-refundable but I told the hotel that I was willing to top up the difference to amend to 14th Oct. Instead of accepting an extra income for the hotel, the hotel rejected the top up and insist I will forfeit the room if I do not show up. I have checked the availability of the same room or even the premier ones and there were many available. Hence I felt this hotel was very unreasonable. I would advise travelers who are thinking of booking this hotel to give a 2nd thought as the hotel can be equally nasty to any errand booking. With such attitude of willing to lose a customer, I believe if there is any unpleasant incident in your stay, you are likely not to get any positive response from them during your stay.

Nice accommodation situated in a nice and good location of the city. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms come with all needed amenities and are very functional and light. I would recommend thus hotel.

We stayed in the hotel for 5 days during Chinese New Year. The room is exactly like the description. Even it is small but it have everything I need. The staff at the Ground floor are friendly and funny. The front desk staffs are professional and nice even they are busy.The only downside, difficult to get a taxi in front of the hotel during the rush hour.

Hotel sav is a lovely boutique style hotel great staff they offer a shuttle to several locations throughout Hong Kong. The deposit required is extremely high the staff reduced the deposit I was grateful. I stayed on a high floor great theme and view, the hotel is near the many stores and the train Uber is also available.

We booked this hotel for three nights and was satisfied with our pleasant stay, the rooms were small but clean. The location was good as it was near a train station and everything was walking distance.

Very handily located near Hunghom railway station and also has its own MTR line a few blocks away from the hotel. Also they have a free shuttle that loops around lower Kowloon. Rooms are what you would expect for a Hong Kong hotel room in size and amenities.

Friendly Staff, Free Shuttle Bus to MTR station & Tsim Sha Tsui, Easy to find the hotel.The hotel is located on The main road. The room is clean. We recommend this hotel. Around the hotel have many local food restaurants.

Not much to do in the area, but they have a shuttle bus to the nearest metro station, which is helpful! The staff have great English and the rooms, although not that spacious, are very clean. I will go back.

We had a reservation for 5 days with this hotel. Unfortunately we had to cancel our whole trip as my husband injured. We contacted the hotel and tried to provided the dr's note but they would not even consider the situation. Once you pay, it's theirs no matter what. We go to HongKong a lot but we won't stay this place ever again. Bad business ethic.

Stayed 5 nights (3-22-18 to 3-27-18) in the dolphin room. This room has a great view toward Whampoa area, even a bit of harbor view with the Kai Tak cruise terminal also known as the old Kai Tak airport. This is my second stay in 2 years at Hotel SAV. The manager was very kind and upgraded us to this theme room. As you can see in the pictures. They go out of their way of decorating, making you feel like in a tropical location somewhere in South Pacific. I found the room to be very comfortable, cozy and clean. The only issue I had is it tends to stay warm during the day even with AC full blast. Overall my experience at Hotel SAV has been fantastic. The staffs are courteous, friendly and dedicated. From the check in person to the gents that carry your luggage onto hotel shuttle. It is truly a great experience and i will not hesitate to stay there in the future.

we chose the hotel as it seems to be something different. do not get me incorrect, there is nothing wrong with this hotel. but its also not special. we go a room on the 25th floor which was great. the complimentary fruit basket = was 3 fruits. what somehow bothered us is that nobody took the time to "introduce" the hotel to us. we only found out some things when we left. the rooms were clean, the bed great ... the size? well, it was small. with a suitcase on the floor it was difficult to get to the bathroom. it might be different for other rooms as ours had an less space.what we did like was the theme of the hotel. it was a mixture if formal with relaxed. the staff were friendly and were wearing white suits. great idea.the location was not ideal. yes, it is near a MTR station but the green line is a bit "off". thus a lot of changing is required.it also seems that somehow the hotel does not cater so much for internal guests. our flight was very late, thus we left the suitcases at the hotel. when we asked were we could change or maybe freshen up ... no idea. we then changed in the public bathroom of the restaurant. not hot, somehow!in summary, we enjoyed our visit but will not come back.

The first impressions of this hotel are very good indeed, modern and quite plush. Don鈥檛 let the hustle and bustle of the area put you off as the noises from street level can鈥檛 be heard in the rooms. The rooms at first appear a little basic but they are modern, clean, tidy and have everything you need, particularly if you are going out for the day which you probably will be in Hong Kong. Nice bars and restaurants in the hotel and complimentary mobile phones to make navigating the city easy and free calls. Great staff too who speak good English, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

The best thing was the staff. The front desk is extremely helpful, and gave great recommendations of things to do in the area. Consider our first day in HK was a level 3 Typhoon warning. It's in a perfect location, walkable distance to all the best restaurants, shopping areas. The room was very clean and comfortable.

We booked this hotel on location and on reviews, and we were not disappointed. We are travelling long term so we seriously keep an eye on costs and Hong Kong accommodation is expensive, Hotel Sav was a bit above our budget but compared to other options this was a good choice . We caught E23 bus from the airport for $18HKD. We purchased Octopus cards at the airport and used these instead of cash which covered buses/MRT also Star ferry and some shops ( $150HKD Octopus loan card and refunded money on return -$9 admin) The stops outside hotel is number 14. On return to airport, you need to go to the stop down the road on same side towards MTR station. MTR was close, we used E23 to go to Buddha Cable Car ( stop down road). Good cheap local restaurants nearby, we found North Viet behind the hotel and the PHO was the closest we have had to Vietnam. 7-11 nearby for cheap drinks. Our room was comfy, reasonable wifi and clean.

Recently stay for 15 nights at this hotel (with 11 consecutive days of cold weather warning) , it was an OK experience given the price I paid for.An very interesting fact I learnt from this hotel was that there was no heating available at this hotel, the thermostat would let you to choose , say 28c, but the aircon can only do fan or cool air. So it is impossible to get the room temperature higher. Initially I thought the thermostat was faulty and ask the front desk to check, a few minutes later a lady from housekeeping shown up and told me "there is no heating in any hotel in Hong Kong".I found that very interesting, even my local friends found that unbelievable.The room's sound proof is minimum, I could easily hear the conversation from next rooms.A very interesting observation was guests like to engage loud conversation at the corridor with their room door opened. maybe because the rooms are too small to fit in all of them.I can confirm the fact the lifts were slow and small, better avoid during morning check out peak hour.The staffs are in general very helpful.If the ground floor has better signage to let guests know where is the reception and the Chinese restaurant would be better, as when I was waiting for my shuttle bus to the airport, I was asked about direction 5 times in 30 mins.I'll stay again if the weather is no cold.

I'm not an Hong Kong expert by any means but looking for an affordable place to stay proved to be a hard task in December and January. Many hotels that suited my budget had horrendous reviews claiming them being cramped and dirty - and the ones that looked nice and presentable were too expensive - even if they were rather simple and not some five star establishments. Sav was one of the two mid-range ones I stayed in and I am happy that I did. Even though it's not as central to hustle and bustle of Mong Kok, it's still in a good location and the hotel itself is fabulous, especially if you get to stay in one of the upper floors. It's also meticulously clean, modern and not as cramped as some of the reviews will let you believe. I loved the modern decor and the natural light in the rooms. Something to grumble about? No reading lights by the bedside and perhaps the room was also slightly cold. Otherwise quite a lovely experience, also enjoyed the breakfast.

Check in is on level 1. We took the E23 airport bus here for $18 hkd one way. The stop is opposite the hotel. They have a very long check in process. They take all your details including copies of your passport and credit card. We were there for 10mins. Our room was located on level 22, there are about 20 rooms on each floor. The room and bathroom was very tidy and functional. The number of light switches for one room was a bit confusing also make sure you don't leave the do not disturb light on when you leave the room for the day as you will need to call for housekeeping services, easy mistake with all the switches! Aircon unit was great and easy to operate. The best part is the mobile phones connected to the network which you can use, there is one inn every room. We didn't need a SIM while in hk this time. We used the mrt everyday, the whampoa station is about a 4min walk. On the last day we realised there was a whole new area close by that we didn't explore - Whampoa Gardens. There are some good eateries and a fashion mall in this area. We would definitely stay here again next time.

Surprise to find Hotel Sav provides Handy Phone with 3G free. We took the phone out with us and tethered. We could also call Home (FREE)! The hotel is also near to the Whampoa MTR station and there鈥檚 free shuttle bus services to Hunghom MTR Station, Tsim Sha Tsui and Kowloon MTR Station.

this hotel is everything you hope for in a cheaper place in HK. the location isn't bad, pretty close to the train. the included breakfast was pretty good, with a mix of chinese and western style food. the service was the best part of my stay here. on arrival i was asked for a card to pay the deposit on the room, i handed them my debit card and was warned that it could take months for my deposit to be returned if used that card. i didn't have enough in cash to cover the deposit and didn't want to find an atm in the middle of the night, so they kindly took the cash i had on me for the deposit. i would definitely stay here again.

This is my 2nd stay at the hotel. A return stay due to pleasant first stay. I was utterly dissatisfied.Frustration 1. The standard room is super tiny. Is one of those which after placing suicase on floor, the only way to pass by is to jump over it. Because of that, my floor wasn't thoroughly vacuumed during my stay. It as close to disgusting.Frustration 2. Hotel management urgently need to redesign the elevator traffic flow. More than one I had to wait for lifts for beyond 10mins. The same set of 3 lifts that transport everyone from ground floor entrance to first floor lobby and 25th floor of room. It was a pain point. Add on with some less considerate hotel guests ...Frustration 3. I was having difficulty to communicate in English with some hotel staff. And I turned up to check in passed check in our, I was merely told my room wasn't ready and requested me to leave luggage and return in an hour. Had I asked for a favour to check in early I can accept, but legitimately after formal check in hour and casually being told so, no formal apology no compensation. I found the ignorant bizarre.Ok on a good note, I love the location. The local neighbourhood is great to experience a real HK life. Endless choice of local eatery in the immediate homely vicinity.

I did not plan my trip in advance and Hong Kong was full because of a trade exhibition, so I booked SAV without knowing the hotel. The location is good, next to a metro station. Rooms are tiny, cleaning is not perfect (you can see the same stain on the floor in the bathroom from one day to another), there is no space like a wardrobe. I found the staff cooperative, especially the ones in charge for luggage and taxis, they really care for you. One of them brought me a complimentary bottle of water just seeing me fighting with a vending machine...

Its not the location (a relatively booring residential hood), its not the rooms (really small and not too clean), absolutely not the breakfast and not the service (it takes you 10 to 15 minutes to check out if you Are lucky...), all is average minus. And thats weird price taken into consideration (at High end its relatively expencive). No, its their genious HANDY, a portable devise you find in all rooms, that you can use as your Wi-fi hotspot wherever you Are in Hong Kong while being There, it save you Money and its easy.. Loved that one! But thats all.

We arrived at the hotel around 9.00am and although we checked in our room was not available until 2.00pm and were made to wait around until then.I guess this was to be expected but it would have been nice to be offered some refreshments while we were waiting.Once in the room it was on the small side but we new this would be the case from previous experience in Hong Kong. The bed is pretty hard and although we had a smoking room the windows did not open at all so we could not smoke even if we wanted to.The rooms could do with a fresh coat of paint as they are looking a little tired. They provide you with a mobile phone but we were too scared to use it as the cost of loss or damage was not worth the risk.The hotel is located just a 5 minute walk to Wampoah MTR anf there are plenty of shops and eateries nearby.The biggest disappointment was that despite knowing we were checking out at 6.00am they did not make provisions for breakfast or even a cup of coffee. Breakfast normally started at 6.30am so for the sake of a few minutes they could have provided a better customer experience rather than a flat NO when I asked for a drink.I doubt if I will return to Hotel SAV on my next trip to Hong Kong it was not very inspiring.

Room is very clean and facilities are very well maintenance. It is not too far form MTR Whampoa. The hotel also provides free shutter bus to center of Kowloon and Tsim Sha Tsui. The only problem is you cannot go to Tsim Sha Tsui or Hong Kong center directly without changing MTR lines. The hotel is located on resident area so it is not too busy and as commercial areas. You can find a lot of food to eat near hotel too. Staffs are very warm welcome and very good service mind.

Hotel Sav is in a lower middle class busy area. Learn the bus routes & are blocks away. A newer hotel but walking a few blocks in a hot summer day can get you in full sweat. Free Shuttle bus, smart front desk. Busy occupancy.

I stayed here on two separate nights pre and post a cruise. The rooms were spacious and bigger than other rooms I have stayed in in HK, at a much reduced rate. Depending on the configuration, one room seemed more spacious than the other, but both were certainly adequate space wise. The bed was comfortable, the air conditioning cold ( a bit too cold at times ), the shower area spacious, the water hot and good pressure. There is a small fridge with included free water and one soft drink / fruit juice. The wifi easily connected and worked well. I did not eat here so cannot comment on the food. The hotel only has 3 elevators which can make the wait a bit long some times but that's a minor issue. The staff were all very nice and friendly with good English and they looked great in their white bottoms and coloured tops. Check in and check out was streamlined and no problems.The young men in concierge were lovely on both visits, helping with getting a taxi, keeping me up to date when the airport bus was running late, opening doors and helping with luggage. The hotel is close to two subway stations. There is a shopping centre down the road and plenty of convenience stores close by. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Sav and would certainly stay here again.

Stayed there for 4D3N with a couple of friends and we really enjoyed the stay there. The room is a bit small, but it's expected of Hong Kong's accommodation. Friendly staff, clean and nice quiet environment. Will definitely recommend this hotel to friends!

Check in - Contrary to some reviews, check in was fast for 3 rooms, we ended up all on the non smoking floor with rooms close by which was exactly what we requested.Room- Clean but very small, with no chair or desk for 2 of the rooms, our complimentary bottled water did get replenished every day. Bed was comfortable. However, rooms were very humid, if AC was on low then the room felt very stuffy.Concierge very helpful in letting us know where the closest laundry facilities were and how to get to other places.Check out was fast tooVery good Chinese restaurant on site.Elevator very small.However, can't say will go back, the location is a bit out of the way, even within reasonable distance to 2 subway stops, it was just too hot to walk on the street. The neighbourhood is an old one, however with a lot of food choices. The hotel itself has maintenance issue, specifically the humidity issue, which may cause it to be run down pretty soon if not remedied. But price was reasonable

We arrived in Hong Kong very early on Saturday morning on a flight from Frankfurt.We had booked a shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel which ended up being quite expensive. We checked in immediately, but were unable to get our rooms until 3pm which made things very difficult as we were very tired from a very long sleepless flight. Luckily we were able to check our bags in with the concierge and go exploring for the day. We called the hotel a couple of times to see if our rooms were ready early (having explained our situation) however we were not given access until the 3pm check in time. While this is their official check in, we have stayed at many hotels who go out of their way to get the room ready early, so we felt this could have also been accommodated in this instance. The room itself was very small - but that was to be expected here, where space is a premium, and the room was very clean and modern. The air-conditioning worked very well and the bed was comfortable. We had the 19th floor and the view was not too bad, once the lights all came on. Breakfast was lovely and our server was very excited to talk to us about his country and what we could see there (I think his name was Tony) He was very helpful and it was nice to chat to a local. There was a free shuttle bus available to us, but we had to work that out for ourselves. It would have been really good to have been told about it by the reception staff on the morning we arrived, as we had no idea where we should go and being so very tired it would have cut out a lot of walking. The location was very good and gave us the opportunity to see both the old and new within a very short walk of the front door. Would I recommend it to others? Yes, as long as you don't want to check in early and look downstairs with the concierge for the free shuttle times and pick up locations.

Overall, hotel is fantastic, only let down which is common in Hong Kong, is the size of the room, wow it was incredibly small for 2 people, but at the same time luxurious. Loved the free shuttle bus the hotel offered. Staff are fantastic and make the hotel what it is. Ultra modern hotel not too far from the city itself.

Good price for this level of quality. Hotel lobby is very contemporary... would not recommend for travelers looking to immerse themselves in "traditional Hong Kong." About a 10-minute walk from Hung Hom Station (for the intercity train to Guangzhou) and within walking distance to a nice mall as well as the stop for the cross-harbor bus to Central. I like the smartphone they let you use for free, just make sure to log out of your email and social media accounts at the end of your stay. Elevators were congested and shower controls were not self-explanatory, but otherwise this hotel was fine... I definitely wouldn't want to hang around it during the day, but most people in Hong Kong will be out and about a lot so that doesn't really matter.

This is a wonderful hotel in Hong Kong. This hotel has free shuttle bus to train station and popular shopping areas. They also give you smart phone to browse the web and make international calls. They give you free water and soda as well. Customer service is good and the room is clean.

Good place to stay for travellers who wants to see small markets (fruit markets, local stalls). Hotel staffs speaks good english and provide complemetary bus to Hung Hom Ststion too. About 600m walk to the nearest MTR ststion called Whampoa station.

Nice buffet, rooms are cute and cozy. Location is decent too, right next to the centre of Hung hom where all the magical food and shopping is :) Good value for a hotel in a rising popular district, with an Mtr station a few minutes away!

We stayed here for one night. The Front Desk staff was professional, prompt and efficient throughout the check-in and out. Our room has a view of the Harbour and it was so nice. The outdoor pool on the 3rd floor was chill and nice as well.Thumb up to the Concierge team especially the Head Concierge Mr. Louis Tsui. His service was top notch and always made is feel extremely welcome. Highly recommend this hotel.鎴戝€戝湪閫欒！浣忎簡涓€鏅氥€?鍓嶅彴宸ヤ綔浜哄摗鍦ㄨ睛鐞嗗叆浣忓拰閫€鎴挎檪閮藉緢灏堟キ锛岃繀閫熷拰楂樻晥銆?鎴戝€戠殑鎴块枔鍙互鐪嬪埌娴锋腐锛岄潪甯稿ソ銆?涓夋〒鐨勫澶栨父娉虫睜涔熼潪甯稿ソ銆傛杩庝娇鐢ㄧΞ璩撳湗闅婏紝鐗瑰垾鏄甯Ξ璩撳徃Louis Tsui鍏堢敓銆?浠栫殑鏈嶅嫏鏄竴娴佺殑锛岀附鏄畵浜烘劅鍒伴潪甯稿彈姝¤繋銆?寮风儓鎺ㄨ枽閫欏閰掑簵銆?,July 3

This is my second time to stay here.I'm so glad the hotel staff still remember me with a warm welcome. My room has been free upgrade with a nice view. The receptionist was so efficiency even under the hot and humid weather in Hong Kong. I definitely will come back again.

Had a fantastic 4 nights stay at Dorsett before travel to Thailand. Around 8 minutes walk from MTR stations or you can take hotel shuttle bus. The room with good design, comfortable bed and everything is spotless. The Reception staffs are so nice, efficient and always carrying with a smile. During the check in and check out, concierge staff always take care my luggages. Will come back again next year!

Dorsett has a decent value for money for most travellers. We had a transit stay here but still mad full use of the hotel shuttle service, good food options and lively breakfast.The pancake counter at buffet breakfast was always in demand, so was the live omelette counter.Overall, decent place to stay, especially if you are visiting Hong Kong for transit. Just one disclaimer: Their service levels are questionable. Alan, at the reception was our saviour. He was quick, receptive and very warm.Barring him, these guys really need to work on their service. Overall service level is a big question mark !Sometimes you feel as if they are doing a favour on you !

We stayed here for 5 nights and very surprise that could find a big size room in Hong Kong with an affordable price. Ok so it's located in an industrial area but only 10 minutes walk from subway and it's fine for us. We had a great time at the outdoor pool, it's not too big but quite chill that the skyscrapers around you when swimming.

I stay at this hotel at least once per year. The location is very convenient to our office location, Kwun Tong Station, and the attached mall. Rooms are smallish, but clean. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful.

Good hotel with comfortable and clean room. Friendly staff and our check in was smooth. The breakfast was quite good. While the hotel is some distance from the city centre, transport services are easily accessible and available from the Hotel. I would Highly recommend Dorsett Hotel.

Visit Hong Kong by myself, study from the web and blog to see things to do in the city. Thanks to the staff help, much easier to find the way to my spot. The interior of hotel is decorated with lots of light with an attractive smell, quite impressed.

Nice and comfortable stay. Located in Kwun Tong Industrial locality. Close to.subway MTR and also close to kowloon bay. Did not try food as I am a strict vegetarian. Rooms are spacious considering other hotels in Hong Kong.Overall a new hotel with modern amenities and other facilities like gym and swimming pool. Which were unfortunately close during our stay because of maintainance.

Office moved and first time staying in this hotel. Located in some kind of industrial area but surprisingly quite, room size not that big but enough for me, especially in Hong Kong. Most impressive is the team of nice staff from the door to room, highly recommend.

Great Service with a smile nice rooms although my view was poor. Breakfast was good plenty of choice but biggest issue for me was no lounge or bar and on a business trip it's important.It is great for the business district and commuter travel with the metro.

The hotel was very comfortable and the staff very welcoming. The room was clean and more than adequate for our stay. The hotel offered a free shuttle service into the main area and the train station is only about 8 minutes walk away. All in all a very nice hotel.

This hotel was good, but not great. Rooms were okay, although our showerhead was leaking and needed attention. Disappointing breakfast. Biggest problem was location. Had to use the MTR service every day to get to all the popular sights.

It's a great place to stay - room was sizable and clean, staff was efficient, price was acceptable. We would recommend you to request a non smoking room if you don't smoke. We accidentally went on a smoking room floor and the smell was strong. Location was not the best but it's close to Kowloon Bay station. You can also take a ferry from the pier to the other side. Plenty of options there so it's not a problem for us.

My husband and I stayed here overnight before our cruise and had a very comfortable stay. It was also very reasonably priced . On arrival by taxi two staff members from the hotel came rushing to recieve us. They guided us and helped to carry our luggage to the reception before we could say anything. Smooth and fast check in with all important information provided . Sorry I forgot the name but the girl who checked us in spoke really good English and had excellent customer service skills. Our room was on 25th floor with a nice view and very peaceful and quiet . The wifi was very fast and it was nice to have the kettle to enjoy tea and coffee in our room. Our request for a little late checkout was also granted happily without any extra charge. We didn鈥檛 use the shuttle service as we just relaxed in our room but it is a good complimentary service if anyone wants to explore more. We would like to thank the team of Dorsett Kwun Tong for a very comfortable stay and we will be back again when we are in HK.

Before a cruise we decided to spend one night in Hong Kong. Holland America set up the hotel for us. There is a free shuttle to the area to see the lights on the harbor. We used the red taxi from the airport which was $330 HKD. We decided not to use the airport bus, but there is a free shuttle provided by the hotel from where the bus drops you off. The breakfast buffet provided plenty of options.

I travelled alone to Hong Kong as it had been on my bucket list for a number of years. I chose to stay in the Dorsett Kwun Tong. It's a 4 star hotel and is out of the way from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong. I found the hotel to be very clean and the customer service was second to non. I used the swimming pool on my first night. The pool itself was very small and the surrounding buildings were able to see you sunbathe or swim. Not really an issue for me though. The room was very cosy not very big but excellent, the bathroom was also very nice and had a shower no bath. The hotel is a 7 - 10 minute walk to the near MTR station (Kwun Tong). I arranged for a free shuttle to take to me back to airport. I was dropped off at Kowloon and took the airport express to the airport.When I arrived I took the MTR from Hong Kong Int to Kwun Tong This took about 45 minutes. Overall the hotel was excellent, nice big beds and a great range of TV channels. Even though it is a trek to the main attractions I would certainly recommend the hotel.

I had a room with view at the 19 floor as i remember and the view was awesome, the breakfast was so good and the hotel was clean, the hotel is in knuw tong, hong kong is one of the best countrys i had even been in, i only didn鈥檛 like the foods ...

We had a pleasant stay at the hotel. It was our anniversary vacation and was given a cake in our room, of which made our anniversary stay more special.The reception area staff were extremely welcoming and helpful, especially Martin Fung, Thank you!!!The room was small but very clean and facilities were excellent.The restaurant breakfast had little variety and restaurant staff at times were not very welcoming and at times not very helpful. There was no egg station and some plates were not washed properly. I do feel the Resturant needs updating as the hotel is quite modern compared to the restaurant. On the whole, We had a good experience. Thank you for helping to make our anniversary trip a good one.

The room is exceptional and cosy . I am out of words the staff can communicate well in English which was my fear . Very close to mc Donald鈥檚 too . Wifi speed is great . Close to the cruise terminal . Great value for money you won鈥檛 regret staying here . The pool area is amazingly beautiful

Wonderful place. I recomended very hot. It's a nice place for stay when you visit Hong Kong. The staff is kind. I will visit again in my future trips to Hong Kong. Lovely hotel. There is and suttle bus to different parts of the city.

First of all, you need to know that this hotel is far from everything fun. We picked it based on the price and good reviews. It was fine enough for our few days in Hong Kong but I wished I had done a bit more research. The room was small and modern and well designed, the bed was extremely hard, and it seemed to take forever to get back there at the end of a long day exploring. We wished we had picked something more central so for example, we could pop in for a quick nap after a long day or outfit change/ souvenir drop off before dinner. Next time we go to Hong Kong, I would spend more money and stay somewhere right in the middle of all the fun!

I think the hotel has been consistent with its services. It's my third time to stay with Dorsett Kwun Tong and I was happy to expect clean rooms, like how it was with my 2 previous stays. I hope that I get to stay a bit longer in the future.Thanks again as usual, Dorsett Kwun Tong!

I have stayed here on about six occasions and have had multiple disappointing experiences. I have only kept (grudgingly) coming back because it is so close to my work. If you have any other options, I strongly encourage you to consider them. --I needed help scanning a very important document for my work at 3:00am (after their business center was closed). The man at the front desk refused to help and went back to watching a movie on his phone. Mind you, this was a scan, not a copy (i.e. It costs the hotel $0, especially at 3:00 am when the lobby is empty and nobody is checking in). --I went on a few day long trip away from Hong Kong and planned to return to the hotel afterwards. I took the hotel bus to the airport express station in Kowloon. Upon my return to Hong Kong, I planned to take that same bus back to the hotel. I went outside 30 minutes before the scheduled departure time at the same place it dropped me off at a few days earlier and the bus never came. Upon calling concierge, they said the bus had arrived at the scheduled time and already left. This is false. The area where the bus stops is not crowded at all so it would be inconceivable to miss one of the few busses coming into that area. Do not rely on this bus. A couple of smaller negatives about the hotel:--You WILL get a twin bed room if your travel agent does not guarantee room type. Among my roughly six stays, I have tried calling ahead, checking in at the earliest possible time, and leaving a note with my travel agent. All but one time I received a twin bed room. I'm convinced there are very few full size bed rooms in this hotel. --They charge for luggage storage. Keep this in mind if you want to take a trip for a few days away from the hotel. This is unheard of at any reputable hotel brand (think Hyatt, Marriott, Holiday Inn, etc... ).--General unenthusiastic attitude. Staff are a bit cold. I'd recommend that they be a bit more welcoming at check-in or at the door. It wouldn't be fair if I didn't include a couple pros, so here they are:--Bed is soft--Rooms are generally clean

Hotel is clean and spacious with nice view. They even allowed me to have an early check-in. Staffs are friendly and very helpful. Hotel鈥檚 location is of walkable distance to MTR station and a shopping mall.

I travel to Hong Kong for business trip. Dorsett Kwun Tong is located in prime location of my clients' office. The room size is good (in standard of Hong Kong hotel). Room is modern. Hotel facilities and amenities are good. The service is also really good. I had just little problem about flushing of toilet. Overall is satisfy and shall be back to stay again.

This hotel was booked for us for 2 nights at the end of our cruise so we didn't choose it but it was a good place to stay. The rooms were an acceptable size and everything looked newly decorated. Good shower and toiletries. This is a high rise hotel so some rooms have good view, although ours didn't. The room had everything you needed including a free worldwide phone which was handy. Complimentary water. The check in staff were magnificent, giving us lots of advice about the MTR, taxis, where to go and what to see. A very personal service. They also checked out taxi bookings at the end of our stay - nothing was too much trouble. The reception area has a concierge and a snack area. There was a restaurant but we didn't use it as the food looked rather unusual. The area is not particularly a tourist one and we struggled to find somewhere to eat on our first evening. Everything shuts quite early in this area. It's about 30 minutes on the MTR to the centre of the city.

Room users nearby were extremely noisy starting from last night in corridor (public area) and I was being awaken early this morning by those people as they were opening the doors and shouting out loudly, it was terrible especially in Sunday early morning saying 7 am, I called the front desk to help and asked why hotel allowed guests to make noisy in public area instead of their own rooms. The manager returned call with ridiculous reply and asked me to change rooms (as I stay 6 nights in this messy hotel). I was shocked as I am the victim which hotel cannot take immediate and proactively approach to stop them making noise in the public corridor, the manager requested me to change room, what鈥檚 the logic behind? I told the manager, my request is simple. I want to have a pleasant environment for taking rest, is this an unreasonable request? This hotel cannot provides you basic hotel requirements, sleep well and taking rest is not a allowed even in your room. And hotel encourage others making noise in late night and early morning in public area. This is the real case and I cannot sleep again. The noisy people only stay 2 nights while I don鈥檛 know why people will stay only 2 nights for making noise in corridor. Hotel manager concept is weird, he did not treasure long stay and punctual guest, they welcome noisy and rude guest. If you want noisy and weird hotel, this is the one you have to choose, I have many years of hotel stay experience and this hotel can rank 鈥渢op 1 noisy weird hotel in the world鈥?,March 24

The staff are professional and helpful at all the time. They share lots of travel informations we need. Room is spacious and clean. Hotel is quite convenience to the metro station, just take around 10 min by walk and there is a free shuttle. The best thing is that we got a free phone with internet and carry with us all the time. We definitely will stay again.

Very nice hotel though in a quieter area, a bit dark at night. Staff were helpful & breakfast spread was good. We had a room high floor facing north. Quilt was too thin & aircon no heater. Wore 3 layers & socks at night through our 4 days stay there.

I was there for 4 nights and its a Nice hotel and great view , the personnel are so nice in the restaurant we like it , 100 meter from the APM center and atm is there that u can move with everywhere in HK easily

Very Clean, neat, spacious and comfortable hotel. All necessities are provided. Very well located. Kwun Tong MRT station walking distance. Staff were very helpful. Hotel provides a shuttle service. Bottle water provided daily which is great. A mobile is made available for use. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Best visit in Hong Kong. Very friendly and cordial staff. Offering services before we even asked. They gave each a local phone with full wifi access. Delicious breakfast and one of the best cup of coffee I've ever had. Beautiful and clean room with 24 hr 4G wifi and exercise room access. I'm here on vacation, but can envision a perfect place to stay for business. Will upload some photo later.

The hotel is pretty well located, near from bus and metro lines.The staff was very welcoming and helpful.Almost all of them spoke really good English.The room I stayed in was huge for one person, it was well cleaned and the commodities were modern and well maintained. The only con was the noisy AC system, but I think it was normal since it was super hot outside. Therefore, for someone with a light sleep, it might be a real problem. There were two bottles of water every morning in the room, and it was completely free!This is really a big plus and a very nice attention, since the weather was quit rude outside.

The accomodation and room was fantastic. I stayed in room 2809 and the room was spacious. Free bottled water and use of a mobile phone + free shuttle which was so user friendly. All the staff, especially Targo was very attentive and friendly. Thank you so much

Nearby are the ferry terminal to North Point and the MTR-Station Kwun Tong. You can use the A22 bus from and to the airport (Hotel offers additionally a shuttelbus-service to the Airportexpress). Many restaurants around, discover them in the industrial buildings (for example in Camel Paint Building Block 3).The shoppingcenter APM is a must see. It was my third stay in the Hotel and at every stay I discovered new things around the hotel. My wife and I stayed 7 nights in the hotel and next time we will book it again.

Stay there from 22/10 for a total of 5 nights and our group were given high floor,above 25th storey. Our view was ok but the rest were good.Room was very comfortable & spotless! Their housekeeping lady did a fantastic job keeping up with the high standards,not to forget mentioning the warm greetings she has for us every morning!Location is not top notch but their staff certainly are.Hilbert is most helpful and very ,very service oriented! Dorestt's gem indeed!His fluency in English,Mandarin on top of Cantonese are superb and hence we are able to communicate our needs to him effectively and he was really helpful and polite.Hilbert goes all his way to help us in our needs.The reception staff were very accommodating and even accede to our late check out request of 3 pm which was helpful as we have a late evening flight to catch. Cheers & kudos to the Dorsett KT team!Thanks a lot and all of us had a wonderful & peaceful stay!

Stayed here 3 nights. The place is vibrant with a simple, elegant, modern, cleverly enhanced with a pinch of some shiny glamour style.The staff can't wait to provide assistance, very, very friendly and professional, and tries to please the guests in all ways. Whatever the need or time of the day/night, they will try to help.Wow! Probably the best staff service I have ever experienced!Rooms not very big (but absolutely sufficient) but comfy, and again, decorated and arranged in the same simple but elegant way.All the facilities, ornaments, even toiletry or the room key-cards are carefully and coherently designed.Staying here is pure pleasure and coming back after a busy day is just relaxing and nice.Highly recomend!Certainly not the last stay, when in Hongkong!

The Hotel was excellent we were on the 21st Floor and had a good view the cleanliness and facilities were excellent could not fault it in anyway All staff were helpful and friendly giving us lots of information for our stay

I have to put my hands together for Shirley and Owen, they took care of the special request that I have and organize all the transportation for my whole trip that I stay in Hong Kong. If you are going to Hong Kong, I definitely recommend this hotel to you!

This hotel is actually the best hotel in town, need to give this reward to Shelly and Owen. They actually help a lot! This hotel have a nice view and good quality. The price is nice, service is good, and the staff here are super good! Will return to this hotel for sure!

I have been staying in this hotel several times!The front desk staffs were so friendly and efficient..bellboy were so helpful as well .not a very good location but room condition is up to standard ..comfort and clean !Will definitely come back again !!

Nice hotel, clean room. Easy to access and convenient. Lots of food nearby. Front desk staff are very helpful, provide lots of information for us. Hong Kong is a great place. Will definitely come again!Will stay here next time!

The hotel is situated too far from MTR - about 12 - 15 minutes walk. Especially after a day out - it's too far away. I would not go back there again. The pool was nice though it is 1.6 m deep. Room was average size.

Check in was great as my group was ushered to a VIP floor for a more comfortable check in. The room was easily the most outstanding part. It was big for HK standards, bed was comfortable, having a handy phone.. This hotel is a solid 10 min to the APM mall which is beside the Kwun Tong MTR but directions are straightforward. There is also another smaller mall about 8 min away that has some food and trinket shopping.

A good hotel, 10 minutes from the metro, breakfast a little loose, the best thing about the hotel was Venus, a friendly and very friendly receptionist.Hotel located in the Kwoon district, not on Hong Kong Island, you have to take the subway to go there, it takes about 20 minutes to travel, but you know Hong Kong better. Many restaurants and supermarkets nearby. It is a safe area although at dusk it is a little empty as it is an office area.

Arrived here at 6 am. The helpful staff were able to give us an early check in on one of our 2 rooms which was MUCH appreciated. The rooms were nice, well maintained, free WiFi and nice size. Staff was helpful and friendly though out. Situated close to the MTR and lots of places to eat out but at the same time on a quiet street.If we are in HK again we will return to this hotel.

I stayed at Dorsett for three weeks during a businesstrip in July. It is located about 10 mins from the metro.+ Clean Rooms, friendly and helpful staff, daily shuttlebuses to Tsim Sha Tsui.- Quite small rooms and the gym was very small.

Really enjoyed our stay here, the staff are very friendly despite the language barrier, great location 5min walk to MTR and shopping mall, lots of good outlet shops nearby as well as two decent cafe/restaurants across the road, really nice walk along the waterfront/park 2mins away, lovely rooms, nice breakfast which we paid for on the morning as we needed it which was very flexible of them.On arrival the reception could see we had a young baby and lot of luggage, pushchair etc and very kindly upgraded us to a suite which made our stay so much more comfortable, would definitely recommend and stay here again.

Room is good, and the receptionists provided good services, very professionals. location close to shopping center, good for people who go to Hong Kong for shopping. A lot of restaurants around. overall, good for any traveler.

This hotel is quite compact with small rooms, but is clean and has all required items. The beds are comfortable and we slept well. Breakfast was very reasonable. Staff friendly and helpful. Perfectly adequate for a base whilst exploring Hong Kong.

The front desk staff were professional and efficient. I was shown to my room in a matter of minutes. The room was neat and clean, and I had a view overlooking Kowloon Bay, which was awesome. They even have a phone with mobile data that you can borrow if you don't have a Hong Kong sim card. That was quite convenient. I stayed for three days and the room was always clean and organized each time I returned from work.I had breakfast at their restaurant twice. The cereals, salads, and ham from the buffet were delicious.Overall, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It was my second time (my first was in Sep 2016) and it was just as good as the first.

We stayed for four nights. The room was in excellent condition and the view from the window was pretty good. The hotel have very good swimming pool, but it is not heated and at outside. So please mind the weather.

The room,as expected, was small (par by Hong Kong standards) but very neat & well planned.The check-in was smooth and hassle free.The free shuttle is a huge advantage and was a pleasure to use.Overall - ticks all the boxes and would recommend if booked at a promotional price.

I stay at the Quad Family room, which is quite spacious. Come with a queen size bed and 2 single beds. As the hotel in Hong Kong is well known to be small, this hotel room is considered spacious with the affordable price. And there are 2 TV in the room, since this is a family room.The hotel location is convenient, however, it's not near to any MTR station. The nearest station (Olympic) is around 15min walk. And the station is quite many stations away from MongKok, Central stations. However, the station is just few stations away from Disneyland and TungChung (NgongPing360). Anyway, there is a free shuttle bus from the hotel to few attractions, such as LangHam Place and Star Ferry, etc. So, it's not that difficult for us to get to Mongkok MTR station. Just take note that, the shuttle is quite overwhelming, so make sure you are there at least 15-20min in advance to grab a seat.Food wise, there are quite a lot of restaurants nearby the hotel. By walking distance, you can reach to quite a lot of restaurants and cafe. Mini market and convenient shops are available within walking distance.Overall, the hotel is value for money and is a good choice for family. Staff service is good as well.

We had a quick stopover in hong kong and found this hotel to be reasonably priced.Rooms were a lot smaller than expected but surprisingly functional and cleanLots of cheap local eats close by if your on a budget.Train station is walking distance.

We stayed at Dorsett Mongkok twice. Access is easy, by bus or with the free airport shuttle provided by the hotel. The staff is very kind, they accommodate us the best they can, communication with the hotel was great. Whenever we asked for information, they advised us about how to get there and gave us a map. A room for two is a bit smaller than what it looks like on the website but very clean. Toothbrush, body lotion, shaving and sewing kit etc are provided. Bedding is very comfortable and the room well isolated so you are ensured to have a good night of sleep! The second time I stayed there (alone) was as great as the first time. I had some breakfast coupon - which you can use from 7 am to 10 pm in a restaurant nearby which does English-style food. Since it is not in the most touristic area, prices around the hotel are fairly cheap. One of the assets of this hotel is the free shuttle bus which stops by (among others) the Ladies Market, Kowloon station, and the ferry pier. Moreover, the staff is very kind and helpful and they make their utmost to make sure your stay is enjoyable. I would strongly recommend to anyone going to Hong Kong.

The hotel in Hong kong usually have small rooms. So if you want to have a bigger room you need to pay a little extra for it. This Dorsett hotel was cleaner than the one in Wanchai. We actually started off looking on the bed before we slept in it. The staff was nice and the room was clean. When we came to our first room it had a smell of smoke. But they were quick to help us to another room. All rooms are smoking prohibited, but, they can't control their guests. I have seen in another hotel how a man several times smoked indoors even though it was perfectly clear that it was prohibited. So yeah. The bed was not to comfy, it was sunk in in the middle. But, like our last mistake in Wanchai we did not alert the staff and just slept in it anyway. We are just very tired people and didn't bother, even if it did bother our sleep, unfortunately. Overall we thought the hotel was ok. The shuttle bus was a big plus, the seats are quite small though. Staff 5/5Cleanliness 5/5Comfy bed 1/5

room was small but functional and clean all the time ref is provided and free candy and wine! in the afternoon. If you want local food there are a lot in the area. Cafe de coral is only 2 mins walk away! Good place will stay here again!

Just spent 6 nights in a Comfort Room. Hotel is located away from tourist areas and is predominately local Chinese eateries and shops. First the room...Small like so many HK hotels but very functional like a cruise ship cabin. Comfortable A/C, usual amenities though the bed is on the firmer side and a little short in length. Next..Staff are all very helpful and courteous and were eager to offer suggestions when the airport shuttle was temporarily suspended due to the protest rally taking place in Kowloon. Finally..the hourly hotel shuttle to tourist spots is the most convenient we have encountered.

Very good service,you can鈥檛 believe you in Hong Kong!Suttle bus is very convenient!It goes every hour.Room is clean and comfortable,view from my room is amazing. Wifi is available every corner,very nice hotel.

If you are looking for friendly, outstanding service in Kowloon, Mongkok area then stay at the Dorsett Mongkok! It is situated in which was once an industrial area. The local people have stayed and turned this area into a very unique place where you can still sit down and enjoy eating original delicious Chinese, Thai and Vietnamese street food. If you are wanting to experience more of the Western world. There is a free shuttle bus running every hour from the hotel. Taking you into the elite part of the city with all the up market shops , the local harbour and to the many markets scattered around the streets. The service in the hotel was to a high standard and all staff went out of there way to make our stay pleasurable. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. The hotel provides you with a mobile phone to take with you when ever you go out and that you can make free calls on to many places in the world. Totally recommend this hotel!

This was the second time we stayed in this hotel, First time being 7 years ago. I knew it was very conveniently located, not too busy nor too quiet..everything you can wish for easily accessible. Olympia metro station/malls in a short walk..many buses very very close to the hotel giving you more travel convenience with more sightseeing possibilities. Big bus like 914 taking you all the way to & along HK island and many smaller buses running off & on to Nathan road etc with the many "markets" just with a swipe of your oyster card, The staff is very friendly.. the rooms are small yet clean & well equipped, airy with nice views. the rain shower is a nice welcome after a long day HK.The free use of the hotspot/phone is very handy and a much appreciated gesture saving us time to find sim cards or rentals. Can also use the phone number (wifi hotspot phone) when using one of the many laundry shops across the road

We were very happy with our stay at the Dorsett Mongkok. It was a great location from which to explore Kowloon. The room was clean and comfortable with great views over the city. There were thoughtful touches in the room like an adapter plug, toothbrush and bottled water. We were able to get in our room early having arrived very early from an international flight which was greatly appreciated. Staff were friendly and efficient. We were unable to use the shuttle bus as it was already full the time we tried. However, we enjoyed walking to the various places it was going. The train system in Hong Kong was very easy to use with the Octopus card we bought at the airport.The Dorsett Mongkok was also very reasonably priced.

Booked the room the night before check in at close to 50% off so I got big bang for my buck. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are specious for hong kong standards and ours had a good view on 20th floor. The room setup was really lovely with large mirror and a small wardrobe. I especially loved the mosaic in the bathroom really beautiful. Staff is very helpful helped us with places to change money and areas to visit. There is a free shuttle around Kowloon which ends quite late. Used it for our near midnight shopping adventures.Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

we stayed here before and after our trip to china.staff couldnt do enough for us,rooms very clean bright. and well cleaned.it was a really top notch hotel,and we wouldnt hesitate to give it top marks .shuttle bus service up town was great,so if snyone is looking for a top notch hotel not in the midfle of the city,this is it. little tip,get a taxi from the airport instead of shuttle bus or train,half the price

The Hotel is quite new and the rooms are large for HK standard.The staff is very friendly.Got a room with nice view over the city.There are many restaurants and bars nearby.MTR station is in walking distance.Will definitely stay there again.

Pros:-Great location (7 min walk to Olympic MTR, 12 min walk to Mongkok MTR, many eateries near hotel, One Dim Sum is just a 15-min walk and there is a McDonalds opposite the hotel)-Affordably priced accommodation as compared to other hotels in Hong Kong-Handy phone provided by hotel -Comprehensive guide for eating, shopping and other activities provided by the hotel-Complimentary shuttle bus service provided by hotel -Direct pickup along K5 route for Airport Express bus to Kowloon Station-Washroom is a decent sizeCons:-Small room-Small bed (My partner is 1.85m tall and I am 1.75m tall and our legs were sticking out of the bed)-Small wardrobe space

We enjoyed our stay in Dorsett Mongkok, excellent service and staff are professional especially Mr Eddy Lo from front desk. Room and bed are clean and comfortable. Overall we were satisfied stayed in this hotel. I had recommended this hotel to others

we will stay again if we travel to hongkong , we can go with shuttle bus free from hotel in certain destination and near with MTR Olympic , all staff receptionist very helpfull many of them can speak english well

Dorsett MongKok is a real gem! The staff at the hotel were very professional, friendly and extremelyyyyyyyy helpful. The location of the hotel is great, walking distance from Olympic MTR and also, a lot of interesting local restaurants nearby which we dined in at. We hopped onto the shuttle bus alot to explore the attractions, however we experienced a bad shuttle bus ride late at night. The driver drove really fast and that send us off our seats but nevertheless, all the other shuttle bus rides were great! The room we had is wonderful and well equipped with all essentials. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to my friends! We will definitely choose Dorsett MongKok again :)

This hotel is in a great location. Easily accessible by walking from Olympic Station or a quick cab ride to Kowloon Station if you take the Airport Express. Rooms are well-designed and big enough for the price. If you like to walk and explore there鈥檚 plenty of great food and interesting sights close by. The breakfast is delicious.

We stayed in this hotel on a first time visit to Hong Kong. The hotel itself was a perfect location for access to good restaurants and shops. Staff appeared friendly. To our astonishment, we discovered two weeks later that fraudulent activities have occurred on the credit card which was used exclusively to pay for our stay. We referred the suspicious activities to our Bank who has since taken the necessary action. We do not in any case blame the Hotel management as we believe this could be the action of a dishonest staff member, possibly at the reception where they tend to be people who have access to customer's credit card details. It is disappointing as we are frequent travellers and this is first time this had happened to us. We hope similiar experience has not happened to others.

I stayed at the Dorsett Mongkok for two nights after a last minute change of plans. Although it might not seem very central I actually much preferred the location to the previous place I was staying in Causeway Bay. It was easy to walk to both Olympic and Mongkok MTR stations, and were a lot of interesting local restaurants and businesses near by.The rooms are on the small side, but still generous compared with Hong Kong norms. The value was exceptional, especially when considering the generous discounts to the restaurants, and the very reasonable price of the minibar.What stood out to me though was the staff - I was caught out by a tropical storm, without umbrella or raincoat, when about to walk to the airport bus station. A staff member offered an umbrella, even after I explained that there would be no way for me to return it. A small gesture, but to me highlighted their genuine care towards their guests.

Hotel is clean & comfortable. Conveniently located to food & convenience store. Walking distance to MTR. Great customer service, very helpful & accommodating staffs. Shuttle service was life saver. Good job.

This hotel exceeded our expectations in all aspects.As travel agents we tend to be hyper critical as we need to make sure that our clients get the best possible deal for their money. This hotel provides more than promised and is highly recommended.

Right in Mongkok, although it takes about 10 mins walk to the Mongkok Station. There are many eateries just across from the hotel. Rooms are clean and bright. Airport express shuttle stand is just beside the hotel and they have staff there even to watch out for the shuttle whilst you wait inside. Hongkong is quite hot and humid.It's worth the price we pay for.

The hotel is located at a very convenient location. You can take bus,taxi, MTR and even by walking to places of interest .Staffs are friendly and accommodating. Room are clean and functional. Free bus shuttle service provided by the hotel. Highly recommended to all.

Hotel has shuttle buses to drop guests off some major attractions along with a phone for hot spot to use around the City. The hotel also provided umbrella to use since it was raining during our stay. They were also when helpful in answering my inquiries prior to my stay. Love the services.

Superb location with access to MTR, walking distance to shops and restaurant nearby and routes to other tourist spots, very convenience. Excellent quality from all staff of front counter by providing fast check in and check out service, arrangement of transport to airport, give valuable advice & info of travel , housekeeping reaponse fast in request.Hotel cleanliness is 100%.Will stay here again if back to Hong Kong

Hotel staff were helpful in all our requests.The Hotel very clean in all areas,Our rooms were small but had everything you required.Hotel shuttle bus every hour was a bonus as we had a short stay for visiting various places..

Front office efficient and nice. Hotel location ok, not too far from MTR station (less that 10 mins walk) and easy transit to airport express Kowloon station and Tsing Yi station. I restaurant in hotel,providing breakfast, lunch and dinner hot pot. Local restaurants nearby including McDonald right opposite to the hotel. Not as busy as Mongkok in fact, no night market and no shopping mall.

We originally booked for 2 single beds via Hotel.com for 1 adult and 2 tweens age 14. The receptionist Mikki was very helpful by advising us that the single beds are too small and we might not be comfortable. She offered the family room at a promo rate which is two rooms with 3 beds at the topmost floor, with 1 free night and 2 free days of breakfast. We availed of the upgrade offer and we made the right decision -- we were overlooking the Hongkong City at the topmost floor, the room was clean, smells nice. Everybody was helpful. The toiletries inside the shower smelled so good and looked so nice. The location was near McDonalds' , 7-11, Mannings and a 5 minute walk away from the train station, Olympic City Station. There is also a schedule of the shuttle bus if you want to go to popular destinations and bus going to airport express train. If you are picky with breakfast and have kids, the menu might not make youhappy because of limited choices (no pancakes for kids or sunny side up) but there is nearby McDo for breakfast option anyway. The hotel lobby looked elegant and everybody was helpful even housekeeping which supplied us with power adaptors to charge our electrical gadgets. The room is also equipped with phone with wifi hotspot you can take with you for your trips which complimented our rented wifi when we split into groups during tours. Over-all, we loved our stay in Dorsett and would book again when we return. Thank you Mikki and the rest of Dorsett staff !

Close to public transit, comfortable rooms, free shuttle to shops and subway. On Fridays there is a manager's reception between 6 - 7pm. The only drawback is that in the morning, the elevator can get busy and travelling with suitcases can be more difficult.

if I have to come to Honk Kong again I will for sure choose Dorsett staff is very friendly shuttle service to take you around very easy excellent service hotel room that we was comfortable smart phone with free locations and easy to use

It's my second stay at Dorsett Mongkok, and we really enjoyed it. The staff were all really nice and helpful, and were able to provide us detailed guides on how to get to the MTR/places we'd want to go to. Furthermore, they even arranged to deliver a birthday cake up to my room as a part of my birthday celebration in Hong Kong. It was really very nice of Franklin Lam & his team, and it was deeply appreciated by me and my boyfriend. Thank you Dorsett Mongkok, for the lovely stay.Would definitely come back again the next time I'm back in Hong Kong.

We really enjoyed our stay at Dorsett Mongkok. All staff at Hotel is courteous, friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and well kept. Their shuttle service was convenient and drop off and pickup at most shopping areas. The Airport shuttle bus stops beside the Hotel thus very convenient. Food is easily available around the Hotel area. We will definately stay in Dorsett Mongkok on our next visit to Hong Kong.

All departments performed very well. From front office up to housekeeping, all were courteous and helpful. The hourly bus shuttle was very convenient and made the slightly out way location inconsequential. The location itself gave a neighbourhood and localised experience of local Hong Kong life, as opposed to the commercialised main roads like Nathan Road.

Dorsett Mongkok, Hong Kong.I would leave message to other guests, it is recommended and worth to stay! Satisfaction in terms of hospitality, cleanliness and service ... ideally location for those who like to travel in Hong Kong.

2nd time in dorsett. Still wonderful. I love everything and for sure will keep coming back I cannot think of any other hotel to stay with in HK. The hotel so accessible, the receptionist so helpful and the free shuttle bus.

Stayed for 4nights in a Queen Suite RoomPositives - Good size room stayed on the 27th Floor views were great. Bathroom good, bed comfortable, free bottles water every day. The free shuttle bus that the hotel provides every hour is great.Negatives - The sofa bed (my son slept on) was terrible!! tiny thin mattress, breakfast room is disgusting!!!! the dining room was dirty - the staff are rude - the food is cold, plates and cups are plastic - they need to improve this area dramatically. Recommend you book room only and go out into the streets and have breakfast the bakeries around are amazing and cheap.Also its NOT close to a MTR about a good 10-15min walk away so location wasn't great

This is the 3rd HK hotel I stayed in the last 2 years and am glad I chose this one. Great location within walking distance to Ladies Market and Temple Street. It is near Olympic and Mong Kok MTRs, allowing easy travel to many places within Kowloon and HK. Hotel also provides complimentary shuttle to major locations and sightseeing spots. They offer a list of restaurants in the neighborhood for guests who want to try local cuisines, with quick references down to the walking distance from the hotel. Good view from our hotel room. Room size is comfortable; mattress firm enough and nice amenities. All rooms are equipped with a complimentary smart phone for guests with no calling charges to certain countries, very helpful when we need to call our HK friends and even back home. Staff speaks excellent English and are very kind and helpful. We visited HK at a very crowded week of the year and stayed 12 nights. No matter how busy, the staff are always courteous and prompt. We want to especially thank Miki Mak and Stephanie Giffin, the front desk staff we asked the most. We are unfamiliar with Kowloon and HK, and they saved us a lot of time and hassle. They both seem genuinely want to make sure all guests have the best time ever. We are amazed at how professional and patient they both are. We travel a lot, and rank this hotel as one of the best we stayed in. We definitely will book this hotel in our future visits to HK!

We had a enjoyable stay at Dorsett mongkok. Location is great, just a few minutes walk to Olympic station. The manager Franklin was extremely helpful. we will be happy to return to Dorsett mongkok soon.

I like this hotel very much!! Clean, good location, neat and tidy yet they have superb fresh smell!! The front desk morning shift staff has a tall guy with spectacle superb nice attitude, guide us alot on our free & easy, can tell he love his job very much and passion with it. The room service is superb nice, even fold my cloths nicely which I throw on bed Highly recommend this hotel!!

Front desk service agent Taro is very helpful and assisted us with great patience! Taro made effort to remember his guests by name! If taking airport express from airport, you can take a free shuttle provided by airport express directly to the hotel. Hotel also provided free shuttle service to places of interest nearby.

Pleased my stay was for only one night, reception staff and porters were good and helpful, the breakfast was not very good and the people working in the restaurant gave the impression that they didn't want to be there, terrible selection and poor quality of food.

Stayed here for 9 nights end of April / beginning of May. As been previously stated by other reviews the rooms are small but this is the norm in Hong Kong. We were on the 19th floor and our room was cleaned every day and we slept very well every night. There were some nice little extras that made our stay even more enjoyable, a personal mobile phone which can be used for creating personal wi fi hotspots , a free safe , free fruit on arrival and two bottles of water every day. In the lobby every night there was a candy wagon that gave out free sweets and every Friday there was free wine. There was also a free shuttle bus that takes you to Mongkok, Temple Market and Central every hour. Every staff member we met were very friendly and were always happy to help out with any queries we had. Lots of places of interest in walking distance and only a ten minute walk away from the Olympic MTR station.Cannot comment on breakfast or the food as never ate there but will have no hesitation in staying here again should we ever visit Hong Kong again .

Stayed for 3 nights on 17th floor. Room is small n so is the toilet but adequate. Bed seems like smaller than a Queen.Location wise is abt 6-8 mins walk fr Olympic MTR and surroundings are full of eateries and aminities such as 7-11, 360 mart, McD, medicine shop etc.Breakfast is sold at HK$55 per person. Variety not much but that is what u pay for.

Was stayed there for 4 nights and had a unforgettable stay. Given an useful booklet with all the highlights and it's informative. The hotel is walking distance to Olympic station by 5 min walk, besides the hotel provide free shuttle to few main spot. Last but not least, an awesome service from reception named Miki and Taro, they are not only doing what they supposed to do, they did extra miles for the guest. Definately will stay there again if I'm going to Hong Kong.

The only negative we would give the hotel is the size of the room, with the lack of hanging/storage space for a week's clothing and the fact that the bed was up against the wall so that one occupant had to get in and out from the bottom of the bed! Also we would not rate the size of the bed as Queen, as stated in our booking. I know the management will respond that there are other room sizes, but we went by photos on their website, which are somewhat deceptive.Now the many positives. The room wasn't ready when we arrived earlier than standard check-in time, but the lovely reception staff told us it would only be an hour, and suggested where we could go to get a drink and snack in the meantime. The staff continued to be pleasant and helpful throughout our week, from quickly bringing the extra pillows we asked for (along with a welcoming small plate of fruit) to booking our taxi for the airport at a fixed price so we wouldn't be overcharged. Other added extras were the two small bottles of complimentary water each day, the free sweets stall from 6-7pm each day, the wine and snacks served on Wednesday at this time, too, and the very useful shuttle bus every hour, which got us closer to sights we wanted to see, saving us walking as much in this 'manic' city! We hadn't booked breakfasts, but decided to take it here on our last morning, to save time, and we were satisfied with the food available (though it could have been hotter, but that's hotel buffets!), and with the cost - 50 HKD (拢5 GB).The location of the hotel is fine, with lots of restaurants of all types nearby (a MacDonald's opposite if that's your style, but they did do good coffee to go with pastries from the bakeries for our breakfasts). Plenty of chinese cooked food takeaway stalls. Also there's a little 'park' just outside, where we sat to eat our pastries.All in all, would recommend.

We (me & my husband) stayed in Dorsett for 4 nights, they gave us room at 12 as we reached early even if check in time was 2. Their rooms are small but lovely, specious & it has everything you can ask for. Room services on time. Best part is, I would say 2 best parts: free shuttle bus to roam around significant parts of the city & free mobile handset with hotspot (apart from free room wifi). McD & 7eleven right in front & besides hotel. & not to forget, free candies ! I loved my stay at Dorsett Mongkok. Attached is the view outside my window.
