It's my 3rd stay at this hotel. Simply just Love the hotel. The staff and the rooms makes my comfortable. Check in take less then 10 mins. It's my husband's 1st stay he too like the hotel he feels very comfortable . Hotel is about 10mins walk to langham plaza . Hotel do provide hourly transport to 4 destination.if u need supper there a MacDonald across . There are few eatery opposite the hotel. Thanks to all the helpful staff n Andrew . Definitely will go back for my 4th stay.

Amazing location, great city view from the hotel, Super clean, comfortable room and good service with English speakers and warm welcome overall. Thanks for a wonderful stay Dorsett! Can鈥檛 wait to try again next time! :)

I stayed for 6 nights and it was a very pleasant experience. The room was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel bus shuttle was the best. You can jump on and off at various stops all day until 11pm free. It was perfect for getting around. The bed was a little too firm but other than that, the hotel was great. Good prices, helpful staff and great location. Next time I come to HK, I will definitely stay at the Dorsett again.

The Dorsett Mongkok is perfectly positioned for someone who wants to maximise their time in Hong Kong. You can reach it easy from the airport by taking the A21 and being dropped off a 10min walk away.The Dorsett also have a shuttle bus services leaving the hotel every hour on the hour and taking guests to key areas in Mong Kok and down towards the water front. We used the bus a couple of times both to be dropped off and picked up. The hotel itself is excellent! The staff are friendly, the service is excellent too. On Wednesday evenings from 6-7pm, they have free wine and snacks for guests. Every other day at the same time they have sweets available for guests.Our room was small yet well designed. The bed was an inch or two too short for me, I鈥檓 189cm tall. I think that鈥檚 more a symptom of Hong Kong鈥檚 lack of space.We left on a Saturday and had a check out to 2pm, that鈥檚 incredibly generous! Overall, we had a great stay here and would happily stay here again!

We just stayed 12 nights at the Dorsett Mongkok and it was wonderful. The location was ideal as it was close to everything. The rooms, though small but apparently typical for Hong Kong, are clean and functional. There are so many extras that this hotel provides. There is a free cell phone in each room which has unlimited data that you can hotspot your own phone to. The hotel shuttlebus runs hourly and has 4 stops that will connect you to the MTR where you can connect to wherever you want to go. They have a candy bar from 6:00 鈥?7:00 every night and a wine hour on Wednesdays. However, I would have to say that the highlite of this hotel is it鈥檚 staff. Everyone including the check-in staff, concierge, maid service and Andrew Lee the Director of Operations, were so friendly and helpful. The standout though, has to be Taro Liew at the front desk!! My daughter is a HUGE fan of Game of Thrones and we arrived in Hong Kong the night before the premiere of Season 8 of the Game of Thrones. We had tried to get access to HBO Asia before we left Canada with no success. We also had no success once we arrived. However, Taro came through literally 10 minutes before the show started. He definitely went above and beyond the call of duty. My daughter is forever in his debt. Taro was such a gem, he was so knowledgeable and eager to help, we went to him with all our queries. When he found out it was our twins 21st birthday, he even arranged to have a cake and wine delivered to their room.We felt so welcomed at the Dorsett Mongkok and will definitely come back when visiting Hong Kong again. Thank you!!

I stayed at the Dorsett 5 years ago and thoroughly enjoyed my stay, rooms were clean and well presented. I decided for our last night in Hong Kong to book the Dorsett again for 1 evening. I wish I could of stayed longer. The receptionist was incredibly helpful and friendly she upgraded us up to a family room which was on the top floor. The room itself was beautiful the bed was a dream to sleep in but the view from our window was flawless. Could not fault a thing. Breakfast was delicious and staff were friendly and accommodating.Would definitely stay here again and highly recommend the Dorsett.

Stayed in Dorsett in 2017 and decided to go back to them again this year (2019). Room is clean and well maintained. The Handy allow us to have Wifi all day and can even make calls out without any charges. Service from the concierge and front desk is superb. Many good local food like Beef Noodle, Dim Sum, Dessert etc around the hotel. Highly Recommended.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: As it was always, the service there is very flexible, room is large and clean, the people there is warm-hearted and nice. In general, it is very comfortable place to stay, and it is well worthy of the price!

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: This was the 2nd time my family has stayed in this hotel but this stay was far better because i have booked my family in to a 2 bedroom suite.What I like about it:-spacious ; each bedroom is ensuite and big. The bedroom accommodates a King Size bed , Study Desk, Big Wardrobe. -Very comfortable bed and pillow -large living room it could sleep a further 2. -Each bedroom and the living room has a large TV-The view is excellent;please refer to pictures-open plan kitchen but kitchen is restricted to microwave cooking only -Location is fabulous; short walk to MTR/Metro/Subway and Bus Station. If you are travelling on the MTR would be best you buy an Octopus Card cause it could be use for paying the bus fare and goods and services at all retailers. If you are taking the Green Bus/Mini Bus beware driver speaks little or no English -The hotel is only 2 stops away to Shatin Station where there are plenty of shops and supermarkets. What dont I like is that the 2 bedroom suite has no washer and dryer so if you are doing a long stay you could enage pick up and delivery laundry service such as Boni. Overall, I would definitely come back to staying in this hotel because this is excellent for small gathering

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Stayed here a few times before, it鈥檚 conveniently located close to University MTR station. On previous occasions I鈥檝e found the soundproofing pretty lousy and you could generally hear noise from adjoining rooms and water through pipes. The room on the 7th floor was pretty quiet though. The carpets in my room were a little bit grubby but overall a nice stay. The breakfast here is not good value but drinks at Tintin bar just about ok if you make it there during happy hour

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Still happy with hyatt to accompany my holidays. Feel myself like a home first of all about stuff. They are always friendly and respectful to me and my friends. Rooms are always clean and comfortable.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: I had several special requests regarding a health issue and the staff was very accommodating of me. I recall a manager named Mark. Also, items I ordered for my room were promptl delivered. The service at this hotel is great.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: I visit Hyatt Regency Shatin again for the conference nearby the hotel. The room, the service and the breakfast are as good as my expectation. On my request, they offer a room which is away from lifts, so I can have a better sleep for another days of the conference.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Distance from main town and attractions, staffs are not friendly to resolve issues, for business it may be fine not for families.I ordered at pool bar, server took 1hr to respond. Breakfast not suitable for asians

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Hyatt Regency Shatin is a very well managed property with very courteous, accommodating and responsive staff. Although it鈥檚 just a 10min taxi ride from our home we often visit to enjoy their excellent buffet, pool, SPA, or stay the night. Hyatt Regency Shatin is in much contrast to the very badly and incompetently managed Grand Hyatt on HK Island on which I have walked out twice due to management issues.My compliments to the buffet Chef for the Swiss Cheese fondue and the MELO staff for making my wife happy with the 鈥榖est ever treatment鈥?she had on Mother鈥檚 day. Special thanks to the staff for coming to our room less than five minutes after calling reception for taking our daughter鈥檚 temperature which was 40C at the time and accommodating a later check-out to sort the situation.Tip #1Dig under the ice to find the large hidden claws at the lobster buffet.Tip #2Get your drinks at 711 University Station (2min walk)Tip #3Go for a walk (tunnel under University Station next to ticket gates) around the University Campus, including the artificial lake at night.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: When booking this hotel I thought I was booking the Hyatt Regency in Kowloon and soon found out there are two Hyatt Regency Hotels in Hong Kong and I had booked the one in Sha Tin but it turned out to be better than expected. The hotel was newer and the rooms are quite large and the room we got had fantastic views across the Harbour. The Hotel is very 5 star looking and feel. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the bonus there is a free shuttle to take you to the other Hyatt Regency in Kowloon or if you wish you can get off at Kowloon Station so getting around from Sha Tin is easy so I highly recommend you stay at The Hyatt Regency Sha Tin plus you get to see the sights of Hong Kong from the shuttle bus that you would possibly never see staying in Kowloon and I highly recommend you book a Club Room as it is fantastic up there on the 25th floor with fantastic views and fantastic staff. I would rate this hotel as 5 stars in looks and service from the moment you arrive at the front door.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: A few minutes walk away from the MTR station University. Good location with some amenities nearby. We were given a room which overlooked the swimming pool, mountains and passing trains. The windows did a really good job of blocking out the outside noise. So the room was quite and comfortable. We have booked again in a few days time. See you soon!

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: We stayed in this hotel at least twice every year, and up to 7 days each time. The level of service provided is not consistent, sometimes good and sometimes below par. But overall, we like its location and price.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: This hotel is well run with friendly, helpful staff. It offers exactly what you'd expect from a Hyatt -- rooms are nice and there are decent coffee, drinks, and dining options right in the hotel -- but you pay the usual high prices for all of that convenience. The location is perfect if you are doing something at the Chinese University of Hong Kong. It's not close to much else, and so food/drink options outside the hotel/university are limited if you don't want to get on the metro. The metro stop is right next door, though, and there are lots of great areas 1 - 2 stops away. (The pool is pretty amazing too).

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Quick and easy check in, room was clean and nice. Good American breakfast available and excellent coffee! About a half hour from HKI by cab but the rail system is right next door as well. all in all a good reasonable place to stay.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Nice sea view Room. Helpful stuff. Can see the hotel is getting old. Out of date appliance in room. Mediocre food quality for the price tag. Night Buffet around HKD700. Day Buffet around HKD 350. The dishes are identical for day and night buffet, just night buffet with some more expensive items such as cheese baked lobster...

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: We appreciated the quiet and calmness of this hotel. Our room was spacious, sparkling clean and I enjoyed sitting on the large window bench watching the boats gliding past on the river. Although you are not in the middle of the city, as Sha Tin is part of the New Territories, the MTR station is just across the road from the hotel and you can easily access all attractions.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Excellent location in Shimshatsui, close to metro and the buzzing nightlife on Kowloon. Very safe to walk the streets around the Hotel. Hotel is very modern , clean and comfortable. Breakfast and dinner are quite pricey and ate out at a few of the many restaurants available just a short walk away. Star ferry is about 10 to 15 minutes walk for the trip to hong Kong island. Staff all very helpful and professional.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Overall a great stay at shatin hotel. Very convenience to mtr but still comsider far to the central area. If there is more shuttle bus timing in the morning and evening would be great.... there a good and cheap cafe nearby highly recommended located at the mtr.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: I chose this hotel as it was a few minutes walk to the MTR station 鈥淯niversity鈥?so I could conduct my business efficiently. It was great to go in either direction further up in to the New Territories or into Kowloon. The bar鈥檚 signature pomelo cocktail was delicious, but the food service was poor, as it took a long time, and the club sandwich with fries was lukewarm and soggy. Considering the prices, one would expect perfection. The king room was a good size and had a great view, but the carpet looked like it needed a good deep clean. The hotel was well-run, apart from the impertinent chef to asked me to put the serving spoon in the right place. I will stay here again otherwise.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Stayed here for my business trips. I stayed on the 8/F and found the floor to be very noisy. The heavy stench of food pervades the floor. Some guests travelling in groups seem to leave their doors open and walked around between rooms carrying food from room to room. It seems the entire floor was booked by them. Apart from the noise, the stench of food through the ventilation was exceptionally awful.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: The pool was excellent, the room spacious and clean, the Tin Tin bar has excellent music team, and room service dinning was punctual and as requested- taxi and train availability easy and fast. thank you will come again.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Stayed there as we wanted to be as close as reasonably possibly to Sai Kung but still be able to get around on the MTR. This was a good choice.Rooms were excellent and staff competent and the cafe in the lobby that served great confectionaries was an added bonus.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Spacious room with very nice bedding, towels and washroom. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Very nice swimming pool and exercise amenities. Close to train station. Perfect for business trip, couples, and family.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: If you don't mind being out of the way a bit yet accessible to many locations through MTR, this is a great place to stay. It does not have the congestion of Tsim Sha Tsui or other parts of Hong Kong and Kowloon. Yet, it is a first-rate hotel.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: 鈾?strongly recommend for family with kids and elderlies 鈾e stayed for 5 nights in the 2 bedrooms suite. The room was clean and perfect with scenic view of Tolo Harbour. The swimming pool was kid friendly. The lunch buffet was delicious, my loved it. The MTR station located within a few minutes walking distance. The only drawback was the check in time at 3PM.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Another 6-night stay for me. This is a very good hotel and I strongly recommend it. Service at check-in late was very good: professional, helpful and quick. My room was large, very clean, and comfortable. The bathroom is particularly clean and well appointed.The one dinner and one breakfast I had in the hotel were good. Service in the restaurant was VERY good.This hotel is very good value for money, and I recommend it. I'll be back for sure.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: I stayed for 3 nights at the Hyatt Regency Sha Tin and I wasn't too sure what to expect, but the rooms are a good size and clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful, they helped to guide me to MTR station and gave me some resources to help find my way back to the hotel. I think the only negative is that it's not too close to any restaurants, I ended up traveling using the MTR to find some local restaurants but this isn't a huge problem. I would definitely recommend staying here if you need to visit HK in the near future.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: if you are visiting CUHK, Hyatt Shatin is the only game in town, and they seem to know it.I have stayed here dozens of times--probably about 40 nights total over the past three years. It's not bad, especially for the money, but I do wish there were other options available. The service is very hit or miss. Some people are very nice, and others seem like they would rather be somewhere else. Same for the rooms--some nice, but others are looking rather threadbare--marks on the walls, chips in the sink, carpets that have seen a lot of wear, etc. Location is convenient to MTR and to university, but nothing else. Once the uni closes, there's no food or anything within walking distance.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Kenny the concierge made my day by locating the taxi driver where I forgot my mobile phone. Kenny went out of the way to help me get my mobile back under 30 minutes. Hats off well done and my sincere thanks to Kenny.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: If you want to stay out of the bustle of Hong Kong but within easy reach of the city by taxi or metro, this is ideal. Harbour view rooms are especially enjoyable, the food is excellent and the service top class.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: I have made 30 visits over the last 3 years. I was always impressed and happy to visit. The hotel and service made the difference, the staff in particular were always helpful. In March 2019 The hotel had its tenth anniversary and held a celebration for staff and guests. At the event I found out the hotel is actually a training hotel for undergraduates studying catering at the University of HK. I didn鈥檛 know this beforehand. It explained why the staff were all highly motivated. It was their vocation and they were being trained by professionals. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff. The hotel is next to the University MTR train station. A major bus station is also outside. Everywhere is reachable and well served. The combination of price, service, amenities and location is probably unbeatable

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Great place to stay in Hong Kong, away from all the city traffic, quiet and relaxing, close to the MTR and close to the Shatin shopping centre. Staff were fantastic and very helpful, all spoke English and all keen to make our stay comfortable. Great food highly recommend this hotel.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: A great hotel, very clean, wonderful service and maintenance. It's located close to the subway and very convenient to move about. Its surrounding is very quiet. Rooms are quite spacious. The price is reasonable.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: I spent 5 days in March 2019. The hotel is conveniently located near the Chinese University MTR line so provides easy access to all parts of the city. The rooms were large with quality bedding and furnishings. The hotel has a lovely heated pool situated against a green hill. Breakfast buffet was quite extensive with a selection of the usual fruits and cereals,pastries, egg station, and dumplings. Hotel staff did not go above and beyond to please but were generally helpful and dutiful. My room was always immaculately made up on my return each afternoon.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Good experience to stay in this hotel where a getaway from the city. The room is large with a great design to relax. Had a wonderful buffet dinner with reasonable price in their restaurant. Many choices from the buffet table. Enjoyed it so much and will consider choosing this hotel again in future.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Just arrived check in quick and room good. Staff all very helpful and been to gym which is well equipped and in very good condition not tried pool but looks good.Having a quiet beer in bar which has a choice of food from the hotel

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Excellent hotel, friendly staff. The university MTR station is 2 min. away.Arrival the city center including 4 MTR changes, and takes about 40 min.The food is amazing: breakfast, lunch and dinner are just great experience. We came back again and again there..

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: I went for Hyatt ShaTin for the concierge service they promised to tramit the visa to cross the board to Shenzhen in the Chinese side.Service was provided according to expected (took 2 full working days) while I spend a good and comfortable time in one of their guest rooms.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: The Hyatt ShaTin is in a great location to access local transportation; it's very clean and modern; the restaurants, TinTin lounge, and the Club Floor are great, and the service from everyone is awesome. I've been staying there when I visit Hong Kong for the last 8 years, and would not change.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Love the hotel, breakfast, service, cleanliness, location, swimming pool and everything. However, the hotel needs to fix the problem with the credit card system where I already made complain through long distance call and email after leaving Hong Kong. Besides email to contact the hotel, there should be a faster channel using immediate free social media to contact hotel staff or management. It can be very stressful when there comes a phone message of a charge of HK$2,400 from my credit card bank where I did not incur that expense, and at the same time you are out of Hong Kong. Appreciate the hotel management Mr. Kan calling me the next day that there was a HK$2,400 as deposit but no such expenses authorize by the hotel to my credit card bank, and that immediately relieves my stress.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: this property is in a great location, offering good service and comfort. the room was excellent, more than expected. i highly recommend it. this has been my best stay in Hong Kong so far. the pillows were great, so i felt asleep very fast.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Never feel better the moment i step in the hotel its like going home The checking in was so efficient concierge was ever ready to help with as simple as getting a taxi was never a hassle for them.Club lounge excellent both food and ambience

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: I had stayed at this venue quite some time ago, The quality of the property in this location is exceptional and value, Obviously my business links suit this location, It is close to the train which gets you into Central in good time and close to Shenzhen if you want to duck over the border to shop.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Spacious and comfortable facilities, excellent customer services. Quality of food at the in-house Chinese restaurant and room service was a little disappointing but overall hotel experience was great.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: gracious treatment of all foreigners, even at the very busiest time of the year! We'll be back next year. This location by the train station and close to New Territories as well as access to Tsim Sha Tsui is perfect for us.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: We spend 4 days at the Hyatt Hong Kong, Sha Tin and we are very please with this H么tel. A bit far from Hong Kong, but the shuttle bus is so convenient. Everything was very well done and the room was very big. It worth the 30 minutes bus ride.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Hyatt Regency in Shatin is very worth the price in terms of the quality of service and the rooms. The hotel is located right on the University MTR station and thus the location is also very much convenient.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Made a booking mistake and requested early check in after a 12hour flight. No consideration given even when informed that I will be checking out one day earlier ( room prepaid) and had to wait for 7 hours for a room to take some rest before my business meeting @ 330pm

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Bad room service bad room facilities and breach of health and satefy regulations. Not good value for money at all. Will not recommend your hotel and will not stay in your hotel whether in HK or worldwide. Extremely disappointed.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Both upload and download speed was only 1mbps ,sometime the internet was even disconnected and I can鈥檛 even to check my email and WhatsApp As I must need to access to internet due to my business purpose, I have no choice to purchase the additional prepaid SIM card at 7-11 and top up 50hkd every 2 daysI can鈥檛 believe it would happen to me from the 5 star hotel

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: I stayed there at least three or four times a year. Overall experience was awesome but what makes this hotel especially special is the staff 鈥?far exceeds any five-star hotel, including other Hyatt hotels. I have membership with IHG, SPG and Hyatt 鈥?in Hong Kong, Hyatt Regency Shatin is my only choice. Remember these managers' names 鈥?Kevin, Godfrey and Steve鈥?they are especially helpful. Here is my two cents: 1 All staff there are incredibly helpful. I left my stuff there, and I got it back during my next visit. I mentioned about the hair dryer鈥?and they gave me a special one. They also let me borrow a heater. I forgot to bring my iPhone cable, and they let me borrow one鈥? The managers of the hotel are professional and caring. Every morning, the senior managers say hi to the guests 鈥揑 don't experience that at other hotels. They don't simply socialize with the guests, but also put in every effort to help them. 3 I mentioned about bad experience with another Hyatt鈥?and they sincerely listened and shared my feedback with their internal folks. 4 I had some issues with my membership points, and they helped me contact the membership center. Though I probably won't get my points back鈥?but I truly appreciate their assistance.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: Great hotel with a very attentive team in the Regency Club lounge. A bit outside of the central city area next to the Chinese University - great option to go jogging, biking along the waterfront. A nice contrast to the busy and crowded city center and only 20 minutes away from TST

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: This review has been a long time coming, I actually didn't want and avoided posting this but the time has finally come. Stayed here for a couple of days last year with my family and in-laws in a 2 bedroom suite. On our 2nd night while just laying down on the bed watching tv, I got the sensation of being bitten a number of times on my legs. At first I thought it was mosquitoes but I couldn't find any, until I noticed the sort of bites I had. I immediately contacted housekeeping, spoke to 2 different housekeepers as well as the housekeeping department but all they offered me was a change of linens. FYI changing the linens wouldnt matter to bedbugs. I am a former hotel worker and I was incredulous that that was the only solution they had for such a high rated hotel but I didnt want to make a scene since it was already late and my in laws were in the other room. So I just agreed to it and noticed that they actually dont even change the duvet itself (which I suspected afterwards was where the bedbugs came from since I didnt get any more bites), just the cover. I emailed them as well about being bitten and although the duty manager called the room right away in 30 mins, changing of linens still was the only option they gave me, which they had already done. The next day when we checked out, Martin/Marvin, a manager talked with us and apologized, assured us they were going to investigate it and that the next time we stayed they were going to give us an upgrade or discount or whatever. To be honest, and he could probably tell at that time, I really wasn't interested anymore, I was just too disappointed with the solutions they offered me. Bed bugs means a change of the mattress, at the very least. Also, when we had already checked out and on our way to Macau, my parents-in-law were talking about how they had a few bites and were itching a lot in that hotel and just realized about the bedbugs when they heard Martin/Marvin talking to me about it. So it wasnt just me and it wasnt just in one room, although I had the bulk of it with OVER 30 nasty bites. As a WOMAN who wears dresses over 90% of the time, this was very TRAUMATIZING for me. I wish they had just offered an antibiotic cream and a really good scar eraser, as well as a discount on our total bill, for the distress this whole thing gave me as well as the aftermath- I was looking at a couple of months of wearing jeans when I only had a couple of them in my closet. For such a big name hotel, they sure dont know how to do any customer-recovery. And for the record, those nasty bites got infected after a week so I had to visit a dermatologist, which initially cost me USD77, plus another USD31 this month for the 2nd jar of scar cream I have had to use. Its been 3 months and the scars are still ever visible, its embarrassing to be going out in a dress or skirt. Im now looking at 6 months, at the very least, till theyre not pretty noticeable anymore.So, an upgrade the next time we check in? What, will it cost over USD200? To get back the money I lost and the money I will lose by staying and being bitten again by bedbugs in your hotel? No thanks. Never again. I would have sued if I had lived there.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency because I had a running race near by. The room was very spacious, and they let me have a late check out, so I was able to shower after the race. I had a great experience.

Hotel: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Sha Tin
review: near to university station. close to new town plaza shatin. friendly staff with good serviceoutside swimpool was good, gym was also goodenjoyed stay in hyatt regency hong kong sha tinwill recommend people who want to stay out of downtown

We had a great stay and were upgraded on arrival to a business suite. The facilities were very clean and tidy and the staff were friendly. There is a modest gym which had the basics to get by and unlimited complimentary drinks and fresh bottled water daily helped. Easy to get around the the MTR and nice to be in a more traditional and less chaotic area during our stay.

The facilities are clean and functional. The location is great, near a metro station, a few hundred yards from the start of the walking tour of HK in the Lonely Planet guide. Excellent dim-sum around the corner (ask at the reception).

A room is indeed small but it is hongkong. Apart from room size, you will have unlimited complimentary drinks at lobby, coffee and soft drinks which is like Oasis after you come back from hot sweaty city tour. It was pleasant staying. Thanx!

The room is spacious and tidy considering the price is pretty low for a hotel in Hong Kong Island. However, the cleaniness could be improved since there were some hair in the sink when we checked-in. The staff were in general helpful and polite.

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. This is the first time we visit to Hong Kong. The staffs are very welcoming, always stepped out more steps to provide us suggestions for our sightseeing, dining. They sent us a tour guide prior our arrival, so that we can more well prepare for our trip. Rooms is spacious, clean and we can get what we need. We love the roof garden on the 4/F and the freebies. We would definitely come back again!

Staffs are so kind and nice. The room is clean and the amenities are good. I especially love the 4/F balcony haha. This hotel serves nice coffee and snacks and even apples. If I come to Hong Kong, I definitely choose here again.

Traveled alone and had a lay over of one day in Hong Kong so after a long search online LBP seems to be the best option around the centre.Good location- about 15 minute walk from central station, great friendly staff, common area equipped with espresso machine and snaks, nice GYM and very clean rooms. Was really happy staying with LBP, Highly reccommended, great value for money. Thank you for the pleasant stay, I'll be back

Good manner and very kindly support as well.Also immediately action for my request.Very important services are massage machine, free coffee and soft drinks, nice terrace as well.And conclusion, nice cleaning condition inside and front desk service.

Have stayed at this hotel many times, can thoroughly it: clean, light and good staff good location for Macau ferries, coffee and light snacks also offered. Very pleased that many of the staff are unchanged and recognise you each year.

I was upgraded to the "business suite", which was a fairly large room for a hotel in this range in HK. The room was clear, had good closet and drawer space, and a seating area separate from the bedroom when you first enter.Hotel reception service was really good, and they even brought me an iron and ironing board when I needed one.I'd definitely stay here again.

Itching bed, i cant sleep at nightPlease clean the room carefully and vacuum the carpet floor and bed,there are dustmite on it. Maybe the receptionist give me a room that did not clean for long time. Terrible experience.

Upon check-in we were apparently upgraded to business suites (2005 & 2004), however upon entry to the room, we joked about what we were upgraded from! The room had a small living/dining area (with room for only 1 chair at the small table) and a tiny bedroom with a bed pushed up against the wall. I know this is Hong Kong and rooms are small, but the space wouldv'e been far better just being one room with a bed, the rest of the space was wasted for us.The room was clean but in much need of a refurb, the curtain was hanging off the rail, the carpet was very grubby and there was a fair bit of mould in the bathroom.There was tea and coffee, but unfortunately no milk.We also only found out all the shampoo and soaps were in the wardrobe (?!) on the day we checked-out, so didn't get to use these.On the upside:Staff were very friendly and professional. They held our luggage for us and booked us a taxi back to the airport.We had two free bottles of appletiser in the room and a bowl of apples.There are snacks and drinks down in the lobby all day.The location (for people, like us, who are completely new to Hong Kong) is great, near lots of good nightlife and bars, however I never realised how hilly Hong Kong island is, so be aware you will be walking up lots of steps or hills in this part of the city. However for us, we are glad we stayed on Hong Kong Island rather than Kowloon, as the nightlife is more to our taste.If you're on a budget, this hotel is perfectly acceptable, however don't expect anything fancy!

We stayed in the suite, we were able to get it at a similar price as standard rooms in other hotels so its more value for money. The place is just walking distance to restaurants and groceries. I was also able to borrow power adapter and umbrella from the hotel, stuff that shows the hotel staff cares and thinks about its customers!

We had a great family vacation here!The room for the 3 of us was a good size, and the lobby had free snacks and soft drinks available all the time.Sparkling clean, and staff extremely helpful. Provided easy access to theme park tickets

This was our first trip to Hong Kong and we decided on Hotel LBP because of the location and previous reviews.We arrived well before check-in time, and they allowed us to store our luggage there until our room was ready. We booked a business suite because we wanted a little more room than seemed common in this area. We were very pleased with the space; a sitting area with its own TV (with several English channels) and a mini-fridge, along with a small dining area; the bedroom had room to hang clothes, a desk, room to store 2 suitcases,a TV, and a reasonably sized bed. It might have been slightly smaller than a queen (our normal configuration), but definitely larger than just a double, and more than adequate (quite comfy, with plenty of pillows). There wasn't a lot of room at the foot of the bed, which made getting up to use the facilities a bit challenging, but no toe stubbing happened. The bathroom, while small, had good ventilation and enough amenities. If you relocate the toothbrushes, etc, that they supply for you from the small hanging shelf, there is more than enough space for personal toiletries. It is a humid climate, and as such, there was some mold and mildew found around the base of the shower sliding door, but not enough to be troublesome. The blackout curtains did their job, and the room was surprisingly quiet considering the liveliness taking place outside. Although the balcony wasn't large and needed a little love (peeling paint, sad looking plants), we really enjoyed hanging out there, with a view of the park across the way, having a drink at the end of the day). The AC worked splendidly, and every employee we encountered were friendly and courteous. (We also really enjoyed the robes and slippers supplied in the room.) The location was convenient for exploring the area; many local shops, laundromats, coffee shops, and MTR stations are right around the corner. We found no problems with the lobby being on the fourth floor; we used the microwave there to warm up leftovers several times, and the refrigerator full of cold drinks was much appreciated. All in all, a good stay, but not for the folks looking for a 5* experience, as the wear and tear and delayed upkeep of the facility would probably detract from their stay.

4 out of 5.Only spent 1 night here (about 10 hrs).Very small room but that's HK for you.Modernized clean room.Price was good so excellent value.Decent location.Wifi was very good. Think they have a router in each room.

Stayed in the business suite for 5 nights and it was ok. Not as spacious as the pics make it out to be but its HK. The bed isn't queen size. Had to ask for an extra bed. The amenities are good in the room and toilet and include tea/coffee supplies as well as full bathroom supplies. The rooms do have signs of wear and tear especially in the bathroom and lounges. The location is very convenient.

I stayed in both a normal room and a suite. Neither had what I consider to be a queen size bed, and I sleep on one at home every night. The suite in particular was run down and becoming very tired. The couch was badly stained, the small shelf inside the shower recess was loose and everything slipped off, and the towel rack was loose. The TV in the bedroom never worked and the HBO channel in the sitting area kept freezing up. Probably some half-arsed Kodi box! And at times the toilet area smelled. There is no space in the bathrooms to store your own toiletries or a shelf to rest anything on. I missed the ability to have a breakfast in the hotel on those mornings I needed to be up and gone.On the positive side the staff were very good. I found the location to be good and being able to use the meeting room to hold discussions with suppliers was a big plus.However, on balance it is doubtful I would stay at this hotel again.

Hotel LBP was clean, with nice sized rooms and helpful staff. I really enjoyed the location. It's very close to Hollywood Avenue and the Metro. The shower had great pressure and the decor was nice. I would stay here again and recommend to anyone.

When reserving a business suite for more than $200USD a day, I expected a quality room. That is not what Hotel LBP has. The quality of materials in the small pair of rooms is 2* at best, and falling apart at that (see pictures). The bedroom was barely twice the size of the bed. The bathroom tiny. The kitchenette is tiny, without a sink, microwave or cooktop. The tiny refrigerator cannot be opened unless you move one of the chairs. The staff and common area is pretty nice, but that does not make up for a lack of quality in the rooms. Kind of sad that the owners don't fix this old building up.

There was no electricity in the room. I inquired of the reception four times, but he didn't budge! We had to go out for a tour, but if there was no electricity in the room, they should have done it quickly, but they didn't. In particular, the reception ((a man with glasses)) very unpleasant.

We selected the LBP Hotel in HK on advice from a friend who knows the city well. It was a perfect solution.Located in Hollywood Central, it is close to restaurants, markets, temples, a design center, subway, museums, interesting street life/stores and art galleries.The hotel itself is situated in a mixed office/hotel building. The reception is on the 4th floor. We had booked a room for a week a couple of months ahead. When we arrived at the desk they greeted us warmly and said they had upgraded us to a suite, at no extra cost. Wondering why such a gesture had been offered, they told us because we had booked for a whole week. Great news, and what a fine room! A small kitchenette (kettle, toaster etc.) but no cooking. A sitting room with ample furniture and storage and a TV, with a DVD player. This room was very spacious, a welcome treat after 6 weeks in Vietnam, in small rooms. The bedroom was equally generous with space, desk, and ample storage. A very nice bathroom with a great shower topped off the accommodations.Now, on that 4th floor reception area I mentioned, the hotel offered; complimentary Nespresso coffee, tea, snacks, fresh fruit, water and cold drinks. A pleasant sitting area with couch, tables and chairs and a small outdoor balcony invited you to enjoy the coffee and browse the books and magazines on a bookshelf. The books were in several languages, very thoughtful. There was also a big selection of CDs, you could take to your room.There was an adjoining room with massage chairs, a foot massage device and a large TV with a good range of DVD's you could access. There is also a small gym, phone charger, computers etc. All of this is 24/7.To top this of, the staff were incredible. Most of them spoke good English, and their efforts to aid and abet were amazing. They were fun to talk to, but also so happy to go beyond a simple answer to "How do we get to the Star Ferry terminal?". At one point three of them were looking for an answer to a question I had about a temple ritual I鈥檇 observed! A magnificent experience all around.

Its a nice hotel in a good location close to tram transport to other parts of the city. There is a supermarket very close to the hotel which makes it easy to maintain essential stocks.We found the staff very friendly and helpful. This hotels worth your consideration.

I've stayed in this hotel a couple of times as I used to travel to HK quite frequently via Macau. Compared to the other hotels of the same price range, I come back to this because it's relatively clean and comfortable. Room size is ok too. Location is great as it's a walkable distance to Central HK, the ferry terminal and HK MTR station which is the airport link, so it's close to almost all mode of transportation. Not noisy like some hotels that are located in the middle of Soho Central too.

perfectly located, great staff, commodities such as roof top smoking area, free coffees teas candies and biscuits : everything is within walking distance in case you love antiques, art and want to discover hong kong island

My friends and I stayed LBP hotel 3 nights.It was good place to stay.The LBP hotel was excellent with a very friendly staff,enjoy every moment at hongkong. LBP hotel is nice clean hotel and easy access to famous places.Good restaurants and supermarket just near by hotel.

I was very satisfied during my stay at the LBP. Staff are very kind. The room was clean to stay with my family.  Hotel is good place to look around . It is very close to use tram, bus, MTR. I hope to stay at LBP next time.

Good central location on HK Island between MTR stations with restaurants and bars nearby. Very clean with tea and coffee facilities, room safe and fridge. Shower excellent and clean towels daily. Only slight moan was the door to the balcony didn't lock and whilst the risk of an intruder was low someone could have got in along the balcony. Staff very helpful and friendly and contacted me quickly regarding a left item allowing me time to collect.

Confortable room, very quiet, staff efficient and pleasant, they lend me a plug. That鈥檚 a good idea !Hotel is located in the historic part of Hong Kong, close to the tramway and the metro Sheung Wan in the main Island.

The front desk was really helpful in getting me a room quickly and early in the day too. Thanks.The room was nice. Bathroom was spacious (due to it being a handicap ready room). The stay was convenient. Location was easy to access. MTR station nearby. Just walking distance.

I'm vvvery happy. I'm satisfied everything your hotel service. So kinds and Room service ok. Room condition is very good. Very clean. Thanks you kindness for me. I remember hotel LBP. Goodbye. Good luck to you.

It's a good hotel. The room is a little small, but it is comfortable and properly located. The massage machine on the fourth floor is the best. Employees are kind and quick to feedback. I'd like to stay another time.

The room is spacious and clean. Amenities are adequate, with hair conditioners is a plus. There are free soft drinks and sweets down in the lounge area which is nice.The place is not super close to the subway station but is convenient enough. The neighborhood is mostly residential area so it鈥檚 quite comfy and quiet at night. A small convenient store nearby as well.

Stayed here for 4 nights for the entire duration of our trip and the overall experience was great! It wasn't peak season when we stayed there so our room was upgraded to a bigger one!! The room we stayed in was clean, had a mini-kitchen and a living room!! They also have a small patio where you can have your complimentary breakfast. We bought our Disneyland ticket from the front desk so we wouldn't line up once we get there and it came with a small HK Disneyland token/souvenir. I would definitely stay here again and actually recommended this to our friends.

It was very nice hotel!Even tho the room was smaller than my expectation, I satisfied the hotel.(Because other hotels are also expensive and small too)It was clean and modern.But the bathroom and shower booth were very narrow actually.

We just had another wonderful stay at LBP . Their reception staff is extremely helpful. We particularly loved the guest lounge and the gym room. The room we stayed in was very spacious, stylish and clean. The bed ultra comfy. Our cleaning lady (Lida) very sweet and friendly. We will definitely stay here again next time in Hong Kong

Conveniently located -public transport easily available. 24 hours security control -lift access by room card only. Room comfortably equipped. 24 hours free flow of coffee, tea & biscuits at reception.

We booked business suite which was very spacious for Hong Kong standard - travelling with 2 children 6 and 11 years old found that extra space was needed. The room was clean and quiet. hotel staff were helpful and friendly. Would stay with this place again if we are back to Hong Kong. Hotel lobby is located on the 4th floor - but did not cause any problems.

I was so comfortable at this place. It was a great experience with LBP Hotel. The hotel is near to the station and convenience stores, so I could take so many advantages from them. Most of all, the hotel staff is so kind. Thank you.

Good location from the Shonwan Ferry terminal. we took the H2 hotel shuttle bus from HK station and walked 5 minutes from the stop. Nice concierge and lobby lounge for 14 hours complimentary coffee and tea. Rooms are clean and satisfied. we totally enjoyed stay there. 24 hours supermarket is next to the hotel, really convenient.

The hotel wasn鈥檛 so modern and trendy but very good, clean, very central close to Soho, night life and shopping, comfortable bed we were two adults only One bed and only One quilt/duvet and when we ask for One extra duvet so must we rent it, strange.

Stayed here for over a week and overall happy with our choice. While it's true that the place itself isn't high end, it serves its function well. We has a small room with a curiously elevated bathroom and it might have been worth it to upgrade to a larger space but Hong Kong is meant to be explored, not experienced in a hotel room. Stayed on the second floor facing a courtyard so no noticed no street noise whatsoever. One notable bonus was that the shower was a good size and not cramped like many other hotel rooms in Hong Kong. The WIFI worked good and the common area had coffee and cold drinks available for guests. On the downside, the hotel room TV was old and seemed to have connection problems and the bed was a bit too short and small for us. Yet, somehow, this didn't seem to hamper the stay. Perhaps this is because the way in which the employees try to make your stay as pleasant as possible . Would recommend Hotel LBP for a budget-minded traveller.

Staff was friendly, neighborhood was great, room was tiny. My husband and I stayed for a couple of days and it suited our purposes since we were only at the hotel to sleep. Requested a queen bed, but it was definitely smaller than that.

This is fine if you merely need a place to stay, but perhaps not long term. While it is perfectly functional the hotel lacks any atmosphere. My room was not particularly big or attractive, but the bed was comfortable and the bathroom very clean. My room had some traffic noise -- to be expected in Hong Kong.No restaurant, however there is a communal area where you can eat food that you bring in or make yourself a tea/coffee/drink.

An unassuming good value hotel centrally located in the Sheung Wan district of Hong Kong Island. Rooms are small by western standards, but are clean and functional, with attached toilet and bathroom. Free wi-fi provided. Location was a plus as the hotel is only 5-10 minutes walk from Sai Ying Pun railway station and is also close to the Hong Kong Macau Ferry Terminal.

The hotel is in Sheung Wan, a convenient 10 min walk to the Macau ferry terminals and other ferry services. The area itself is rather interesting, but most tourists wouldn't buy anything that the shops around peddle. Rooms were extremely small - smaller than I had thought. They were kept clean however, and the hotel offered a few free snacks. There were two bottled grape juices in the fridge - I am not sure if those were free. The bathroom was rather small, but acceptable,. It had translucent walls - something to note for strangers staying together - and some black mould. The bed was really comfortable, but small. Welcome was okay, and most staff were friendly. There was one who was slightly more surly however. There wasn't a pool, but there's a small fitness centre with a treadmill and one weights machine. Transport wise the hotel is okay.. there are many tram and bus options - the MTR is kind of far away, maybe a 7 min walk.

Right in the middle of everything .... Walking distance to SoHo, Hollywood Road, Centre street etc. Lots to see in any direction for walkers. Some/most rooms windows actually open which is Rare in better hotels. Hotel is similar to Butterfly on Waterfront but better location. Best to pay extra $20 to $50 a night for the suites..... extra space is needed for 2 or more people. Small but decent gym.No restaurant but great concierge level free coffee bar, light snacks open around 18 hours a dayBest soap, shampoo and lotions; square design capsules ...... should have bought more.High floors best to avoid road noise ...... Overall a Good 3.75 star hotel !

I have stayed here twice and find the property to be extremely well located from Central and LKF (10-15 mins of walk). Well kept, clean and tidy. They have a coffee and sitting area on the 4th floor with an outside seating. Staff is helpful as well. Overall I will stay here as long as I have to travel to HK and access Central HK.

We stayed in a business suite. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the location was very convenient.very easy transport & many food options within walking distance. One of the best hotels I've ever stayed .

the location was good the room was spacious enough if it's your first time visit to Hong Kong and don't know a thing about Hong Kong this place would be good for first timersThe bus stop from the airport is close

This was our second stay at this hotel. Overall, we were very impressed with this hotel. The room was large and clean, you received daily bottles of water and bathroom products. The staff were welcoming and helpful. I also like the fact that the hotel is in an area that says 'this is Hong Kong'. Would we stay again? Most certainly!

Overall pretty good, big room, but the bed was a little bit too small. If the bed was a little bigger, the overall experience would have been fantastic. Also, there were free facilities on the fourth floor, such as snacks, drinks and a lounge room, which was awesome.

We stay at LBP every year as it has everything we need; modern, clean, very helpful friendly staff, and good size rooms, and convenient location, being within walking distance of Central and Mid-Levels, and MTR stations.

Good Location and easy to take any transportation; Staff are friendly & helpful; Room is quite and clean; 24 hours complimentary coffee & snacks & massage chair to relax. Highly recommended this hotel .

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Great service at great price. Pulls of the Shangri-La brand really well. Not many options of hotels with swimming pools and the price here for the quality is really good.They have shuttles to airport express which helps with luggage.All rooms same size regardless of views except suites which are larger.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Clean, central and convenient right near the CBD within travel distance. Located right next to Hong university station surrounded by local eats and charms. Great stay! Complimentary shuttle bus all day round around the city is bonus

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: I don't even remember how many times I have stayed at this hotel in the last 5 years. This hotel is located right next to University of Hong Kong Station and is surrounded by restaurants, bakeries, drug stores, grocery stores etc. Very convenient. Even TST is within 20 minutes. Highly recommende3d.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: If you鈥檙e looking for an authentic Hong Kong experience, this hotel delivers the goods. It鈥檚 smack in the middle of working class Kennedy Town, whilst still being a quality hotel. The neighbourhood is bustling with locals going about their daily business and is bursting with amazing food options. HKU MTR Station is steps away (exit B2) and if you walk a short distance to Des Voeux St, the famous trolley cars (affectionately known as ding-dings) will take you up and down the northern coastline of the island for about 25c!Hotel Jen staff are charming and helpful. Rooms are well appointed and our bed was super comfortable. The rooftop pool is a blessing on those steamy HK days. Last, but not least, the hotel has a complimentary shuttle bus to and from Hong Kong station, which links with the airport express train. This makes for quick (60mins) and easy transfers. This is our 鈥榞o to鈥?hotel whenever we鈥檙e in Hong Kong and I recommend it highly.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Great for a short trip, very helpful and attentive staff from the front desk to the chambermaid. Staff recognised us and only had to be told once about us being a family of Coeliacs. Pleasure to stay their with easy access from HKU station into Central.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: The room was not so big but it was ok for 2 persons. So close from HKU station, which looks little bit far from central city, but I had no problem and actually liked it here very much. We stayed there beginning of June and it was very hot so that we enjoyed swimming at the rooftop, water was clean and view was fantastic!

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: My hubby's favorite hotel in Hong Kong, reasonable price, and good location, opposite HKU MTR. As Jade member we get free breakfast and upgrade to Club room.Cafe Malacca serves authentic and best Malaysian food in Hong Kong. Breakfast has very good spread of western and Malaysian food choices.Club lounge has fantastic harbour view, and nice evening cocktail.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Hotel Jen is on a busy street in HK but very conveniently placed close to HKU Station on the main island subway line and close to HK University where I was attending a conference. The ground floor entrance from the street is for cars with the lobby on the first floor which can be disconcerting. Check in was confused and slow and the lifts are always busy so getting to one's floor can be a wait.The double superior room was more than adequate with a nice bathroom and shower. Chambermaid service was really excellent. Breakfasts are in the Caf茅 Malacca that, true to its name serves Malaysian/Singaporean food. The choice for breakfast was really large encompassing Western, Chinese and S E Asian. Also lunches and dinners were the same and very reasonably priced.A better choice than somewhere nearer the main HK centre

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We had a great time at Hotel Jen and honestly couldn't find fault with anything. The staff were polite and helpful, the room had plenty of space and a great view, the pool was big enough to do laps, and the gym was open all the time which is great when you have jet lag! I recommend staying in the club rooms as access to the club lounge was a definite high point for us. The breakfast selection was fine and wasn't busy. But the best was going up for cocktail hour; a great way to unwind after a busy day.I would definitely stay here again, was sad to leave!

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: I stayed at the Hotel Jen wile attending a conference at Hong Kong University. Proximity to the conference venue was ideal - 10 minute walk - but you鈥檙e also in the middle of a neighbourhood with lots of shops, restaurants, and services. Easy access to the MTR, less than an hour away from the airport. Hotel Jen is a fantastic destination for this part of Hong Kong.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Really can鈥檛 think anything at all negative about this Hotel. The room we had on 23rd floor was of a very good standard with a view of the harbour. Good links around HK with free shuttle bus to the Central Station. Thanks

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We selected this hotel primarily because of its location and the fact we only had 24 hours in Hong Kong. Public transport, food and local life are abundant from the moment you step onto the busy street outside. We had a room on floor 23 with a city view. The room was on a club floor, but we did not have a room with club benefits (by choice). The view was an appreciation of Hong Kong鈥檚 density. The room was well appointed with more of an upper-end traveller feeling rather than a business feeling. There was not a lot of room, but at the same time there was plenty of space and larger than we thought it would be for Hong Kong island accommodation. The bathroom is small, but a perfect utilisation of space and the shower had great pressure. The bed was clean with good pillows and we had a great sleep in a quiet space. The common areas (lifts, hallways etc) have the appearance that they get a lot of traffic. It is a very clean hotel, but it is starting to show wear. We booked on-line through the hotel website. We arrived on public transport from the airport and the hotel was easy to get to. Check-in was really straight forward.Breakfast was included in our rate and the fresh made laksa was really good. The coffee was machine produced and ordinary. The fruit selection was fresh and seasonal. We checked out the pool area but did not use it. Excellent space and great views we just wish we had more time and we would have dived in. We had a late flight out of Hong Kong. We paid a half day rate to have the room until 6pm and we thought it was value as it allowed us to have a jam-packed day with some rest and a good shower before a long-haul flight. The hotel location alone is the reason we are giving it 5*. And it is because of the hotels location that it would be our preferred choice should we visit Hong Kong again.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We stayed two nights at the Jen after my wife arrived in HK from the States. It was ideal for our purposes. The hotel was well appointed and well arranged, our room was modern and comfortable with nice amenities, not huge, but not tiny either鈥擨鈥檝e been in NYC hotel rooms that were much smaller. The staff was uniformly friendly and courteous as well as bi-lingual. We liked the location as well, outside of the main tourist areas so a better feel for local culture, activities and cuisine, but easy access to all of HK with the HKU subway stop just a few steps away and the HK Tramway only a block away. The hotel also offers a shuttle service that goes hourly to Central HK Island and on a posted schedule to the Peak Tram, Disneyland and other attractions. We loved the rooftop pool with a killer view of the city and harbor. We would happily stay again.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Arrived with great expectations after the good experience we had in Singapore.Unfortunately this hotel did not live up to same experience.This hotel is in a less desired area and rooms were even smaller than Singapore. Also the onside restaurants and bars did close very early.Breakfast was a mile off from the choice and service levels of Jen Orchard Street..Hotel will have to step it up a notch to meet service levels and amenities of both Jen hotels of Singapore.BTW, hotel is easy to reach from airport via train and underground.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: I booked two rooms with a total of 4 nights stay at Hotel Jen. The Harbour View rooms had an awesome view overlooking the sea. The beds were comfy and though a small room, it was practical with a sliding door partitioning the bed room section from the shower/toilet section. Breakfast was good. Location wise - excellent! With easy access to the MTR and tram station in addition to the free shuttle service. The service staffs were super friendly and helpful too. I would return to the same hotel for my next visit to Hong Kong.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Had a very comfortable stay at the Jen made even better by the efficient and friendly housekeeping crew.Really enjoyed the club, Ivan and his team made sure that all of their guests were well looked after.The only negative is that the breakfast offering in the restaurant is fairly limited, but it is HK so there are lots of choices for breakfast.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: I never leave reviews on hotels but thought I would take the time for this one. I booked a room 1 month in advance and made a mistake on the date when confirming online (because of my phone screen). I called the hotel immediately to inform them of the unfortunate mistake and asked for a change in the date (many rooms were available at the date I wanted). They simply refused to change the date or refund and did not suggest any alternative. I was very surprised and did not expect that from a 4 star hotel. I called them many times and my experience of their customer service was terrible. This is not what I am used to even with hotels with loser standards. They just dont care about their customers. The Jen does not match EU standards. This has tarnished the Shangri la brand for me.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Stayed in HKU MTR station this time and close to it, JEN hotel which belongs to Shangri la Group. Lucky to have a sea view room, size acceptable, convenient shower and toilets, very clean...Weak points : the area if you are not too used with Asia, you will find less interesting places to have food or to visit. Also escalators were not working so well.Not too far you can go to Sun-Yat Sen park to have a wonderful view on the bay.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Hotel Jen is in the middle of a bustling busy area but the noise level in the hotel is minimal.The start was not very good as we had travelled for over 13 hours and when we got there our room wasn't ready so we had to leave our suitcases and go wandering for a couple of hours and we weren't really in the mood for that after all our travelling.Eventually we came back and they told us it was ready and although the room was quite spacious the carpets in the hallway could have done with a good clean and the room although clean on the surface those carpets could have benefitted from a bit of a clean too.Putting all that aside the room was okay, no sights to see from the window but an elevated road but I wasn't going to sit looking out of the window all day.The second day there the credit type key decided it didn't want to play any more and really messed us about. The maintenance guy couldn't fix it, the guy from reception couldn't fix it but the manager decided to change the battery which was supposed to have been changed a week earlier and that did fix it fortunately.The meals were good very Chinese which is what you would expect in China and the beers were a bit expensive apart from happy hour where it was 2 for 1, guess when we did our drinking?There is a pool on the 13th floor which when you look over the edge sends you a bit giddy the lesson is don't look over the edge. It was a nice pool nicely laid out but the water was a little cold but then it was March.The hotel is within walking distance of a host of eateries, shops and the Chinese way of life, an education I can tell you but you must have a go on the trams that run down the middle of the road. For 2$ 60 you can travel as long as you like and I for one loved it.A decent walk sends you to where you can get a feery to the mainland and that again is an education all by itself.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: I've travelled with my son and wife to Hong Kong for a short trip of 3 days. The hotel is in a very convenient and calm location, in downtown Hong Kong, close to subway and not far from nice toursitic areas (Victoria peak, Soho, antique market, city harbour). Hotel is very clean, well organized, with a delicious breakfast included. The only negative point was that they prepared a room for two people although requested for three. Since we arrived late in the night, the problem was solved only in the next day.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: I chose this hotel for a weekend stop in HK - it was peak peak weekend with the end of Canton Fair as well as a long Chinese long weekend approaching, so all the Island hotels were running close to rack rates. Hotel itself is decent, great bed, slept well, however curtains are not black outs and day break light comes through the cracks which isnt ideal. TV channel selection is decent. Did not have breakfast or try any of the restaurants as I was out for all meals.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Once again chosen thru trip advisor comments. I had real high hopes and left a little deflated. We have stayed in club rooms before so expected a lot more then what we got. Also having stayed in Hong Kong before and being happy in another hotel that felt the same room wise.Check in fast and Check out even faster.The rooms however a little disappointing, we were meant to have a mountain view room, I think we got a cram your neck and may get a sight of the mountain.The room comfortable and clean, however a few cosmetic flaws in the tiles and areas that may need a refresh. The bed comfy but a little squishy for my tastes. Free bottle of water and the usual shampoo, conditioner, toothbrush and paste.Safe available as well as a small fridge.The club lounge is nice. The food at the 530 til 730 nibbles is either amazing or missed the mark. However the staff on the shifts make a mean drink which kept us there Breakfast is very nice but once again either really good parts and really bad parts.Used the lounge after check out until our flight, so enjoyed the free wifi and coffee.The subway right across the road, HKU exit B2 for the people like me who try to do it themselves.We used the pool however it was a cold day (26) and the wind was bad. Would be nice in hotter weather. Food all around and easy to take a walk and look around.Stay here if you don鈥檛 want the hustle and bustle of inner Nathan road.Would return but maybe not a club room as didn鈥檛 meet my expectations.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Booked 2 rooms , for 4 of us. So far it's has been a comfortable stay. Bed and pillow was comfortable for us.But building looks old, everything seems to look worn off .When I check in, I saw my toliet has got a long hair on top the toliet celling, till my last day of check out, it is still there. It's really very obvious and visible ,I wonder how come the house keeping can over looked it.. the toliet celling is very low, so definitely the first thing u see is the long strand of hair. Really disgusting. We don't even dare to wipe off ourselves as well.Location wise, is super convenient.Around the area has got quite alot of food choice. Will recommend for the location.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Great views from the room and Club Lounge over the harbour. Very friendly and helpful staff. Perfect location for the MTR and nice to be in a more 'local' area than among the tourist traps. Cafe Malacca lived up to its reputation!

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Great place to stay with friendly staff and helpful clerks. The pool on the top is small but adequate and is great to relax in after a long day of exploring or as a beginning to your day. Close to MTR subway for quick travel around HK and 7/11 for snacks and food at all hours of the day.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We decided to try out this hotel because we like staying in Shangri-la hotels. The hotel is situated in Kennedy Town on the east-side of Hong Kong Island. The hotel is a stone's throw from Hong Kong University subway station.Check-in was faultless - it was nice that there was someone who greeted us when we got dropped off by the taxi and took our luggage to the foyer. Check-in was very efficient and the front desk was very helpful in answering our questions.We got upgraded to Club Level and we stayed in Room 2311. The room was average sized (by Hong Kong standards) and featured a lovely view of Hong Kong University. The room layout is clever, but may not be to everyone's taste - you walk through the bathroom to get to the bedsitting area - although there are separate doors for the shower and toilet (both small). There is a sliding partition that can be pulled across the room to separate the bedsitting area and the bathroom. We didn't like the dirty toilet seat with water marks!Storage is on the low side with only a few hooks and a very narrow wardrobe. We did struggle to store our luggage (two suitcases, two carry-on cases) and use the room at the same time.The bed was very comfortable and the room's air conditioning worked well. The bed lighting was very nice. Overall, the room was very functional and stylish but not as luxurious as the Shangri-la.Breakfast was nice. Breakfast is hosted on the 2nd floor restaurant and it looks fantastic. There's also a wide (and healthy) selection of things to eat. The staff were very nice and welcoming. We could not fault the breakfast (and we can be fussy).The hotel is in a nice area but guests might feel a bit frustrated by the lack of local amenities. You will have to travel if you want to go shopping or finding something to eat, so it's not in the best location. It's in a friendly neighbourhood but not enough to want to spend time. It's convenient to walk to nearby places like PMQ and Hollywood Road but I guess it's in an area similar to Shoreditch - a cool area but lacks amenities.It's convenient to get to the airport - don't bother getting the shuttle to Hong Kong station, just jump into a taxi and head straight for the airport (it will save you time). Would we stay again? Probably not to be honest. It's a lovely hotel but too far away from local attractions. You would be doing a lot more travelling around to get to places like Causeway Bay, Central and Wan Chai.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We wanted to stay in the hub of Hong Kong so we chose this hotel - what a little gem. The outside doesn鈥檛 look too amazing but the reception is very welcoming and the staff very friendly. Check in was easy and rooms lovely and clean - small but typical for city hotels. They have a roof top pool which is a decent size and a good size gym (latter not used by me). The bar area is small and drinks unsurprisingly more expensive than the bars along the street. They do have happy 鈥榟our鈥? or ally lasting for two! Breakfast (included) is amazing and caters for all tastes. We spoke to someone staying there who had stayed at the posher hotels and said this was way better with the food and facilities plus you felt you were in Hong Kong not just some other faceless hotel. A stay here will not leave you disappointed, simply the opposite. A 100% recommendation.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Stayed in a harbour view club room. View is ok but an apartment building nearly opposite and not comparable to say the view from the Kerry. I would probably not pay the extra next time. Very clean. Gym small but worked well. Club was great: not as fancy or plush obviously as it鈥檚 bigger Shangri-La siblings but super friendly staff and very pleasant. Food choices etc were ok : limited food range but quality fine. Area is residential but nice to see a different part of HK away from the shopping malls. Had some great local food. If you use the MRT like we did the location is great, if you don鈥檛 it might be more problematic. Good value for HK and I would happily stay again.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: First visit to HK so I picked the Hotel Jen for its price and convenient location to MTR HKU stop just across the street. Most important for me is clean, safe and good location. Hotel Jen experience was spot on for us, no fuss just a good and safe place to rest. Breakfast spread was excellent provided a variety of options which is always good. Room was clean and good enough for us. The location to the HKU MTR stop was bonus we got around Hong Kong quick and easy. The pool and gym on the rooftop was pretty cool. The staff was nice and helpful when we had questions. Highly recommend!

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: This hotel is situated in a dirty and noisy environment in Shek Tong Tsui of the Western District near one of the Hong Kong University MTR exits. The location is convenient, but the pedestrian/ road traffic seems to be messy. The staff are not visitors-friendly at all, and the washrooms in the lobby that were previously used to open to all visitors are now locked with a numerical keypad; and the staff would not grant you the code for access unless you are a current hotel room guest, even if you are visiting someone staying in a hotel room there, or simply wanting to check with the reception desk for their room availability. This could be due to the fact that their washrooms in the lobby were still very dirty like before and were still dirty these days that the staff refused to expose them to the public.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We stayed here for one night and had a late midnight flight the next day. The hotel was booked for the next day and we needed a place to stay until 9 p.m. because my husband was sick. The hotel gave us a 1 pm checkout and allowed us to stay at their 28th floor lounge to hang out all day. The lounge is beautiful with complimentary juices and small snacks all day. It was a great place to lounge all day and for my husband to rest before our midnight flight. The shuttle bus to Victoria鈥檚 Peak was very convenient as well as the hotel being close to the MRT. The train ride from the airport during the day with a transfer to the MRT was easy going to the hotel and in the evening we took a taxi ride back to the airport. We had a superior room with a view of the harbor on the 16th floor. The room was modern and clean. The staff at the desk and the lounge were all very helpful.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Juste came few days in Hong Kong.Found this nice hotel. Impressed by the well behavior of the employee.There is a top level place where you can sit and watch the see from it. A place where you could take a cup of tea and work a bit ... no actually, for the tea you have to pay 250 HKD ... what ? Can I just sit and have a coffee or tea ? No sir... you have to pay the amount of the full day cocktail and dinner ... (obviously they charge the room!) but I just want a tea!In France we call it a 芦聽racket.聽禄It鈥檚 not a matter of money, it鈥檚 just a matter of commun sens.I definitely do not recommend this Jen by Shangri-La !

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Very well located for MTR. We stayed in a superior room which was very clean and bright. Not very big but adequate. Staff in reception very pleasant and helpful but sadly in the Cafe Malacca it was difficult to attract the staffs attention on numerous occasions! Very functional and mid range property for those on business.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Don鈥檛 be put off by the slightly utilitarian aspect of the Jen or the perception that it鈥檚 location on Queens RD W has it in an unfashionable area. Due to the proximity of the MTR almost on the hotels doorstep means you are only minutes away from all the main Central places if you are prepared to use HK鈥檚 excellent underground system.The rooms are smallish and un inspiringly decorated but adequate in every way with a excellent strong shower and separate WC.
