The upgrade to Club more than worthwhile with a very pleasant and warmly staffed lounge where a decent breakfast is available and a 2 hour happy hour of free drinks and considerable food is available every evening.Lastly if you like to swim there鈥檚 a sizeable lap pool on the roof which all works perfectly next door to a well equipped gym. For the price I reckon absolutely outstanding value for HK island. I wasn鈥檛 wowed - but on reflection of return. Plus the staff were all lovely.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We always have a great time whenever me and my family stays at Hotel Jen Hong Kong.Pros: - Very friendly and always helpful staff, excellent customer service! - Rooms are reasonably spacious and nicely laid out. There is even a sliding divider to separate the bedroom and toilet/shower area. - Shuttle service (Tue & Thu only) to Disney and more frequently, to central locations - Convenient location, HKU MRT station is just a few meters aways. There are also numerous shops in the area. Just one MRT station away is Kennedy Town where there are a lot of fancier restaurants and cafes.Cons: - Breakfast is generally good, though sometimes there are some dishes that taste just so-so

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: This is the first time we are staying in Hotel Jen. The hotel is conveniently located along Island Line and the surrounding is not as crowded as the hotel belts in Kowloon. That to me is a big plus point given how crowded HK can be. In addition, there are several eating places outside the hotel. The staff spoke very good English and were very professional. The only concern I had was the interior of the superior twin room I took was old and room size which was typical of HK hotels. If you have a bigger travel budget, I would suggest that you take a club room with harbour view.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We would never have found this hotel if it hadn't been recommended to us by a local. But we are so glad we did. We had a harbour view room which was great; we joined the "club" (for an extra HKD500 a day) which was so worth it as it gave us a wonderfully relaxed and tasty breakfast in their 28th floor lounge, somewhere to hang during the day if we needed it, and free drinks with canapes every evening we were there. It's right next to HKU station on the MTR metro so getting anywhere in Hong Kong from here was a breeze. You'll love this place.And treat yourself to the limo service from the airport. So easy and so worth it.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Location is right next to the metro station which is so good getting about HK. The rooms at this hotel were well kept, clean and maintained throughout my 3 night stay. Breakfast was fine each and every morning and the staff were very attentive. The pool was closed during my visit however I was informed of this by email prior to arrival. There is a complimentary bus to help you around the City and a timetable is provided at reception for you. The staff displayed good local knowledge however there were a few things I needed to Google!

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We recently stayed at Hotel Jen on Queen's Road West in Sai Ying Pun. This is a good mid-range property in this area of Hong Kong Island. Reservation was made directly on the Hotel Jen website where we found better room rates than what was being offered on booking.com for the weekend we were interested in staying here. Email confirmation was received shortly after booking. We were well received upon arrival, check-in was smooth and quick. We were up in our rooms within a few minutes of arriving. Property location is just outside the HKU MTR Station Exit B2, providing good access to other areas of Hong Kong Island. Lots of local eateries and a 711 just outside the hotel. Not much in the form of western dining nearby. However, you are just a couple MTR stations away from Sheung Wan and Central if need be. Rooms are spacious with sufficient closet and luggage space. Room includes work desk, rolling chair, expected safe, ironing board, fridge, kettle, lamps and good lighting. TV, Wifi, A/C all worked very well during out stay. Importantly, beds are comfortable, providing good sleep. Views from our room were just ok. Overall, our room was rather comfortable.There is a rooftop pool and gym with great views of the city. You'll also find a simple lobby bar and Cafe Malacca on the second floor. Hotel provides free shuttle service to places like the Peak, Macau Ferry Terminal, Ocean Park and Disneyland amongst other places. Check the hotel for details. Overall, we like Hotel Jen by Shangri-La. Its a functional and pretty nice mid-range property, perfect for those with business at HKU and those wanting to stay in Hong Kong Island near an MTR Station.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Excellent well connected and serviced hotel in the Western District. Near MTR station,bus and tram stops. Fine breakfast and very good quality rooms. Young staff helpful and professional. Would gladly stay here again.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: This was our first visit to the Hotel Jen HK and for sure not the last. The hotel is situated in a very convenient location and they provide complimentary shuttles to carefully selected locations within HK island. The staff are amazing and check-in was fast and convenient whereas the check-out was accurate. Rooms are clean and well maintained.A shout out to Raymond from concierge, he goes way above what is required to make sure we are well informed of. Thank you the team at Hotel Jen

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: My only complaint is that the hotel advertised a special rate for 3-night stays based on age, but wouldn't actually offer it when asked. Otherwise, my room on the 12th floor provided a glimpse of the water (which was fine - I had many other views of HK during my visit). The space was so cleverly designed that I had no complaint about the room size. Front desk staff were always friendly and helpful, including offering a birthday surprise and allowing late check-out. I used the A10 bus to get from the airport, which took 45 min., was cheap, and stopped a few steps from the hotel. Returning, the hotel arranged the shuttle since it was raining hard. The MTR entrance is a few steps away and if you want to visit Hong Kong University, you can use the station hallways as access. All in all, a satisfactory stay.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We recently stayed at the Hotel Jen and had upgraded to a club room. We found that the extra cost was well worth it. We had access to the club room in the evening and found the food available was enough for the evening and the drinks were of a good quality. All the staff were excellent and helpful, very attentive. The food at breakfast, also included in the upgrade was of a good quality with plenty to choose from, no need to have lunch. Its location, very close to an underground station, was excellent and made travelling around HK very easy.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: This was my 5th stay here. Staying in a room with club lounge privileges. Therefore I paid a premium to stay there with my new wife.Sadly, the service at the lounge is worse with each stay. Staff too busy doing assigned work on their computer, rather than looking after the hotel guests who pay a premium to stay at Hotel Jen's club lounge level.I don't blame the staff. Management seems to have forgotten, no guests, no pay. Unhappy guest

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Upon arrival and throughout our stay the staff were so helpful, especially the Front Desk. Everyone in the hotel made sure everything was correct and in order. We were sorry to leave. My wife and I strongly recommend Hotel Jen. Clean, great food. Very pleasant room. Wonderful staff. Reasonably priced. Great location that allowed us to eat with the locals and experience the real Hong Kong. I would not recommend this hotel for people with a mobility impairment.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: After reading several reviews saying the rooms were small that was what we were expecting. It turned out to be fine, not massive but not small either. The room had tea making facilities, free bottled water.It was 2 mins walk from HKU station, so very convenient. We found a nice little bar just around the corner called Salt and Barrel, they did decent food.The area the hotel was in was a typical suburban area. We found it walkable to central but we like walking so probably to far for some.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: My wife and I recently stayed for 3 nights at the hotel. The location is handy, being next door to HKU MTV underground station, and there is a McDonald pretty much next door too (yes I know, but it did come in handy!). Check in was quick, and the room was clean and bright. The air conditioning unit was a bit noisy, and the noise from the fly over outside our 8th floor window and the street noise below did not give a great sleep experience. The bathroom had a bath with shower. There was an in-room safe and a kettle and fridge (plus free bottled water). The most annoying thing about the room, was that there were no drawers, so you had to live out of your suitcase. The staff were polite and helpful. The downside was that we discovered that the swimming pool was unavailable as it was being maintained, so there was nowhere to go and relax. There is a 鈥榗lub room鈥?on the 23rd floor which had a great view, but this is only for 鈥楥lub / Suite鈥?class guests. From looking at the hotel website I expected this to be available for all guests, so I was disappointed to discover that this was not the case when I got there. There is a bar area in reception, but it is a bit dark and not particularly inviting.So all in all, it was fine, but if I were to return to Hong Kong I 鈥榙 probably look at alternatives.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We stayed for 3 nights as an end to our honeymoon.We upgraded for a city view - I think these rooms are a bit bigger - spacious enough and very clean and comfortable with good amenities. Comfortable bed and great air con. Hotel very kindly arranged a bottle of Prosecco for our welcome which was a nice surprise.Definitely try and get city or even harbour view - just adds to the experience and makes the room feel bigger. Organised the shuttle from the airport with the hotel directly which was easy to arrange by email and was a convenient service. Great location with metro not even a 5 minute walk away and the trams close by. Can walk to the harbour. Great authentic dim sum place across the road from the hotel where all the locals go or if you don't fancy that McDonald's is right next door. Lots of eatery options in area + shopping mall close by.We didn't have meals at the hotel as we wanted to be out and try local things but the restaurant options seemed very good. First time in Hong Kong realised quite quickly that it is easy to get around and the hotel offer free shuttle to a lot of the key tourist areas, we didn't use it as the timings restricted us a bit. Only disappointment was that at the time of our booking we didn't know that the pool was under renovation at the time of our stay and we did specifically book the hotel for the pool option but it's just one of those things.Thank you to Elaine on the front desk for being so friendly and helpful and felt good to have a familiar face to talk to to help plan our stay.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Was very impressed by friendly staff , Anthony stood out as he was also service at the club lounge .The location was very good had public transport from metro go bus & taxi allAround us .Hotel has free shuttle bus to various spots !

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: I stayed one night for a city break and found the hotel firstly very convenient step off the metro and it鈥檚 directly to your forward left so great easy access. The rooms were decent size and good use of space from what I鈥檝e stayed in other hotels in HK, clean & comfy accessible from basement with key card elevators as well as lobby floor. A good option and my booking although last minute was a very competitive rate to local options so good value hotel in convenient location for exploring the city

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: The rooms looked exactly as the pictures but extremely small. There was no space to store clothes. You could hang a couple but the rest had to stay in a suitcase. My first room was a tiny triangle, it was super uncomfortable. Next room was much better but still small. I have miss feelings, the staff was amazing but I wish the rooms had more space, at least where to put my clothes.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Stayed here 4 nights. Not as good as we expected. Not 4 stars as rated. Rooms very small but this is normal for Hong Kong. Breakfast very good but restaurant in the evening very busy and loud and so so food. There is are bar in the lobby but rarely staffed.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: The Hotel Jen is an excellent choice if you are staying in this area of Hong Kong Island. The rates are quite reasonable for Hong Kong, and while the room was a little small, it was spotless and comfortable, and the staff was very friendly and welcoming.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: The location on HK island and relatively low price (by HK standards) are the selling points. It is also by a metro station and on thr bus route to the airport. So good for transit passengers, and well located for HKU. But otherwise there is little to sell this place. In line with all HK hotels, it is pricey. Rooms are good but small. The roof top pool, which was a major selling point for me, was closed when we visited. The bar at the top of the hotel has great views over HK but only open for premier guests, or a significant cost for other guests who might just want a drink and the view. So overall it was good but not exceptional, and useful rather than somewhere to recommend.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: The rooms were fine although small and we were expecting a harbour view but it's fine since we booked a superior room. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful in our various requests, and our favourite service was the free shuttle bus which included free wifi on the bus, to go to Disneyland and the peak central. The MTR (Exit B2) is very near the hotel as well which makes travelling convenient and fast. Breakfast was amazing as well.If you have children and plan to go to Disneyland, do use the shuttle bus as it is convenient and it is only a 30 minute ride. However, the bus only heads there on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 9:10am so do not miss it.Also as it was my grandaunt's birthday, the hotel provided us with a cake and personalised greeting which we really appreciate! Great stay overall! Thank you!

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: the location of the hotel is a bit off the busier areas of HK Island, getting to the place is relatively using the Island Line MTR after arrival at HK Island Airport Express Station. There is no free shuttle bus provided by Airport Express to the hotel unlike other hotels. but for limited timing Jen Hotel provides a free shuttle to pick up and send customers to and fro the hotel and airport express station.the club suite is great and the daily breakfast and use of lounge from 630am to 11pm are very welcomed. the daily cocktail from 530pm to 730pm are also well liked as it comes with some hot food. would be great if the breakfast served at the lounge would include bacon. maybe even a return promotion code for customers who are returning as a perk. thanks for the welcome wine and snacks. Thanks to the cleaners who cleaned our room well and stocking it up with lotions, shampoos, etc.Thanks to Amy and Suki for the smiles at the lounge. Cleaners Whom i forgot the names. Thanks

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Expected more for the price paid. The photos on the website are well enhanced to make it look a lot nicer then it is. The place is quite run down. And noisey. Can hear when almost anyone showers, uses a bathroom, the sound of water is constant. Can hear the people in surrounding rooms and in corridors easily. I believe the location is good from a transport point of view if you are confident using the trams/trains etc. Otherwise it鈥檚 a taxi almost everywhere. Breakfast buffet offers a range but is isn鈥檛 big on the western front. Dinner, lunch menu is limited and restrictive. Staff are friendly and helpful at the counter and the option of a shuttle running at various times is convienent. Wouldn鈥檛 personally stay here again

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: I booked this hotel because of its proximity to HKU. But I was happy to find the room and service to be very good. The location is right next to MTR so that is a great feature, and it's near a lot of good restaurants (with a few minutes walk).

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: location: just 10 mins walking distance far from HKU and MTR station(HKU station)Rooms: rooms not big but clean tiny and brightservice:staff friendly and helpful. check in and check out smooth. concierge assist to get taxi very quite and suggest me to take shuttle bus. Food: Did not take breakfast or lunch at restaurant so not sure its good or not. good and nice hotel for the stay if need go to HKU.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Hotel just next to MTR and 40 mins taxi far from airport cost around HKD $400. Many local restaurant near hotel e.g: Hong Kong style fish ball; barbecue pork & goose. During mid-night not much thing open only McDonald or 7-11 convenience store. Rooms is good so far and check in staff were nice and friendly. Can stay again if next time to Hong Kong

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Stay in Hong Kong during Christmas time and found Hotel Jen for my accommodation. I catch A10 from airport to hotel it鈥檚 only took around half an hour very convenience. Everything was great check in check out staff smiley and polite with kindly remind us passport and cell phone with us and room safe empty. I stayed in 24/F with a great harbour view. MTR near by hotel and take afew stop can reach LKF and Wan Chai. So far everything is fine and reasonable for me. Love it! Merry Christmas

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: First time stay with Hotel Jen Hong Kong. Easy to travel from the airport by airport express and the check in staff Ivan know this is my birthday trip arranged a bottle of wine and cake for me with a lovely birthday greeting. Thank you for his surprise and I really had a lovely stay. Apart of this; the hotel room look clean,tidy and size reasonable. Location is good next of the HKU station and around hotel with a lot of good local restaurants. So far evening was great and Reception staff was polite and friendly even they look always busy. The view of the club lounge is great with full harbour view but since I prefer spend time outside so did not join the club package or the gym room at the top floor only went up and found the gym is small but view was great. Swimming pool is close during winter but look though from gym it should be good when swimming in summer so next time we must try it. Thank you for everything and I will be back next time.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: This property is not in a posh neighborhood, not near shopping and not within walking distance of anything Except the HKU MTR Station, and THAT offsets quite a lot. Add to that a staff that is congenial and professional and it is very worth your consideration. Rooms are quite small, rates are reasonable, a small gym has just enough to keep you exercised. Swimming pool was closed for seasonal maintenance. Lounge is adequate and the breakfast is good. The three lifts are a bit oversubscribed (slow), so if you are reasonably patient, it will work out.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Hotel Jen is conveniently located next to HKU mtr station on Hong Kong island and there are a number eateries in walking distance.Rooms are clean, new and also comfortably sized for Hong Kong. It is also breathtaking to wake up to the view of HKU or the harbour in the morning.Prices wise may be a little too high for a family holiday but it's a perfect business hotel.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Great location when visiting Hong Kong University on Hong Kong Island. MTR station across the street. Staff are extremely enthusiastic and helpful. Good breakfast and nice Chinese food in the restaurant.The view from the rooftop pool is exquisite. The water is too cold to swim in December but should be very nice during summer.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: It is next to the MTR (HKU) station that gives you the flexibility to travel around. The electric tramp is one street away another means of cheap transport to travel along the whole strect of Hong Kong Island.Rooms are comfortable and clean. Only one restaurant Malacca but great variety and taste.However many food outlets nearby even a tasty small joint with great Tim Sum. Breakfast location for porridge just round the corner of Hotel Jen.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: I made an error in booking. I usually avoid basic rooms but "Superior Twin City View" sounded rather more than basic. Sadly, it appears to be "Basic Standard".My fault for nor reading more carefully.The room was fairly basic and the city views referred to the backs of adjacent buildings. But the bed was comfortable and the pillows good.Housekeeping good.Breakfast good.Front desk staff Good.Reception area a bit jaded.Location. Immediately outside B2 exit of HKU station on the Island Line. 3 stops from Central.Take care to note that the true price requires the addition of 10% tax.I paid about $HK8400 for 5 nights. That's not cheap and not much less than a good quality hotel in Tsimshashui.There are a number of "popular" home cooking restaurants in the area but they are not cheap. Most dishes $HK55+.The connection to Central Station is good but Central is large, busy and it feels a long way from, say, the harbour and a good map app or compass app is necessary to avoid walking in circles.The connection from Central to Hong Kong Station for the train to the airport is within fairly lengthy walking distance.HOWEVER, all that said, I'd probably stay there again on my next trip to HK - for the pillows, the mattress and the breakfast and its easy of discovery from HKU MTR station B2.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We loved our stay at the hotel. the service is impeccable. excellent experience from the moment we checked in till we checked out. the room was comfortable, clean & it was rather spacious by HK standard. The food was very good too esp. the pastries. The club lounge truly lives up to its purpose. It has a fantastic view, relaxing ambience & attentive staffs. Its location is super convenient with HKU MTR just 2mins walk away, bus stops nearby, hassle-free airport shuttle service. Many local eateries & McD nearby. I can't wait to return :)

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Great hotel, nicely located and accessible to tram, University and underground. Most impressive is the staff. We forgot a couple of items in the room, and the cleaning person noticed and ran after us all the way to the exit of the hotel to give us the items. In comparison, I stayed at a luxury resort in Arizona and I notice the I forgot my CD player when I arrived home. I called them and of course, tey did not find anything. Worst, I stayed at a luxury hotel in Slovenia, Ljubljana. I had a silver pendant in the safe. I noticed at the airport that I forgot the pendant in the safe )yes I have a habit of forgetting things :)) . I called the hotel and asked my host to call the hotel - but they did not find the silver pendant in the closed safe :) So five stars to the employee at the Jan Hotel.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We stayed here for 3 nights and wish we had stayed for longer. Hotel itself was extremely clean, the staff very friendly and helpful.Restaurant for breakfast had everything you could possibly want.Club lounge located on 28th floor had brilliant views over the harbour and should be a must if you book here. Very peaceful after a busy day in Hong Kong.Hotel situated very close to trams so access anywhere made very easy.Highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be coming back.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We wanted a larger hotel room with something of a harbour view in a more local area but handy for the MTR. Hotel Jen fulfilled all these criteria at a reasonable price and more than exceeded our expectations. The standout was the excellent standard of the housekeeping and the room's design features which made the most of the room size (quite large by HK standards though). The hotel's website photos are good indicators of what you get for your money and it also has good tips on things to do in the local area. Jen's location is fantastic if you want a more local feel; supermarkets of all kinds within a 2 minute walk, as was the MTR station entry with the ding-ding tram a block away (this is a very cheap way to get around the north of HK island). The on-site Malaysian restaurant was good and there is a rooftop pool and gym, a bar for Happy Hour (expensive otherwise) and a free shuttle bus (restricted times but very handy if you plan in advance). Any minor problem was quickly fixed by the staff who were super helpful. Highly recommended and we would certainly consider other Jen hotels in Asia as a result of our experience here.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Comparatively inexpensive for a hotel within the Shangri La group and an excellent location (next to HKU MTR). Staff is very friendly and helpful. On the downside, the bathroom is very small and poorly tiled, and the elevators take forever!

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We stayed at this hotel for two nights as a stop over on the way home from Australia. It was picked for us by our travel counsellor and we were very pleased with her choice. We were originally booked into a club mountain view room but offered an upgrade to a club harbour view room for an extra 10 dollars a night which we decided to do. We were on the 27th floor and the view was amazing. The room was generously sized, spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfortable. Being in a club room gave us certain benefits which included complimentary tea/coffee throughout the day, free canap茅s and drinks between 5.30 and 7.30 and an opportunity to have breakfast in the club lounge on the 28th floor instead of the restaurant and we would like to mention Sharon who was very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast buffet was absolutely fantastic, I have never had better. There was a fitness centre and rooftop pool but we did not have time to use them during our stay. We would also like to thank Guchi on reception who was so friendly in helping us navigate our way around Hong Kong on the underground. We would not hesitate in recommending this hotel. It was situated in the suburbs, not the central district but that was not a problem to us.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: My mom stayed in this hotel for more than a month this time, and we really appreciated the warm welcome back from the hotel staffs. Most of the staffs are friendly, and the duty manager Holiee is cheerful and helpful, and has made my mom's stay enjoyable. The seaview room is nice and tidy, and the hainan chicken rice in the cafe is as good as before!!

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: November 20-24,2018Dear Hotel Jen,Thank you for the great accommodationWe have experienced in Hotel Jen Hong Kong. My daughter and I were so delighted during our stay. Special shout out to Hoilee Sze , who has arranged a little surprise for my daughter who is celebrating her 9th Birthday.Not only she arranged a Birthday decor in our room, she has also arranged a Birthday cake and signed Birthday card. Also, she has provided all the airport transfer options to and from hoteland suggested nice local food places . Thanks so much for all of your help, Hoilee. You are such a star!Hotel Jen is located just next door to HKU MTR Station. You will not only experience the modern and city lifestyle while in HotelJen, you will also experience local lifestyle. Great for families, both young and old.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: This is my second stay in Hong Kong and first time at Hotel Jen. The best thing about the hotel is its location next to the subway. Overall the rooms are cramped and old. They are modestly clean, but the carpet has been there for so long that it has become that indistinguishable shade of beige. Shangri-La step up your game!

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Great location not in a high tourist area. exit from B2 at HKU station and hotel couple of minutes walk. Staff were welcoming and a pleasure to deal with. Room was clean and comfy and good addition was power adaptors. Would stay again when next in Hong Kong. Cafe malacca food was nice, there are restaurants close by as well as convenience store and grocery store. Tram stops are also within walking distance.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Nicely decorated and charming hotel.Room is very comfortable, but bathrooms need attention, mainly new showers. That would possibly give the washroom more space with a trendy standing shower. Also better coffee, perhaps a coffee press or k-cups. Otherwise good location and overall comfortable.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Hotel Jen is superb. We stayed 6 nights in a Club Harbour View room (2604) and although you can't actually see Kowloon waterfront from there, it's still a pretty good view. It was well worth paying the extra for the Club room because you then had breakfast on the 28th floor in a relaxed quiet atmosphere (all you could want from a buffet, pastries, fruit, yoghurt, fruit juice, tea, coffee, cold meat, cheese and hard boiled eggs, plus scrambled eggs with usually beans, tomatoes or mushrooms). You also have access to free drinks (pretty well unlimited wine, beer, prosecco etc) plus sandwiches, sushi, other savoury nibbles all served in a quiet and efficient way by Billy and his colleagues.The pool is small and rarely had any sun when I was there but it is clean and not too cold, even in November.The in house restaurant was great for an early evening dinner before heading off on the Star Ferry for the night markets in KowloonThe location is amazing - just 1 minute to the nearest MTR station and buses/trams all within 5 minutes' walk too - the hotel website does not emphasise this enough! Shops, restaurants (try the Treasure Lake, authentically Cantonese, though not much of the menu is in English) and supermarkets all round the corner for convenience.Tip for the older generation - they do a discount by decade rate for the room so we got the third night and the sixth night for a fraction of the other four nights because of our age!

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Hotel Jen is located right beside an exit from the HKU MTR station, which means it鈥檚 a very quick and inexpensive trip to and from the airport. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are comfortable, with options for views. It is worth paying extra for 28th Level Club access, which means breakfast, and drinks with very substantial snacks in the evening. The neighbourhood is authentic, and offers lots of eating opportunities. Hotel staff recommended the Halite Massage service, just down the street, where I had a great massage. This was my 2nd stay there and I would happily go back.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: The Jen is modern, exceptionally clean and has all the amenities you desire-whether travelling for business or pleasure!The breakfast buffet is plentiful with lots of options and the restaurant has a Southeast Asian restaurant also with Western options.The beds are comfortable, my room had a wonderful shower and plenty of room at the vanity. The hotel is well located in a lively neighborhood, but is exceptionally quiet. There鈥檚 a gym and large pool on the roof.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Hotel Jen is located in the Western district, right next to the HKU MTR station. It is about 30 minutes from the airport on the MTR, and a mere 5 minute ride from the Macau ferry port and the Central MTR station. The hotel has a nice lobby with a bar on the first floor and a restaurant on the second floor. There is a pool and a small gym on the roof and a club lounge on the 28th floor which offers breakfast, afternoon tea and evening food and drinks in addition to the all day offering with soft drinks, coffee and tea. No to mention the great harbour view from the lounge. There is good Wi-Fi throughout the hotel and as a Shangri-La elite members you will get a nice upgrade. The rooms are nice and a good size with Hong Kong measures and they have a nice windows ledge to sit and admire the Hong Kong view with either the harbour or the peak. The bathrooms are nice and well planned. They also offer a shuttle service to nearby attractions. Overall a very nice and well located hotel in the centre of Hong Kong.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: The Hotel is quite Ok, more like a 3 star hotel than a 4 star hotel. For the price that we paid we found it extremely expensive in benefit - cost, and for being from the Shangri-la brand I was expecting better rooms.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Good mid range hotel in great location with access to the city via the MTR station just across the street. The MTR network is a cheap and efficient way to get around Hong Kong and costs just a few 拢鈥檚. The rooms in the Jen are quite small but well laid out and have a great shower and separate toilet. There is a good TV and kettle for tea and coffee and the room was clean and housekeeping changed towels daily etc. Views are great from the the 鈥淪ea View鈥?side but less so from the back but you can get the mega view of the city from other locations in Hong Kong. There is a small gym and a roof top pool but this area lost the sun in the afternoon but we did visit in November. Breakfast was a buffet with great variety but be careful as they struggled to keep up with demand (clear tables and stock up the buffet) after 8.30 when it got busy. The restaurant for dinner was standard fare but was quiet if you wanted a more reserved atmosphere compared with busier eateries down town. Reception staff were polite and helpful and there is a free shuttle service to key areas around town.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We were in HK for our department trip. We stayed Hotel Jen for 3 nights. The hotel is very accessible to and from Airport. Can Take MTR or bus which is super near to the hotel. There is a Tram Terminal near by too~! The hotel is located near the University and residential area, there is a traditional market nearby. I have a good time soaking in the environment and had traditional breakfast.The hotel is clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Most of them speak fluent English. Highly recommended to stay here next time~!

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Hotel Jen is a dry clean and modern hotel, right next to HKU MTR. Very close to Hong Kong University so perfect for visiting parents and academics.The service was excellent. I recommend the club rooms as you get access to the club lounge and evening drinks with a fab view of the harbour.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: This is my first time in Hong Kong travelling with a friend in these parts. My friend had previously stayed at the Hotel Jen in Beijing and recommended we stay at this Hong Kong hotel. It鈥檚 in a great location, with many small shops, stores and eateries close by as well as a short walk to the metro station and airport buses. We had to cab it to the ferry terminal as it was a bit too far to walk - in the heat! Hotel Jen is a lovely, clean comfortable hotel with a rooftop pool that was quite nice and even had a lifeguard on duty. What a great view. Toiletries like toothpaste & toothbrushes were provided along with a superior brand of shampoos, body lotions, etc. Bedding was good quality and very comfortable. For a reasonable additional cost, we purchased the breakfast package which also included happy hour drinks and delicious snacks on the 28th floor with a great view of the harbour. In my view, the strength of this hotel is their exceptional staff - friendly, efficient, extremely accommodating, all which made this stay a wonderful experience. Everyone from the front desk staff, restaurant servers, shuttle/ taxi organizers, room cleaners, etc all did their part to make us feel welcomed and valued as a guest. I鈥檒l definitely be back to stay at Hotel Jen in Hong Kong as soon as possible.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: Lovely hotel with. Nice pool and the gym has a fantastic view. Lovely breakfast with a good variety of East and West.Rooms are large enough and good quality service. Lobby excellent and well looked after by Jeanette.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: A few days during the " Golden week" of China. The hotel is a bit further away from the main shopping area but getting there from the hotel is not a problem. The MTR station is just outside and the tram just a block away.The room is a good size and very comfortable. The price was a bit higher but most likely due to the holiday week of mainland China.Overall nothing but good things to say about this hotel.

Hotel: Hotel Jen Hong Kong by Shangri-La
review: We stayed at Hotel Jen for a couple of weeks while waiting on our flat to be available. It is situated a couple of steps from the HKU MTR, buses, and even the tram so you can easily roam through Hong Kong. This spectacular hotel has a friendly and helpful staff (reception, bellboy, and cleaning staff are all top notch). The rooftop pool and gym provide the most incredible views of Hong Kong. The room and bathroom are nicely outfitted to feel comfortable.

This hotel is located in the heart of tsim sha tsui which is very strategic location...MTR station just next door, many restaurants and places to eat nearby and also if you like shopping, many shopping spot nearby...but honestly the room is very small so i think this hotel only suitable for solo traveller or couples but not convenient for family with children...other than that, all great...

This was the worst and the smallest room I have ever stayed in. When I booked the room, I chose the deluxe twin room, which was supposed to be 118 square feet. However, the room I got (#2) had only one bed and the room was approximately 7 ft. by 8 12 ft. The bathroom (shower, sink, and toilet, with no shower curtain) took up part of that space. It was just big enough for a bed and a small walkway to the side of and along the foot of the bed. Although it was advertised as a non-smoking hotel, the room smelled like cigarette smoke. I told Mike that the odor was terrible, and he sprayed the room. Unfortunately then it smelled like a combination of smoke and a chemical spray. The wallpaper was peeling in several places, and it was not applied properly. So overall, the room was tiny, smelly, and depressing. It was not deluxe in any way. Substandard would be a more accurate description. It was half the size of the room advertised, which I think is deplorable. That is false advertising! If I had known the true size of the room, I never would have stayed there, so I think that I should get at least half of my money back. It was in a good location, near the TST subway and the A21 airport bus, but that was the only positive thing about it. There was no lobby, just a small room from which you could access the 5 sleeping rooms,with a dispenser for hot and cold drinking water. Not a place to hang out if your room made you feel claustrophobic. So to call it a "boutique" hostel is quite an overstatement.

Sunrise is located literally steps away from TST MTR. Small but really clean. Easy access in and out after they gave you the passcode. Foods are everywheres, as well as shop. Explore nearby kowloon park, enjoy an oasis. Festival of light and harbor are also steps away. The best one is sky bus from airport stop directly in front of the building and you only need cross the street to find the sky bus stop.

My mother and I had visited Hong Kong in December 2018 and stayed at Mike's apartment. The apartment is centrally located in the midst of the hustle bustle of Tsim Sha Tsui and a minute's walk from the MTR station. Commuting was a breeze given the location of the apartment.The apartment though small, was neatly arranged and had all basic amenities. Mike was very helpful in explaining the directions etc to the apartment. WiFi was good and the room offered a good view of the lane outside. Highly recommended for its location, cleanliness and practicality.

Owner (Mike) was fantastic. I stayed here and had no problems at all, deposit was paid back on time and in full. The area is great, lots of restaurants and shops near by. Rooms are quite small but everywhere in HK is small, I would stay here again if I needed a place to live for a short period of time.

This location was perfect right near all the TST action: Kowloon park, Harbour views, major shopping. Mike was very helpful in finding my way both to and from the hostel via public transit and provided a very safe environment (as I was traveling alone) with superbly clean rooms. Highly recommend to those looking to be in a central area of Hong Kong with their own space!

The room is small like any other budget hotel in Hong Kong, but clean. The owner is friendly. The location is great, close to Symphony of the light or ferry terminal. Close to Chungking building where you can find cheap or halal food

room is very clean and tidy, full of useful equipments: tv銆乽sb charger銆乤ir conditioner銆乪lectric fan銆乭ot water...the host, Mike, is a very kind and nice manIf you are Chinese and you don't speak English well , you can communicate with Mike using Wechat.鎴块棿骞插噣鍗敓锛岃澶囬綈鍏紝鐢佃鏈恒€乽sb鍏呯數鍣ㄣ€佺┖璋冦€侀鎵囥€佺儹姘村櫒涓€搴斾勘鍏ㄣ€傛埧涓滃彨Mike, 寰堢儹蹇冿紝寰堟俯鍜屻€傚鏋滀笉鎳傝嫳鏂囩殑璇濓紝鍙互鐢ㄥ井淇¤窡浠栨矡閫氥€?,October 10

For guests who are meticulous with cleanliness but on a budget, Sunrise International is the place for you. Right in the heart of downtown. Conveniently located at all amenities. From the airport to public transport, subway, convenience stores, to fast foods and others all roll into one. Shopping for all types of goods is on every corner. Just walk till your foot hurts.Room might be too small for some but clean and everything is so convenient. Owner Mr. Mike is very accommodating and helpful. Just simply ask and he would be readily available to provide you help and the information you need. Overall its a worthy experience. Will be coming back to stay again.- CHARLIE_Philippines

convient/cosy/clean/Mike is quite nice and considerate. You will know it once booked the room. First, It's easy for you to find the room. My room is small given its centre place in Tsim Sha Tsui, so it is fair. Thus, a great location for you.Then,I like the room for it is clean and comfortable. The mattress is soft锛宎nd you can have a nice dream in your bed. What's more, when it comes the due time to leave, you can still keep your lungages in there for some time. So, for some people like me, go shopping is quite unhurried. At last, hope everything goes well with Sunrise.

I am confused at the previous reviews that suggest Mike was lovely. With my booking he was extremely unhelpful to remedy a booking mistake even though i notified him a few hours after booking.A very un-cooperative man that has knocked my faith in hoteliers in that region. I would strongly advise others to reconsider other options before booking!

It's very small room but it's ok.Just like Japan's business hotel.It's very clean room, specially so quiet.The HK was very cloudy and noisy.The host was very kindly person.If i go HK again, i will this hotel again.

well, it is located in the downtown and near a subway station, which is convenient for us to find it. Also, you can go shopping and enjoy delicious food there. What's importany, the landlord is very friendly and warm-hearding.

The location is really good and the host is very kind. If you visit HK first time, this hotel will be the best choice. Closer to Tsim Tsa Tsui station thus you can approach easily to almost all Landmarks of Hongkong.

I had a very pleasant stay at Sunrise. The room that we stayed in was clean all through out our stay. The location is great because it is near the Tsim Sha Tsui Station and when you go down, shops and restaurants are everywhere. Sir Mike, the owner, was very accomodating and friendly. The room was cozy and small which was expected because it is Hong Kong (the bathroom is very clean tho which is a plus). It is great to stay there if it is just the 2 of you but I guess it is too small for 3 and more people (just my opinion).

very clean and very good location, Mike is so so friendly!It was a great experience!Thanks for everything!Sunrise is very nice and very near to MTR! 闈炲父涔炬法鑰屼笖寰堜究鍒╃殑鍦伴粸锛屽氨闈犺繎鍦伴惖鏃侀倞锛孧ike涔熼潪甯稿湴鍙嬪杽锛屾槸涓€鍊嬪緢妫掔殑缍撻锛岃瑵璎滿ike閫欓杭绱板績浠旂窗锛丼unrise 寰堟锛?,April 20

Excellent hostel with nice and friendly host. Mike will contact you prior to your arrival which showed that he sincerely welcomes his guests to stay. Thanks for the early arrival arrangement and the welcome drink. :) The location is great, located very near to Tsim Sha Tsui station as well as the shopping areas. You will feel safe as it鈥檚 using number password to access your room.There are also security guards available in the building and after 11pm,you need to ring the bell to access the building gate (the security guard will open the gate for you :)) The room is ideal for one or two persons with not much luggages, clean and bright. The bed is comfortable. Soundproof is considered good, I did鈥檛 really hear the noise from outside. In the room, you will realize Mike pays attention to details. The space is fully utilized which I found it is so amazing. Travel adaptor is provided which brings convenience to foreign travelers. Water dispenser also available at the public area! Overall, I had a great night staying at Sunrise Hostel! Will strongly recommend to my friends and definitely will come back! :)

I'm Taiwanese. I stayed at sunrise hotel for one night. The bed is very comfortable!!! And the host is very nice!If I have free time can visit Hong Kong i will choose it again!Especially the subway is very close to sunrise hotel!! It's very convenient!!!!

This hotel is well located and accessible to the heart of tsim sha tsui by walk.The owner, Mike is kind and willing to help. You can ask tips for your tirp.But you can't expect A HOTEL. The room is even much tinier than a hostel. If you want have snack in your room, you have to sit on the bed.you can hear everything what is going on in a toilet. you must come with whom you are not shame of the sound you make in a toilet.Overall, The room is reasonable. If you are looking for a luxury travel, go to Shangri-la.

Mr.Mike is very reaponsive to each request and also helps out if ever you need questions to go to a place. Also the rooms are neat and cold. Has hot and cold shower and fast internet. Will definitely come back for next years travel. Thanks Mike

Very smoothly run, I found it very easy check-in. Also, the location is in the heart of TST and cannot be any better than this. Room was very very clean, high up enough so you don't get hit by the busy city noise. I also found it easy and fun to communicate with Mike.

The place is easy to find and location is great because it is just 2 bldgs away from the Tsim Sha Tsui B1 Exit MTR Station. It is also just a few blocks away from Avenue of the stars and other tourist spots along Victoria Harbour. It is also near well-known shopping boutiques such as louis vuitton, chanel, esprit, etc. The room is clean and facilities are labeled for ease of use. Mr. Mike is so accommodating and friendly. There is also water dispenser in the common area to which you can get free water. It was worth the money. I will definitely choose Sunrise International Hotel for stay when I come back to Hong Kong.

The place is in a secure building in a great location. The owner is very friendly and does not hesitate to make you feel welcome. The rooms are clean and equipped with a/c and a fan. Although small, very convenient and you have everything in room including a converter charger and USB charging. The a/c vent does need a clean, as it has quite a bit of dust. We do breathe that. The exhaust fan also had quite a bit of dirt. Area around very safe with 7 eleven and Mc Donald's and subway around the corner. Even early in the dark AM you feel very safe and lots of cabs around. Close to markets and harbour.

Fine accommodation. Very clean. Excellent location in Kowloon near to an MTR station and walkable to Temple Street Nightmarket and the Star Ferry.Room was very small and spartan but adequate. Good wifi. Owner Mike was very pleasant and helpful.

stayed here for 16 nights. Room is small (for 2 people and luggage) and compact but clean and neat.Room cleaned 6 days a week, towels changed every 2 days.Good if using as a base and going to be out most of the day.As other reviews for this hostel very close to MTR, Mr mike is a great friendly guy and happy to give advise.CCTV records all movement through main door and corridor and feels very safe.doors are keyless requiring codes to enter, no worries about losing keys.Drinking water available in corridor as is a shared kettle ( due to rooms being small) but you will need your own mug.When in Hong Kong again I will check availability here first.thanks Mike as we got married during this stay, it was great not having to worry or have any issues with the room.Choose this Hostel due to Price, previous reviews about cleanness of rooms and no reports of bed bugs.KEEP UP THE GREAT WORK MIKE!!! and thanks.

Something that I really appreciate is the cleanliness of the room and the owner was really friendly and helpful. The location was great and easy to be reached.Near the hostel, we can find a food center where you can buy various food, mostly Indian food.So if i am travelling with my friends or solo, I will definitely stay at this hostel again. Worth for price and excellence in the services.

The room is very small, but clean and provided necessary stuff like hair dryer and USB charger. The location is perfect! The airport bus stop (A21) is in front of the building. The MRT exit of Tsim Sha Tsui is also really close to the building. It is very convenient to go shopping area and good restaurants.Mr.Mike is friendly and warm welcome.Hope to see you again in my next HK trip. :)

The owner. Sir Mike is very polite. Easy to talk to.It is located along Nathan rd. in tsim sha tsui. Very accessible to bus, taxi or mtr (train),The room. It is really small. Even the toilet is also small. Mike: 5 stars.Location: 5 stars.Room: 2 stars.

I was in Hong Kong for 10 days and wanted a great place to stay that would not break the bank. This place was great. It was the perfect size, no wasted space. It was very clean, everything worked well. There was a USB power strip for my phone. Mike was the perfect host. He was able to answer all my questions and offer suggestions.

Sorry for super late review, We want to thanks to Mr. Mike for a lot of help when we stay in Hong Kong, the room is small and I don't really like when he change my room that I booked with other customer without asking me first, so when I check in it's not the room that I booked, but I want to thank for helping us to find stationery store in night because we need tape , He help us to find a way with map picture on whats app until we find the open store (because it's already late night) and help us receive some goods for us. About the room is small but got everything that we need, the place super nice in the middle shopping district and Sasa shop is on the right on the building, super near to mrt station only a minute away, but the mrt didn't have escalator only stairs (so watch out if you bring big and heavy luggage !!!) I almost faint bringing my luggage >_<When we visit Hong Kong again We will stay here again, but please don't change our room with others again lol ^^

Room is small but location is super convenient, food and shopping area is just around us.Clean room and everything you need is just inside this hotel. Mike is very nice owner and we will come back for sure to stay again if travel to hong kong again.Thank you Mike :)

Mike was a great host, he is friendly and warmhearted. While staying here, he made a cup of tea for us and talking! Then he told us where should go around here and also suggested another itinerary for us; actually we didn't have plan last day. It was helpful for us, thank you again!Also I think the location is very convenient to go main sightseeings in Hong Kong, such as Mong Kok and the peak. I highly recommend to stay here if anyone looks for the accommodation around Tsim Sha Tsui.

The host, Mike is soooo kind.He wait us 1hour for helping us check in.And communication with him is really goodMy friend lost selfphone and we call Mike, he advise about it.And his place is very good location.Near the tsim sha tsui station.And the room is really clean.But if you are big, the bed is small to you.(I think the bed in hongkong is usually small, so if you go anywhere, it'll be small.)If i go hongkong again, I will choose his place!!!I really recomand it.順胳姢韸?毵堨澊韥敤電?鞝曤 旃滌爤頃挫殧鞝€頋潣 觳错伂鞚胳潉 霃勳檧欤检嫓霠り碃 鞝€頋ゼ 1鞁滉皠 霃欖晥 旮半嫟毽叏鞏挫殧.毵堨澊韥檧鞚?雽€頇旊倶 靻岉喌鞚€ 鞝曤 鞛?韱淀枅鞏挫殧. 鞓侅柎霃?鞛橅晿靹胳殧.鞝?旃滉惮臧€ 頃鸽摐韽办潉 鞛冹柎氩勲牳電旊嵃 臁办柛旯岇 頃挫＜靺柎鞖?攴鸽Μ瓿?鞙勳箻霃?旃偓於旍澊 鞐澊霝?臧€旯岇泴靹?鞏措敂 雼る媹旮?韼疙枅鞏挫殧.氚╇弰 鞝曤 旯仐鞚?旃橃泴欤检嫓瓿犾殧攴茧嵃 臁瓣笀 雿╈箻臧€ 鞛堨溂鞁滊嫟氅? 旃寑臧€ 臁瓣笀 鞛戩溂鞁れ垬電?鞛堨柎鞖?(靾欖唽毳?鞚搓吵鞝€瓿?霃岇晞雼る媽 瓴巾棙鞙茧電?頇嶌僵鞚€ 鞗愲灅 歆戩澊 鞛戧碃 旃寑霃?鞛戩潃瓴冴皺鞎勳殧. 鞏措敎臧€霌?雿╈箻臧€ 鞛堨溂鞁滊嫟氅?旃寑電?鞛戩溂鞁り卑鞓堨殧)鞎勲 雼れ嫓 頇嶌僵鞙茧 鞐枆臧勲嫟氅?雼れ嫓 鞐赴搿?臧堦矁臧欖晞鞖旉皶於旐暕雼堧嫟

My wife and I went to HK for the 1st time and we were glad that we booked with Mike. We stayed 5days and 4 nights. His place is a little tight, but its clean and has lots of natural light. Its in the center (walking distance) of everything...transportation, food, and shopping. The unit was safe as you wont need any key to have access, just memorize codes or save them on your mobile.:DMike received us personally and was a cool host going out of his way to guide us on how to get to places. We extended our checkout time by an hour or so and Mike was good with it. It was a fun experience for us. Its a good place to stay.

I stayed at Sunrise for 3 Days 2 Nights. Mike, the host, is very helpful and response very fast through messages. The room was clean and comfortable with soft bed and blanket. The location is close to MTR Station, restaurants, and shops. I definetely would stay here again.

Clean, safe, great location. Mike is a warm hearted man who provides everything needed (and more). I would definitely book again (if available) if I ever come back to Hong Kong.Thanks a lot for everything, Mike!x

Sunrise international boutique hostel is a great value the location is fantastic. Incredibly convenient from the airport bus and literally steps from the metro station in the heart of Kowloon. You can't go wrong in that respect. The rooms are clean and functional but very small. Given the price, how could it be otherwise? All told, it's a great value, but be aware that you won't be able to do much in your room other than shower and sleep. If that's okay with you, then this is a great find. Mike, your host, makes everything easy.

Hong Kong is a very expensive destination so it is very difficult to find a reasonable room. This place is great if you are an independent traveler on your own. I arrived from the airport at midnight and someone was waiting for me. The room is tiny but has all the comfort. I sleep very well (no noise as not directly on the main street). The bed and the mattress were super comfy. Very clean place but super tiny so even as a couple it can be too small.

Mike's house is fantastic.The common feature of Hong Kong house is not spacious, i understand,anyway,this is the second time i live this place.Mike is very helful,last time I asked him for more blankets,a water boiler and slippers.This time i came here,i found mike had prepared everything.Plus, the location is good .There are some local restaurants dedicated to hungtun .Ilove them very much.what's more, you will be never disappointed at shopping here.

My husband and I booked a room for 4 days thru Hotels.com. We asked them to confirm our booking since we had paid in full, and it was confirmed by the owner after several hours. He was very helpful actually. He will send you everything you need.The building where the hostel is located is near Tsim Sha Tsui Station so going around is not a problem. The bus from the airport stops in front of the building which is actually great. One thing I like about this place is the lift. We never experienced waiting in line to go up and down. The room was super clean when we arrived, and we have a big window. Yes, there was a window. It didn't feel like staying in a den. The mattress was fine and same with the pillows. We just wished the blanket was big enough for 2. Other things we like about the place was their free water and their kettle. There was just one tiny issue we encountered. The room was tiny that we could not open our luggage unless we slip it under the bed. But it's HK. Space is limited. We will definitely stay again in this hostel. :)

I enjoyed my short stay here. The rooms are clean but small. But this is perfect if you are not staying long and just want a decent place to stay. The host Mike is very nice and accommodating. The location of the place is very great. In the middle of Nathan Road and is easuly accessible by MTR and bus. Great place to stay. Would try it again.

Location, location, location....Subway next to hotel, buses going everywhere (airport too) by the hotel. Literally hundreds of restaurants and shopping galore just by stepping outside Nathan Road, the main street in Hong Kong and where the hotel is. You can walk anywhere from this hotel as it's in the middle of the town. Very clean, serviced daily...has shampoo and soap in bathroom. Yes, it's small, but all we needed was a clean room, the bed and our private bathroom. Have no complains. Mike was great....whatever you need to know, please ask him. The place is clean and safe (fire escape stairs across from elevator-we found them). No key to come in the room or the main area, just a code. There's also a guard downstairs. The rooms are on the 10th floor of an old building but never felt unsafe at all. Excellent free WiFi and AC. Yes, there are people on the street trying to get you to go to their stores but that happens around the world in big cities and has nothing to do with the hotel. Just ignore them and don't make eye contact. We stayed in Rm 2 and need to mention one thing: to reach the bathroom you need to step up about 12" to get in. We were ok but need to let others know if they can't lift legs up too much. There's no bathtub and shower is next to the toilet but it has a good drain. We experienced no problems. The other thing is the TV only has Chinese channels, no English channels for those who want to watch TV. For the price this very small hotel was a great find and we recommend it to every one.

Mike was very helpful and extremely responsive over email when I was setting up early check-in before my arrival. He also sent detailed check-in instructions and directions to the place the day before arrival.The room was very small but clean and had all the necessary amenities. Great access to the Kowloon/Mongkok attractions.The cons were thin walls, potential fire safety issues (no fire escape in the flat), and the neighborhood was a bit hectic (aggressive shop owners on the street trying to get you to come into their stores). Overall, good value for the money and great service.

Me and 2 friends was booked the family room for 4 nights. We had late to arrived the hotel, but Mike was waited for us until we came. And give all the information, how to access the room. Typical room in Hong Kong, the small room but the hotel was very clean, comfortable, peaceful and near from the MTR station also near from the Bus Stop. You can reach the Ferry Terminal, Avenue of Star, Shopping Center only by walking distance. The family room supposed to be for 2 adults and 1 Kid, but If you going to book the Family room with one additional person then you must pay the additional charges. Overall we are satisfied with our days during our stay in Hong Kong.

I arrived early afternoon on a Sunday and departed late morning on a Thursday. Mike passed me all the information I needed to get to the room from the airport and was responsive to a few inquiries I had. The room is in an excellent location and the pictures are accurate. I'm 5'10" and had no issues stretching out on the bed.

Stayed for five nights and was wowed by the price and Mike the owner/manager who provides access instructions before you arrive and was generally a great host, nothing was too much trouble, so use his local knowledge. Hotel is very close to Tsim sha Tsui station and the airport bus stops virtually outside. Rooms were usual smallish size for Hong Kong but has a decent size wall to wall comfy bed, TV and small private shower/toliet but note their is a 30/40cm step up from the bed area to the toilet area, so not suitable for disabled people.

The host was very accomodating and gracious. Very hassle free. The location is near tsim sha tsui station, near the heart of everything and located at nathan road a prime street in the city, in the hallway everything you need for travels is posted. The room is quite small but is very worth it.

First of all calling it 鈥淏outique Hotel鈥?is a bold exaggeration. It鈥檚 a closet with a bed and a toilet-shower. From now on I will be referring to the hotel as the closet.Let鈥檚 start with the good things.Mike, the owner, is a nice guy who is very helpful.It鈥檚 in a central location.It seems clean.Here鈥檚 what鈥檚 bad about the closet.It is the smallest thing you can imagine. Actually you can鈥檛 until you have seen it. It鈥檚 difficult to open a suitcase inside the closet!The beds are unbelievably uncomfortable. It鈥檚 a wood board with a thin and extra hard matrass. At home I sleep on a matrass on the floor so I like hard but this is like sleeping on your yoga mat. The closet should provide a free bottle of wine every day so that you can at least pass out for a couple of hours every night because real sleep is hard to come by here. At night there is a lot of light coming in from outside.The walls are paper thin. You can literally hear the neighbors farting.When you open the windows it reeks of kitchen. Keeping them closed makes the closet stuffy.Everything is so cheap. Starting with the TV with a viewing angle so bad you can鈥檛 see properly when you are lying in bed to the thing that should hold the shower head but comes crashing down.

This place is no boutique hotel, period. Even calling it a hotel is a misnomer. It is basically a collection of five guest rooms occupying a section of a floor in an old commercial building. It is also clearly a fire hazard as there is no fire escape plan for guests. Neighbouring units include a Korean language centre and a massage centre. I booked a so-called deluxe double room and got the shock of my life! Room 4 was so tiny that two persons will have to take turns to walk if they are not on the bed. And even one person will find it a struggle to take a shower in the cubicle of a bathroom without bumping into the sink and the toilet bowl! Naturally my wife and I checked out after only one night and were in fact quite happy to forfeit the other three nights that we had booked and paid for. It is unbelievable that this place is ranked so highly by TripAdvisor and we are of course thoroughly disappointed as our choice was based entirely on this ranking.

Location is great. It's just beside Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station with McDonald's and KFC a few more steps away. Room is small but designed well so you actually feel its bigger than it really is. Bed was quite big and comfortable. Room is clean too. Bathroom is so small but you will get used to it. Btw careful with the hot water because it gets too hot it can be boiling you don't want to burn yourself. What I did was turn it on only a few minutes then turn it off when I'm about to use the water.Mike was nice and easy to talk to. No problems with him. There's no bathroom mat though so I always slip because a bit of water makes the floor slippery. I'd recommend to put bath mat outside the toilet door. Electric kettle could be put inside the room so you can use it whenever you want but i don't know where to put it since there's no more space. Overall great stay in Sunrise Hotel. Will go back again.

The room was very small and perfectly formed, with room under the bed for luggage. There is no view, it does have good air con and compared to pod hotels it's a mansion : ) Bathroom / shower was very good, had small hairdryer that was great and it was spotlessly clean. For size of room, bed was surprisingly large! It is located on the tenth floor of a 12 floor building on Nathan Road in the TST area - one of the two main roads in Kowloon, so you are literally on the door step of the shopping and the neon. Kowloon park is over the road, which is lovely and provides a bit of peace from the bustle. There is a metro next door and getting around is very easy with excellent public transport and very reasonable taxis. Mike, as other reviewers have said, is great, very helpful. There is both useful information in the hotel for restaurants and how to get to places and he is very prompt answering queries etc. Highly recommend if you want somewhere to sleep, that has what you need, is very good value for money and in the centre of Kowloon.

The room is small, but this is normal in HK! Mike is very attentive and all the time gave us a support! We can go all places by Subway because hotel is very near!!!If you want to save money and stay in a good localization, you can choose this hotel!

I enjoyed staying there.Room is small but very clean,good security and the interior is cute.The best point of here is good location. Staying here was so good for me to sightseeing in HK.And the host Mike is good guy. I wanna stay here again and see him:)

I find this place amazing cause Mike has done a very good job in terms of securing the place and keeping the place clean. The room is small but really comfortable and vibrant. It's a very nice place to stay and very accessible in terms of transportation as it is just a few minutes walk away from mtr.

The room was so big and clean, the bathroom was amazingly big. The staffs were very friendly and helpful especially the manager Edwin and paul they were so accomodating. We enjoy our stay here and will be back again
Sparkling clean room and fine space. Alan and Edwin are so nice and helpful. Our rooms is suite and it is big and tidy. The facilities are fantastic.Others who are considering this hotel worth a try.

Nice Hotel, Staffs are very helpful, Clean rooms and common areas. I did online booking through Booking.com,The room was as mentioned online as suitable for Family of 3 members, but the room was not even suitable for a Single Traveler as there was no space for keeping a suitcase. We got our room upgraded from a Superior Room to Deluxe Room, which was far better with decent space for our suitcases and space for hanging our clothes. The Bed as mentioned was Queen Size but seems to be a bit lesser than a Queen size. The bathroom was spacious but no Towels hanging provision. There was no response when you call for Room Service, hence every time to order food one needs to go down to Reception to do so! The cafe restaurant was too small for morning breakfast, hence there was a wait time to get a free table everyday. Breakfast variety was less than standard hotels I have experienced during my 30+ years of International Travels. Since the Hotel is located along the Central Line of the MTR one could walk to the nearest Tai Wo Hau station. The Shuttle Bus system to and fro from Kwai Fong MTR station which is located next to Metro Plaza Mall was a Plus, only drawback was the last Shuttle bus from Kwai Fong MTR station is 22:15, which is a bit early for returning from any of your late evening activities.Dinner is a problem as there is no Buffet meal available.The next door 7 Eleven store is a great plus as one can get all your requirements from there at very economical price.There are no restaurants or eateries near the hotel at a walk-able distance.The overall experience was average!Not a value for money hotel!The Superior Rooms are not recommended for anyone!

Many group tours come to this hotel so if you arrive or leave with them it is very hard to catch the elevator and the line at breakfast is very long. It is complete utter chaos.The Dorsett is their basic room, but it is really small. And the bathroom is not very pleasant, moldy with an unpleasant smell. And the floor material is a mystery. Also I do not think the hotel respects the division of smoking and non smoking rooms. My friend was given a non smoking floor (16th) but her room smelled so bad she had to change it and she also overheard the reception staff telling another customer checking in that they could smoke in their room on the 16th floor. However I would like to thank Eric who helped me change my room. The breakfast buffet staff are not very friendly (probably because of the sheer number of people)but reception staff were efficient.

Nice hotel with nice mountain view , very good shuttle service to city. The service quality is excellent. The housekeeping staff very prompt , be it any requirement. Front desk very positive and prompt . I had read about Edwin and Stefani on Trip advisor and found them both absolutely same.....professional and positive.Edwin helped us with early check in , understanding very well the tiredness of overnight flight (though had to compromise on double bed rooms for that).......Thank you. Few areas not that nice.....rooms very small, washroom cramped, no wardrobe. Location is ok but 30 mins far from Tsim sha sui area.

The hotel caters mainly to tour groups from the Mainland, which tend to congregate in the small hotel lobby so it can be quite crowded. The rooms are very small and you will hear your neighbours if they talk, watch TV or engage in other activities. Breakfast was adequate, but the coffee was cold. The hotel is located quite far from the main sights and is within walking distance (approx.. 10 min) of the next MTR station. An okay hotel but really too far from restaurants/shops and town.

The hotel in general is so nice close to the metro station walking distance 10 min and also providing shuttle service, the hotel is not in a touristic area but in Hong Kong its easy to access the whole city by the metro.There is a small Grocery down the hotel building.Price wise the hotel is on a very good rate and the room size is very good comparing to china and Asia standard also was so nice for 2 adults and one child.Advise the guest who can walk to the metro to stay there.Also try to use UBER as its always cheaper and better than the city TAXI

Our stay is memorable because of Edwin, Sarah and Alan. They are very helpful. Special mention to Edwin which we recommend to be a supervisor. He is very professional. We will recommend this hotel to our friends.

My family stepped into Dorsett (Tsuen Wan) on 21st May'19 with lot of apprehension & ambiguity, as I took a chance by staying at a single city that too in a single hotel for 8 odd days of my tour to Hongkong. But your team at Tsuen Wan (Mr. Ricky NG, Rooms Division Manager in particular) proved my decision right in less than 3 hours with his communication and interpersonal skills. He has helped me with early checkin (1pm) and room upgradation (realized that 2 Delux rooms are small for us). Thank you very much Mr. Ricky and Team Dorsett Tsuen Wan for all the support.Plus points:Ample scenic view from windowsCleanliness and hygieneSupportive staffBreakfast, Shuttle services, Umbrellas.. etc.Things to focus:Compact room and bathroom (I assume this is obvious in a city like Hongkong)Missed Wardrobes big time.Access card deactivation issue and struggled with Wi-Fi

A bit far ,walk 10mins from tsuen wan Mtr. room is clean but hair dryers need to improve. Staff is friendly and helpful,Special thanks to Edwin and Stephanie from front desk for their welcoming service. Will come back again.

Staff is friendly and helpful. Room is clean and well-equipped. Bathtub is included which is an extra plus. Special thanks to Edwin and Sarah from front desk for their welcoming service. Will be back again

This is one of the best hotels we stayed in. Room was large with a sitting area with a couch. The room was very, very clean and modern. The staff (Edwin,Sarah,Eric) who at the front desk was very friendly, helpful and professional. I definitely would stay at this hotel again.

Edwin, Sarah and Eric were very helpful on the front desk. The bed was very comfortable, the amenities in the suite rooms are well appointed. Hotel shuttle bus needs pre booking, overnight if early morning ride is required.

I had to walk to hotel from MTR, but the direction from MTR is poor. Once you reach ground level, there is no sign at all. And if you don't have data or GPS, you're pretty much rely on your good self. Had to ask 5 locals before one knows the hotel, most don't even have a clue.Room is clean, internet phone works on and off, had to restart every half an hour. Very much relied on shuttle bus service to Kwai Fong if you need to get access to food and etc.Stefani is very helpful during the stay, including the concierge staffs.

Friendly staff, nice and big room. Especially like the desk in the room. It鈥檚 huge so that I can do my work here during my stay. The room is clean. I like everything here. It鈥檚 just a 10 mins walk to MTR station.

Edwin Sarah and Stefani have done a good job guiding us, as a frequent visitor Dorsett has become our to go option at anytime just because of your amazing quality and services, very well trained employees once again, thank you!

My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Dorsett Tsuen Wan on our last trip to Hong Kong, and cannot recommend the establishment highly enough. The facilities are thoroughly modern, and expertly maintained. We found our room to be large, comfortably adorned, and the hotel itself boasts excellent amenities. While not centrally located, the hotel is convenient to public transit, and is well positioned to commute into the city center, as well as visit the sites on Lantau Island. However what elevated the experience beyond a simple stay at a comfortable upscale hotel, was its staff. We would like to particularly commend Edwin, Karrie, and Zuji, who took a personal interest in us, made sure our stay was as pleasant and comfortable as possible, and took the time to offer us advice on how best to explore Hong Kong. It was their personal touch that made our stay so special and has made the Dorsett our favorite hotel in Hong Kong. We intend to make it our hotel of choice for future Hong Kong travel, thanks solely to their wonderful and dedicated staff.

The dorsett hotel did us good. Close enough to disney and close to centre. The pool was fun for the children. The breakfast was delicious and plenty of variety for adults and kids. The restaurant in the evening was not fabulous. The food was just ok and little variety. Vegetarian dish ordered and it was a plate of boiled broccoli. The family roared with laughter at how poor it was. The pool snacks very expensive. Shout out to Stefani in reception for the early check in and excellent service. Concierge service very helpful throughout our stay.

Simply perfect.Very quick check in. Leo Sarah and Dickson were very professional.Room confortable. Very good breakfast. Perfect position close to metro.Also very good price according to hotel fares in HK. Happy!!!  Marcello

A top notch customer services by Edwin. Good hotels with clean and quality room are easy to find, but an excellent customer services are rare nowadays. Edwin approachable and welcoming attitude definitely provide values and much appreciated services for me and the rest of the vacationers.

Ms Anna & Ms Stefani are very helpful on my whole check-in processing which giving a very good first impression towards customers for their holiday. Would probably intro to friends & family members or even come back again for the next vacation.

Spent a week in Hong Kong at the start of April, I usually stay Causeway Bay or Mong Kok (most of the time a few nights in each location) and my preferred hotel was the Dorsett at both locations (some times the sister hotel the Cosmo). So this time round I happened to book when the Hong Kong Sevens were on and the last two nights accomodation was sky high, so I decided to stay at the Dorsett Tsuen Wan as it was still reasonably priced.So the Dorsett was just like its other locations, the room was small, but has everything you need, it was clean and comfortable, the view from my room was not great (looked like an abandoned building, but also had a view of the pool (which was very refreshing) the hotel itself was great, but it鈥檚 location was the issue. If you are familiar with Hong Kong it鈥檚 not a massive problem as transport is amazing, but I am guessing a new tourist in HK may have some difficulties.There are two near by MTR stations I couldn鈥檛 tell you which was closer, but the easiest one to get (Tai wo hau) to was straight down a motorway about 5 minutes walk (very easy to find) the other Kwai Wing was most likely closer, but you have to pretty much climb up a mountain then scale down it to get there. Kwai Wing is also where the closest shops and restaurants were. And that was the major issue.I imagine if you were having a family holiday this would be a great place to stay, but if you want to be in the centre of the action I would recommend the Dorsett Kowloon or Wen Chai.

The hotel is easy to find, just one bus ride from the airport and a minute of walking. It's not too far away from the MRT, about 10-minute walk. I am very happy with the concierge, their people are so nice and good, easy to talk to and helpful. The check-in is good as well as it is 24 hours. I just expected them to be a bit nicer or more accommodating. I sent an e-mail before the check-in (some inquiries about check-in and booking) and no one got back to me and as we were checking in separately at different times I wanted to request a bigger bed for my parents instead of two single bed and I just got the answer that it's not what I reserved, I hope they were nicer about it. In terms of the room, it is okay, it is spacious and the bed is good especially the pillow. What I didn't like is that the room is dusty.
