I'm guessing they just change the sheets and not really vacuum the place or sweep it. Stayed for a week and during the last day, I was surprised they didn't refill/ gave me tea in my room. Another thing they have is the buffet breakfast, the selection is not that bad, average. We had some experience there though, we were already in the cafe, we went in the right entrance and they checked our room in the list and before we could get some food, someone asked us to leave and reenter again, and I just told him that we went in from the entrance and we even have our table already. Interesting stay... Overall, the hotel was okay, again thumbs up to the concierge and hopefully, the rooms would be cleaned more thoroughly (at least removing the dust).

Was pretty bad experience. Had an instance where i had to raise my voice to share my discontent. Concierge gets busy at night and staff becomes cranky due to their long shifts.Hotel staff wasn't very accommodative. Breakfast wasn't exemplary and very limited options for people who doesn't eat pork.

The check in experience was great! Front desk Eric was polite and patience.Hotel lobby was modern and sleek.Bedroom was a good size, bright and clean too.The shuttle bus is neatly organised, if you did not registered, and the bus is full, you will be rejected to board! Good control!The nearest MTR station is a good 10-15 mins walk.. boring and dangerous walk.Experience it for yourself!

Best interface with a good smile, I love to thank Danny alot he helped me to checkin before the time I was totally exhausted from the flight.Nice hotel with friendly staff with good service that all we need !!!

This hotel is very comfortable, on the arrival desk Mr.Edwin is really friendly and really helped me by updating my parents room which was a big surprising and they feel very happy about the room and pleased by Mr.Edwin I think it is the best place in sense of value and comfort in HK .Stefani and Dickson are friendly and gentle in service, this is my 8th visit to this hotel in span of 10 months.

This hotel is comfortable and in a very convenient central location next to the race course. The amenities are good, with an in room safe and coffee making facilities. The room was very clean. Breakfast was adequate, but you had to hang onto plates and cutlery that you might want to use. The staff are over enthusiastic about clearing tables and getting guests moving. We had one problem while staying at the hotel. We had a connecting room, th3dor which was of course locked. We were woken at 1.30 am by a party being held in the next room. At 3.30 am, I called reception to complain. They did nothing. I telephone again at 4.30am and was told that we could move to another room. While were were not causing the problem, we had to be the ones who sorted it. I told them to get on and just sort the problem. We were basically told it was our fault for not refusing a connecting room.Because of our experience, I could not recommend staying here. It was a great pity that such a good hotel was let down by unhelpful management.

All staffs are very professional in providing services above and beyond expectations, also Miss Zuji is really friendly and really helpful !! They both went out of their way, not only to a flawless check-in process but, in assisting me in fixing the problem of my devices. SUPERB

This is the second time (for 7 nights) I have stayed at the Dorsett Tsuen Wan when the first time was in November 2018 (for 10 nights).The prices for Dorsett Tsuen Wan is very reasonable for Hong Kong hotel prices although the hotel is away from the tourist attractions but then HK is really a small place. The hotel is not actually located in Tsuen Wan but in Kwai Chung and the nearest MTR station is at Tai Wo Hau which is a 7 mins walk along the main road (Castle Peak Road) from the hotel. To get to Tai Wo Hau MTR you will need to cross a footbridge but elevators are available at both ends of the footbridge for those with steps climbing difficulties.There is a direct airport bus A32 ($18.90) from airport to hotel and the stop is directly outside the hotel. The journey takes approximately 45mins and the stop is the penultimate stop on the route, listen out for bus stop announcement under the hotel name. On the way back to the airport you will need to drag your cases up to the top of the hill for the bus stop back to the airport or alternatively go down the hill from the hotel and round the corner there is a bus stop for bus E32 ($10.80) back to the airport, journey time is slightly longer than the more direct A32 bus.The hotel does supply free shuttles sharing with Silka Tsuen Wan hotel to Kwai Fong MTR, Tsing Yi and Tsim Sha Tsui. The bus holds approximately 30 passengers so it is best to reserve your place at the front desk. Coming back to the hotel operates a first come first serve service. Shuttle bus timetable is available online on the hotel website.From hotel to Mong Kok you will be looking at journey time of 30mins and Tsim Sha Tsui 35-40mins and Central 45mins.There is a small 7-11 directly adjacent to the hotel that shuts at 11pm (they do open longer when there are customers). Go up to the top of the hill and turn left there is a HK style Cha Chaan Teng (Windsor) and other small eateries. Or at the top of the hill and turning right, there is a small shopping mall (Kwai Chung Shopping Centre). In the shopping centre there is a Cafe de Coral and Wellcome supermarket amongst other shops.On to the hotel, both of my visits I had a superior room but I have to say I much prefer the layout on my latest room on the 20th floor. You can have either 2 single beds or combine them to a double/king bed. The amenities in the room include a large wall mounted flat screen TV, mini fridge, kettle, tea/coffee, safe and a walk-in shower. You will also receive complimentary 2 bottles of water daily , free use of a smartphone for phone calls and internet and free in-room WiFi. The WiFi speed was brilliant on my previous stay in November 2018 but on this visit it was a tad slower at times with buffering video however it is still very usable.Laundry service is available by the pound with minimum of 5lbs at $73 then an increment of $7/lb. Per item laundry, dry cleaning and pressing is also available.On the ground floor of the hotel, there is a small restaurant. Above this is a gym and an outdoor swimming pool.This hotel attracts a lot of mainland China tour groups. So expect masses of people at check-ins and in lobby late in the evening and some indiscipline behaviour.Overall the staff from front desk to house keeping to shuttle drivers are very good. The quality of hotel and facilities are good. The cleanliness of the room and bathroom although good but could be better such as do some dusting. The location of the hotel although not brilliant but is still very manageable to get to places. If you don鈥檛 want to wait for the shuttle bus, you can just walk 7mins to Tai Wo Hau MTR station then HK is accessible at your fingertip. The real gem of this hotel is the price. For the price that you pay and the quality that you receive, it is way better than the extortionate prices of centre of town hotels in Hong Kong with less quality.Although there is a slight disappointment at check-in but in no way affected my stay and it was a great room that I had. Having now stayed a combined 17 nights at this hotel where many guests would normally stay for limited nights. The hotel did not recognised myself as a returning guest but instead offered me at a cost upgrade from a bed of 1.5m to 1.8m at check-in. Now how much would it cost to them to offer a returning guest a free upgrade? The room I booked and paid for was more than adequate anyway. If the price is still right, I will definitely return to this hotel again.

The location nearly MTR. Edwin, Stefani & Sarah Very friendly and always helpful staff, excellent customer service!Good wifi and can enjoy The room. 鎴垮児涓嶈泊锛屼絾瑷倷寰堥綂鍏ㄣ€傚墠鍙版湇鍕欎汉鍝″緢灏堟キ锛岄兘寰堥鎰忓公蹇欍€傝蛋璺綁褰庡氨鍒板湴閻电珯锛岄檮杩戜篃鏈夋鍫村反澹埌閬旓紝浠嬬垂绲︽湅鍙嬩竴娴併€?,April 6

excellent service fromEdwin,Anna and Sarah of Dorsett hotel. 5 star rating for service and outstanding customer support!we will definitely come beckand recommend dorsett hotel when in Hong Kong!Awesome Team

We were here easily and we are glad that the staff at the front desk gave us the room a little earlier than the official check in time and I would like to talke this opportunity to thank Sarah Edwin and Anna who arranged that for us

We stayed here on our layover in Hong Kong and could not be more impressed. A 25 minute taxi from the airport for about 265 HKD. Our check in was a breeze and the staff working the front desk was beyond helpful. Our rooms were clean and cozy, which is all we needed. We went for the buffet in the morning and it was very good, a lot of selection and the fruit was very fresh. I would definitely recommend this as a place to stay.

Thanks to the thoughtful of Mr. Edwin, Kam, and Stefani, we experienced such pleasant when first visiting to Hong Kong. We are both looking forward to having next trip with staying at Dorsett Tsuen Wan.

After long hours of flight to Hong Kong... Dorsett proved to be the best thing happened to me on the day.. Spacious room, Clean and well-organised, loved the decor, breath taking view of the city from balcony.. I will give a 4/5 rating to the facilities... The friendly staff and excellent service... especially Edwin and Caesar deserves the extra star 猸?...

Highly appreciated the staff at the Reception Mr. Caesar Choi and Stefani Tsai for the distinguished customer service. They provide effective and efficient check in service after my long distance flight. I felt so tired. With their helpful and friendly smile, made me feel a good start from this hotel. The service from the Concierge was excellent. MrKin Tsang always provided updated information for all customers. Finally, the room attendant Ivy, she also provided excellent room service. She always maintained my room clean and tidy. I enjoyed my stay in Dorsett Tsuen Wan. Highly recommended.

This is my first stay in Dorsett Tuen Wan, reception staff gave me a very good first impression of this hotel. Staff are willing to help with very nice attitude. Especially manager Leo, he help us a lot and makes me feel warm like home. I would definitely book this hotel again and I would like make a great compliment to Leo!

Back again at the hotel, staff was quick to help, credit to Anna from Reception, Kin and night shift young man at Concierge. Location were great and quite. Just 10 minutes walk to the station. And nearby lots of food and restaurant (also 10 minutes walk). Definitely will stay with this hotel again.

Nice stay at this wonderful hotel. Clean and accessible accommodation.Clean sheets and it has all the amenity you gonna need. Front desk is responsive and helpful. Free wifi is also provided.If you plan on visiting Hong Kong, this hotel is surely recommended.

We were kindly greeted by Edwin and his team - Stefani and Nerissa. Edwin was so kind and gave us a free upgrade to a suite !! What a great start to the holiday. It is amazing. We will definitely enjoy our stay here! The room is so big and spacious which is great considering we are in Hong Kong! Thanks Edwin :-))

Dorset tsuen wan hotel at Hong Kong Three days two nights trip Our first time to travel Hong Kong . Clean room Big room Helpful staff- Zuji Free wifi Free shuttle bus services Good view Fast service Check in and check out Close to airport

Great service from Nerissa and Eric. Enjoyed the stay in Dorsett hotel at Tsuen wan. Staffs are friendly. Listen to us patiently when we have language barrier. Clean room and nice bed. I will definitely come again.

Stayed two nights in last month for business purpose at tsuen wan district, check in was quick but staff seems not welcoming Chinese people. Location is far away from train, taxi was hard to find, no staff had time to help. Only find my way to walk half an hour to my workplace at tsuen wan. Room space is acceptable for 1 person, amenities are sufficient, main problem was that, the soundproofing part is fail, TV sound, talking easily heard from next door, called twice to reception, sorry, no one answer. After the stay, my boss told me that some other hotel may closer to our company, like the Panda hotel.

I would like to Express the experience here about our stay . lovely smile of mandy and zuji , they are very professional. they considered our needs to provide the room with good suggestion of traveling with our kids.

Miss Sarah Stefani have good arrangement on the room, thanks.good welcome gift and sweet, best location. thanks. good hotel and nice arrangement for the hotel and easy to go other place and 7-11 is around

鍝″伐Sarah, Anna, Stefani鎱嬪害闈炲父鍙嬪杽锛屽緢妯傛剰瑙ｇ瓟鍟忛锛屾渻妤靛姏婊胯冻瀹汉闇€瑕侊紝鎴戜粖澶╂槸甯跺皬瀛╁墠渚嗗叆浣? 搴婂緢鑸掓湇锛岃ō鏂戒篃寰堟柊锛屾埧闁撳緢娓呮綌锛?閰掑簵瑷湁绌挎宸村＋鍒拌懙娑屾腐閻电珯锛?妯撲笅鏈?-11闇€鐒舵瘮杓冭泊锛?浣嗗嫕鍦ㄦ柟渚匡紝 鏈冩帹钖︽湅鍙嬩締浣忋€俉hats a wonderful hotel i have never live in. Staff Sarah , Anna, stefani are very nice

We stayed in dorsett for a night and Mr.Leo at the reception upgraded us to a suite and the room was fabulous. I was a little sceptical about the location but there is shuttle from the hotel every 30 min so everything is easily accessible. Will definitely come back.

I stayed here for only one night. Anna the receptionist is very helpful and nice in helping us out.When i was here i need to go to airport early in the morning, concierge help us greatly in booking us taxi to get to airport

Sarah she is so.nice and helpful thank you for her service, even thought I checked in in the middle of the night feeling exhausted I still got an free upgrade to a suite which in much spacious than I expected !

I enjoyed my 1 week stay here in late Feb 2019, high floor with great views to Tsuen Wan, the Dorsett is a new modern mid ranged hotel that is well run with friendly helpful staff, at first the location can look a little isolated but its not really, easy flat walk to Tai Wo Hau Station, beware as there is only one elevator and no escalator, and there is a free bus to the larger Kwai Fong Station with yummy $7.50 fresh steamed buns at the station entrance.My only complaints are that on a non smoking floor someone was smoking and it was going right thru the air-con system and that the pillows were truly awful, way to soft and gave me a stiff neck.

It s a great hotel and we loved the convenience . Hotel is clean and spacious . I love that it is near eatery. The staff was very helpful and theres is free shuttle bus provided. Staff is helpful and nice. Hope u can consider coming here.

People in font desk are very nice. Everyone was so helpful specially Edwin & Sarah who were on duty when we arrived that they welcomed us with warm , welcoming smile... Looking forward to stay in this hotel again

Words won't describe the service i got from Mr Elwin and miss Sarah, they were helpfull and very profesional,Mr Elwin help us with suggestions and makes our stay just great, his english is great makes the communication easy,Thank you for all,

Generally very nice place and rooms. Staff all very helpful. Shuttle service is very good.Several eating places inside. Very modern.The check in/out is on first floor which is good as it leaves the ground floor free for people waiting for pickup with their luggage

Good Service and clean. The reception is in good manner when I get to hotel, they are kind and professionally, the room air-condition is cool. I can see the CCTV, which is really nice that I can know thing happened in China and world.

Stayed for 4 nights with friends. Reception tried to charge us extra day when we arrived. Towels are all worn. Beds old and uncomfortable. Shower head connection broken and spraying water. Pillows were old and squashed flat. Was reasonably close to bus and train interchanges. It's an industrial area so only few restaurants and eateries and a 7 eleven that closes on Sunday.

Me and my girlfriend first time travel in Hong Kong is a blast thanks to this hotel. We have nice and comfortable room to, stay it is very clean and the hotel have complete and admirable amenities offered. Lobby is a bit crowded in the morning as the guest are waiting for pickup, they have nice game rooms to kill sometime while waiting. Although we didn't expect to have a good hotel because we applied for travel package but it is great to be surprised.

The room is comfortable, the breakfast is excellent, the pizza bar is yummy with reasonable price, and the service is careful. The location is a bit far away from the Diamond Hill MTR station, so be careful when going.

The Pentahotel has a cool aesthetic, a game room, billiard area, a restaurant and a pizza place. The rooms are not large but comfortably proportioned in a city where space is at a premium. The bed was king sized (important as my husband is very tall) and comfortable. There was a window seat for reading or just staring at the surrounding buildings. The bathroom was clean and the shower had both a handheld spray and a rainhead shower with excellent water pressure. The nearest MTR (metro) station was only a 5-7 minute walk.The hotel receives a number of groups but was well set up for it. Groups have a separate check-in so you won't have to wait behind 50 people to check in or ask a question. There are also numerous, spacious elevators so even when 50 people all try to get to their rooms at once with luggage, you won't have to wait more than 3 to 4 minutes for an elevator.Cons: The hotel is about 40 minutes from Central (main business district) so, if that's where you plan to do a lot of site seeing, you should bear it in mind. Disney, as well as the airport are about an hour (the airport is where you catch the bus to Macau) so, again, if that's your plan and you are cramped on time, it is a consideration. I found the lighting in hotel bathroom quite dark when I was trying to put on make-up (we also encountered numerous dark bathrooms at restaurants on this trip so maybe it's a thing in HK). It was only a problem for putting on make-up but there is a big mirror on the bathroom door (facing the room) so you could use that with out issues.The hotel is on a street with some warehouses and between that and the tour groups, I worried about noise (bad past experience in France and Thailand) but the rooms were very well insulated. I only heard noise in the hall once - otherwise, nothing. I didn't hear the delivery trucks, the neighbors, nothing. Overall, the hotel is very nice and very well priced for Hong Kong.

Well my friend and I were taking a Vacation to Thailand from the United States. Heading back to the States was quite difficult given the Airlines had over book over flights two days in a row. Nevertheless we needed somewhere to stay. I found this very aesthetic hotel, booked it around 7:35pm and was checked in by 8:45pm. I swear this hotel is amazing... it definitely gave me New York City vibes. Everything was perfectly odd but it mesh brilliantly. Let me not forget to mention the bathroom and showerhead is literally to die for. Also this hotel is so tech-savvy and each room includes a PS4. On to the staff they were so caring and professional, from the time the taxi picked us up until the taxi took us back to the airport. What I'm really trying to convey this hotel should honestly be on every person list. If I ever end up in Hong Kong again this is the place.

It was a rainy day, we drove to the hotel but being informed that no parking at all and we need to park at the charged car park around 10 mins walk from the hotel. Also, the hotel is far away from mtr and bus stop. Poor location , should arrange free shuttle for guests.

Perfect in the end as I got better room for the 2nd night to the higher floor. The first night was not ideal due to poor sleep & slightly rough reception guy.But the breakfast is great & the shifted room perfect.

This hotel is in a more local and less touristy part of town which I actually enjoyed. The hotel feels very western in style but still cool looking. Lots of lounge areas. The room is kinda small but still enough space to hold luggage. Buffet breakfast was amazing and the best hands down I鈥檝e ever had.

I have mixed feelings. The place was modern but in an odd area. The biggest issue for me was the lighting. It was dim everywhere and the bathroom was the worst part. I was not sure if my sunscreen went on evenly and I had to check with a mirror once I got outside. My biggest complaint was while I was lounging after pizza. A man who clearly worked at the hotel said I could not lounge and needed to sit up. I was appalled and just answered him stating, fine! I will return to my room then.

Location was about 10 mins walk from mtr station.Bad service attitude from the staff especially at the breakfast buffet. One of the staff even shouted at my mum. Spoilt the whole holiday mood for all of us.Huge disappointment especially when i heard good review on this hotel.First and last time im gonna stay in pentahotel.

It was great to know that there鈥檚 a great place to stay in Kowloon. Upon arrival, Lizzie Kim (I鈥檓 not sure if I spelled the name correctly) welcomed me with warm smile. Check in was very smooth. Rooms are perfectly clean, spacious if your a solo traveler and convenient if you鈥檙e with your family.Breakfast is great as well as the selection. If you鈥檙e tired from a whole day tour, the hotel offers room service too! What made me and my family comfortable was the shuttle service being offered by the hotel from and to the city - very convenient if you don鈥檛 want the hustle of walking to the MRT station nearby. Most of all, the staffs were helpful especially the room attendants who kept our room cleaned everyday.My family and I had a wonderful stay and will definitely be choosing this hotel on our next visit in Hong Kong.

Unlike other hotels I鈥檝e stayed in, this hotel really helps me relax and keep my mind off the stressors of daily life. Definitely recommend it for someone trying to get away from it all - location is a bit of a challenge to get to and away from the usual tourist attractions but MTR and bus connectivity make up for it

Very nice overall. Staff are mostly helpful and friendly. Room is clean and tidy, even after the house keeping. location convenient and quite.gym room is nice but can be having more options will be great .

Don't be put off by the 'out of the way' location - as a base from which to see HK, it's as good as any non-Central hotel. The staff are youthfully energetic, motivated, and very helpful ... happy, it seems, to satisfy the customer whenever the opportunity arises. No negatives.

Visiting Hong Kong for the first time, I had high expectations from this hotel. And it truly didn't disappoint. I booked the hotel via Expedia and the process was smooth and hassle-free. From the moment we checked in to the moment we left the hotel, we were treated with utmost care, professionalism, genuine passion and the truest of hospitality from every single member of the staff. The hotel has a unique modern yet understated luxury, with sleek and clean cut architectural design, reminiscent of yesteryear Hong Kong oozing with nostalgic cultural and traditional embedded in every detail of the property.A big thank you to Julia Leung, the Communications Manager who ensured the fullest of professionalism in her entire correspondence with me. She was knowledgeable, well spoken, timely and robust in her handling of everything from day one. The housekeeping lady named Aida was also particularly amazing, always cheerful, smiling and loving in her tone, speech and mannerisms.The hotel rooms are superbly appointed, clean, well maintained. The floors are quiet and noise-free, the lobby and dining areas exude chic elegance mixed with typical Hong Kong pop culture, heritage and modernistic elements combined for a marvelous experience to one's senses. All in all, this was a brilliant experience and we would gladly stay again. We'd recommend this property to friend and family without a doubt, and are looking forward to another stay here in the near future!

Loved the stay. Location is decent though in a ex-industrial area. Direct bus is available to peak tower and ocean park. Food is good and the staff is friendly. Amenities provided were decent enough. Expectations met

The hotel is well located, and quite modern, but there are less stores nearby. No bus goes from the airport to the hotel straightly. People are kind, at your service all time. Besides, safety and qualities have been well performed.

The rooms were a good size, clean and comfortable. Over my visit I stayed in 3 different rooms due to travelling and can say that they were all of a very good standard.The hotel is approx. 45mins from HK airport and a taxi will set you back around 300HKD.The hotel is a little way from the busy centres of HK however there are great bus and rail links just around the corner. A Taxi to the busyer areas with cost you around 100HKD or 180HKD if you are crossing to the other islands.On what should have been my final night I lost my passport - It was at the hotel!A very big thank you to Tim Chan for keeping hold of my passport until I returned (unfortunate I missed my flight) but all the staff were amazingly helpful

Comment is good . The overall visits for me and my family were more than 10 times in the past 5 years. The rooms are good enough with good views. We enjoy the swimming pool very much in the previous visits. The gym is also good

Larger than average (for Hong Kong), clean and modern room. Check in & out was very quick. Staff friendly and efficient. Hotel offers free minibus service to either Diamond Hill MTR or into TST area. Local cafe/restaurants are nearby and Diamond Hill MTR station is a 5 minute walk away. Convenient pizza restaurant is on the ground floor and Chinese food street restaurants are on the first floor. Will definitely go back.

Staff is nice and helpful. The Surrounding in hotel is good & food is delicious, Transportation is convenient with me. I enjoy the buffet breakfast very much. When I visit HK for business trip, I will stay your hotel again.

Stayed 3 days at this awesome place, great rooms and staff. We arrived early and they had our room ready within an hour, having a newborn is a big plus!!!They have a game room and breakfast in the morning had a wide choice from local to international. Would like to come back when in Hong Kong

All the staff members are kind, considerate and helpful. Room is clean with super comfy bed and pillows. Bathroom is also very clean, equipped with refillable soap and shampoo dispenser! No waste! And a big plus, is the quiet and peaceful neighbourhood to return to after a hectic day in the bustling city.

It would be better if the bathroom door had a lock. Any one can push open the bathroom door while someone else was using the bathroom. Also, it would be helpful if there were more hooks in the bathroom for people to hang their clothes when showering or when using the bathroom to change their clothes in private while there are other people in the room.

Simply Said, A fine place to stay if in the Kowloon area ... not the heart of the tourist area, but access to subway. We arrived by car service (friend paid $50- U.S. to join us one way ... buy subway passes & cut costs by half. We had breakfast every morning - great variety of food offerings for a very multi-cultural group of guests. We ate out most nights, but a few our group had pizza / others ate dinner and complimented the offerings they tried. The room(s) were perfect & the staff great (PROVIDED you talk to the right one). All seemed young, eager to help, but some are not strong in English ... get the right staff person and your question, concern, or problem is addressed properly. This was our first experience with Pentahotel(s) and strongly suggest you consider them in your travel plans. We will be using them again for sure. P.S.check on line pricing - very competitive in the Hong Kong market place, and well worth the savings if you travel on special budget ... HONG KONG is expensive on some things.Shop and you will be rewarded.

The room was clean and stylish, but if they prepare cotton buds and hair conditioner, it would be even better.The location is a little bit far away from TST, but it鈥檚 not so a problem as the way from Diamond Hill station is simple.

This was my 4th time I stayed at the Pentahotel. I often feel welcome. Quick check in and out with no fuss. A clean and decent size room in HK standard. Staff are very friendly and helpful. I was staying at the 31st floor. The housekeeper Ada was extremely helpful and often made my room very clean and tidy. I鈥檓 sure I will stay there again when I back to HK.

Very nice size hotel room for Hong Kong standards. Location is a bit far from the hustle and bustle but they have shuttle buses to the nearest MTR station. There is also a shopping centre nearby. Overall I think this hotel is very good value for what you get in Hong Kong. The only downside is, you need to budget for Uber fees when you stay here as you will need this service everyday!

location is very handy for MTR. A lot of Amenties around that area. Staff are friendly and helpful.The room size is comfort and use the room card to go on the lift to room. That make it feel more security.

This was my first trip to Hong Kong and I was very pleased with the hotel the travel agent had selected. The customer service, particularly at the registration desk, was awesome! They assisted with directions, highlights to visit and even made some arrangements for me. The rooms were clean and comfortable with a modern d茅cor. The food in the restaurant was amazing, particularly the breakfast buffet! The only drawback for me was the location. I had to use taxis to get all of the places I wanted to visit.

New & modern hotel. Very spacious room, not the typical room size of of hotels in HK. Not near the city centre but they provide direct shuttle bus to TST. 10 mins walk to Diamond Hill MTR, Plaza Hollywood mall, Chi Lin Nunnery & Nan Lian Gdn. The mini bus station is just around the corner. We took a bus to Sai Kung Pier which is quite convenient. If you are done with the usual tourist spots visits and wish to explore HK suburbs, this is definitely a good hotel option.

Definitely one of our best stay in Hong Kong! The room was wonderful, modern, spacious and comfortable! There was still space to walk after I opened my luggage. It is located in a quiet neighbourhood with a shopping mall Plaza Hollywood about 8 mins walk away. There's a direct bus from the bus interchange (next to the mall entrance) to Sai Kung for a relaxing day trip. You can also go for the guided tour provided by the Hong Kong Volcano Discovery Centre on weekends but recommended to book in advance on their website first as it's quite popular. Convenient to take bus A29 from the airport to Diamond Hill Station. It's about 10 mins walk to the hotel from there.

The second major meeting for me in February after the India visit was at Hong Kong. This time, we had been looking for a hotel close to the office and the best we got was Penta Hotel in Kowloon. There seem to be two in Hong Kong and hence, it makes sense to get the address (in Chinese also if possible) to show to the taxi driver. Made it in 35 minutes from the airport. Access to the hotel is via one of the lanes and unless you happen to be looking for it, it is easy to miss as the name plate is also not very large. But my driver had no issues finding it. There is a pizza bar at the entrance and a seating area, but the actual check in is on the first floor. You could go via the elevator or there is a set of escalators going 2 levels up past mezzanine to the check in lobby. Check in was quick and efficient though we had quite a few people. It could be because group check-ins (of which there were many in the days I was there) are handled elsewhere which reduces the crowd on the 1st floor lobby. Got a room on the 22nd floor and the view was pretty much the buildings around鈥othing great. The room itself was quite small and minimalist compared to other cities, but was large for local standards. The bed occupied much of the space with a small area for storage without a wardrobe or cupboard again. (Ended up leaving my soiled clothes out in the open.). There is a small work area adjoining it and a mini-refrigerator. The bathroom was a small affair as well ( in stark contrast to my last stay just a week ago)., but equipped with the common toiletries and amenities. In short, minimalist and everything worked. Only things I missed was a set of drawers or wardrobe, an iron with board and given the climate, a spare umbrella. Am told the last two could have been requested from reception though I did not try. Though they had 25 rooms or so per floor, it did not seem overly congested and there was no noise creep from adjoining rooms. The window area also had a seating cushion if you wished to sit by the window. It helped for times when had my colleagues gather in the room for a meeting and not all of us could be accommodated on the bed or the one chair. The most impressive feature of the check-in was a short card they gave which had a map of everything one would need in the vicinity of the hotel including convenience stores, medical, supermarket, transport, etc. For any first time visitors to Kowloon, this was immensely helpful and a very nice touch. I must also mention that the metro station is a short 8 minute walk away. We had opportunity to use the bar on the first floor and also the restaurant for breakfast. At breakfast which started only by 7 am, there were no manual lists and they would just swipe your room card to let you in. While I was impressed on day 1 with the choices, by day 3 it became a little repetitive as there was absolutely no change in the dishes. A lot of the food was Asian style including samosas from India, Congee, local style noodles, fruits, bread, etc. Table service was minimal and you sat where you found an empty table and served yourself. The bar service was a lot better in the evenings when we had dinner and drinks with a good selection of burgers and other convenience food. The area around the lobby also had some entertainment areas for playing games including two pool tables which were in use most of the times I tried. They also had a small reading area which was a hit with the kids spending a lot of time there. One of my colleagues tried the pizza bar and was all praise for the quality of the food. Checkout was quick and efficient again despite a small queue. The staff ability to converse in English was definitely helpful. There is a queue outside for getting a taxi and though we in one of the smaller lanes, they could call for a taxi whereby waiting time was not that bad. The space in front of the entrance was also big enough for the larger buses with the tour groups to come in and park. 鈥?,March 18

Room is considered big for a hotel in Hong Kong. Buffet breakfast in the morning is also not too bad, quite a spread although some of the food like the scrambled eggs are quite dry and rubbery. There is no kettle in the room though. Other than that, would still stay there.

Super worth ur money,Room is huge, bed is comfortable and big.Super clean and cozyHard to find this type of room at Hong Kong. Location is a but off, need to walk 5 minutes from closest MTR, but everything else is perfect. Love this hotel

The rooms were quite an experience in itself and the value was immense because of the price I paid for 3 nights. You won't regret staying at this place. All the amenities were included and all the nearby stores had almost everything you might need. Found my Go-to in Hong Kong!

Nice place, clean, but very small rooms. They were very accommodating when I was forced to change hotels, which I truly appreciated. They are centrally located and close to the sea terminal. and to the center of the city. We were exhausted from travel so we really used them to rest and for a stop off for a day trip.

I鈥檓 a simple traveler but I鈥檓 picky with hotels. I wants the basic comforts such as 1) quiet room2) good customer service 3) safety This hotel met this and had perks such as free water bottle daily, shuttle service to central shopping area known as K11, shampoo and body wash, toothpaste and hair dryers. My room also had coffee pot, small fridge and a safe. It鈥檚 location away from the hustle of Kowloon kept it nice and quiet. It鈥檚 also within walking distance to subway and busses. So much so that I pulled my suitcase to the bus station at Rhythm Garden and took the bus A22 to the airport for $39 HK which is about $5. The hotel also has a airport shuttle for more $ but it was so easy to ride the bus. The nearest subway station is Diamond Hill with a gigantic shopping center with a supermarket on top floor. The wifi at the hotel was great too. In short, I鈥檇 recommend this hotel!

Clean room, good view, helpful and friendly staff. The room is spacious for to standard. I Will want to stay here again when I visit hk and will also recommend friends and family to stay too. Great job!

As a tourist, location is very important, and as a commuter train is the best way of transportation, 7minutes walk from the hotel going to diamond hill station. I commend all of the staffs in the hotel, because they are very accomodating, friendly, helpful and very knowlegeable, all queries are answered very well, the room is very clean, there is game room, pizza bar, the internet is very fast, the gym is open 24 hrs. All I can say is wow... I can recommend this Hotel to everyone. Two thumbs up

I like the design of the room, restaurant, lobby. Amenity at room are also cute and good design. There are convinience store and restaurant around the hotel. Walking distance to nearest MTR station. Unfortunately thestaurant was fully booked around 19 oclock.

Staff so helpful, the room was compact but had everything we needed such as a safe and kettle. We had a great night's sleep on very comfortable beds. The breakfast buffet was not included so we paid for it. There was plenty to eat although the western food was not as hot as i would have liked.

I feel relax when I stay in your hotel. I like the bed and hotel room, decoration is nice and space is enough. Staff needs to be more training , seems not really make me comfortable during check inRecommend to have more options for room service

Located at the eastern part of Kowloon area, it provides with nice view from room. The rooms are quite spacious for the price and the MTR station is also very close to the hotel. The staff is friendly as well.

I actually made an oopsie with my booking as we planned the trip 3 days before arriving. I thought the location was closer to the main city but its really not.That said, we still really loved the hotel. It is walking distance to the MTR. We really liked the pizza bar and frequented the McD nearby. Hehe.We took the buses and trains from close by. The hotel itself is lit! The ambiance was amazing. Rooms are small buy sufficient and had amazing views. Love!

I stayed in this hotel during the Chinese New Year Holiday (1.2.19 to 4.2.19) A chic-modern hotel with the right amenities you would want. Check-in & Check-out was very smooth. Thanks for Mr.Edwin (extremely kind and courteous). Rooms are decently sized. Breakfast spread was good (but needs a change in buffet menu as it becomes monotonous to eat the same variety every day). walkable distance from the Diamond Hill MTR Station (A Exit). 7Eleven & Manning few blocks away.

Stayed for three nights on my Asian tour. This is a modern well designed hotel and everything is in working order. Wonderful roomy shower. The bed was perfect for me. Quirky bath amenities. The breakfast buffet has plenty of variety for everyone. The downside is the location. It is not even on the tourist map. They do have a shuttle that takes you to the heart of Kowloon that runs on the hour, however the last one back is 7:30 pm. The subway is about 4 blocks away but the area is not the most comfortable to walk around. This is an abandoned industrial area with massive construction as of this writing. This hotel is fantastic if you are with a group of some sort but as a single woman traveler I do not recommend it at this time.

The hotel was very nice. Modern, comfortable and great service. I didn't get to experience all the amenities but will return to enjoy the hotel. I've been in and out of Hong Kong for over 30 years and decided it was good to not stay in the normal places on the island or in busier Kowloon. This was very different. Out of the busy areas, quiet and unique as it is in an industrial zone. The restaurant for breakfast was very good and the pizza bar a nice change. I'll be back

Hotel location is not near most things tourists want to see. Ended up taking a lot of taxi rides. Breakfast had international choices. Housekeeping was very responsive. Views from rooms not scenic鈥?apartment buildings and industrial sites.

This boutique hotel was perfect for our visit! The view from our room was very good at day and beautiful at night with the lights of the city. They do a very nice breakfast buffet and the pizza restaurant downstairs is very good at a great price. Rooms are large for Hong Kong with comfortable beds and a nice shower. It is a clean, well maintained place in a convenient location and the hourly shuttle service to the large mall/shopping area in Tsim Sha Tsui is a great way to explore! Planning a return trip in April and we鈥檒l definitely stay here again!

I was very impressed with the value and quality of this hotel. The location is a good quiet place in the city and it was easy to find. Also very friendly and helpful staff.Upon arrival I experienced a bit of difficulty finding the reception desk, mainly because it was very busy inside, I was tired after a long day, and also the staff was busy dealing with the crowd of people it took me a while to learn the check in reception desk was on the 1st level. That's OK, no big deal, as soon as I found it, check in was very fast and I was in my room very quickly. The staff was very helpful and attentive.

The hotel is clean and the front desk staffs are friendly and helpful. The pizza restaurant is tasty.My question is why they don't give you one more spare bathroom roll tissue for back up. And the location is good to consider staying there.

I just stayed 3 nights in this hotel, location is really crowded, hotel room was just ok, but bathroom was the hell, so bad smell in the bathroom, i just want to get out from this hotel, will be never come back, but staff is really nice and breakfast was awesome.

Very good location in Kowloon, amongst the shops and eateries, I had requested a room with a separate shower, the one we were given didn鈥檛 so we were told that was no problem, just wait in the room and within five minutes we were escorted to another very nice room. The choice for our breakfast was unbelievably, eggs cooked to order, I only had dinner there twice and it also was good. We also had use of a free phone in our room for local and international calls, I would recommend this hotel and would certainly stop there again. The only thing that I didn鈥檛 like was when we were dropped off from the airport transfer coach, was to find myself looking at a dark passage way and being told the Hotel was down there, it was a bit confronting, wondering what had I booked, when It opened up onto a courtyard and there was the Hotel

It was a comfortable stay at Tsim Sha Tsui in this hotel. TST MRT is about 400m away straight while Tsim Tong Station is the other way about 300m to the lift. Many cafes and restaurants nearby but one can get lost in the smaller streets. The Wifi Phone from the room can be used as a GPS guide.

Loved this hotel situated at Tsim Sha Tsui which is a really central location for all the shopping and good food. Hotel service is superb! Only thing is the single bed room is a tad small but must say the bed is really comfortable.

Family room is big enough to accomodate family with young kids.location is good as it is near to mtr and good eateries shops. Staffs are friendly and helpful. If the tv programme can include more channels then it would be even better.

The park hotel was Very clean and tidy and is close to everything and good value. We had a triple room and it was a really good size for 3 people. The train is a only a short walk along Cameron to nathan rd

I was visiting Hong Kong for work and thought of extending the stay for some sightseeing so started looking for a budget hotel in the area.As I was planning to use the MTR so the hotel had to be closer to a station- preferably east Tsim Sha Tsui.I spent 2-3 days looking at different properties, their facilities, tariff but none could match up to this one which was well within my budget.The positives- 2 mins walking to the train station- easy to find, it has two entrances, back side is more approachable- front desk staff is warm- provide you with a smartphone with free calling and data- with my booking I even had the mini bar to my disposal- room was quite spacious- smart control panel for all the lights/aircon, the panel is placed next to the bed- I got the room which was road facing and had good view compared to the back side ones- no noise/disturbance, mine was the last room in the corridor that could also be the reason- walking distance to the shopping areas, pier, malls- bed was comfortable- I could sit by the window and watch the city - had requested for a higher floor and given 9thWhat else can you ask for?Maybe the rooms between 1-10 are facing outer side of the road and provide better view.

Nice compact hotel, big room for Hong Kong TST - Hong Kong area. Convenience and strategic location for food and shopping, good and help staff. Quick check-in and check-out. Convenience that can take K4 from high speed train from airport at Kowloon station.

Had 6 nights stay. Check in & out was fast and efficient. Room is very spacious as compared to other hotels in Hong Kong. Buffet breakfast was delightful, service excellent. There's Chinese, Western, Indian food. There's a few selections in the cheese section, wide variety in the bread section, a pancake machine as well. Wide variety of fresh fruits, juices, and cereals. Excellent! Room service was good, food portion is just nice. Housekeeping staff is friendly and does a great job! Coffee cups in room are of a comfortable cup size not the regular small cup usually in hotels. Room comes with a universal plug and many sockets and usb ports. Room has room slippers, extra pillows, mobile phone for ease of travelling out. So you dont need to worry if u did not buy a local sim card or data roaming. Basically, all the necessities you need in a hotel are provided. Wonderful stay!

Our room was clean, tidy and maintained through out the trip. Liked having a bath available. Bottles of water provided daily. Great location. Close to MTR. Many inexpensive restaurants close by. Laundry matt round almost around the corner. Busy in the evenings. Felt very safe in the area. Walking distance to Star Ferry.

My first time in Hongkong - layover to fly out to Fiji. I only had one night, shuttle dropped me off before check in time. They did all they could to give me my room earlier. 11h30 a.m. was the very kind offer. So I started walking. The nice spots in Kowloon are in the neighbourhood. The harbour, the promenade, the shops, Nathan Road, the HopOnHopOff bus stops... The room was nice, they even provided chargers - and I still forgot mine there....clean bathroom, big and comfy beds, no noise, everything you need and a really good breakfast buffett... I wish I would have had more time to enjoy the food. Park Hotel is a good place to be Hongkong.

I will be writing the detailed review of this hotel so read on...Location:-The hotel is located in a very busy area...tsim tsha tsui market area....Its location is very nearby to bus staion,MTR(just 5-10mins walking)....taxis are easily available here 24X7there is a very nice garden opposite the hotel....its very good in the night time to just take a stroll away from the hustle bustle...Hotel:-the hotel is well maintained,fresh and neat....the facilities here are good...the rooms are very good.The Hotel is not the best in this area but can't rule this one out.Hyatt is nearby which is the best n just a stone throw away distance from the MTR.The check in to the Hotel was not so smooth and it has a very small lobby...my kids were tired because of the travel there was no place to even sit....check in took time.Food:-The breakfast here was pretty average....the modern cuisine was excusable.Luckily we had the priviledge of Indian food cause of 1 Nepali Chef here....he is very helpful.Didn't take dinner or lunch here....Service:-There was no bellboy available to collect our luggage when we were checking in which was a major let down.The staff here understands a bit of english not completely though.They are friendly still.Overall:- I would still rate this hotel above all mainly because of its location....its in the heart of all the action and MTR connectivity is good.

Everytime I visit HK for pleasure or business, I only stay at Park Hotel. Aside from the property being situated conveniently to public transportation, restaurants and shopping places, the overall experience of this hotel is bar none.

Over all a very good experience, hotel with a great location and good service. Surrounded by stores for shopping and dining, including good options for Indian food.Rooms are good and clean. Since this is in the city area a lot of tour operate from here, also taxis are easily available.

Amazing location, very clean and friendly staff and very helpful if you ask for anything. The most important is location as 7 eleven just across the road and many nearby restaurants and shops. Nathan road just 10 minutes away

Great location. The hotel is close to Tsim Sha Tsui station. Many eateries close by. Room is quite large and clean. Staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast needs more varieties. Would definitely stay here again.

This is the second time stay in Park hotel. This hotel is very good location and many restaurants near around. It is very convenient for businesses trip in Hong Kong. Also AEL free shuttle bus is available in the front of the hotel. Very very convenient!!!

Hotel is well situated, good standard, efficient helpful courteous staff across all the service areas, from Reception, Concierge, Bar, Cleaning and Breakfast area. Apart from what I consider poor noise insulation in the room I occupied I enjoyed my stay and would recommend Park Hotel Hong Kong to others considering a stay in this part of Kowloon.

Was a great hotel rooms were spotless and the staff couldn't do enough for you .the food in the restaurant was lovely would recommend to anyone and will be staying there again as it was great value for the price

This hotel gave us everything we needed, great location, great staff, clean rooms, and a wonderful breakfast selection. The Concierge was very helpful in suggesting activities we could do.Our room was perfect, the cleanliness could not be faulted.

Very good location and convenient for taxi. There are many food stores behind the hotel, overall experience is good but a bit pricey, we really enjoyed our stays for 5 days in the clean and spacious room.

Great place to stay: extremely nice and professional people. After a hectic trip through Vietnam and then landing in Hong Kong with sensory overload, the hotel was a great place to recharge the batteries.

First time that I have booked a room directly and was pleasantly surprise at the 'solo travellers room'features and comfort. I have stayed at the Park on at least 6 previous occasion, but the travel agencies have book a Duluxe suite and was not made aware of the solo traveller room until I visited your web site. I am hoping to visit Singapore next year and will take the opportunity to book with the Park Group doing a direct booking through the web page. The service by all your staff was excellent particularly the room cleaning group who always greeted me warming when seeing them in the corridor.

this is our second visit to Hongkong and i chose park hotel as i had an amazing experience last time, excellent hotel in the heart of the citysuperb location, well maintained rooms, nice staff overall 100% value for money. our request for early check in was accommodated. Breakfast had a variety of local Indian and international cuisines.Smart phone is very helpful

Stayed at this hotel for one night. It鈥檚 in an excellent location! Steps away from tons of great food, bars, shopping and only a 20 minute walk to the Star Ferry (even quicker by cab). Staff is friendly and helpful. Buffet breakfast is good! Only complaint is that the bed was rock hard, mattress was way too firm for my liking but that could just come down to a personal preference kind of situation. Room comes with a cell phone which is cool. Overall worth the money!

Pulling out a guest from a breakfast table is the worst anyone can do. The front office staff of the hotel dont know what is mentioned on the website. My son of 7 years had free breakfast as per their site but the front office staff on 23rd April did not know that. They kept on saying it is not mentioned on their website, but where as it was clearly mentioned that a child of 7 to 11 years eat free. Overall a terrible experience staying with them due to that.

Stayed at the Park Hotel for four days during our trip to Hong Kong. Fantastic location. Close to transport. Hotel had everything we needed. Was well appointed and was spotless. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Cafe in lobby had a good range of delicacies for morning or afternoon tea and had a discount if you were staying there. Free wifi and also free phone that you could call overseas on. Well done Park Hotel. Keep up the good work. Will stay there next time we are in Hong Kong

The hotel is strategically located near to many shops and local eateries. Park Cafe is having an attractive 40% discount for in-house guests to dine at their buffets, worth a try. Air conditioning is nice, adjustable temperature and not too dry.The room service food was nice and big portion.Generally not bad but 2 things that left deep impressions on me.1) the housekeeper did not thoroughly clean the room during one of the days. I returned to find there was still a piece of tissue found between the sofa and the bedside table of my room (1104). The floor was also not well vacuumed, still had bread crumbs from my previous night鈥檚 in-room dining.2) the handles on wardrobe and fridge door are loose, need to be gentle with it.I hope to see improvements when I do return in future.

Efficient check in, given an upgrade and room was ready for early check in. Breakfast was poor as all the food was precooked and supposedly kept hot, but items such as tomatoes, hash browns, baked beans were barely warm, Chicken sausages, also barely warm and like chewing rubber, some of the worst I have ever had, barely edible - very very disappointing breakfast. Also told quite bluntly that my package did not include breakfast and had to pay and bought the bill when I was eating.was given a one hour late check out and this was handled efficiently

The hotel was average but clean. The concierge service was excellent. They were always ready to help translate and hail a taxi. Taxis are plentiful in the area so short wait times. The location has a convenience store across the street which is handy. Check in and out was efficient and again the staff were excellent. This started off as a business trip in Macau and we extended in Hong Kong. Glad we did!

Great location and easy walking distance to many sights including eveing light show along waterfront Promenade, many restaurants and Macau Ferry and Stanley Ferry as well as the Kowloon underground metro.

Perfect location of the hotel as situated in the very happening part of Hong Kong and lots of Indian restaurants nearby. Metro station just 2 minutes walk and bus stop out side the hotel. Seven eleven store bang opposite the hotel. Hotel has a neat ambiance with good and spacious rooms and very helping staff always egar to assist. Lavish breakfast was a delight with lot of Indian and continental dishes. Will strongly recommend to all...specially Indian visitors to surely check this hotel once travelling to Hong Kong. Only news to improvise in room service as sometimes takes too long to deliver rest its a perfect ten hotel.

Thanks you for the memorable stay in park hotel at hongkong. Me and my husband stay 4 days and 3 night. Very clean, room is big spacious, all employees is very Accomodating and helpful. My only comment when me and my husband stay no available room for double bed. We use twin bed 2 bed in one big room . But overall excellent. The breakfast buffet has plenty food to choose. And very deliciousUntil next time

Location quite good. 5 mins walk from MTR. There are alot eateries around and a supermaket at around 5 mins walk too. The airport transfer is just outside the hotel hence very accessible. Room is quite big and bed is comfortable. Provide complimentary water and handy phone.

The location is near to 2 mrt station, nearby a lot of famous food and shops, price is also reasonable. although is next to the road, it is not noisy at night, thus easy to sleep. Front desk staff are friendly.

I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We have a 10 and 8 year old. Place was perfect for us. Prime location. Ate at walking distance to hotel. Never took a taxi during our stay. Sleep, eat, explore, eat some more and repeat.

The park hotel in Hong Kong is great! We arrived on the Thursday evening and left on the Sunday evening. The staff were happy and helpful through out our stay. The hotel is in prime position by the sea front and by restaurants and shops. In addition, it is near the MTR (metro) which can take you nearly anywhere in Hong Kong. The rooms were comfortable and reasonably sized. I highly recommend this place!Excellent!!!!

Park Hotel is located Bang in middle of action and is approachable by Bus/Metro or a Taxi. Good eating and shopping places near-by..The Hotel itself is very good with excellent and prompt service..Is highly recommended for stay while in HK

The staff are friendly, check in and check out are very convenience.The double bed is too soft. I always woke up by the movement of my partner.Airport shuttle K4 travel between Kowloon express train station and the hotel.

nice staying on this hotel. they have free mini bar and its all free sodas and beer with water inlcuded. And also they have a free wifi and free cellphone used. the location also near with the other tourist spots and its easy to find the location.

Convenient location to TST station (400m). Took airport express from airport to West Kowloon Station, and then the free hotel shuttle bus to the hotel doorstep (K4, Stop 2.) Unable to do early check-in as the hotel was full - but check-in process was completed and I was offered luggage storage until I returned at 2pm. Great size room and decent size bath room with toiletries supplied. In-room Nespresso machine was great for morning coffee!Easy walking distance to enjoy the 8pm light show in the harbour.Great restaurant options in easy walking distance from hotel.Marigold Bar was great for after dinner drinks (all day happy hour.)More expensive than my usual hotel option - but brilliant price for HK

Nice and Pleasant Stay with lot of cosmetic shopping options nearby. Also, you can have many Indian food options nearby.Other Options you can explore via public transport (taxi/metro) that is easily available.

The Park Central Hotel is conveniently located in Kowloon close to a subway stop. It is easily accessible from the airport express train via the hotel shuttle service (an excellent option from the airport). After a long overnight flight from Toronto, we appreciated being provided an early check-in. The room was comfortable and the breakfast was excellent. Would definitely return again.

Location, room size and amenities, cleanliness, service - all of it was a positive experience. And for the price, it's great value! I have stayed here once before and I must say that they have done a great job of excellently maintaining the property.

Hotel was in center of town and we were able to walk to shopping and the river to watch the evening light show. Impressed by the cleanliness of hotel and nice breakfast. Would stay with you again if we visit Hong Kong again

Had a 5 night stay at Park Hotel, a great hotel, location perfect, room perfect, service great, helpful friendly staff. My 4th stay and will be back again in the future. Enjoyed "Marigold" Tony & Jessica made us very welcome

I had a long wait of 2 hours at check-in, even though i had informed hotel while booking 20-25 days in advance, for check-in at 12 p.m. I stayed at The Park, TST, for 9 days for business from 27th Feb to 8th March.

Room was big enough to accommodate an extra bed and still have lots of space to walk around the room. It was nice that the shower area was separate from the bathtub since I was with my 80 year old parents. Staff was friendly and accommodating.

Overall good experience, nice breakfast spread and close to MTR station. Hotel rooms were good, only thing I didn't like was house keeping service, even after 2 calls dwe idn't get wine glasses in my room instead we got regular glass after 3rd call.

Carpeted floors, modern toilet, free wifi, near McDo and YoshinoyaDouble bed is good for family of 4. There is a deposit of 900 HKD but it will be given back at the end of stayThey help us book taxi going back to the airport.Over all, very nice hotel, reception is clean and there are many personnel on the lobby to assist you.There are 6 elevators so no problem on the space

Good hotel in a good location. I'm always staying at Park Hotel during business visits in Hong Kong. Always satisfied.Except that the hotel is nice, clean and good rooms, it is located in a nice area and a lot of restaurants & bars very nearby, which is important for me.

I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights and the great advantage is it's location. It's really in midst of Tshim Sha Tsui market and everything is very approachable.The metro station is walking distance which connects to all the tourist places including Disneyland, Ocean Park and other attractions. I also planned to visit repulse bay and there's a bus which directly takes you to repulse bay stop. Truly convenient.On walking distance you can go to Victoria Harbour to see Symphony of Lights in the evening. Temple street market and other places are very nearby.THe hotel have huge breakfast menu including Indian breakfast, so highly recommended for travellers from India. Even for dinner, you can go for a walk to have dinner in lots of Indian restaurants. Overall, it was a pleasant stay with English speaking Conceirge, whom i found really hospitable. They help you and guide you in nice way to define your itinerary.Last but not the least, biggest benefit of the hotel is the Handy phone, which is placed inside your room. You can use it for the duration you stay in the hotel where you can call to specific countries and use the phone for navigation purposes. I loved the stay.

The hotel is located at Tsim Sha Tsui where is every convenient. All public transports are easily accessible. Just few minutes walk to the nearest MTR station. Besides that, several convenient stores and restaurants are nearby the hotel.

Friendly Staff - Staff were nice and handling thing professionally.Great Location - very near to nice restaurantasNice Interior Room - Newly deocated.Clean Toilet - well maintained Overall - very satisfied

I have stayed here on and off for the past year as I have been working in HK but on an accommodation budget.Since I basically live in HK - I wanted to be somewhere a bit quieter, but still with good public transport. I much prefer Ovolo southside's location on the south side of HK versus Central or the north of the island. And the MTR is a 3 minute walk which is perfect.Over the months the nightly rate for mini queen / twin has been around 700 HKD (usually by booking through one of the online travel sites). That is a fantastic deal for an on-island hotel with MTR connectivity. A cab at night can take as little as 10-15 minutes from central.Would note that booking direct with ovolo / marriott is usually more expensive, although the latter gives you breakfast and happy hour every day. The mini queen room is perfect for a solo traveller - might be a bit small for 2 people.Nice touches include free minibar, welcome bag of treats, and free self laundry. The apple tvs and large TV screens in every room are great.Big floor to ceiling windows provide sweeping views. Electric blackout blinds keep out all light, although occasionally the blinds get jammed in the mechanism. A/C is perfect. Everything feels new, and i like the style of the exposed ceilings with the pipework visible. the hotel is hip and has a 80s music vibe. Customer service is very good and everyone speaks english well. It feels like staying in a western hotel - which is a very high complement. From my experience in Asia -- even the swankier and pricier hotels sometimes lack that western, friendly customer engagement. i always ask to stay on the ocean park side as it is a great view and there is no road noise (motorway runs behind the hotel). When i stayed on the motorway side i did on occasion find the traffic a bit noisy.Be warned - there isnt much of a bar scene (the hotel's own rooftop bar is great though) and there are a few eateries nearby, but i tend to go out in central anyway.

A fantastic concept in hospitality. Very affordable but with brilliant service. Such welcoming, helpful and considerate staff. The general manager makes a point of engaging with the guests and is a real host.Can鈥檛 wait for them to open in Europe!

We recently hired the rooftop restaurant and bar for our staff party. This is the third annual staff party we have had in the hotel. Super accommodating, great food party menu for canap茅s and flexible drinks packages to suit all guests. I can not recommend the hotel as a venue enough!

Ovolo Southside has been renovated for the better the second time we stayed. We love the hotel, however the service and the friendly staffs are ones of the reasons we will be back for. They has been very consistent with the service, if not better. One of the staff, Joe, has been very helpful and attentive to our requests during both of our stays and made us felt welcomed. Definitely be back when we visit HK in the future.

The hotel location was very convenient and interior was very trendy as well. Isabel was very helpful to us and gave us great recommendations as to where we should hike in Hong Kong and also what food would suit us. All in all, a great stay and would definitely recommend to everyone!

Location of the hotel is not bad, few minutes walk from the MTR, and a short 10-15 minutes into Admiralty area. Free Happy Hours with snacks, work areas, a pool table retro music are most certainly welcome in the evenings. Food at the restaurant is gourmet and interesting, and the rooftop bar open till late is very cosy.Service from the funky checkin area onwards is very friendly and homely.A refreshing off beat stay in HK !

Stayed here for 5 nights with family (and for business). The first thing you'll notice is the retro '80s theme which gives the hotel a distinct and fun vibe. The rooms are very modern and clean with all the amenities you could need. The room was equipped with a TV with many channels, as well as an Apple TV. WiFi is very fast and abundant throughout the hotel. Thankfully you only need to login once at the beginning of your stay. The free minibar is a nice touch. There is a free happy hour in the lounge everyday from 5pm - 7pm with free flow drinks and snacks. The lounge is the perfect place to work with your laptop. And if you want to take a break there is a pool table you can use for free as well. The fitness center is sizable with all of the equipment one would need. The food at the restaurant (Komune) was terrific, with a good blend of modern and comfort food. The rooftop bar (Above) has a panoramic view of the neighborhood.But the best part of this hotel are the staff. They were willing to accommodate all of our little requests and went the extra mile to ensure a comfortable stay.Cheers to Sonesh and all the staff for an unforgettable stay. Will definitely visit again!

We love it as OVOLO love the F word where F stands for FREE: FREE Breakfast, Minibar, Happy Hours, Goodies Bag and many more. Ohhh... F also stands for FRIENDLY. They have helpful and friendly staffs, including the manager where we almost see him everyday. Room is rather small but there's a great socializing area / living room right beside the check in area where we spend most of our time. Again FREE Minibar, Nespresso, Cookies, Teas and Billiard Table. Location wise, it's very convenient as it is very close to the MTR station. 1 stop to Ocean Park, 2 stops to Admiralty which is very very close to the heart of the city. Another plus point regarding location, it is not located in a very crowded area. We will definitely come back to this property!

We spent our first weekend of our vacation at Ovolo Southside, and it鈥檚 been the best weekend we had so far in our 1 month trip around Asia. We stayed in their suite for 2 nights, which was over the top. We fell in love with the room right away after checking in. We loved the full floor-to-ceiling glass window view to Ocean Park, the comfy sofa, the bar, the make-up room ( which my fianc茅 loved so much), and very nice minibar that got refilled everyday. As I have informed Joe during the booking process this would be our pre-wedding trip, although I was only expecting a small surprise from them, we were amazed by how he had the room ready so nicely decorated and the welcoming note from the hotel management and staff to surprise my fianc茅. It was just incredibly well-prepared. I really appreciate the effort and wowed by the impression they made. Then we had a chat during happy hour with Joe, I just randomly mentioned about the fact that there was only 1 trash bin in the bathroom, and then once again, the staff went an extra mile to follow up (although it wasn鈥檛 really a request from us), as we got back to the room after happy hour, we found an extra trash bin in the living room area, which showed how thoughtful the staffs were, as they really do listen to their guests. We also got helped from Brian (the night security) as he called a taxi for us to the airport at the very last minute and we only have to wait about 10 minutes( we couldn鈥檛 get Uber in the early morning - about 5am, which we thought we could the night before, so we didn鈥檛 request booking the taxi ahead of time). Overall, there is no word that can express how we loved our stay at Ovolo Southside. We would definitely not only recommend Ovolo Southside to our friends and families, but also come back here again when we visit HongKong. P.s: I鈥檇 like to thank the hotel management and staffs (especially Joe ) here for a wonderful stay ever!

Lots of thoughts about my stay here. First of all it is much closer to the main centre than it looks on the map, it was only 14 min by bus at night and 2 stops by the metro to Hong Kong Island Central. Staff were very friendly and helpful and took delivery of some items I had ordered before I even arrived at the hotel. There is a lounge/restaurant/bar/chilling area with free tea/coffee and biscuits. You can order food from here or go upstairs to the main restaurant and terrace the food is good but the menu limited and on the expensive side. My room - Mini Queen - was on one of the lower floors to rear of the hotel on the roadside so i did not get the views overlooking the park and football pitches in the photos. My main issue was not only was there noise from the road but also a large generator/air con unit to the side of the building by the room, although it didn't keep my up if your a light sleeping the combination of both may affect your night, i called reception willing to pay for an upgraded room (Deluxe Queen) however they were fully booked at the time. The room apart from that was good with a comfy bed and strangely large shower that faced the road with frosted glass. the rest of the room had electronic blinds that did a good job of covering the floor to ceiling windows and blocking nearly all the light in at night. The items in the fridge are freebies and also you get a goody bag with a couple small snacks which is great. One excellent facility was the free self-service laundry room which allowed me to wash and dry all my clothes and bring the back nice and clean :) there is also a fitness room. If you're up for abit of a walk you can take the back route from the hotel along the river and up to Victoria Peak, it takes just under 3hrs or ones stop to Ocean Park. Overall a good stay but next time i'll get a deluxe room.

the staff was amazing- extremely friendly and helpful. the room was beyond our expectations - very cozy and homely feel, with free amenities - where do you get that !!! we were out for most of our meals but enjoyed the refreshments / happy hour and breakfast. Thank you Ovolo Southside

Ovolo hotels are excellent value, quality accommodation, great staff, free mini bar, free daily happy hour 5-7pm, free breakfast, excellent facilities at Southside too. Highly recommended, treat yourself.

My husband and I stayed for 1 month in Ovolo Southside. It has been a wonderful experience for the whole stay. The room size (Long loft) is good in comparison to other HK properties. Location is perfect - quiet and well-connected. The design of the hotel is chic urban living art and casual fine dining. The special part is the co-working and community space, which encourages great networking possibilities. What really make real difference is the amazing staff team who went extra miles to help us with all types of requests, from recommending the trips, managing storage, and sharing living experience and tips in HK, with warm hospitality and personal attention. We would like to sincerely congratulate the GM and his team, who did great job putting such a wonderful team together.

I was in hong kong for a short vacation. The staff service wad perfect and just like a family.That was so warm on my stay because the staff so kind and helpful.Lauren helped me with checkin who upgraded me to the amazing corner room and also gives me lots of information about the hotel. Kinki, Aki and Isabel helped me a lot on itinerary! I had a different perspective on hongkong! From street food in mong kok to the victoria harbour view from the peak, we were very well prepared with the information they provided. Hong kong is very easy to travel around when the MTR stop is only 5min away! Would definitely come back to Ovolo for my next stay in hong kong! See you soon!

Ovolo Southside is a very nice boutique hotel with thoughtful management such as free snacks & drinks at the cosy common area, freebies in the room, good gym, free self-help laundry room. Service staffs are very friendly & helpful. Good location with easily available taxis, bus stops & MTR nearby.

When I arrived at the hotel around 11am, I didn't expect they will give me a room to let me fresh up (since the weather was crazy hot outside) after I dropped my luggage. Amazingly, the reception team was so considerate that they not only let me have an early check in but also upgrade my room. That was so sweet...I'll definitely visit Ovolo again!

We had a poor start to our stay at the Ovolo Southside, with an indifferent鈥攑ractically cold鈥攔eception. No smile or welcome of any kind, which seemed strange, especially after having received very warm welcomes in mainland China. We were then checked into a mini twin room. Our mistake for booking it. Noise from the busy four lane road below was totally unacceptable. After returning from dinner late that night, we asked the front desk for a room switch. The night manager accommodated us immediately, putting us in a high floor room with a double bed. A much better arrangement for us, roomier and quiet. The rest of our stay was really good. Breakfasts were terrific, the one happy hour in which we partook was nice (good wine, beer and snacks). Self service laundry was a great feature. Tea, coffee all day long.The location? Super handy to the MTR (you鈥檙e in Admiralty within minutes) and some cutting edge contemporary art galleries are just steps away. The neighbourhood is transforming. And don鈥檛 forget the beaches (ie: the lovely Deep Water Bay) that are close by too鈥ave a swim in the morning!We will return.

This hotel has great people to take care of you, however, the rooms are small so its what you pay for but still you could be paying the same or even more and get disappointing service so at least this one worth it, location is okay if your meetings are in the same area.

5 nights in a corner room with great views of recreation grounds and the mountains. Loved the friendliness of the place. Felt at home with drinks and snacks in the lobby and other freebies to enjoy. Packed our free drink from the mini bar when we took off to explore. Staff helped us get to where we wanted to go. I loved the quieter location close to station and the happy feel of the place.

Cool, trendy, chic, fair-priced, clean, super-friendly, helpful, great breakfast, nice rooftopbar, nice goodie-bag, cool freebies, close to public transport, nice to come "home" to after a day in the city, nice rooms etc etc etcThey go the extra mile...all the way from Hong Kong to Germany: lost my beloved ovolo-bag (freebie / ovolo tote-bag) on the train in Munich and was super-sad as I used it everyday and really loved it. Tried to get it back, buthad no chance (who would hand in an empty tote-bag...). Got in touch with hotel and told them the story about the lost bag. 10 minutes later I received a message from the GM that they would be happy to post a replacement bag (for free...on top of everything else). I wasn't expecting any reply at all, let alone the message that Ovolo would send me another bag (more than one year after my last stay there). That is customer service you rarely find anywhere.Thank you Sonesh, Quinton and everyone else at Ovolo. You made my stay a memorable experience and managed to top expectations long after that one more time

One of the best hotel stays I've ever had. Not the fanciest place ever, but uniquely styled. The staff was always incredibly helpful. Delicious breakfast, awesome daily happy hour, adequate gym and free laundry room.

The hotel is new and chic and hip. The rooms were great looking and trendy .Hotel is a short walk from Wong chuk hang station .There鈥檚 a game area which you can play.Overall everything was fine with this stay.

Had such high expectations for this stay but:-No hot water on two occasions, both off peak times.-Minibar/bottled water not replenished at any time during a three night stay.-Room floor dusty on check in. Not cleaned during stay.-Desk staff would not walk 5 metres to the bar to serve me a drink despite doing the same for other members of my group 2 minutes earlier. There were three staff and only one guest checking in. Heads down doing busy work apparently.-Bed lumpy, TV reception poor.-No follow up from management to my feedback.
