Very decent hotel, superb atmosphere in the Aberdeen area, perfect for business visits to the closer parts of the hotel. Few minutes away by taxi you have Wan Chai Area where you can hang out, drink , eat and relax.

love the happy hour, laundry facilities, breakfast, but especially the staff including Sonesh and Tomas...Accessible from Central by bus 70 and 90 , or subway 3 stops away. Good price, nice rooms, complimentary snacks and beverages

This hotel is more than just a pretty accommodation. In fact, the location is not perfect if you prefer the Kowloon area (it is 2 stops from Admiralty on another line and 1 stop from Ocean Park). I came without expectation but left with abundance surprise. Ovolo upgraded me to their corner room and hold me up on the 22nd floor which coincidentally matches with my birth date on 22 May. Awesome amenities and welcome bar on the 1st night. Every staff (I swear hard) we cross path with during the 4 days stay was nothing short of top notched service. I concluded the stay with a surprise birthday celebration prepared by the hotel with my favourite girl. In 4 days, I also found my favourite hotel. Thank you Ovolo Southside.

The staff is very helpful.And I really like the locations.It's very nice.I will come again.I like the happy hour and the breakfast.And I love the view at the roomI will come again and I love to stay at there

Spent a week here as a base for a business trip and, as with previous visits, it was excellent. Room was spotless and always cleaned thoroughly each day, breakfast was great and despite the apparently small dining room there was never a delay in getting a table. The rooftop bar is a great spot in the evening where I invited local friends over who loved it. The Komune restaurant was even better than previously. I can鈥檛 think of a valid criticism to make for the week I was there. It is certainly my first choice for accommodation next time I come to HK.

The hotel is tucked away from the city and close by Ocean Park HK. It is actually located in an industrial area but there some good restaurants across the street. A point to note is that the 7-11 is not 24 hours and closes at 11pm.The room size as expected is acceptable. The bed and pillows are comfy and clean. Everything in the mini bar is free and refilled daily. The toilet is small but adequate and the water pressure is superb.There is a 24 hours gym and also free flow of beers from 5 to 7 pm at the lobby. The breakfast however is a letdown. Minimal choice and exactly the same everyday. Image staying for 4 nights.The nearest MTR is Wong Chuk Hang which is the green line about 5 mins walk. Very convenient.Overall i give this hotel a 8.5 over 10. Staff are helpful and friendly.

It was very nice experience of staying such a modern design artistic hotel. Less than 5 mins walk from wang chuk hang stn, less than 20mins to Central stn. Friendly staff to guide you. The room was clean room. Only thing I have to admit this hotel was noise from the road. If you are to stay at Wang Chuk Hang road side, please request the hotel your room to be an opposite side of the main road. I was at 6F level on the main road (i rhink itscalled Wang Chuk Hang road ..), and louder noise of cars passing by on the road was coming all day and night. Not sure if the window has noise protection but it disturbed sleep at night. you better have earplugs otherwise you can hardly sleep.

It was a wonderful stay with Ovolo Southside. Staff are super friendly and helpful. I made the reservation through trip.com, but for some reason the booking is not confirmed. Noel the concierge is very patient and helped me checking through the system. Fortunately everything is sorted after i have called trip.com, and i got a free upgrade as well! The room itself is stylish and clean. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay here!P.S the staff also gave me a handwritten bday card and a little gift when i checked out! Very thoughtful touch indeed. Thank you :)

If you are looking for a place to stay on Hong Kong island add this hotel to your list. I didn't find it right away as I wasn't looking for hotels on the South Side of the island - but I should have been! First off the location is amazing. Right next to the MTR meaning moments away from Central and Causeway Bay. It is also right next to the Aberdeen tunnel so is a 5 min bus/cab ride will have you near all the action.That said it is a much nicer place for the price than you would find elsewhere. The free mini bar is great as there is always a chilled bottle of water (or beer :) waiting for you after a long flight.If you book through the hotel you still get Marriott points which is an amazing value at the price point. Simply quote your Marriott number at check-in.Also special shot out to Joe who I often see at check-in. He leads by example and always puts the guests firsts. The whole staff has a cool energy that really makes the place come alive.Hong Kong has tons of hotel, but amazingly this one stands out and is likely one of the best places in town.

Besides location that bit far from downtown everything else is excellent. From check-in until check-out five days later, we really enjoyed our stay. Special thanks to Patrick, the concierge, that REALLY helpful with great smile. He is such a treasure that really shine Ovolo beyond its class. Front desk ladies also great. Breakfast pretty extensive and free daily-restock mini bar is really put an icing on the cake.If you not must to stay in downtown, try Ovolo and you will thank me later. :)If you going to Ocean Park, it's a crime not to stay here since it just one MTR stop with half the price compare to major hotel brand that inside the park.There's construction during our stay but we didn't experience any issue at all. Kudos with Ovolo. We will back again when our trip lead us to the area. Thanks!

Stayed here again on a business trip last February and the property was still as good as the last time. They've remodeled a little and changed the restaurant to Kommune HK.Overall, the service was excellent led by their manager, Sonesh. I'd stay here again on my next trip to HK.PRO TIP: This property is near Ocean Park, on a previous stay, I just actually walked going there. It's also near an MTR station as well.The only "downside" I could see was that it's in the south island area of HK, which means it's fairly far from the main action in the central island. I would typically do all my activities that I wanted before coming back to the property - mostly because once I'm back I'd get lazy to go out again even though it's probably just a 20-30 min train ride from the action. On the upside, the area is rather quiet and more relaxed than most areas in the city - which is a huge relief after either a day of touring and shopping or business engagements.

Excellent experience and we will definitely return and recommend to my friends to stay here!! Excellent location- only 5 mins walk to Wong Chuk Hang MTR station.Amazing staff - A lovely receptionist who assisted me to check in and explained the in house facilities and how to connect the WiFi ( which is the most important thing for everyone, I guess). I have mentioned the occasion for staying is to celebrate my husband鈥檚 birthday, and she offered us a free upgrade to a bigger room on higher level. Lovely room with nice view - The room is very clean and cozy. The stylish interior is cool and unique. All drinks and snacks in room are complimentary which is the cherry on the cake. Overall, We had an amazing experience while staying in Ovolo and I will surely recommend this hotel for any friends coming to visit HK.

My teenage daughter and I stayed at the Ovolo Southside for 7 nights. The hotel is located away from the main tourist hotspots, in an industrial area, so you get to see a side of Hong Kong that most visitors might not. That said, the fantastic MTR makes it easy to get to most places you might want to visit during your stay.Typically, we stay at boutique hotels with just a few rooms, so I was a little apprehensive about staying in a hotel that had over 150 rooms. However, except for one Saturday morning when the breakfast room was packed to capacity, the hotel still retained the feel of a small and personalized one. The staff are all friendly and go out of their way to help with any requests you may have. During our stay, Andy was usually on breakfast duty. He greeted us with a cheerful smile every morning and was always on hand if I needed help with the Nespresso coffee maker. Tomas and Quinton ensured the check in/check out was easy and effortless. The housekeeping lady on our floor (11th) was also very sweet! We stayed in a Mini Queen room. The room is adequate for two people. Our room overlooked the Wong Chuk Hang road, and surprisingly we could hear traffic whooshing past on the road 11 floors below. No review of Ovolo is complete without mentioning the freebies! We loved the bath amenities, the loot bag, and the free mini bar. We also used the free self-laundry facility. It drizzled pretty much most days while we were there, and we used the umbrellas the hotel provided. We enjoyed the fun and quirky ambience of the hotel - so different from the typical look that most hotels adopt.Overall, we're glad we decided to stay at Ovolo Southside.

Overall, we really liked this hotel as we were there for business and it's got lots of space you can work (like a co-working space) whilst helping yourself to the free Nespresso (cheap for them and clever!). Rooms are spacious and efficient. Love the free bar touch! Only complaint was lack of a bin apart from in the shower room... Food we thought was great. We had an issue with some noisy neighbours but they immediately swapped us to another room. When we left I realised I had left some stuff behind. Quinton Lai, their Operations Manager, was fantastic - he co-ordinated it all and was super happy to do this. It's that sort of service which is hard to find in HK and reason to go back.

The hotel is not very big and is located at the south side of HK island. There isn't much commercial stuff around the neighborhood and quite limited dinning. For me who travels for business, it takes some time travel to my office which is located at central. About 30 mins by subway. For tourists, it is very close to Ocean Park and not too far from Repulse Bay and Stanley market. What I love the most is the vibe here at this hotel. Interesting interior design, not too commercial. Lovely lounge area. Free mini bar drinks with lemon tea, juice, sparkling water, beer, coke etc and replenished everyday. It also provides a bag of snacks and a shopping bag per each stay. Great service. Staff here are super friendly. The Operation Manager Joe and the sales manager Joe (yes two Joes) are super helpful.

ALWAYS stay at this hotel any time I am in the area for business. They have excellent customer service. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They go out of their way to make you feel so welcome. Will be back!!

This was my 4th time staying at Ovolo Southside in Hong Kong and it has become THE place for me to sit back, relax and have a good night sleep when passing through Hong Kong. After traveling so often and for so many years, I learned that familiarity is important and you start to realize the feeling that you're at home is a great thing, and Ovolo Southside provides exactly that. Things are consistent and just as good as the last time - being welcomed by the friendly staff (aka Sonesh, Quinton, Tomas, et al), free mini bar in the room, well appointed room with a great view of green spaces of Hong Kong to name a few, and yet still so conveniently located minutes away from Central via MTR. I honestly cannot imagine staying at a different hotel in Hong Kong and I'm already looking forward to my next stay!

Love the modern industrial theme of the place. Very cool interiors and artworks. Staff are well-trained and very friendly. The free mini bar and loot bag was a pleasant surpruse the whole family enjoyed. Will definitely come back!

We have now stayed at this hotel several times, on two occasions for several weeks at a time. It truly feels like a home from home. The staff are all good and if you book directly with the hotel you can join in 鈥榟appy hour鈥?(drinks & appetizers) from 5-7pm which is a nice sociable time & we have met some interesting people. We have no plans to stay anywhere else when we travel to Hong Kong to visit family.

This was our second visit to Ovolo鈥檚 hotels in Hong Kong. This time we decided to try Ovolo Southside and we were not disappointed. The hotel is super convenient to the MTR line and a quick ride into Central. The hotel has a great style (including the well-appointed common area) and all the staff were amazing, we haven鈥檛 been experienced such good service in a long time. Highly recommend.

Awesome place to stay!! Right near the metro station so an easy trip to the CBD.Really well designed space with a sweet rooftop bar with an awesome view of the hills nearby.Free coffee and cookies in the lounge is also a bonus, great when looking for a quick get me up in the morning. If we come back to HK again I will not need to look anywhere else!

瑷傛埧鏅傝ɑ鏄庡笇鏈涙湁楂樻〒灞ゆ垨鏅杓冧匠鐨勬埧闁撴暣闁撻厭搴楁湁23灞ゆ〒 鍗诲彧绲︿簡鎴戠鍏〒灞ょ殑鎴块枔绐楁埗鎵撻枊閭勫彲浠ヨ窡灏嶉潰鐨勫眳姘戞嫑鎵嬨€傝姹傛彌鎴垮墠鍙颁篃鍙閰掑簵鍏ㄦ豢銆傞殧闊充笉浣筹紝绐楀棣矾涓婄殑鍣煶璺熻蛋寤婁笂鐨勫櫔闊抽兘寰堟槑椤€佸瑾紝鎴戜笉瑕哄緱閫欒！鑸囪純楂樼礆鐨刪ostel鏈変粈楹煎叐妯ｃ€侻ini bar 鍏嶈不鏃╅ 鑱借捣渚嗗緢妫掑惂浣嗛€欐瘡涓€鍊嬩汉閮芥湁 璺熶綘鐨勬渻绫嶇劇闂滈€欒！鐒＄枒鏄娓湴鍗€钀豹楂旂郴鏈€宸€斺€斺€斺€斺€斺€斺€斺€斺€擶hen I booked a room on Marriott App,I made a note that It would be better if I could have the room on high floor or with a view.Surprising,they gave me a room located on 8th floor.However,the hotel have more than 20 stories high.Also, it is noisy and you could hear the honk from the road.I can鈥檛 tell the difference between here and hostel.Yes,it is definitely designed hotel instead of service hotel.Briefly, below average and keep away from here especially you are the Marriott elite member.

Couldn鈥檛 have been happier with my quick stay at Ovolo! After a red eye flight, the manager accommodated my request for early check in and offered a room upgrade! Made my day and the staff, rooms, and happy hour was such a bonus! Thank you Ovolo for all your wonderful hospitality during my time in Hong Kong!!

We stayed Ovolo hotel for 2 days. We were satisfied everything. All staffs was so kind and room was very clean too. Also Happy hour was so great. We could enjoy unlimited two kinds of wine and Kozel beer and some snack. I was very impressed their service. Actually I visited HK three times but Ovolo hotel was the best. I'd like to recommed to my friend when they visit Hongkong ofcause I want to stay again if I visit Hongkong again. Thanks to staffs of Ovolo I was happy in Hongkong

We went on a holiday to celebrate our tenth anniversary. Ovolo Southside put me at ease on the first day (I was a ball of nerves already from sleep deprivation). Rooms were clean, staff were professional and always willing to go the extra mile, the general ambience of the hotel was terrific, oh, and I almost forgot the MUSIC is brilliant!If I can make one suggestion, please offer a small selection on the menu to accommodate those who are allergic to dairy and gluten 鈥?but other than that, you exceeded my (our) expectations. Thank you Team Southside. Much love from South Africa

What can I say about this place? It's amazing, the customer service is so good, the staff go the extra mile with everything, such as helping choose a wine to accommodate our evening meal. If you book directly with the hotel you get so many added benefits, such as breakfast, happy hour daily, free mini bar in your room, self laundry... I could go on! Well decorated and with a positive vibe. Would highly recommend this hotel and next time we are in Hong Kong we will stay here again.(We are currently looking at staying at their Sydney hotel too).Thanks to all the lovely staff at Ovolo, Jonathan and I feel very lucky to have met you

As a boutique hotel, they added nice touch of convinience and toughtful service to this location. During check-in, breakfast, all interaction were pleasant and entire staffs made sure every guest to enjoy their stay there. Surprisingly location was quite convinient to reach to city area. As you know, most of HK hotels are tiny but nice interior and staffs' service compensated nicely.

Booked this on SPG / Marriott points. Great and thank you for that. Cool hotel. Small rooms but nicely done. Powerful shower. Had connecting rooms for kids. Breakfast nice. All good. I鈥檝e stayed in a lot of HK hotels over my time and for a family holiday destination this is good. MTR is 2 mins away and easy to get to Central etc.

My wife found this hotel actually. I was a little reluctant as I 鈥榯hought鈥?it is a distance from downtown. Turned out I was completely wrong. Located beside Ocean Park, the MTR Station at Wong Chuk Hang is so convenient to get around. The staffs at the hotel is the primary reason why I will come back again. Excellent customer service. The room is spacious and comfortable. All in all, we love our time at Ovolo Southside! Thank you.

We stayed at the Ovolo for two nights and couldn鈥檛 fault it! If you are concerned about its location...don鈥檛 be, it鈥檚 a two minute walk to the nearby MTR station and only a couple of stops into the centre. We upgraded to a corner room (about 拢15 per night extra) which was lovely. The free drinks, nibbles and minibar were a great addition to our stay, but you only get these if you book directly with the hotel. Staff were friendly and very helpful. If we ever return to Hong Kong we will definitely stay at the Ovolo!

That is a rare occasion when the hotel is so distinct from the breed, that I do recommend to try staying with them to understand whether it fits or not. The quality of furniture and bedding is pretty good, amenities are of upscale market. Though the room is small comparing to other 4-5 stars in Hong Kong, but everything was there with well done lighting and aircon. They have great restaurant for lunch and dinner, though breakfast is mediocre to say the least. Very attentive staff, it help a lot during our stay!

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: We stayed here with our two toddlers , with connecting rooms . Lucky enough to have a harbour view , which is beautiful to look at every night and morning . Location is great , a short walk to an MTR and a tram stop directly across the road. A 7/11 mere meters away, and plenty of food options , short walk to coffee and DIY laundry .Check in was easy . All staff were helpful and friendly, they went above and beyond . I Would highly recommend this hotel and we will be staying here again .

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: I stayed here with my father last yr. I have had an excellent experience. My father also liked it. He was 86 yrs old and since have expired. I have my last pleasant memories of my father associated with this place. We stayed for 4 nights and day. We arrived by the free shuttle bus from the central station after taking the airport Express train. That bus serves 4 other local hotels too, and selecting the bus might cause a bit confusion. Talk to the driver because sometimes eventhough it's written that it will come to this hotel, but it may go to another hotel. For regular travels, walking 10 mins to the central station was our choice. Somedays we have taken the tram , which used to stop almost Opposite to the entrance of the hotel. The ground floor has some shops including a Starbucks where we had some snacks. Very convenient. 7/11 was next door. Lots of restaurants all around. We used to try a different one every time. I booked the room with A free breakfast option. A superb widespread menu of buffet with good seating options was available. My father really enjoyed it and ate a lot. The menu consisted of continental and asian items. Getting a room was very fast. I am an Accor member. So I had a separate counter for fast registering and check out. Very convenient. I would advise everybody to take the accor membership. Got me a lovely deal and also a harbour facing room. Lots of elevators available but sometimes there is a bit queue. I have had prior experiencees with long queues in hongkong few times so took it in my stride. The room was small but not the smallest I have stayed in HKG. The view window was truly magnificent. Huge wall window. The early morning sunrise gave a huge positive vibe. Bathroom was neat and small but all basic amenities were available. Cleaned daily. Beds were cleaned too. Beds were very comfortable and soft. Pillows were okay. Overall, I was very satisfied. Value for money. My suitcase got stuck , and they sent a mechanic very soon, but he couldn't open it. So we broke the lock. But he was very helpful and well behaved.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Was here for 2 week stay and had booked a city view room, however due to length of stay and being an Accor member I was upgraded to a side harbour view room.Reception can be found on the 5th, plenty signage and 3 lifts to get you there. Pleasant friendly welcome by the reception team, quickly checked in and on way to room, there鈥檚 another 2 lifts going from 5th floor to rooms, so 5 in total. During the stay never really had to wait for a lift at all. Room was on the 20th floor out of 32 so gave good view over part of harbour, essentially facing the ICC building. Room was a good size for Hong Kong, probably more so as I was by myself. Room amenities included TV (international channels), fridge, tea/coffee facilities, free WiFi, air conditioning. Decent size bathroom with shower, one thing I enjoyed was the shower as it was quite powerful, with hot water available anytime day/night within a minute of turning on. Air conditioning was a god send after being out all day to come back to a cool room.Food/drink wise, hotel did have a restaurant on the 6th floor with bar on 5th. Only had breakfast here on one morning, which I found to be good, with cereals, yoghurts, cheese, breads, fruit, cooked food, was a good mix of traditional western and local foods. To get to hotel there鈥檚 3 options from the airport. Easiest/most expensive option is airport express train then free shuttle bus which drops you outside, this also covers 4 other hotels in area. Then you can catch the airport flyer bus from the airport to bus terminal with a 10/15 minute walk. Cheapest option but not the easiest is a local bus from airport to Tung Chung, then the MTR to central to change onto island line then a 10 minute walk from MTR station.Nearby.Beneath the hotel is a Starbucks and Italian restaurant, there鈥檚 a 7-11 around the corner and also a U-select supermarket which sells Tesco branded goods. Within 2/3 mile there is 2 shopping malls, which have a variety of eateries, including a M & S Foodhall.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Location is amazing. Take a room wit sea view, it is really worth it!The breakfast is really really good and offers a huge variety for all tastesRooms are rather small but for Hong Kong have a good size. Very clean We had a very pleasant stay with our baby

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Everything was great about this except the A/C was noisy. It was too hot to not use it but kept us awake at times. The room was small but adequate. We had a fridge and plenty of tea and coffee. We didn鈥檛 eat in the hotel as there were too many options outside! The location was good, but google maps were hard to follow the tiny and convoluted streets. Just get lost and then ask google to take you home! The effort to get to and from the airport to the hotel was relatively easy. Train to the central station and a shuttle that runs every 10 minutes and drops you at the door! A real bonus of you have never been to HK before....it can be noisy and confusing!

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: This Ibis is located in the Sheung Wan area of Hong Kong, which is the next stop from Central on the MTR. It is surrounded by shops and restaurants and is a 5 to 10-minute walk from the MTR station. The hotel incorporates a Starbucks Coffee shop on the ground floor. Next door is a good restaurant, mostly western food, which is a good place to settle for a final drink before bed. The Ibis is a 3-star hotel and is good value for that rating. The lifts are a little confusing as not all go down to ground floor, but you soon figure it out. They are fast and you never wait more than 2 to 3 minutes for one. Reception staff are polite and helpful. Breakfast was varied and I am sure had enough choice to satisfy Eastern and Western palates. I paid for a harbour view room and would do so again on a return. The view was magnificent and was indeed the focal point of the room. As such, drawing the curtains at night was the last act before retiring. The room is as it looks on the hotel's own website. They are a little small, though average by Hong Kong standards and have all amenities you would expect. In summary, when looking for a hotel in HK, the harbour view was the most important to me. After that came location and price. All the 4 to 5 star hotels which offered harbour view rooms were extremely expensive by comparison. I opted for a reasonable 3 star standard but with a 5 star view, which was much more affordable.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Stayed in the hotel as my Friend is a hard core ibis fan. With her membership, we managed to get a room upgrade and complimentary breakfast. Room is decent size and clean for HK. Side perks such as water dispenser for water refill and that the free airport shuttle right at the hotel doorstep help adds points to the hotel. Hotel was however 10-15 mins walk from the MTR station which can be a disadvantage in HK.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: This hotel is centrally located and staff is helpful - its almost 30 story hotels and it is centrally located - from here u get free shuttle bus every 20 minutes ( bus number H2 ) to tarvel to hong kong station mtr AND THIS HONG STATIONA ND CENTRAL MTR , u can roam whole hong kong through mtr and bus etc - also sheung wan is nearby MTR and if u are on blue line then get out at this sheung wan mtr and IBIS hotell is just 10 minutes walk. also if u are accor member then u get 40-50 % discount when super sale is gong on so become accor hotels member .the kift at IBIS hotel is also very nivce and unique - there are 5 lifts nd it gives beep sound which lift is coming to your floor to take u to ground floor or upper floor as the acse may be . laos u can refuil free water bottles on 5 the floor where admin and office staff is there . also there is weighing machine on 5 the floor so u can weigh and find whether u are carruying exceess luggage or not . also u get 3 pin internatoional converte charger free so that your charging to mobile phone does not stop- just call admina and ask for free converter charger .

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: The product is ok for this level of hotel 鈥?basic and clean*. However, the management has evidently lost all sense of standards and quality, and apparently never actually manages the property or staff.The front office staff are absolutely incompetent, poorly trained and wilfully ignorant. They struggle with rudimentary English (and there are no Korean or Japanese speakers, despite the number of guests from those nations). On check-in I had to make a request four times and then ask twice why she was not acknowledging or responding to my questions. On check-out I was promised a consolidated invoice, which I never received and, apparently, cannot be done.* By the service standards, cleanliness and need of routine maintenance, management appears never to be checking or reviewing anything. It is time for Accor to take action and fire the GM and senior management.The worst service experience I鈥檝e had at any Accor hotel 鈥?I鈥檝e stayed at this property many times.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Hotel was very nice and staff was very friendly. Very close to public transportation, and easy to reach from airport. Breakfast buffet was good with several options. Check ina and check out was a breeze. I would stay here again

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Great hotel in a great location. We were in Hong Kong for a week and stayed here for 6 nights. It was a perfect location for us and a great place to explore from. It is basic, but had everything we needed. The staff also did their best to help us with anything we needed. They were also very friendly. Our room was on the 30th floor, with a harbour view. You could not have asked for a better view, especially for the price. The bathroom is small, but again was clean and well stocked. Our only critism was the beds are far too hard. Would definitely stay here again.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Staff paid great and genuine attention to my request and did their best to accommodate. Great location, great view, good breakfast. I cannot eat gluten and has the good surprise to see gluten free food at the buffet

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: We stayed for 4 days in May 2019. We booked this hotel based on proximity to Station and reviews. The hotel is located at prime location. The whole process of checkin and checkout was good. We faced issue with extra bed but that was attended immediately. The breakfast was good with lots of variety.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Stayed here for 1 week of business trip and did not disappont at all,Room has enough space for solo traveller, Wifi is reliable and Housekeeping teams do great job to maintain cleanliness everyday.The location is ultimate, short walk to tram station that will take you everywhere within the Island while also conveniently walking distance to MTR Station.They provide complimentary water dispenser on 5th floor which is a very nice touch, but maybe to have another several water dispensers on some of the other floors won鈥檛 hurt; like maybe every 5 floors? Overall, clean and comfy 3* hotel in Hong Kong Island that give best value for traveller on budget.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: From the time I made the reservation until check out, it was a smooth ride and a great stay. My emails and calls were answered quickly and clearly. They allotted rooms to us at no additional cost even though we arrived at the hotel way ahead of check in time. The rooms were clean. The staff is friendly, courteous and helpful. The location of the hotel is simply superb - positioned in the centre of the traditional herbs and dried sea food traders, the hotel is close to the Sheung Wan MTR station, bus stops, and tram stations. Starbucks is on the ground floor, and a 7/11 store close by. The one downside was the shower - water would not drain out quickly enough and it was not a nice feeling to stand in it. We have brought it to the attention of the hotel staff.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: I really liked this hotel, good price, good location and good service. Maybe a 15 minute walk to the central HK and the escalators. A lot of restaurants in different price classes around the hotel. Near a 7/11. We got late check out without any cost wich was great.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: We were a family of 3 with a 6 yr old. The room was enough for our use for 5 nights in HongKong. We particularly liked the location as it was near enough the Sai Ying Pun MTR station. The trams or ding dings passed by the hotel and the stops were just nearby. Going towards Queen Street and Queen Street Central were more shops and restaurants. Beside the hotel was the Queen Street Cooked Food Market which was open until past midnight.THere were branches of Wellcome supermarket, 7 11, Mannings and U-Select just walking distance from the hotel. The room and bathroom were clean and tidy. There were just basic amenities like toiletries, slippers, towels, in room safe and coffee/tea making facility, hair blower. These were enough for our use during the whole duration of our stay. We did not avail of hotel breakfast as we wanted to explore the restaurants around the area. Check in and out was a breeze since I paid at check in. THere was a complimentary shuttle bus from Hong Kong Station to the hotel. It came at 20 minute intervals. Going home, we also availed of the free shuttle bus from the hotel to HK station, then we took the Airport Express after In-Town check in. It was a breeze for us as we did not have any last minute visit to any nearby attractions. A Starbucks was located at the ground floor of Ibis. The hotel lobby was at the 5th floor.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: I only stayed one night and chose it to get a view of the harbor. And well, it didn鈥檛 disappoint. The staff were friendly and responsive. The room is small but totally adequate for me. May be a bit tight for two people and lots of luggage, but my understanding is that that鈥檚 typical of hotels in Hong Kong. The location is close to ferry as well as metro, but there is a bit of a walk (and there鈥檚 a way to walk above on bridges instead of streets below, and is a more pleasant and direct route). I come from a big city so walking is not a problem for me. Public transportation in Hong Kong is super easy. Also there鈥檚 a starbucks on the ground floor so there鈥檚 that. And it鈥檚 also super close to the highly regarded restaurant Yardbird!

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: IBIS in 99% of the cases is a safe bet. It's convenient and reliable. Price-wise versus location a good trade-off. Within about 10 minutes walking distance from the nearest MTR station, and a good "basecamp" to start your HK tour.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: This is a very good option for affordable hotel in Hong Kong island. It is around 10 minutes walking to Sheung Wan MTR station and also to HK-Macau ferry terminal. Room is small but quite comfortable. My AC was a bit noisy though but just for one night it was ok. Service in hotel was great, especially Ms. Anson that was fast and very efficient. Breakfast was good enough with many options. Overall is a very good option if you look for a basic place not far from Central.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: It's the China Golden week holiday and room price is steep. Opt to stay in this location due to the location is near to HK Ferry Terminal as I was traveling back from Macau to HK.Lobby is located on the 5th floor and Starbuck is located on the 1st floor. About 5-10 mins to the Sheung Wan Station. You could opt to take the "ding ding" tram which cost only HK26 cents to the Central Station for transfer to the red line to city (Mongkok, TST)

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: We stayed from the 29th April until the 4th May. We was in room 3209 which was the top floor with a harbour view. We had stayed in the Shangri-La the night before as a birthday treat from my son. The room in the Shangri-La was as big as my sons apartment in Hong Kong so compared to that the Ibis was tiny. But big enough to have a good stay . The view on the other hand was 100 times better than the Shangri-La. WOW IT WAS AMAZING. The room itself was very clean and has a great bed. A mini fridge and a safe. The bathroom was clean and the shower pressure perfect . The hotel is a 15 minute walk to Central but trams are just outside a good cheap way to travel. We would definitely stay again. The staff were very helpful we had to check out at 12 but our flight wasn鈥檛 until nearly midnight so the staff let us leave our luggage in storage . The pictures are the view from our room.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: We mostly stay in Ibis Hotels. You can depend on what is on offer. This hotel is easily reached via the A11 airport bus that stops at the Macau ferry terminal, a 5 minute walk (even with luggage) to the hotel. It is also well situated to get to ferries, busses, the Metro and trams. It is well worth getting a harbour view room as the view is worth it.The staff were always friendly and helpful, from our early arrival (luggage were stowed) to our departure (taxi organized). Apart from multiple restaurants in the area there is also a very "local" food court style eatery if you turn to the left out of the front door of the hotel and left at the first junction, then up an escalator where we had an interesting and affordable meal.The breakfast is the normal, busy affair with a good spread of eastern and western food available. We did not see any venue in the vicinity that that provided an easier or more affordable alternative to their breakfast offering.I would certainly consider staying at this hotel again when I return to Hong Kong.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Nice reasonably priced roomsLocation is great and easy accessible via airport express and free bus Really good restaurants nearbyand the great park and walkway along the water is very nearby.. Starbucks (if you care) is in the same building.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: The hotel is nearby the subway and close to bus/tram stops. You can walk from the Macau Ferry Terminal. Supermarkets, convenience stores and restaurants and nearby. Reception is professional and helpful. Rooms are okay and offer all you need, also a small fridge. They could be cleaner, as well as the common areas. We had a great view to the harbor, otherwise it might be a bit boring what you will see. The Breakfast room is not very well done, red windows, rude staff and too many people giving you the atmosphere of a station restaurant.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Arrived in Hong Kong very early fromour flight from Sydney. The hotel was very easy to get to catching the airport train and the the free shuttle H2 from Hong Kong station (Ibis is the 3rd stop). We knew that it was unlikely that our rooms would be ready until 2ish so was happy to leave our luggage. At the time of arrival we were told I that one of the rooms a studio would be ready earlier but decided to just come back after 2pm.When we arrived back after a very long day of shopping at around 5.30pm. When we went to check in we were told that the studio wouldn鈥檛 be ready until after 7pm (despite being told that it would be ready before 2.00pm early. As my Mother in law was exhausted and this was her room, this was just not good enough. Finally they managed to sort the rooms out and gave as a complimentary drink as we are Accor members.This did set us off on the wrong foot slightly!The rooms are exactly what you pay for, very basic. The studio room is worth the extra investment as it gives you that bit of extra room. There is absolutely no amenities, we didn鈥檛 have any shampoo even which was a little surprising not sure if this was an oversight or not.Location is ok, there was so good restaurants in the area and the tram leaves straight out the front which is handy.Given the number of hotels in Hong Kong don鈥檛 think I would go back to the Ibis.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Stayed for one week at the Ibis Hotel. The rooms were extremely clean and although a little small still had enough room for two of us to feel comfortable. You could not hear any noise from any other rooms. Free bottles of water provided every day. The hotel is located extremely close to a tram stop and approx 10 mins Sheung Wan MRT Station. The trams cost approx. $0.50 AUD so a must do when in Hong Kong.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Upon arrival, we were told that our booking made through Booking.com had been made fro 2 people but only breakfast for one was included in the price. Our booking clearly showed that breakfast was included. No amount of discussion would change the mind of staff. We ended up cancelling the breakfast and ate elsewhere.Restaurant next door offered happy hour for drinks which made refreshments a little more acceptable. Meals offered were reasonable by Hong Kong standards.Rooms were basic but beds were as hard as making them less than comfortable. Couldn鈥檛 recommend the hotel based on our experience.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: The reception on the 5th floor, no problem as loads of lifts. The Bar is expensive at around 拢8 a pint of lager. Reception staff very friendly and helpful.It鈥檚 above a Starbucks, and there鈥檚 plenty of small places to eat to set yourself up for the day. I wouldn鈥檛 class the location as main tourist but it seems safe and a bit more real Hong Kong.It鈥檚 15 minutes walk to MTR (underground/tube) station, but Taxis are also abundant and cheap. Tip download the MTR app to get about and get an octopus cardThe rooms are clean but basic, the shower is good. The beds are comfortable, they do lack enough storage for two. There is an easy to operate free safe in the room

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: The rooms are the same as the HK hotels where space is a premium but this Hotel has the standard in cleanliness and professionalism. What is not advertised to their disadvantage is that this Hotel is on the ROUTE of H2 free shuttle bus from the HK Airport Express Central Station. The free shuttle is every 20mins and so convenient as is just right outside the hotel. For those who are into shopping, this is a great location for those into dried seafood, mushrooms etc. Great quality! The location is great for all sorts of shopping and with laundry shops, money exchange and also a cooked food market nearby. There is also a Tram line just outside the hotel where you can get a nice day doing city tour by hopping onto the tram and doing HK island from one end to the next. I was even upgraded to a high floor room with a view of the water front. What a nice feeling on the high floors over looking the seafront!

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: This place is not a 5stars hotel but for the price you pay it has everything you need: good bedding, amazing location, lovely staff and the rooms are sound proof. We upgraded our room for a better view and it really worth it !

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Decided to try the Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan on a few business days in Hong Kong. Had not stayed there before, away from some of my other 'normal' HK Accor properties. I had done a recon on one of my previous trips.Well, I was very happy. Great staff from check In & I had the privilege of meeting the FOM Jennifer. Several check in/out desks & always quick service at Premium one. Also good number of lifts to add to the efficiency of the hotel.Excellent room over looking the Macau Ferry Terminal. Close to MTRs, Trams & A etc buses, & of course the Ferry Terminal. Nice food & drinks in the hotel, where we had a meal of two & my partner organised a birthday slice.Rooms were a good size, comfortable & cool. The floor was quiet & next visit I would love to book a themed room, like the one next door.Great cafes & shopping nearby & all the facilities necessary made for an excellent stay.Being CBD west-side, transport to & from HKIA was that little bit shorter. Plus Hong Kong Airport Express Train is easily connected to by the complimentary shuttle. Great late checkout very much appreciated.Thanks again to all the team. Excellent stay. Be back soon.Cheers

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan is a modern hotel, which provides a good standard of accommodation. The staff were very helpful - in some cases outstanding. We particularly appreciated that service staff were available 24 hours a day. The rooms are smallish, but are well designed to maximise the use of the available space. The breakfasts, which were included in our package were excellent.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Excellent place to stay. Staff is friendly. Environmentally friendly as well. It has a water filling station at the reception so that one can fill up your bottles without having to throw away more plastic....Beautiful sea and plastic free!!The buffet breakfast is wonderful, both Asian and Western, all you can eat.Very convenient to a lot of interesting eateries...small pot rice at Kwan Kee, Sai Kung Moon Kee on Morrison street for excellent Chinese dessert...Yumm

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Rooms are fairly small but are equipped with fridge and have excellent WiFi. Complimentary tea and coffee also water daily. A safe was provided. Beds were a little hard but housekeeping provided a mattress soft cover and extra pillow with a smile. The hotels situation was perfect near to trams buses and MTR. One small quibble the prices of laundry. Best of all reception ordered taxis booked trips any request was met with cheerful efficiency

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: The house keeping did not perform properly. I informed the hotel that I usually get complimentary water in every Ibis Hotel but not on this hotel. The hotel agreed to give me as stated on their letter (I have the evidence of this letter). But no realisation.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Stayed 3 nights, the staff at reception is very cooperative and available. The hotel is basic,true to Ibis niche, needs refurbished,very basic amenities,great view of the harbour. Breakfast also quite basic.The bad thing happened on the last day of my stay. I left my travel wallet outside the safe with 鈧?00 in 鈧?0 bills that disappeared. I did not check the wallet prior to leaving the hotel, maybe because it never happened to me before. Nevertheless the money was there, unspent,and I was counting on it at arrival in my country for immediate expenses. After leaving the hotel the wallet was always on me; the only way the money could have gone was me being mugged. Contacted the hotel management by email, they were courteous, looked into the cctv tapes, saw nothing out of the ordinary. The reason I leaving this review here is cautionary: do not leave valuables outside of room safe.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Arriving in Hong Kong for the first time since 2010 I had forgotten just how big the airport was although it easy enough to follow the signs. I took the Airport Express to Hong Kong Station, end of the line, and transferred to a free Shuttle H2 to the Ibis Sheung Wan Central, the shuttle drop off and pick up point is at the side entrance of the hotel, take the lift to lobby on the 5th floor. The free shuttle is part of your ticket for the express train but nobody on the bus seems to check for a ticket.The reception area is smart and clean with an adjoining dining area; the staff on duty spoke good English and in no time I was checked in and on my way to the room. The room was large and spotlessly clean with twin beds, small fridge, tea and coffee making facilities, fast free WIFI, and good sized shower and toilet. The location is good being 100 metres from one of the main arteries and tram lines with Hong Kong鈥檚 retro streetcars.I had to skip the included breakfast as you need a good deal of time to go through the processing for the HI Speed Rail service to Beijing which leaves West Kowloon (on the mainland) at 8:05am. But from what I gathered it consists of a self serve buffet. From past experience with Ibis hotels their breakfasts are good value and set you up for the day. This hotel came as part of a package my travel agent sent up (I usually book my own accommodation), although I did suggest an Ibis, I find they represent good value for money and usually are fairly close to the action, although not always. This Ibis did not disappoint. A couple of tips if you need a 24hr shop or cash machine, just outside the hotel鈥檚 main entrance , turn left into the side street and there is a 7-Eleven right in front of you on the opposite of the road. The HBSC bank is right in front you on the main street, two cash points on the main road side.On the Sunday I was about to catch the first shuttle at 06:20 but it was cancelled at 06:30 we were told by one of the other people waiting, she had phone the shuttle operators. Taxis were passing by the dozen so as I needed to get to the High Speed Train fast I hailed a cab and it took me direct to West Kowloon HST station. It worked out at AUD21, not bad, and that included the tunnel toll.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Me and my wife was greeted by hotel staffs with welcoming smile. The room is spacious with nice views to the harbour. Everydays the room is serviced and cleaned. We were visitting from dusk to dawn and when we arrive back to hotel, we had the feel like home quietness. The day arrive for departure, our flight is midnight flight. The hotel look sfter our luggage whilst we were visiting HK all over on departure days. The hotel even gave us the pick up time of shuttle bus to airport. Thank you Ibis HK Central.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: I am very torn. Pro's:The staff were amazingly friendly and attentive. We asked for extra pillows and they arrived in minutes. We asked for an iron and it arrived almost immediately. I left my camera in the lobby area when departing and the staff were of great assistance in getting it couriered to me. They gave us good advise on getting around the city.The breakfast was very enjoyable with lots of choice.The view from our harbourview room on the 32nd floor was spectacular.The shuttle bus service from/to the Airport Express was most welcome. Cons:I know this is Hong Kong and we have little experience of travel in Asia, but for what we paid, we found the room very small. But the bigger issue was that the room was damp. The large window was always running with condensation and we wiped it with one of the towels when we wanted a clear view. As a result, our clothes were damp. In fact, the contents of our suitcases were damp when we got home.There was a large dust ball that appeared from under the bed.The bottom of the door frame in the bathroom had moisture damage and there were signs that it had been repaired previously.On one occasion the elevator doors would not open on the 6th floor and the elevator just went all the way back up to the 32nd floor. Made us and the other guests feel very uncomfortable.Given these pro's and cons, I have rated the hotel as average. I feel bad doing so because the staff deserve a better rating.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: That was something shocking. The whole hotel is so arranged and organized that it can not be called a hotel. It does not match any of the stars.Truly disappointed. During check in they upgrade my room to a better room and it was not for normal people.Drama. Wasted time and money.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: This is our second stay for the week after returning from a short trip to Macau. The reception staff is courteous unlike our earlier experience. Not sure if it was due to my earlier feedback. Anyway, it's encouraging. Room is spacious by Hong Kong standard and has all the basic amenities . The 2 area for improvement :1. Need smarter elevator. For a few instances we had it zoomed past us without stopping or stayed put without coming up/down!!! 2. Room 1410 shower room floor is not properly leveled and caused water accumulation.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: I arrived at the airport and took the Airport Express train to Hong Kong Station. I then took the shuttle bus H2 and got off at the 3rd stop which is specifically for this hotel. Piece of cake. I found the whole process to be very easy.When I checked in I was upgraded to a harbor view room (I'm a member with this hotel) and that was much appreciated! I was on the 28th floor. The room was not as clean as I would have liked upon arrival. I found some hairs (this is a particular pet peeve of mine) and the room was a bit worn down but certainly serviceable.It was nice and quiet which is great. The breakfast was fine, pretty typical for a hotel at this level. The staff at the front desk were very helpful each time I interacted with them. I had them write down the name of where I wanted to go so I could give it to the cab driver after I hailed one in the street. I did take a lot more taxis than I normally do because I found them to be so much cheaper in Hong Kong. That was a nice change.The hotel is right across the street from a tram stop. It is a bit of a walk to the metro but not too bad.Overall a good choice. Very convenient for the airport and it was very nice of them to upgrade my room.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: This hotel was great for our stay - but don't expect to want to spend any time there. The rooms are verrrry tiny! Also, there is a common space - a small restaurant on the 5th floor but it was always closed when I checked. So I spent a lot of time on the starbucks on the ground floor. They have the annoying system of putting your key card in a slot to press the elevator button to get to your room - but it only worked half the time. This was doubly frustrating as the elevators were crowded! So they need to fix that but other than that it was a good deal for the money, and the location was great!

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Rooms are basic and outdated with only 2&1 shower and body wash. Unfriendly check-in staff and no acknowledgement of my Accor membership. Location is okay. Only 10min walk to MTR and away from busy areas.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Stayed here for 3 nights. Location is brilliant. Close to lots of great areas! Check in great - Believe they are interns, really friendly. Room .... V basic :-( Bed not comfy. You are in a basic ibis, but really - for what you pay. Rooms small though. BUT - does what it says on the tin. Great breakfast!!

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Great service, excellent restaurant, good location, great views from the hotel, the hotel staff are amazing , I needed some extra help due to my husband having a fall in India a few days before and we received so much from the staff, very clean, very well organised,

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: On arriving on the free shuttle bus from the train station, who make this possible, check in was painless and the staff very helpful.We were on the 15th Floor with a side view of the harbour, which was fine as most mornings it is quite misty. However, the rooms are very basic, initially the bed is hard, but we slept ok . Had to request another pillow as only 3 pillows. As we were there for 6 nights there is very little wardrobe space, certainly not enough for 2 people clothes.The first day we went to use the safe only to discover that it required new batteries. We reported this to the reception area, so by the time we got back to the hotel in the evening it was working.The rooms are quite overlooked, so it would be nice to have some nets or blinds, one does not always want to draw the curtains.One point, it is requested that you reuse the towels, however, these are quite thin, hence housekeeping did actually change these every day.On the first day you get a bottle of complimentary water in your room , however if you require further drinking water, then you need to go to floor 5 and near the lifts there is a machine where you can refill your bottles.Breakfast needs sorting out, most days quite early there were a few things that ran out, like bread, pastries rolls, bacon tomato sauce to name a few items. The hotel know how many are booked in and how many are having breakfast, so these items should be checked on frequently, one should not have to keep asking for these items.The fruit juice, was only coloured water, there was no taste.WIFI was good except that every morning you had to keep signing in, which was a bit of a pain.The last annoying thing is the lifts, there are 5 lifts, but only 3 go all the way to the ground floor, and you have to keep putting your key card in the lift to enable you to use the. lift

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan鈥檚 rate was still among the slightly lower among the hotels in the Central area but still we were hurting paying almost half a grand for a 36 hour trip to Hong Kong. Staff were efficient with our check-in and the front desk was always manned with the friendly staff. Although we didn鈥檛 spend enough time in our rooms to justify the higher rate, the harbour view rooms on the top floors had unbeatable unobstructed views of the Victoria Harbour. Twins rooms were not spacious but had enough breathing room for two persons. While it didn鈥檛 cause much inconvenience, the rooms will probably need some fix up soon with some wooden floor panels showing signs of separating and bathroom showers being leaky. The location near Macau Ferry Terminal is superb being less than a kilometer from lot of good restaurants in the Sheung Wan area. Despite the steep rate, it鈥檚 about the same as similar hotels nearby making this a solid choice for those who can鈥檛 handle staying at budget accommodation.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: I love this Ibis hotel. Its location is great - it's in walking distance to Sheung Wan or Sai Ying Pun mtr stations and there are plenty of good food around this hotel. The room was clean, modern and neat. You can't hear your neighbours from your room it's very quiet! The staff was helpful and efficient. You wouldn't find a long queue at the reception as the staff was just quick. It deserves a 5 star. It's a bit on the expensive side (circ 1000hkd a night) but it's worthwhile.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Ibis have a reasonable level as hotel rooms go. The room in this case was slightly down on previous (UK) standards. The beds were firm and not conducive to a good nights sleep. Outside the bathroom door the laminate had begun to come apart from being wet by feet straight out of the shower. Could do with a refurbishment. Staff were great and very helpful. Food plenty of choices. Ideal location for getting around. Lifts were a bit weird. 5 lifts - 3 of which went to the ground floor. 2 served floors 5 to 32. Reception on 5 - dining room on 6. Getting from 6 to ground was a nightmare - and you couldn鈥檛 use the stairs???

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: Stayed here most of the times in hk. It was really good and comfy room/ bed. It is also really convenient if u come from the airport , there鈥檚 a shuttle bus that drop u in front of the hotel. Would stay here again next time

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: The room I stayed in had a beautiful view of the Victoria Harbour which explained the not so competitive price of the accommodation paid. Other than that, the small room had no wardrobe, and very little space for movement or storage of your luggage or things. The bathroom had serious drainage problems because of the small drain hole. After a light shower, the bathroom floor would be flooded with soap water up to your ankle. There was a very strong smell of bleach or some sort of cleaning detergent that lingered in the room. The team at the reception looked inexperienced and some had problems communicating in English. When asked for assistance to book a taxi, the young lady at the reception looked bewildered and asked me to drag my luggage to streets to hail for one. It was only after a direct request, she reluctantly hired one for my family. Overall, IBIS Central operates like a youth hostel. Expect minimal facilities and service provided if you choose to put up at this DIY styled hotel.

Hotel: Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan
review: We have spent 3 nights with Ibis central & Sheung wan. We usually choose the Kawloon side; however, this trip we pick the Hong Kong side. The hotel is best in term of system and efficientcy. Check in process is super fast with the online check-in. My room, #2004, facing the habour. The room is well designed; however, a bit small. Free wifi is avaliable with password. Convenient stores and tram stop are just around the corner. A starbuck coffee shop is located at the hotel 's ground floor.There is a complementary Airport express shuttle bus to the central station very 20 mins. Only one weak spot is shower room cleaness and towel condition shall be improved. At the bottom line, i enjoy staying at the Ibis Central & Sheung wan.

We have stayed a few times at the other two airport hotels (Regal and Novotel) which are themselves very good stopover options. However we tried the Marriott a week ago and it will now be our preferred choice.We arrived from Europe at 8.00 am off a long flight having booked an executive room. Maybe that helped because our allocated room on the 15th floor (no 13 or 14) was available to us by just after 9.00 am (at no additional cost) which meant we were able to get a bit of sleep on arrival. The room was spacious and well appointed with a great shower and decent WiFi. The staff everywhere in the hotel were very polite and helpful and those in the Executive Lounge were particularly friendly and competent. The drinks and snacks in the evening were sufficiently ample so that we needed no other meal that night and breakfast in the morning was equally good. The shuttle to the terminal was quick and on time.This was a top class experience helped by the excellent staff in the lounge.

This hotel is very convenient for airport access there are several places to eat and shop in the area and the hotel offers a shuttle to the mall area. The hotel is very nice and clean the rooms are updated. The fitness center is well equipped and has numerous types of cardio and weightlifting equipment. Staff was very friendly and helpful. All in all I have nothing to complain about. Nice hotel.

Hotel next to airport (no noise) but only 30 mins from Hong Kong Central on Airport Express. Room well set out & comfortable. Great 24 hour gym, Fantastic 25m pool. Three restaurants, all good, the steak in the grill was superb, Staff are always on hand, friendly & eager to please

Provides free frequent shuttles to airport and Tung Chung station. Good food.five star ambience. Had a comfortable stay:) Strong WiFi even in room with smart TV option to connect Netflix using Miracast.

Good place and the team takes good care of me. The location is convenient and the hotel offers shuttle for transportation between HKG airport. The team have high enthusiastic, especially Ryan who is a trainee from luggage team helps me a lot. I will definitely choose this place next time.

Just rang down for simple in room order off day menu that I now know stops at 10.30pm. It鈥檚 10.36 and ordered a simple sweet and sour dish I was called back to say it鈥檚 6 minutes past the deadline. I asked if I could have it as it was literally minutes past 10.30, to be told I would be rang back. Chef was asked and point blank no, what great customer service. Yes there is a time but surely sticking a bit of sweet and sour on rather than a full English could be done for a guest. But no, and having read the below comments about customer service and inflexibility towards its customers it now doesn鈥檛 surprise me. Manager please don鈥檛 reply stating the 10.30 deadline, that鈥檚 not the point. Do not stay at this hotel if you expect a certain level of flexibility and understanding which should be expected of any service provider. You will be met with outright contempt.

Chic and classy airport hotel. We needed a place to stay overnight near H K airport and the Marriott is a great, really nice place to stay. Room was nice and clean. Nice decor, modern, ours had the bay view that was nice. Nice restaurants, spa, pool. Great shuttle back and forth to airport and one to a great mall area with a cable car attraction near by I would highly recommend. Well run hotel that was first class. We really liked the place and had a great stay. Just watch you don鈥檛 bump yourself on the classic closet door and pointed closet handles. Real high climb over to get in and out of the tub. Make sure you use the hand hold and use the bath mat. Bathmat could have been a longer to cover more of the tub. Even had bath salts and fruit in the room with water and a mini bar. Robes and slippers too. A class place. Really enjoyed our stay !

I stayed here on business during a 12hour layover.Quick and easy check in.Beautiful, clean, luxurious spacious and quiet rooms. great for a little catch up on sleep. Delicious and memorable (if a little bit costly) Sunday morning breakfast. Great air con in the rooms. Beautiful bathrooms and shower.Only reservation I have, is it took some time for the shuttle bus to come to collect, during which one waits in the temporary airport pick up area - in the sun, very hot and not too pleasant.Highly recommend this hotel, and will stay again

The hotel is convenient for overnight stay at Hongkong airport. The room was clean, service was good and the breakfast buffet was great. Although it's far from downtown transportation is very accesible.

Stayed at skycity Marriott for one night since we were arriving late in HKG. Very convenient location for flights in and out of HKG and visiting Lantau,Ngong Pin, Great Budha. However, too far from the city and anything else. Glad we stayed only for one night. Staff was great and breakfast Buffett was OK, much better at Marina Restaurant at Ocean Park Marriott where we stayed for the next 3 nights.

Property had good airport trasnportation and shuttle serive to Tung Chung MTR station. Property was clean, staff was very nice. The gym was nice and had quite a few stations. 3 restaurants and a pretty good Executive Lounge. Would stay again.

Very near to Airport and Macau Ferry terminal. Decent accommodation, Courteous staff, ample parking, Clean rooms. Hotel provides Complementary bus service to nearest MTR & Cable car station.But take higher floor as lots of construction going on around.

Spent a week in China for work and had a morning flight back to the US. Didn鈥檛 want to risk getting stuck in traffic or immigration so this place is as close as you can get to HKI. You could probably walk to the airport if there was a way, but it鈥檚 all congested roads and construction. So take the free five minute shuttle. You pay for the location as the hotel is nothing super special. The lobby is nice and I had a good breakfast. The room was above average but there was an overwhelming spell of cleanser or something. I got used to it but it was strong. I would stay here for the convenience.

It was an average stay at this place. They need to work on the hospitality a bit. Food was disappointing with mostly boiled or steamed items, and most items tasted artificial. Pancakes waffles and such were served cold and soggy. I hope better service in the future.

Just visited this hotel and service from arrival was good! Kudos to the front desk for their prompt and quick service despite of the long line. However, staffs in Bistro needs to be more smiling no matter how busy the restaurant is. Just saying. All in all, good experience!

We had to overnight in Hong Kong between flights and chose the Marriott SkyCity. Really glad we did. The hotel provides a regular shuttle between the airport and the hotel and back to the airport. The hotel also provides a shuttle to and from the closest metro station. The hotel really understands that it is an airport hotel and understands what its customers want when staying in an airport hotel. As for the amenities, there is everything you expect from a Marriott Hotel and I mean that in a really good way. We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again if we had to stay overnight between flights at Hong Kong airport.

This is an outstanding airport hotel. I have stayed here in the past, and it's still as wonderful today as it was years ago. The hotel is currently renovating guest rooms which is not needed, but is great that they are investing in refreshing the property to maintain it's high standards. The hotel rates a 10 out of 10 for location (airport proximity), a 10 out of 10 for comfort, 9 out of 10 for character, 9 out of 10 for service, 10 out of 10 for amenities, 10 out of 10 for wifi.Check-in was very welcoming and friendly. Check-out was equally pleasant.My guest room was spacious and very well appointed. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room has black-out curtains which were much appreciated for sleeping in in the morning and keeping the room dark. The bathroom is very well equipped and well stocked with amenities. The property has an EXCELLENT fitness centre. It is of sports club quality and size. There is also a lap pool, sauna, steam room and showers. They have an on-site spa for massages, etc.The hotel offers a shuttle between the airport/hotel every 30 minutes on a large bus - it was a very efficiently run operation.This is a GREAT CHOICE for an airport layover hotel, or after arriving overseas and wanting a comfortable start to your visit in Hong Kong. Highly recommended.

We arrived in the middle of the night with nowhere to go and no rooms available and the hotel staff were kindness itself. The personal attention they gave to our plight was beyond the call of duty. I cannot recommend the staff highly enough especially Ms L--g, the concierge, night reception staff, shuttle bus driver and housekeeping. We had a lovely stay the following night in a clean good sized room with a very cosy, comfortable bed; all badly needed. The staff are excellent and deserve full praise for the turn over they have to perform. In addition the breakfast buffet is, to my memory, the best I have ever seen on display. Well done everyone; a truly good service which will be remembered by us for all time and our very grateful thanks to everyone.

its all good having beautiful swimming pool along with steam bath sona bath zakuji with clean washroom and bath roombrake fast is awesome along with fruit juices and cakes and honey comb etc room is well furnished with good ac

Customer service was excellent from the start. Received an email days before arrival asking about flight info then provided instructions on where to meet their team for the hotel shuttle. Received a personal escort to the shuttle in order to avoid any confusion finding it.I do have status with Marriott and the staff brought me to the Executive Lounge for check-in which was handled expeditiously. The only downside of the stay was that smoking is apparently permitted on the outside of the lounge so the smell works its way inside if somebody is smoking...not cool.Room itself was very nice with touchpad lighting control panels. Shuttle back to the airport runs every half hour and was quick.Customer service made this an excellent stay - well done to all involved!

I've stayed here about a half-dozen times, so have some degree of authority when making this review.There are some weaknesses in this product:- It is one of two hotels at the airport, and of the two, it is not physically connected. Therefore, it needs to work a bit harder because it's just not as convenient as the other hotel (and therefore not the first choice from a location standpoint).- That said, both hotels sell out -- and sell out fast -- so it can get very, very busy. When people arrive, there tends to be times when people literally arrive by the (shuttle) bus-load, and the lobby gets very busy. - On my most recent stay, I booked two rooms (one for me and my wife, the other for my three young kids), and I specifically asked for them to be connected. So imagine how irritating it is when I checked in and they have several rooms that are of the connecting type, but none side-by-side (which defeats the whole purpose). Really poor planning and room optimization at the front desk, and complete disregard of my special request at the time of booking.That said, here are some positive points that saved this particular stay from being a disaster:- After realizing how silly it was to be giving away all their connecting rooms (and ending up with a number of rooms that had the connecting option, but the other side was occupied), the front desk upgraded me to their next level category which was decently upgraded and had some premium amenities.- For a standard, non-upscale/non-luxury hotel, their lobby restaurant was very pretty good and had some nice perks, like a pressed juice station and plenty of options for vegans. - We were particularly impressed by the excellent service of their restaurant team, particularly the 'captain' and the senior staff there; very warm, friendly, and dedicated. Thank you for going out of your way to assist us and ensure that we had a good meal.- Checkout was otherwise quick and efficient.

I was supposed to check in with my husband but unfortunately he couldn鈥檛 make it but, with the assistance of duty manager, Gary. I thank you for your kindness to offer me beyond expectation when i need help.

Rate:More or less we spent 40,000 pesos for 2 rooms with 2 queen beds each room for 3days and 2nights with free complimentary breakfast (buffet style) for 4.Ohh by the way, when we checked out we paid more or less 45,000 pesos. That includes the chocolates and water that my niece consumed in our room So if you guys are worried arriving in here with empty stomach, no worries because they got you covered but of course its not for free We did online booking or reservation, they will just ask to enter your CC for it to be valid transaction and then during our check-in they asked again for CC for our payment. Dont worry if they will punch in your payment or some amount on your CC because it will not be charged automatically. What they do is that when the guests are still staying in their facility, they just hold the transaction and it will be just pending. They will just charge your CC once you check out.It will be easier also if you have member's card so that you will be catered faster during the check in process, but if you dont you will have to wait for your turn around 5-10mins only. So its all good.Room:Well maintained. Neat and Clean. 100% Dust-free and Very Spacious.I dont have a decent picture of our room but all I can say is that we had a blast staying here. We all have free access to their wifi, pool areas, sauna etc.Its "pricy" for people travelling with a certain budget only but I think you might want to stay with this kind of place when you're with family and wanting to relax and just have a worry-free stay.Our bathroom includes bathtub with cold and hot showers. Its very spacious. They also provided all necessary toiletries, slippers, bathrobe, blower etc.Food:Very satisfied. Serving is more than enough for 1 person (Im talking abt their complimentary breakfast btw).We also got complimentary coffees and teas.They also have resto bar downstairs if you are craving for something else.Food in our room including all the bottled beverages,chocolates,chips,etc they placed all the prices there so no need to call frontdesk from time to time.Service:100% Best Staff Indeed excluding their trainees of course.First I enumerated why I think their staff is indeed the best:1. They will never ever make you wait2. Since not all of them are very fluent in english, they still communicated very well and in a clear manner3. All of them are fond of kids, atleast thats what I noticed and its a plus factor4. They will always guide you in terms of anything and everything5. You will never ever see any one of them being rude or anything else in a negative aspect* I really love them Secondly, their shuttle bus is completely free of charge unlike hotels in the Philippines if you know what Im talking about They have designated schedule for their shuttle buses. So we had our airport transfers and subway transfers completely free of charge.*Im sorry for the messy pictures

We checked into this horrible hotel. We were 3 persons, so we needed an extra bed. We did not get an extra bed, but a rock solid square that ruined my back. After this nightmare of a night, I stumbled down into the lobby with my broken back. I asked Edward to replace the bed or make it better, but he refused and said that he dont care and this is how it is. Horrible service, and I am going to contact a lawyer and sue them for my back pain. Stay away from this place.

I have stayed here multiple times and have never regretted any of the stays. I decided to use the hotel again as I had an overnight before a flight out of Hong Kong Airport. The bus is not easy to find with all the works going on but I was sent an email explaining what to do - go to visit the hotel counter at B05 and the lady will tell you how to get to the bus. In fact the lady escorted me down which was welcome after a long flight!The bus goes every half hour (30 mins) and we were soon on our way to the hotel. Check in was fast and I was welcomed like a long lost friend!I had been upgraded to a sea view room but more importantly one of the newly upgraded rooms. Don鈥檛 get me wrong - unlike other hotels that go through upgrades - the old rooms normally re showing their age - not here so don鈥檛 worry if you are not given an upgraded room.However, this was defiantly an improvement - modern decor, plenty of connectivity at the beds and a nice walk in shower (rather than shower over bath I have had previously). The amenities at Than and are wonderful - I took them to use in the other hotels in my stay!I slept soundly - the only comment I would make - and I hope someone takes note - is that the hairdryer is pathetic - really useless - luckily I had used it briefly the night before or else I would have missed the bus due to the length of time it took to dry my relatively short hair! The only negative in a wonderful stay!I ate in the restaurant - they Man Ho Chinese restaurant does a very good value set meal for hotel guests - it has gone a little fancy with the main course - but otherwise it was nice. The hotel bar did a good cocktail too.I was back on the us in the morning - they have swapped to a large coach which was lucky with all the people waiting to go when I left at 0900.I was given a birthday cake - it was so nice that it was remember when you are the road as much as I am. The staff are wonderful here and the hotel just has a great vibe.As you can gather I will be back - but I can highly recommend this place to anyone - it really is a gem in hotels (not just airport ones but all networks all over the world)!

Good service overall versus downtown busy hotelsRoom is more relax and spaciousGood for a break at end of trip to get peace of mindSlightly remote from shopping district but its how you get the right quietness

The hotel is very nice with good amenities, but the service in the restaurants is lacking. My husband and I are vegan, so we tried to locate menus for the 4 restaurants in our room and on line, but they weren't there, so we went down to the lobby where we will told they were not available. We were told we must go to each restaurant to see each menu which we did. We found we would be able to eat in the Bistro. The Lobby Attendant told us that we would have a choice of ordering off the menu or selecting the buffet which we did not want since most of the selections were not on our diet. When we came down that evening to eat, the hostess was unhappy that we did not want to have the buffet. She finally agreed that we could order from the menu but she insisted that she must seat us near the "exit". From that moment on we were treated like outcasts.
