At least 50 people came in while we were there, all from outside the hotel - "locals -?" - and they did not even stop at the hostess stand but proceeded to sit wherever they wanted. We couldn't figure why hotel guests were treated so differently than non-hotel guests. The next morning we had breakfast at the same restaurant as it was the only one serving it. We were seated and given coffee, we got up to get food from the buffet, and our table was occupied when we returned moments later. There certainly is a problem with coordination in the morning. It felt like the restaurants were not owned or managed by the hotel? Would not stay there again because of this treatment even though the hotel is nice.

Stayed for a conference at Asia world expo. Arrived early and the staff found a room, but they charged for it.....quite a bit. Staff pushed hard to try to get me to upgrade for the remainder of my stay and looked quite offended when I refused to pay almost 8000hkd for the priviliedge...for 4 nights. I had already paid in advance and didn鈥檛 want to pay more as we were already paying a premium. The upgrade charge was more than 2.5 times the original fee I had paid. They were fully booked because of a Kpop concert so eager to find someone to upgrade a room at a fee rather than have to do it for free. Room clean and tidy. The controls for the lights were ridiculous and sometimes took up to 15 seconds to work....not much good when trying to get into a pitch black bathroom. Press them twice and they鈥檇 turn off when they fancied.Stayed in an accessible room as requested - no shower screen or curtain so floor was soaked. No vanity to put anything on. Very deep bath and difficult to get in and out of. Very slippery.Everything was horribly expensive even by HongKong standards. Ordered room service - a margarita pizza......without a single piece of fresh tomato, and 6 tiny pieces of basil. Need to take out a mortgage to eat in the restaurants.Paid for a late checkout at 7pm but got several calls to ask when we were leaving.Please get rid of the metalwork in the floor on the way to the lifts...trying to drag two suitcases was horrible because of this.... navigating a wheelchair over them was uncomfortable and a hazard.Useful for the conference but that鈥檚 it. Miles from anywhere and they take advantage of this.

Convenient to the airport for a stopover. Rooms are good, spacious and well appointed. Checkin was easy and staff were friendly and efficient. didn鈥檛 try any food or beverage but everything else was good. Similar piece to other airport hotel and much better

As usual stayed here before an early flight. Beds are comfortable. Check in was easy.Wish breakfast started earlier and shuttle to airport ran every 15 minutes instead of ever 30 minutes. Would be nice if executive lounge had drinks and heavier food later as really an airport hotel 24 hour check out and in are expected.Music in lobby is much much too loud.

I had a complimentary one night stay at this hotel due to a delayed flight and missed connection. A shuttle service was available to/from the airport terminal and hotel, and is about a ten minute ride each way.The lobby was welcoming, the front desk staff was polite and helpful, and the room overall looked clean. However, with table lamps turned on, one can see that the ledges and lamps needed more thorough dusting.As with most Marriott hotels, the bed was very comfortable. Airconditioning was strong, television selection was sufficient and wifi was complimentary.I was assigned to a handicapped room so it was more spacious. The bathroom was also handicap-friendly although I cannot comment much on its functionality since I am not aware of the needs. I can only say it was slightly difficult to get in and out of the bathtub and shower water could easily wet the floor. I appreciate all hotels that provide bathmats and this bathroom had one. All toiletries were available and housekeeping was quick to provide additional items requested. Overall a satisfactory stay.

I stay there for 2 night. Short queue check-in but long time in waiting line even though there are 3 staff standby, I wait for 20 min but in fact there is just 1 queue before me. I have know idea why the process is so long. The room is big and bed is comfy. During my check out, staff told me that the system is down. I am fair enough to tell them that I have to pay 14 HKD for printing service they get the cash and promise to send me the receipt but I never received it until now. Bad idea but just thinking if staff is not honest to hotel and guest. Actually I really enjoy the stay and appreciate the shuttle service but what happened to me is ruined everything.

Due to glitches in travel, I was in need of overnight lodging near Hong Kong International Airport. I had mistakenly made a reservation for the night prior to my actual arrival. Ayaka was the Marriott Associate who kindly assisted in finding a room for me in a near sold out state. Her understanding and effort on my behalf was sincerely appreciated.

We arrived late at night into Hong Kong. We caught one of the last shuttles to the hotel. Checkin was efficient, the room very comfortable and the breakfast offered a wide choice of items. An excellent choice for an overnight stay.

My last three visit in a Marriott hotel has not been as expected. May be the new Company BONVOY is getting too big and less responsive to its loyal customers. I noticed that being a Gold member does not mean anything anymore. Even though prices have been going up I still have been a loyal customer. In the last 9 months I have stayed in Vienna, Budapest, Lisbon, Khao Lak (Thailand) and twice in Hong Kong. I was paying more in staying in a Marriott Hotel all these years, but I was recognized as a Gold member with some benefits. This is not the case any more when I travel outside of the US. (I do not travel in the US) No more benefits as a Gold member, so I decided not to stay at a Marriott Hotel anymore. I can stay in a nice boutique Hotel for less money and a lot more charm and personality. Every country has Boutique Hotels.

The room was really good - very nice a bed super comfy. It all went a bit wrong with breakfast. Staff either way too lazy and slow and others too overworked and rushed. I was FORCED to sign a bill for breakfast even though it was included in my package. The food was average, the coffee - no excuse - horrendous truly un drinkable. Twice during breakfast I had Marriott staff push past me to get their food. And more than once was forced to move out of the way of more staff just walking through the dinning room. Decided to go to the Cafe in reception to try to get a decent coffee (Illy) has to wait 15 mins to be served. It鈥檚 an absolute Shambles. This hotel should be much better than this

What a mess. I made a reservation via the Marriott app. It's kind of hit or miss whether it sticks. I'm platinum so I've stayed at Marriotts a bit.We found the shuttle after a little running around. It was not the worst experience but Marriott is not at fault for this.I checked in and went to my room with my wife. We get to the room and the door is held open by the sliding latch thing. First thought? "Uh oh." Open the door? The room is a complete mess including a slept-in bed.So, we stroll over to the lounge and tell of our story. This is where we met Eris Hui - with a big friendly hello and smile. She proceeds to invite us to sit while she sorts it out for us. She ultimately comes back with a key to a new room on the 9th (what happened to our lounge-level floor?). Walk in and almost suffocate with the smell (which is also in the hallway on 12) from the remodel. The room looks GREAT. We almost passed out (ok, slight exaggeration) from the smell. NO WAY we can sleep in here. So, back to 12. Eris, can you help? She comes back again. She and another person walk us to an upgraded room in the corner. Great big room with a nice view. It's got stained carpets and a few other problems - clearly not (and thankfully) an upgraded room. She also invites us to a glass of wine. We don't drink. She keeps going - ends up on ice cream which made the wife happy. She sends us an ice cream for the 3-room dance. 3 rooms. and stained carpets.Eris is amazing. She's friendly and did a great job caring about solving this and even appeared to feel bad. Thank you for that.We also encountered what turned out to be a guy from concierge on the elevator. super friendly and helpful. We met him again later when we went to concierge and once again very helpful. He gave me a business card - Hong Lee (thank you!) - a friendly helpful guy.The shuttles...oh the shuttles...we took the last shuttle from the MTR back to the hotel and it was clear the driver wanted to get home. I confused him with Mario Andretti. I was in a lot of pain from a back injury from 2 days earlier and it was bad - bouncing all over the place. The wife commented about him racing especially around curves.The airport shuttle in both directions was ok. Due to my injury, it was tough for me to get my suitcase that had receded into the well a bit with the trip. A customer had to help me as the driver (a different driver for a different trip obviously) watched me struggle. Thanks.Most of the staff was good though surprisingly check-in and check-out were nothing special.Usually one can forgive some issues during a remodel but this is a joke. Really messy. Typical Marriott of late except we had great service from Eris.I'm especially concerned by the price - >$300/night for sloppy service, remodeling construction terrible smells and so-so service.

This hotel is very conveniently situated adjacent to the airport we have stayed here several times recently. While the Concierge Lounge is good, the beds are terrible with the typical sag in the middle. It's a big step down from the higher-quality Marriott's that we've stayed in both Hong Kong and other asia countries. The night prior to departure everyone wanted a good night's sleep but we all woke up from the beds with a little bit of back stress after our 2 weeks of travel.The hotel shuttle runs every 30 minutes and I would recommend taking that the morning of your departure. Be prepared to load your own bags on and off the shuttle bus, you're not getting the same level of loading or unloading service as you would with a taxi driverOn arrival I would just grab the Blue Cab line at Terminal 2 and pay the 25 HKD for the quick drop-off convenience especially keep it on the road awhile

The Hong Kong SkyCity Marriott Hotel is a great choice for a Hong Kong layover. The rooms are clean and spacious and the pool is very nice. The morning buffet is also very good. Shuttle service from the airport to the hotel was also very efficient. I would stay here again.

A very convenient hotel for whom part of Asia expo n guest who are transit with airport a nice five star hotel with spacious room n with good breakfast with good services but room amenity are very poor against the price they charge

Stayed one night Feb 24 in transit to Kuala Lumpur. As a titanium member, got access to the lounge and breakfast downstairs. Service was very good, especially Mr. Water Yip at downstairs restaurant. Only thing I complaint was the executive lounge food. There are 3 hot items being served that evening but all of them were at room temperature. Even after refilling the food, they are all at the same temperature. I talked to the lounge staff, she said will let the chef know. Hope they could have improved next time I visit. I wondering why they didn't take any immediately action that night ?Just reheat and make sure food were hot!

Well oiled act especially since a trade fair was on.Room was fresh and clean.Excellent house cleaning.Top notch breakfast and great gym.Good dinner at the chinese restaurant.Very well organized and delivers under pressure.

This is our first time staying at sky city marriott hotel. Despite this hotel location is convenient and close to airport, the customer service need to be improved. Hotel staff somehow are less attentive and not really welcoming. My friend got this feeling too.

We had a brief (1-night) stay as a family of four. Lovely collection from the airport, and great service (as always). It was a great room, with a nice view over the airport, so we watch the constant stream of airplanes coming in. Fantastic breakfast. Great executive lounge.Highly recommended!

Over priced and old hotel with low quality food and disappointing breakfast. Not a 5 star at all. Do not recommend it. Much better to find a hotel a little further and get the train or taxi to the airport.

The rooms are nicely appointed with all the gadgets. Make sure to insert your room key in the slot by the door, otherwise, no lights. Breakfast is effing fantastic! The longest buffet evah! From cold cuts to hot soup. English, Asian, American, continental. ALL YUM!Half hourly shuttles to the terminals. Train station across the street at the expo center. 30 minutes from downtown Totally worth it!

I chose this airport hotel because I knew I was coming in late and would be tired.The hotel shuttle comes only every 30 minutes. I had to wait 25 minutes for a hotel that鈥檚 less than a mile away!This brand name and high cost should give better service.

Thank you Hong, and Jon with the concierge, for being so helpful with our first time visit to HKG. Your patience and kindness were much appreciated. Your game plan to help us get into the city with the train and the ferry was perfect.

Was a nice hotel for stop-over/ early morning flight. Hotel provided shuttle bus in the morning to Disneyland and return trip at night and every 30mins to the airport. Tips: ask for the room closer to the lift if possible, I found a bit tired to push the luggage on the carpet and quite a long walk if you stay at the room at the far end.

Arrived too late to transit on to our final destination, thus stayed overnight at this nearby airport hotel. Welcome counter located in Hall B and shuttle to/from hotel is convenient and service is outstanding. Some of the hotel rooms have been stylishly refreshed with all the modern amenities and decor. A great hotel for a layover or quick in/out if you need to be close to HKG International Airport and don't want to hoof it all the way into the city.

WE stayed here one night as part of our honeymoon. We got the BEST service from Ayaka when we checked in (I had already checked in mobily). When she heard it was our honeymoon she made sure our room had a nice view and made sure we had access to a really nice breakfast. When we checked out we still wanted to explore Lantau so we kept our bags with concierge who were also really great and fun to interact with. They helped us with the schedule for the shuttles and took good care of our stuff. The shuttle is an awesome perk and got us from the airport and to the metro station that takes you to the skyline. For us it made sense because we wanted to stay on Lantau island but getting to the rest of Hong Kong wasnt too bad either. The rooms were MUCH better than I expected for an airport hotel. I'd likely stay there again even for a longer more Hong Kong Island heavy visit.

Wonderful hotel, I stay here as a first & last stop before flying on my trips to Hong Kong. Large shuttle buses run every 20 minutes to the airport. They also have shuttle buses to Tung Chung to see the Giant Buddah or catch the MTR. Staff is friendly, hotel is clean, and rooms are beautiful. I was really impressed with the breakfast buffet both in the lobby. and in the executive lounge. Also, the Gym & Pool facilities are great and very clean.Ask for Ayaka on check in, she's very helpful and friendly. Try and get a room with the ocean view.

Hotel is adjacent to Asia Expo Center and Airport Express Station. Hotel offers complimentary shuttle pickup/drop off HKG airport as well as shuttles to Disneyland and Tung Chung Area + MTR. For faster service to Kowloon and Central take the airport express and arrive in 15-20minutes. Last train from Central back to hotel is around midnight and first train around 0600 hours. Hotel has a great fitness center and pool. Quan Spa is also available for pampering. There are a couple restaurants on property but only Velocity Bar is available for late night dining. There are no nearby restaurants. Executive lounge access (Club Room and Platinum members) is open until midnight and offers business center services and snacks/beverages with morning breakfast.

Very helpful staffI have visited Marriott Skycity Hong Kong so many times.I always ask them for special requests about pracels or electronic devices.The hotel staff always arrange it for me and make me so comfortable.

The hotel gymnasium has been renovated, and now it is a new board, a new fat measuring machine, a new bicycle, a new look! Coach Evis of the Hong Kong Team is enthusiastic in guiding me to practice shoulders! The feeling of congestion is full of... Fanny, lobby manager, friendly and polite, with a smile and cordiality! Coach Juno is friendly

I traveled to Hong Kong this week and I stayed in L鈥檋otel. Since I need to gym everyday so I try the fitness room and have a look. The gym room is the beautiful which covered by glasses. The personal trainer - Evis and Juno are so professional and they gave a lot advise in gym and how to shape my body efficiency. I learnt more when I came to L鈥檋otel this time.Besides, the restaurant is very nice and special. There is a buffet included local food - like milk tea and Hong Kong noodles. It is really interesting.Especially, the concierge - Jimmy, he helped a lot when I have some problem and requirements. Thx bro.Anyway, L鈥檋otel is a nice to stay and choose when you travel!

My first stay at this hotel. When I go to the gym and pool area, Juno and Evis are there to welcome the guests, special Juno very patient with me. And the lifeguards are very friendly and they the pool area very clean and watch all details.Nice hotel, and Fiona very polite and helpful.

I live in HK but recently stayed at L鈥橦otel Island South after locking myself out of my home with no one to let me in!I stayed only 1 night, my choice of hotel was based on cost and accessibility to Central.The hotel is on the new MTR line extending from Admiralty. Central is easily reached with 15 -20 minutes door to door. The neighbourhood itself is a quiet commercial area with not much going on but provides easy access to Ocean Park and the Island Line.The hotel reception is several floors up and was quite busy upon arrival late in the evening. It would seem to be popular with Mainland tour groups.a seperate set of key operated lifts provide access to the rooms.The room itself provides great value. Spacious room with many amenities beyond what i would usually expect in HK at the price point. I did not try the breakfast.DO stay here if you are seeking:-value-spacious rooms-neighborhood escaping the hustle and bustleDon鈥檛 stay here if you are expecting:- nightlife on your doorstep.-amazing views.Personally i would be happy to stay here again next time i lock myself out!

I joined the gym club as member initially on a monthly basis. As member, I can make use of both the gym facilities and the outdoor swimming pool, plus free personal coaching. After the first month of exercise and personal coaching by Juno (the coach), I decided to join its membership on annual basis. Apart from the fact that gym room is equipped with all the necessary equipments for workout, the weekly personal coaching is very effective and Juno designs exercise that is tailored to my needs. The staff (Juno and Evis) in the gym room are very friendly, helpful and professional. I visit the gym room for exercise a few times a week and I find that the room is always clean and tidy.

This is a good, modern 4* hotel. Comparing to the most mid-range hotels in HK it has "normal size" rooms, good bath in every room. Many rooms has sea view. There is a good pool, gym, restaurant etc. This is not a very central area of HK but it is very accessible by cross-harbor tunnel buses and now days by new metro line. Easy to visit from here the Ocean Park, the Repulse Bay, the Stanley and other nice sea resort places on this side of HK.

I stayed in this hotel for a month with my husband. One of the reason I chose this hotel is that they offer gym instructor service for guests. I'm glad I made this choice. My instructor, Juno and my husband's instructor, Evis both offerred excellent advice. They taught us how to use machines effectively and safely.I also want to give a clap to the sales manager, Yan Lam, for immediate follow up when we encounter issues during our stay.The cleaning staff are polite and they keep our room clean. Bed is comfortable.

This hotel is clean and newish. The rooms were very big compared to others in hk. Bed was big and comfy.A short walk to the nearest mtr at Wong chuk hang. But there isn鈥檛 much in the area because it is a traditional industrial / office area , so you will need to go to other places for shopping and eating . Had a good stay overall.

My third stay at this hotel. Everyday when i go to the gym and pool area, Juno and Evis are there to welcome the guests. They are very patient with the guests. The life guards are very friendly and they keep the pool area very clean and watch all details. Nice hotel, real good for value of money. Most people think its abit far but it has alot of buses on the street level and they take you to Causeway Bay/ admiralty/ central/ Stanley/ Repulse Bay/ and TST and other places in Kowloon. Also green mini buses. Rooms are very clean and spacious. The spacious sitting area in the lobby offers free selfservice coffee and tea. Fast wifi. The sun covers the whole pool in may, june for sure while i stayed there during these months. Love to go to that local cafe restaurant across the street. Easy to get to from the airport. I usually just take the taxi direct from the airport which cost about 380-450 hk $. But this last time, i took the airport extress to Hong Kong Station( about110 hk$), than taxi to the hotel cost about 80 hk$. So total is 190 $. I definitely will go back again.

Great hotel! I would highly recommend L Hotel Southside. Very peaceful and relaxing location next to the mountain. Especially the beautiful pool and gym. Amazing helpful gym and pool team including Evis and Juno! Very helpful.

We had to stay in this hotel for four nights and we realy liked the facilities. The room was large enough and the bathroom too. The only negative thing was the higiene. I was surprised to see how the cleaner cleansed the bathroom only with damp towel and no detergent. Very good organisation of taking taxi from the hotel and very helpful staf.

My husband & I have had several long term stays here & it feels like home now. Love that the rooms are large for HK along with comfortable beds & large bathroom. It is quite convenient for us to take the bus for work related purposes. We particularly want to uphold the professional training & professionalism of the staff here which have made our stays here so comfortable. I would like to commend in particular Sammy Tse at the registration counter on the 5th floor for her extra-mile efforts to meet our needs. She has given us excellent care regarding our accommodation with a great attitude of kindness & respect. Kevin was also very professional in checking us in. We have also received quality service from our housekeepers on the 36th floor from Selina & Joey. Also of particular note are the concierge team on the 4th floor namely Eddie, Keung & Jimmy who have helped us to move & store our things numerous times with great courtesy & care. This wonderful team at the hotel has brought us back again & again & made us feel at home. Looking forward to future stays with you.

Efficient check in. Front desk staff Marcel and Marco being helpful. Concierge staff Weslisy provided clear information for restaurants nearby. Convenient location close to city center. Love the gym and pool facilities. Helpful and friendly staffs, Juno & Evis are nice gym instructors! 锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛侊紒锛?,May 5

鈥楽ervice attitude changes everything.鈥橧t鈥檚 real after I have stayed one night at this wonderful and captivating hotel . First ,when we arrived the hotel the staffs who were Jimmy and Eddie in front of the hotel parking ,came and serviced us with their passionate . Taking our packages to our hotel room ,make us more relax to go to the check-in counter. When we got in our hotel room , the packages were already here ,which is efficient and make us feel comfortable. Second , when we decided to upgrade our room , a staff was running up side down between the floor of our old and new rooms to make sure all my family know the changes.He is very responsible and kind.Regarding the recreation in the hotel, It鈥檚 was fun and intimate . I had a great experience鈥攆riendly advice and help from Evis Lai , the Sports and recreation supervisor.He teach me new and fashionable . The advice were super useful and his attitude is very impress .I would like to thanks for this wonderful experience and I feel happy .I will probably go again next time .

The first time i can realize the haven that is real And i can keep the exercises in there The staffs too nice , specially the gym room Evis, Juno and King , they so kindly and cheerful and the ways they instructed me too professionally. Anyway this place is number 1option when I come to Hongkong

We have tried many hotels in Hong Kong and now we stay here every week. Buses and subway are very handy, rooms are big for Hong Kong standard with views. Services are excellent. And the gym is really a bonus, new and clean with nice mountain views. Instructors King, Evis and Juno are all very friendly and helpful. Enjoy staying here.

My husband and I stayed in this hotel in end Dec and we were very happy with the accommodation. The rooms were clean and big. The staff were very responsive. The wifi in the room was weak, but the hotel put in a temp router almost immediately when we called them about it.The hotel also provide free coffee for in-house guests.As to the location, the hotel is in the industrial area and there are no shopping mall around. There is a local food centre about 5mins' walk from the hotel. We also discovered a caf茅, BIT, 2 doors from the hotel that serves nice breakfast and tea.The Wong Chuk Hung MTR station is about 10mins' walk from the hotel. There are several buses at the doorstep of the hotel to bring people to Stanley Market and Victoria Peak. Overall a good quiet place to come back to after a long day out.

We are corporate gym member of the L hotel for some years now. We are glad to know that the Gym manager Evis has returned and immediately the service, condition, and cleanliness of the gym has dramatically improved. The gym trainers are always ready to support and help us during a session. Mr. Evis is managing his staff and the gym in a very professional and proper way. Please pass our gratitude to all gym staffs and we will happy to continue our membership as long as this standard keeps up.

My wife and I stayed here in November. Location and room size were good. Staff were a bit of a mixed bag - had some very friendly and not so friendly. It is quite noisy on the lower levels and with my wife being pregnant and having trouble sleeping we requested another room to which the staff obliged, However we were put in a smoking room which was horrible. Asked to change rooms again if possible as we had requested a non smoking room we were met with a not so friendly staff member! Third time lucky we were put into another room which had twin single beds but we didn't want to go back and ask for the king we had originally booked after the last conversation. Our last day weather was perfect so we decided to relax by the pool but the pool is closed between October and April. No mention of this on website or at time of booking so was really disappointed. The hotel itself isn't too bad but I don't think we would be staying there again after our experience.

My husband & I have stayed at this hotel many times. We love the location & the hotel rooms are large for HK. We feel it is a home away from home & love the views. I would like to commend the front desk staff especially Sammy Tse. Because we have several bookings she was very friendly, helpful with our needs & very professional. The concierge staff was super helpful as well. Highly recommend this hotel & the staff for many awesome stays.

A nice quiet hotel which is quite cheap too. It is in a quiet part of Hong Kong Island, with only Ocean Park & Aberdeen Sports Ground / sports facilities as notable things of interest nearby. They have a luxurious lobby area and a classy gym/pool area.Note that on the TV, the channels additional to the usual free-TV 6 are 99% soccer and sports - if you're into that (me) it's great. Otherwise the TV is not so great.

We stayed for 1 night at L'hotel Island South recently. It is just one stop MTR ride to Ocean Park. The room on the highest floor is so big and comfortable. My kids are so excited to the nice view facing Ocean Park. "Crab" buffet at LIS Cafe is yummy. The staff is friendly especially thanks to Jay, the GSM for his hospitality.

Had dinner at the LIS Cafe and the food and service was amazing. Seafood was super fresh, the suckling pig (signature dish) was cooked to perfection and the service was 5 star. Special thanks to Sylvia and Winnie for their amazing service.

We stayed in L hotel Island South for 5 days recently in our trip to Hong Kong. The hotel is conveniently located on the main street within walking distance to MTR. The room size is decent and big compared to the majority hotels in Hong Kong. Staff were very friendly and the cleaner always asked if we need to have our towels change or coffee/tea top up. A very pleasant lady. The hotel seems to be very busy all the time with conference guests or group tours so allow sufficient time to wait for the lift on the day of checking out. Overall the stay was excellent and I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to stay on the southern side of HK island.

The hotel itself was ok i guess, pretty much what was expected in terms of room, cleanliness etc. The service experience I endured however, was one of the worst in my 25 years of travel and hotels. What made it worse was the many glowing reviews of the service right here on trip advisor. My wife and I booked two nights as we were moving house and have two young kids under 8 years old. Given that check-in was listed as 2pm, I turned up at the hotel with my two children at pretty much 2pm, to be told that owing to full occupancy the previous night, my room was still being remade by housekeeping and we would need to wait another 20 minutes. That was irritating to begin with, as my youngest child was approaching regular naptime and I had expected to put him straight down to bed not long after 2pm. It got worse however as after 35 minutes we were still waiting in an uncomfortable lobby area with nothing for my children to do, and no drinks etc. I then approached the same woman at reception, who told me another 10 minutes or so. That 10 minutes dragged on for another 30 minutes or more. By this stage it was around 3:15pm and I just lost it, not something i like to do at anytime, but our treatment was just unacceptable, especially as there appeared to be other people arriving and checking in by this time. Ultimately I was forced to make a big fuss at reception and in view of others, raising my voice and calling for the manager and then of course magically our room was ready. By this time it was approaching 3:30pm, and we had waited for 1.5 hours after the advised check-in time. I don't like to single out individuals but the young woman who tended to us the whole time just didn't seem interested in helping at all. In fact she was the type who didn't appear comfortable speaking to foreigners, found it hard to make eye contact, and quite clearly was just happy for the problem to go away without doing anything about it. Her customer service was non-existent. I'm sorry, but this kind of person does not have a future in hospitality, and whilst i won't name names, whoever was doing the afternoon shift on October 31st needs to be spoken to by management at a bare minimum. I'm sorry but I would never consider staying at this hotel again based on this experience.

L'Hotel Island South has an amazing team of Concierge, chamber maids and front office staff. They remember their guests and are always helpful. One of the best hotel service teams I have come across. Cant recommend L'Hotel Island South enough: great location, service staff, and good room size. My first choice hotel in HK.

Stayed at L'hotel from 23 Oct to 26 Oct 2018. On my first day, check in at the counter was prompt and fast.I was given a room at the higher floor with a nice mountain view.The room was very clean, comfortable and quiet.Basic necessities such as tooth brush, shampoo, shower gel was provided as well.I was really impressed by the politeness and responsiveness of the hotel staff.Bed and pillows were soft and I had a good sleep during my stay here.One thing that they can improve upon is the hotel buffet breakfast.They have a wide range of food for breakfast. During my stay there, I see the same food for the past 3 days.It would be good to have a different variety of food each day.Overall, I am very pleased with my stay here at L' hotel Island South.Would head back next time if I am here for business.

I went to this hotel on March 6 and and i was arrived early like 10 am, i was asking for the room and the receptionist asking me wait 20 so i wait and then she gives me key but when i entered to the room its twin bed. I was asking to change because i am by myself and they just promise i can change later but never been asked for double bed.Also i was asking for city view as per request but she gives me mountain view which just like in the pic.Hotel its good by the way

I become a member of the fitness program in L'hotel (Island South) since two months ago. I appreciate the fitness center staff providing professional service and friendly smile to us. Especially, Evis and Juno who always provide strength and conditioning coach to me. They share their professional fitness knowledge with me that not only can train me up but also can improve my body shape. In additional, all of the lifeguards there are attention to the swimming pool safety, especially Tak gor, he always takes care and offer assistance to swimmers.However, I hope the hotel could add more fitness equipment and improve sun protective measures.Thank you very much for all the fitness center staff.

So....the area around this hotel isn鈥檛 probably what you imagine when you go to Hong Kong. It鈥檚 a mix of residential and light industrial....Ocean Park is quite close....there鈥檚 a complex of newer restaurants (Pizza Express, Vietnamese, Starbucks) and a trendier hotel (Ovolo Southside) close by. But other than that (I guess you could head to Aberdeen too), as either a tourist or business traveler, you鈥檙e probably heading north. South Island line is a ~7 minute walk from the hotel, and then 2 stops into Admiralty 閲戦挓銆俆he rooms here are quite big - shockingly so by HK standards. But the hotel opened around 2011 and doesn鈥檛 seem to have been renovated much since....so it鈥檚 a bit ragged around the edges. Think of it more as a faded three star hotel. Seems to attract lots of mainland tourists / groups. Essentially no real complaints, but I probably wouldn鈥檛 stay here again. Convenient enough, but if you have a short stay to 鈥渆xperience鈥?Hong Kong, this probably isn鈥檛 the place.

We had lived at L' Hotel Island South for 3 years. Sadly we moved out because of the increased rate.In the past 3 years, we were impressed by the quality of the services - the friendly concierge, the always-clean-and-neat room, the professional gym coach, the helpful porters and so on.The location of the hotel is 10-min walk from the train MTR. Also Starbucks and convenient store are at the same distance. However, there are not many restaurants and no shops at all. You can take bus to the city hub or Stanley at the bus stop near the side exit of the hotel (they call P1 Level).

We got a family room. It was modern , spacious and very clean. All staff were very helpful and polite. We enjoyed dinner and breakfast there, the food was reasonably good. Highly Recommended! Thank you very much!

My wife and I arrived to find that the room I had booked a few weeks previously was not available but a more than acceptable substitute was found. The room was spacious and clean and the mattress to our preference, suitably firm (which some may not like). Our housekeeping lady, YoYo, was diligent, thorough and friendly - we cannot praise her enough for keeping our room spick and span and essentials replenished. The housekeeping services were quick to respond and efficient. The room鈥檚 safe was faulty and I could not access my documents. A call to the front desk resulted in a prompt response and attendance of staff who arrived, took stock, accessed the safe for my documents and had the safe replaced in less than half an hour. The only possible negative is the location. Outside the hotel is a busy roadway of public transport, construction and private vehicles giving rise to a noisy road environment that you are blissfully cocooned from once inside the coolness of the hotel.We have not tried the restaurants so cannot comment. We highly recommend this hotel for its service, quality of essentials and value for money.

Easy access by train from airport. A little walk to the new South Island line. Rooms are larger by HK standards. Large 25 m lap pool and gym with glass cycling. You can see an eagle or large bird flying around the hills when working out in the gym. Had a room on the 32 floor. Has all the basics for a working trip. There鈥檚 a dim sum takeaway at the MTR station that feeds carbs & lard for fuel after your run or swim. Easy walk to the academy. Aberdeen town also access by walking for local food and shopping. Very helpful & pleasant staff. Two train stations from Pacific place in Admiralty for high end shopping & gourmet food. A nice little gem tucked away for a great stay over.
Guest room comfortable, normal toiletries. You can see the hill view. Hotel is near train station and bus station.Hotel outside not too much restaurants or fast food shop. But room rate not expensive

This is a great hotel and I very much enjoyed my stay here.The staff were all excellent as well, especially Jay at the front desk who expertly dealt with all my queries and who gave great directions and recommendations of places to goWould recommend

After my initial experience, my subsequent ones had been more than pleasant. The room we were given was on a high floor. It was quiet and it had a good view! The room is bigger than most of the hotels in HK , with a good size bath room that comes with bath tub.

Someone else like Jimmy in that hotel is not working, jimmy chan marvellous Sami and a gentleman, and it's one I think very loved ones together with friends you must raise to the salary because he even get a tipJimmy is the best man in the Lhotel

We had to move rooms twice. First as we were allocated a smoking room and second as our room smelt damp. We paid for a bigger room on the 32nd floor which was nice as we had a living room also. It is a good place although I would stay nearer the centre next time as a preference.

This hotel locates in Wong Chuk Hang, very near to Ocean Park and also just minutes away (by subway) from the busiest part of Hong Kong - Causeway Bay. The best offerings from this hotel, besides the comfortable accommodation, is the fitness facilities and their very passionate fitness manager - Evis and his team. They offer personal training sessions at no additional cost because they are passionate of what they do (which i don't think any other hotel would do) and they are super knowledgeable too so you are guarantee to receive very high quality fitness training. If you are staying in this hotel, please make sure you head to the gym and ask for Evis for a training.

My husband and I like l鈥檋otel, Island South. We are originally from Hong Kong and return for holidays, so we know about the region. We also like and know value for money. We haven鈥檛 found an alternative hotel that gives the same quality for the price, plus a larger room with a very professional, friendly and helpful staff. We highly recommend l鈥檋otel, Island South. After 7 years and more than 12 stays, it hasn鈥檛 been beaten. The seafood buffet, fresh and good range, with a guest discount, is outstanding. Recently, some acquaintances actually recommended l鈥檋otel just for their buffet. We followed their advice and we are very pleased.On the downside, the streetscape in front is pretty much concrete bland, but management is keeping the place very clean. You can see staff constantly cleaning the place. The location of the hotel is on the 鈥渨rong鈥?side of the island, but the new MRT station is a short walk, with frequent and quick service, it is not an issue at all.Big thank you to all staff, especially Marcel and Nelson.

We have been here for a month. The room size is quite good for Hong Kong standard and the bed is really comfortable. It is quiet and located near by the MTR station which is only 2 stops away from Admiralty. Unfortunately the restaurant is disappointing. However, the staff is really nice and kind. We highly recommend the fitness as they actually provide free courses! ( You can ask Evis for a great training:)) And the pool is just perfect!

I stay at this L`Hotel since more than 4 years once i travel to Hong Hong. Always very satisfied with this Hotel. Rooms very clean- Service is also pretty much more than good.very clean washroom. hope to stay there for the next 10 years. I highly recommend this Hotel either for business or family. Both is very fine to stay. I used for Exhibition in Wan Chai. takes with the taxi approx 20 minutes.

We stayed in a family room (2 connected rooms with about 60sm in space) for over 7 weeks. The experience was very pleasant. The room size allows me to set up a small office with good working space. The lounge area on the reception level is a good relaxing venue for business / social catch up. Their special dining offers for long-stay guests offer good choice of food to avoid repetitiveness. My long-stay offer comes with one parking space, which is very handy. Their concierge service is friendly, so is housekeeping, front office and even the technical staffs. Coming from a hospitality background and having traveled extensively worldwide, I can vouch the staff training at L'hotel Island South is very good and warmly.

Great friendly responsive staff. Great managers.Lots of relevant amenities. Nice restaurant. Location was good for our activity. Walking distance to one of our destination.The room was nice and large with a desk for our laptops and recharging stations on the bedside table for cellphones, tablets, etc.

Meetings in HK and this location was the best. the MTR was a short walk, including attractions. Loved this hotel with the buffet each morning and a great dinner menu with lots of seafood. i will be staying here again

I have been staying at the L hotel whenever I am in Hong Kong for a long time. I always use the gym facilities during my stay. In my most recent visit, there is a new gym manager who joined the gym.He is very friendly and provide assistance during my workout. Ever since he joined, it is noticeable that the gym has gotten cleaner and he is always watching out for the users.

We would like to express our sincere thanks for the excellent services during these two weeks at this hotel. Especially their Guest Service Manager, Mr. Hysan Lau. He is very kind, patient, helpful and took care of all our needs. I have never met such an excellent hotel staff like him. I would give him 110 marks if 100 is full marks. We would highly recommend this hotel to my friends and relatives. Of course, we will absolutely stay at this hotel again and we are looking forward to our stay next year.

I booked a few of my VIP musicians that we flew in from New York for an Art Basel event. They were staying for 2 nights. There were quite a lot of back and forth when arranging some of the requirements requested by my VIPs but the hotel was later very accommodating.My VIPs were very happy during the stay and my colleagues who also stayed at the hotel during the event period. They said that rooms were very clean and the guest service was good during their stay.

I originally don鈥檛 expect much from this hotel, but i will say the hotel service is fair. Although the location is not very convenient and no much entertainment facilities nearby, yet it is quite close to Ocean Park with fair price.Well, something i would like to spotlight about, the gymroom. The gymroom are nice decorated, the tall windows makes the room looks bright. The gymroom coach, Ken provided great service, he is very knowledgeable and professional. He gave me reminders and advices on behalf of my body health.

This hotel gave me an unexpected experience! First of all, the staff at the Front Deck are very nice, and I could even got an upgrade of my room~Secondly, the room is very clean, and the facilities inside are kept in good condition. That make my family feel so comfortable to stay in the room.

Only stayed one night during Lunar New Year, nice modern clean room with plenty of space, large king sized bed which was very comfortable. I read one review saying there was no shampoo or shower gel, they were in the bathroom inside a drawer. Perfect location for travellers wishing to visit Ocean Park or the Floating restaurant in Aberdeen.Staff were friendly, helpful and professional. Breakfast buffet was decent quality, ham, eggs, breads, salad, noodles congee and dim sum. With good coffee.Would definitely stay there again.

There were a good service from Front Desk and they gave me a nice view room. The room can see Ocean Park and little bit ocean view. MTR was starting so more convenience and easier to go downtown. I will stay again at this hotel when I need!

It's my 3rd stay in about 2 years , in which I have an absolutely different experience this time. The room given to me was on a higher floor, and was quiet. Even though it's not right in the city, I do like the fact that the surroundings are not as catastrophic as the ones right in the hub of the city. We are thankful for the staff who helped us with our luggages, and showed us our room personally. To add on a personal touch, there was fresh fruit platter daily too. Well, its more of a business hotel, whereby the bar / lounge is quiet enough for me to do my work in peace. Having a MTR which is 5 mins walk away does help this hotel to score points. I do like to be back again.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: We got to Sham Shui Po station, lugged our bags up the stairs and came out to the real world. We walked for about 5-10 mins to get to our accomodation for the next 2 nights YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel YHA 缇庤嵎妯撻潚骞存梾鑸? Check in was quite easy, we were given a tv remote to return on check out and we also have to take back our pillowcase, sheets and duvet cover at that time also. Apart from this not being convenient with luggage and 2 young kids in tow this place is well worth the money. It is 2 bedrooms with a bathroom, spacious and close to an MTR, markets and shopping centres. We were given brekky vouchers where you can choose from noodles, glutinous rice and chicken, egg and ham sandwich or a croissant with ham, tomato and lettuce.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: My friend and I stayed at YHA Mei House Youth Hostel in April 2019. The room we booked was a twin room with private bathroom; it was clean, spacious, luminous and comfortable. We paid 3400 HKD (380 鈧? for 5 nights. The hostel has a spacious kitchen with all the facilities and it was always very clean during my stay. There are also big fridges where guests can store their food and very good washing machines and dryers.The hostel is well-managed; the reception is 24-hour, the staff speak English and Chinese and was very kind with me.The hostel is located in Sham Shui Po, just a 7 minutes walk from Sham Shui Po MTR station, Exit D2.A note to the hostel: I suggest improving the breakfast. I cooked the breakfast by myself because I鈥檓 vegan and all the five choices were with meat. There are a lot foreign travelers who would enjoy a vegan breakfast, so I suggest you to introduce at least one vegan meal.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Conveniently located in Sham Shui Po, just a 7 mins walk from Sham Shui Po MTR station, Exit D2. Can take Citybus A20 from airport to Yen Chow Street Sham Shui Po (located at 226-242 Cheung Sha Wan Road), which takes about 45 mins and cost HKD33. The bus comes in 60mins interval. Near to many nice eateries and walking distance to many attractions like Ladies' Street.My girlfriend & I stayed in a theme twin room and was quite spacious. About S$120/night. 5 choices to choose for breakfast. Especially love the Glutinous Rice chicken (with a chicken wing inside). The other sets still quite ok.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Been in HK many times, thinking we would try something more 鈥榣ocal and different鈥?and, stay in somewhere other than the usual areas.We booked a private double bedroom with en-suite (26th March), which is the same prices as most mid-range hotels in HK.Pros:Heritage building built in the 50鈥檚.Clean room and common areas.Local feel.Cons:1) DREADFUL RECEPTIONIST: we were checked-in by Mandy who was unwelcoming, unprofessional, full of bad attitude and perfunctory. This sort of service gives Hong Kong鈥檚 hospitality industry a bad name. Yes, this is a 鈥榟ostel鈥?but it doesn鈥檛 mean it needs to be 鈥榟ostile鈥?and rude. She almost made us felt that she was doing us a favour by giving us a room! Other receptionists I dealt with, seemed much better. This is the typical case which one member of the team can dent the good work of other members.2) Hostel facilities but not hostel prices.3) The private double bedroom is just 2 mattress push together. Bed is rock hard.4) Poor amenities in room, everything is at extra cost, even to change a towel, costs! 5) Forget about the breakfast! One of the worst breakfasts we have ever had. Don鈥檛 know why the bother?! Just go around the corner and plenty of cafes offer decent food.I do not recommend this place other than if you want to stay in their dormitory and go rough.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: A place with interesting history of Sham Shui Po and housing in Hong Kong. There is a gallery and exhibition area (2 levels) that are available for public access. Worth a visit if you are nearby.There is a hill at the back of the hostel, and you can climb up to get a nice view of Sham Shui Po

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: In central Kowloon at the base of a hill is that lovely clean hostel. Stayed 3 nights in a twin room with attached bathroom.Rooms are large, clean and comfortable. There was a TV, jug and also free WIFI which was fast .Breakfast is included.Staff speak English are are polite and efficient. Close to the metro and in an area with plenty of places to eat.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Although it's a youth hostel, many guests are not so 'youth.' We were wondering why it's considered as a youth hostel. From the name of it we would expect a back-packer like accommodation with common kitchen, bathroom... etc. Apparently were slightly mistaken... It turned out to be a nicer place than we thought it would be. The hostel is managed professionally, like a hotel... Location wise, it is also beyond our expectation... in a nice way... although the property is located in a super busy area (a bit difficult to find at the beginning), but because it is located in a hilly area, it is quiet and clean. It does't feel like in Hong Kong... From what we see, most guests are from different parts of the globe. The ambience is nice too, feel homy with yummy breakfast served in a common room like a cafe. Happy we have chosen to stay here...

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Dear Jude, my visually impaired staff did a wrong booking for my accomodation. It should be 15-18 Jan 2019 but instead she booked 18 to 21 Dec 2018. I only realise this mistake when i receive a request to review my stay on 22 Dec 2018.My purpose to HobgKong is to visit HongKong Society for the Blind which is quite near your organisation. I am from a non profit organisation in Singapore and we hire visually impaired. This trip to HongKong is to explore working opportunities with society for the blind so that we can further reduce inequalities for the blind people.Your duty manager, Josh had rejected my appeal despite me sending him all the supporting documents and also calling him from Singapore to plead. I hope you are able to review my appeal and pardon the mistake that my visually impaired made. My organisation have limited budget hence i do not have any budget to rebook accomodation. My flight to HongKong is on budget airline.RegardsAaron Yeoh

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Hong Kong isn't like other South East Asian cities in that it is a bit more expensive and you don't get a free breakfast at most places. Mei Ho had a breakfast that did the job, nothing fancy, not much fresh fruit but that can be said of most of the hotel restaurants in HK. The rooms are really clean and efficient and the people at the front desk are very helpful. I would stay here again if I go back to HK.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: If you're like me, you think a hostel is a somewhat dodgy place that you stay in when you're young and broke. When it comes to Mei Ho House, that could not be further from the truth. This hostel is a former public housing unit that underwent an extensive renovation to become it's current iteration. While there is the traditional hostel bunkbed dorm room, MHH also offers LARGE modernly furnished rooms with a private bath. Your stay also offers you a daily breakfast and access to a very well-curated museum that does an amazing job in conveying the history of public housing in HK, the realities of life in very small quarters and memories of the people who lived in there. The museum really is a gem because it serves as a reminder that HK wasn't always gleaming skyscrapers and wealth. Other details: MHH is located in Sham Shui Po which is great neighborhood to be in. The MTR station is about a 5 min walk. There's tons of amazing, cheap traditional HK foods. And it's an interesting glimpse of a more working class neighborhood. Final verdict: Nice hotels in HK are super expensive. Cheaper hotels or an Airbnb is likely to be crazy tiny. So do yourself a favor and stay at MHH.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: I choose yha mei ho hostel at Sham shui po. This hostel very resonable cost. The breakfast from hostel is very delicius. The hostel is so clean and comfortable. If you want to stay at this hostel. You should bring padlock for your locker. If you buy the padlock at hostel it's so expensive.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Hostel is near road junction close to Sham Shui po station (exit D2 - need to cross junction). Shek kip neo station (exit B2) is a 5-10mins walk away so easy to get to. The hostel take a $500 deposit which is refunded within 2/3 weeks (not yet received this). You pay on arrival but there was a preoayment on my credit card a week before I arrived. Room was big and clean with entry by card. One bad point was that there was no plug socket next to bed. Air con works but you can't leave it turned all day when out on without the entry card as this acts as the power activator.You get breakfast vouchers on arrival - hand this in when getting breakfast. Breakfast is nothing pecial (the baked beans in the western style are given cold! - not ideal. There is a selection of drinks to buy if needed - hostel guests get discount but cheaper is shop across road.On the whole would recommend. However I stayed over the national holiday weekend (didn't know about this when booking) so ended up being quite expensive but it should be cheaper at other times of the year.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: I chose to stay in Mei Ho house YHA in Kowloon because of the reasonable cost when considering the size of the twin/double room. It also includes breakfast. The room is indeed spacious and clean, with also common room with kitchen and laundry. The staff are also pretty friendly. The location is not far from MTR station and a short ride to the city Centre areas. But what impressed me most is the museum on the ground level, describing how this building came about ( it is one of the earliest public housing built in 1950s) and the role of YHA in the revitalization project. The hostel is located in shamshuipo known to be one of the lower income areas, where you will see older people selling things and begging, reflecting the reality of poverty in the metropolitan city. But it is also a vibrant area with good food and a popular computer mart, attracting many young people. This area also has some other old buildings ( like Garden bakery) for visits. I am glad to have a chance to stay in Meiho house YHA and get to experience the daily life in a local neighborhood!

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: I stayed here for a week and had a very pleasant time. My bed in an 8 bed dorm was comfy, the individual lockers contained plugs for handy charging, and the 2 bathrooms were cleaned daily, which was excellent as some people liked to soak the place each morning while showering! Free breakfast, whilst a nice and welcomed touch, was an interesting experience- whilst the Asian options proved popular, perhaps cereal and toast would be favorable to the western option. I would recommend the hostel, but would add that there is zero interaction among guests; organised tours would be a nice touch in such a big hostel. The location on the metro line is great- with all main sightseeing areas easily accessible. It was also easy to get to the hostel from the airport using public transport.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: I enjoyed my stay here. The staff were friendly and efficient. The facility was decent, not amazing, but I didn't have any problems. It was a little bit hard to find coming from the south of the hostel, it's better to approach it from the west, where you can see it clearly, kind of up on a hill, but the address "41" can be clearly seen from far away.The aircon didn't overdo the job. The washing machines worked well, The daily instant coffee packets and water kettle were appreciated. I liked the location. Lots of good local eateries nearby. The 4 choices of food for the breakfast were nice- the food wasn't amazing, but good enough, and I got quite attached to their leaf wrapped sticky rice with a chicken wing inside.You could do a whole lot worse than this place.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Having stayed in numerous hostels, hotels, Airbnb in Europe, the US, SEAsia, Japan, Korea, India & Pakistan etc, this is the first time I had this weird experience. Stayed with a few friends in different double/ twin rooms for a couple of nights, we all heard chair dragging sounds, heavy cupboard banging noises from upstairs late in the night. Also heard doors opening/ closing sounds from the corridor. Perhaps it鈥檚 due to the poor sound insulation as it was originally a public housing block built in the 1950s. Lights went on & off by themselves in the middle of the night and couldn鈥檛 be on & off after we had them checked out by the reception. Reception offered is a change of room and fortunately, it鈥檚 our last night there too. Hard beds, inconvenient power points but large and basically clean room. No daily cleaning service unless we pay extra. Had stayed in many hostels and had some of my best sleep there ( even in many beds dorm rooms). Some of these hostels have hotel quality bed linen, comfortable beds and pillows, convenient power points & individual lights. Stayed in double/ twin room but no toothbrush/toothpaste, had to strip the bedsheets, pillow cases and comforter sheet to return to reception. No mini fridge? But well, this is a hostel. Pro: 1) Location: hard to find initially by cab but after familiarizing, it鈥檚 a 5-10 Min walk to Sham Shui Po MTR. 2) Facilities: nice cafe and convenient store that open till 10-11 pm, outside Terrace seating to chill. Very interesting heritage museum about the history of the hostel and the public housing in HK. 3) Room size: big by HK standard. Interesting experience and stay in HK, make for good travel story to friends.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: The like the place, it鈥檚 conveniently located not far from the MTR station, it鈥檚 safe and super clean. The staff is very efficient, friendly and helpful.Stayed in a 4 bed shared room with nice roommates. The share bathroom is in a decent size.Very nice is the rock behind the building which allows a great sunset few over HKG.Many great faculties like the attached restaurant and the balcony for relaxing and reading a book.Close by the Sham Shui Po with plenty of food options.The hostel give a cozy and relaxed atmosphere.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Back to here again 2 years later! Stayed private room this time. Even though the location is not very good but the 5 minutes walking distance isn't far. Breakfast is included and available every morning There is also a museum in the hostel compound. There are many popular foods available near the hotel and popular shopping street too. Definitely will come back again!

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: This is the second time staying here. The hostel works best again. The authentic neighborhood of Sham Shui Po always attract me to stay here. The hostel is new and clean. Only one point when think about re-visiting is about the roommate. I found that she turned off the air-con during the night (even it鈥檚 very warm outside) which i don鈥檛 know why because she is uncommunicative in English at all; and keep speaking Chinese to me. The only way to communicate with her is non-verbal. (She looks a bit arrogant but i think i will feel better if we talk the same language). This is an annoying experience. Btw this may go beyond the hostel鈥檚 responsibility but rather depends upon my luck. So many times i stayed in hostels in Asia and don鈥檛 have any problem with Chinese teenagers; at least they understand English. Next time i may check for hostels that鈥檚 unpopular among the Mainland Chinese.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Location: Convenient. The Sham Shui Po MTR station is less than a 10-min walk away. There are many vendors and stores nearby. You can get good deals and cheap local food. Hotel facilities: Good. Although there is no gym or swimming pool, they have self-service laundry. The washer has detergent so you don鈥檛 need to bring your own. $30 a wash and $30 to dry for 45 minutes. A caf茅 with ample seating and an open patio serves as a place you can relax. Bed: OK. A bit hard and you can feel the mattress springs. Shower : Spacious bathroom. Low water pressure and does not drain well. Often need to ask staff to unclog it. Room : Spacious , well-furnished, and well-lit. Curtains needed to stay drawn due to close proximity to a construction site and other buildings. There is a small refrigerator, safe, water boiler, and hairdryer. Wifi works very well. They will lend you an adaptor if asked. They will only change your towel or clean your room every 3 days. Staff is quite helpful. Receptionists are OK.You feel safe because they have a security guard outside and you need to use room keys to access many areas in the building. Most of the customers are young and there are no large groups of Chinese tourists. Hotel is quiet and comfortable.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: I have travelled many places across world especially using booking.com which has been very reliable and never had any issues until now and I never have had to complain ever except this once!Firstly it says 'great location' Yes it might be 15 mins train ride to centre Hong Kong , but they don't tell you it's in one of the poorest and Unsafest districts! I felt really unsafe at night walking to the station and the surrounding area I seen extreme poverty. Please (see photographs) .I thought not a great location at all. I prepaid for 8 nights at the hostel and I managed to last 3 nights , it was fully booked hostel and the girls in the room were extremely rude , being very loud , playing music , talking at 1am - 6am in morning, they didn't care if they woke you , brought in smelly food stunk out the room. i complained to the staff and not once did they try and speak to anyone in the room to be quiet. Obviously after 3 nights of no sleep I had to check out of my 8 night stay and told them as to why I'm leaving , they said " oh you sometimes get unlucky and get noisy guests" I asked for a refund for the remaining nights I'm not staying a knew they would sell my bunk to another guest , and they told me to sort it via booking.com Upton my return from travels , were they fair and gave me a refund for my 5 nights I didn't stay ? Even though it a full hostel and my bed would of been sold to someone else yet again making more money ? ....No I didn't get a refund ! In the end I paid for a lovely hotel costing 拢450 for the remaining 5 nights ! Please anyone please do not stay here if you want safety , security and also a good nights rest , your complaints will get ignored and they will not be fair to you if you leave due to noise and disruption! I really didn't want to pay extra for a hotel as couldn't afford it and needed to borrow money off my parents , but that's how seriously bad this place was !!! PLEASE BE WARNED ! Worst place I've ever stayed at in the world ! No respect from staff or the guests that stay there ! You get what you pay for and it night be cheaper staying here , but you pay price with a horrible stay in a bad area.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: I stayed here for a night in an 8-bed female dorm. The dorm had 2 bathrooms, which is enough for 8 people. The whole place is incredibly clean, wifi was decent when I was there. The mattress is a bit hard. If you're on the top bunk, the electrical outlet is is by the lower bunk so it can be a bit awkward when charging your electronic devices.Breakfast was filling, there's 4 options to choose from. It's close to the metro and local restaurants/eateries. Be sure to check out the little museum they have on site about the history of the neighborhood and the hostel...it's super insightful!

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: facilities: I stayed in a dorm room. That was a peak period of Christmas so all 8 beds are occupied. The room is new and well-designed so it is at least adequate if you expect a 鈥渉ostel experience鈥? less privacy but low cost. Walking down to the laundry to use hair drier wasn鈥檛 bad compared to the case of sharing bathroom. The breakfast was not much delicious but it introduced me to know different style of breakfast. Only one point is that I found the sink drain of my bathing room wasn鈥檛 clean well so it got clogged by hairs. I think it would be nice during non peak time: more privacy, less crammed sharing areas. location: located in old residential area. so it鈥檚 good if you are interested in real local life. not too far from the MTR.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Room was spacious for HK standard. Staff was friendly and helpful except one with whom I enquired about pocket wifi rental. She gave me misleading information. Great location.1) Angry Housekeeping - When we stepped inside the room after check-in, we were dismayed to see a thick layer of dust tangled with hair lying on the floor under the bed. The Front Desk apologized immediately upon receipt of our complaint and sent for a housekeeping person. Few minutes later, an angry-looking lady came to the door with a vacuum cleaner. Instead of saying sorry or showing apologetic for the poor cleaning job done, she said to me bluntly that the dirt was found under the bed because I had shifted the side table. She might not be the person who did the "sloppy" cleaning for our room before we checked in, there was no reason for her to make sure that I knew she was angry at me (the guest). 2) Awful Breakfast - After having the first breakfast there, we went out for breakfast for the rest of our stay. Mei House is a hostel, so we did not expect much. Unfortunately, the food was really below standard. 3) Wifi was frustratingly slow. Don't understand why the wifi speed at Mei Ho House has not been improved after so many bad reviews.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: The hostel was a multi-million dollar conversion from an old public housing building, so one side of 1st floor was kept as a museum.Stayed 5 nights in 2 room types (8-bed & 4-bed dorms).The counter staff were friendly & helpful.8-bed female dorm (at the back of the building facing the hill):I picked the lower bunk next to the lockers (4x2rows), and used the closest locker (bottom left). The cabinet doors only opens to 90 degree, so accessing the left-most lockers would be a little awkward (it would help if the hinge is along the wall side).The bed was very firm (even by my standard), but clean. Dorm-mates were quite good, no noisy ones (hope I wasn't the noisy one with all my sorting & packing)People seemed not to know there're air-conditioning units within each dorm, but the one on our side of dorm was very noisy when turned on, so I just used the one on the other side. It's good to have 2 bathrooms between a maximum of 8. our timings worked out well, with some early sleepers, and late risers etc..The room was clean, though the cabinet top next to my bed was a little dusty.There weren't enough hooks to share around.4-bed dorm (at the front of the building facing the street):same size room with only 4 single beds. No more locker issue too. Free towel. Still 1 bathroom per 4 person. No hanging rod (though there was a small wardrobe space), but enough hooks to share around. Considerate dorm-mates again (thankfully). The air-conditioning unit on my side was quiet this time, so even the bed was still firm, I slept quite alright.Even there was some construction site next door, but with the windows, I couldn't really hear that going on. Wifi: it's free but I didn't bother with it..... just too slow (my advice if you're staying for more than 1 day: get a sim from 7-11/ Ap-Liu Street) Breakfast: it's free! and 4 choices. Nothing too fancy, but indeed hot breakfast. Otherwise there're heaps if you go into the Sham Shui Po area.Transport: E21 only runs hourly, and I missed one. As it was nearly 9pm on the day of arrival, I ended up taking the airport express to Kowloon station then taxi to the hostel. Otherwise, getting around was pretty easy with the MTR, being a 7-min walk away.There's a track up the hill behind the hostel, which offers a good view. be prepared though, there's quite a few steps to climb. For a clean room on a budget in HK, in a safe & secured building (there's a guard outside 24/7 & single purpose building (instead of other hostels/ guesthouses being nested within residential buildings), and a handy location, you can't beat Mei Ho House.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Just stay here for 5 nights with my friends in triple bedroom.Our experiences were great.Nice and helpful staffs. Lot of smiles.The triple room is large compared to HK standard.Very clean. They do change your towels once in 3 days, but they clean your room & empty the trashbin everyday.AC works well. Full HD TV, very clear display.Hair dryer available.Bathroom is great, cleaned everyday.The breakfast menu has 4 different choices, not bad.The only weakness was the wifi speed at our room.It was so slow... but it's okay since we have data package at our phone.The location is about 7-10 minutes by walk from nearest MTR Sham Shui Po. There are a lot of shops in nearby area.You can also take bus E21 from airport and alight on Yen Chow street. Don't forget to take their map, it's quite useful.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: I stayed here for two nights. It was located in a busy area in the city. Close to the metro supermarkets and next to a large hill which gave a great view of parts of the city. Not a very social place for backpackers. Seemed like it was more for local people and groups. You get a free breakfast but it wasn't very appetising. The staff were friendly. I could hardly get any sleep due to people in my room making weird noises and snoring. One guy even started singing at 1 am for half an hour! There are lockers in the room so I was sure my stuff was safe.If I came back to Hong Kong I would rather stay on Hong Kong island as the area was nicer and there were more backpackers. If I were to return to this hostel I would stay in a private room for definite.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: the room was big for HK standard, it was well located near of subway station and stop of airport bus. The staff speaks good english and it is enough helpful. The breakfast is ridiculous, not good at all. Always same thing and quality of food is poor. They clean the room every 3 days and not change linen.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: We booked ourselves a private room for two, and we were frankly blown away by the quality of the room for the price. We weren't expecting much, but what we got was a fine room, relatively clean, and absolutely huge. This was perfect for us since we were actually going through an overseas move and had a few pieces of luggage. There was plenty of room, and it was perfect for us.The only solid complaint I could have about this place is the breakfast. It was pretty small, and the western breakfast was obviously made by a person that has no idea how to make a western breakfast. Every day something new would be cold, and for some reason it included corn. It's not a reason to avoid this place by any means, but it's a reason to make sure you have alternative plans for breakfast.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Stayed as a school group, 11 in total. Decent rooms, clean linen and perfect location. 5 minute walk from Sham Shui Po MTR station. Never seemed too busy despite being fully booked. Meals in the restaurant are sub par however, especially breakfast. While you do get 10% off at dinner, I'd avoid this and just go to one of the many local restaurants.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: I stayed at Mei Ho House for two nights. Positives: The beds are quite hard, but I liked that. The duvets and sheets are quite nice. Good air-con is a must in Hong Kong and thankfully the room was nice and cool. I also enjoyed the short hike behind the hostel, which gives a nice view over HK. Improvements: To me, it's always a little stingy when you have to rent a towel, which is the case here. The breakfast could also be improved significantly. I had both the western and Chinese options; both were shockingly bad. It's also a pity they don't allow early check-in, but was nice that they have a free luggage room. Overall, I would stay here again if I couldn't find a better option elsewhere.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: I stayed here for two days to basically run some errands before leaving Hong Kong and was quite satisfied. Even for those not familiar with HK, the hostel should be easy to reach as it's close to the MTR and easy to reach from the airport. The red line is directly connected to major stations such as Mong Kok, TST and Central so ideal for those on a short stay that still want to experience some of the more popular areas. There's also a post office within walking distance.As for the facilities, I stayed in an 8 bed women's dorm and the beds were great, high quality bunks. There were two shower/toilet combos that you only have to share with your roommates and it was all quite clean. The reception is open 24 hours, which is awesome! Late check in is not a problem for that reason.They're also very helpful. I got two free breakfast vouchers and wifi is available, although it was very slow in my room and I ended up using data instead. You can do your laundry yourself in the laundry room, but the washer and dryer BOTH cost HK$30 (approx US$3.8) per cycle which I found a bit much even if you don't need to provide your own detergent. I personally wasn't looking to socialize with other people from the hostel as I was really only looking for a place to sleep, so don't know much about what other type of people stayed here, but I had both young foreign travelers as older guests as my roommates.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: The museum at this site is far more interesting. It shows the history of Hong Kong's public housing development from the Shek Kip Mei fire of 1953.Shows the squalor of early tenements to the relative luxury of the modern day flats.The hostel is built from the very flats that once housed whole families.The cafe on the ground floor serves nostalgia as well as good breakfasts and teas.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: I loved the free breakfast - set meals that comes with mixed greens with roasted sesame dressing as a side dish. I also like their orange juice Hotel Room is really huge compared to the other hotel rooms in HK considering the price . It was a steal!Location is just ok . You need to walk for abt 10 minutes to reach the MTR. This side of Hongkong is the locale/residential side of HK. Free Wifi, Bath Rooms with Bath Tubs

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Very interesting place to visit to learn about some of the first public housing constructed in the early 1950s in Hong Kong. Most of the guided tours are in Chinese, but we were fortunate to meet a Chinese-Canadian who had spent her early years living here and was quite willing to talk about it. Otherwise, not Chinese speakers will have to read the placards.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Everything is pretty solid - clean room, nice breakfast, nice staff and so on.But there is no common area where you can meet new people or just hang out with your friend. Also, should bring your own lockpad.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: It is clean and room is on the spacious side in Hong Kong standard. We specially like the leminate floor so it is much clean compared to carpet. it is like a 3 stars hotel in a local neighborhood. Very close to computer Golden shoopping center. MTR is 5 min away by foot. Definitely should see the ground floor museum of the old hong kong government housing.There is washer and dryer with hk$30 each cycle detergent incleded. so $60 get you cleaned. there is also a public kitchen with all utensils. Breakfast is free with four choices but do not expect much. you can walk 5-10 minutes and there are plenty choices of local food.Check-In at 4pm and check out at 11am is strictly enforced. you can pay $100 for a late checkout at 2pm. there is a deposit of $500 for our double room you get it back at checkout after they verify no damage.
