You need to bring bed sheet duvet cover pillow case and tv remote with you for checkout because it is a youth hostel.Wi-Fi is a little bit slower for video download but adequate for other tasks. you can connect up to 4 devices.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Great place - clean bed, great facilities in common area (hair dryer, computer with internet access, hot water, kitchen with oven, pot and utensils), friendly staff to help in travel information. Breakfast included too.Great location for great food and easy access to public transport to town or airport.If you meet some inconsiderate roommates, just make yourself a great roommate by accommodating them.Will definitely go back the next time.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Cannot fault this hostel. It has everything! Located in a historic part of Kowloon, in the last surviving H configuration building which used to house the victims of a devastating fire in the area. The building itself is a piece of history. There is a museum inside the hostel which is free to the public. Guests staying in the hostel can enjoy an exclusive crowd-free period every morning before the official opening times. The hostel is spacious, and has a canteen on the ground floor which serves free breakfast (3 styles) to every guest. The 8 bed female dormitory was spacious and light with 2 en-suite bathrooms, The lockers were large with an inbuilt socket, but do remember to bring your own lock! There are so much local eateries around the hostels, in fact some of the best local eats in Hong Kong are located in this area! Very close to both bus to the airport or MTR for those who can afford to splash the cash. All in all, very good value for money, would return again.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Stayed in two different Hostels on my January Hong Kong trip and YHA Mei Ho Hostel was about 4 times more bigger than the other place! It was very clean and the atmosphere from check in to check out had good positive vibes. The four major things I judge a place are location, wifi, customer service and price.Location - Subway is close by and was easy to navigate to and from the hostel as well as the airport. Area was well lit and appeared safe as well.Wifi - No issues at all with Wifi. Worked at all times.Customer Service - The staff were all very friendly and I had no issues with any of them. Thank you to Bonnie for making my check in hassle free.Price - Price was well worth every penny.Their breakfast wasn't satisfying but since it was free, I have no complaints.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Very nice hostel, very clean, location was good close to the subway. A lot of eating places around not expensive. The staff was good, especially front desk person Allen he was very professional,helpful and informative All the comforts of home.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Well located - near to 2 MTR stationd, and bus routes (instructions to catch E21 bus from airport are clear & easy to follow). Front of house staff are friendly & helpful. Rooms are well cleaned everyday, and common areas (e.g. kitchen) are spotless. Best laundry facilities of any YHA hostel I have stayed at in last 3 months - washer cost includes powder and the dryer is fast & efficient. Only 30$HK per cycle. I manged to get everything I am travelling with (including jeans!) clean & dry in two loads. Self-catering kitchen is small, but functional to use. Would recommend a stay here.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Locate at Sham Sui Po, is very near to MTR station. The room was very neat and tidy, and comfortable. The hotel also provided free wi-fi and free breakfast. Mei Ho house gave us a good impression and i will recommend to my friends if they visit to Hongkong.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Arrived after midnight and was pleasantly surprised to find the Hostel was open 24hrs.Our private room was very large with a king size bed and we had an ensuite bathroom. The room was air conditioned and spotless. Towels were provided and all linen changed every three days. It is an historic building in one of the older parts of Hong Kong and has been refurbished in a clean, modern style. Lovely central courtyard to relax in. A restaurant is on the premises and breakfast was included in the price. Lunch and dinner menus were available. It is situated a little way from the subway, (Shan Shui Po) but once there, it is has a direct line to Tsim Sha Tsui station and the Harbour. Don't miss the museum on the ground floor of the building. Also the walk up the hill at sunset is worth the effort. Path at the back of the Hostel.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: I am from HK, I stayed there for a bit because I had to get my shower fixed at home. I didn't expect much from Mei HO house as it is a hostel but the place is very very clean and the staff are super friendly. I felt really safe there. You can lock your stuff at a locker, they sell locks at the desk. The bathrooms are very clean too!

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: This place is fantastic! I stayed in a mix 6 person dorm. I was a bit scared because I normally stay in individual rooms and the idea of sleeping strangers scared me a bit. However, it was completely unfounded. This place is clean, safe, friendly and is a home away from home. The room was clean and the beds were comfy. They provide a locker in the room and the great thing is there is a plug inside, so you can charge your electronics and still have the locker door locked and closed when you leave. Breakfast was simple, but adequate. Nothing to get full on, but enough to get you started off in the morning. I had a late flight and they let me store my luggage in the luggage room for 6 hours before I left. I stayed a total of 5 days and 4 nights. Will definately be back the next time I am in Hong Kong!

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Overall it was a good experience stay for a few days. Room was clean and spacious to place luggage. Bathroom was clean too. Location wise was good, about 5-10 minutes from MTR, while walking along the shops. It was also good for morning run and there is a hill behind should you want to take a walk up for a view. There is self laundry service.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: Knowing that it is a building that renovated from the earliest Hong Kong flats into hostel, and with themes, so decided to give it a try. Twin room is big, breakfast is fine. Mini store sells thing that is interesting. Walking distance to lots of restaurants and MTR station. One of the eatery place 鍚堢泭灏忓悆 is highly recommended for its curry fish ball, cheong fun, soya milk and etc. The only thing is it is better to have 2 key cards for each room, so that one can go out and able to come in without the other person following. There is an exhibition hall that tells the story of this place, don't miss it.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: I stayed at this property with a quite big group (friends + family) and the overall impression was very positive. All rooms were spacious, spotless clean and silent. It is located close to a metro station, but the neighbourhood isn't the most beautiful in HK. But in terms of value for money, I think it is a very good option for those looking for reasonably priced accomodation in HK, and I would definitely stay here again.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: It is a bit out of the center (10-15min Taxi/Uber ride) and can be quite noisy since you`re close to the road and they might have constructions. But that`s not to bad.Other then that it`s a very clean hostel, with frindly stuff and ok breakfast options (for that price). There is even a Restaurant attached to it, so you can have lunch/dinner there. Defenetly feels more like in a hotel then a hostel! Would recomend to stay there and book it again.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: I stayed for 5 days with a friend and we had a great time. The staff were friendly the room was spacious and the location was amazing. It was extremely near to an mtr station and the place itself had loads to do. It was overall a lovely place to stay.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: It was really good place to stay in HK. There were a kitchen, a laundry space and so on. Plus, I can access to breakfast on free. Enjoy your stay!! 棣欐腐銈掕Τ鍏夈仚銈嬨伀銇亜銇勫牬鎵€銇犮仺鎬濄亜銇俱仚銆傘偔銉冦儊銉炽倓銉┿兂銉夈儶銉笺偣銉氥兗銈广倐鍏呭疅銇椼仸銇娿倞銆佹瘞鏅╂枡鐞嗐倰銇椼仸銇勩伨銇椼仧銆傚銇偒銉曘偋銉嗐儵銈广伄銈堛亞銇仺銇撱倣銇屻亗銈娿€佹ソ銇椼亸銇婇厭銈掗２銇裤伨銇椼仧銆傛ソ銇椼亜婊炲湪銈掞紒

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: The facilities were so nice that I could hardly believe that it is a hostel. I can say that this place was one of the most nice hostels that I've ever stayed. Location was also quite nice but it was little bit hard for me to find a way from station to the hostel. It was also very clean.But, my friend's luggage was broken in the place-looks like a storage with lock- in which hostel told us to put our luggages while we are waiting for check-in and they said that according to the cctv, it was done by other customers so it is impossible to offer my friend a compensation. So I would like you to say please be careful.

Hotel: YHA Mei Ho House Youth Hostel
review: A nice budget hostel. I stayed in the 8-beds female dorm. The room is clean. I like the locker because it is huge to put in my 60l backpack and a daypack. I enjoyed the simple breakfast provided. The cafe is comfortable with friendly staff. The hostel is a building by itself so it has facilities from a kitchen/lounge, cafe, book shop. I appreciate the open space around the hostel. So most of the time when I am back to the hostel, I will spend my time sitting outside/inside the cafe, lounge etc.
